name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Captain America and the Original Human Torch
description:
After receiving the Super-Soldier serum, the once sickly Steve Rogers fought for freedom on the front lines of World War II. The serum grants him superhuman strength, stamina, and agility, making him one of the strongest heroes in the world. Along with his signature vibranium-infused shield, Captain America contends with any foe who threatens the innocent.

The Original Human Torch was not born but built. Created by the brilliant Professor Phineas T. Horton, the android burst into flames when first exposed to oxygen. Eventually, the synthetic man learned to control the flames that wreathed his body and vowed to help humanity. From the battlefields of the Second World War to the streets of modern cities, the Original Human Torch burns brightly to banish the darkness of the world.

—description from the publisher

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Baron Strucker and Arnim Zola
description:
Baron Wolfgang von Strucker may have been born into the ranks of the nobility, but he has spent his prolonged life in pursuit of nefarious goals. As an ally of the Red Skull and wing commander of the Death’s Head Squadron, Strucker waged campaigns of invasion and oppression. As the founder of HYDRA, Strucker’s villainy has spread deeply across the world. After becoming infected with the deathspore virus, Strucker gained an array of superhuman abilities, including suppressed aging that keeps this notorious villain alive to this day.

Doctor Arnim Zola was a scientist who pursued the creation of super-soldiers for the purpose of world domination. Performing cruel experiments during World War II, Zola worked alongside villains like Baron Zemo and the Red Skull. The mad doctor transferred his consciousness into a synthetic body, allowing him to continue his nefarious work well into the future, using his genius intellect and scientific knowledge as weapons against all who would stop him.

—description from the publisher

name: FARMily Feud
description:
Welcome to FARMily Feud, where farmers must grow and protect the crop they are championing until one comes out as the ultimate winner. FARMily Feud provides players with the choice of 14 identical actions on seven farm cards, so the playing field is level and each farmer has an equal shot at victory.

Everyone has an identical starting card showing three of their crop--tomato, aubergine (eggplant), carrot, or corn--which is placed in a set formation with the other players' starting cards.

From here on out, the game is played in rounds, with players picking and simultaneously announcing the number of the action they'd like to take. The numbers determine player order. The action is executed by paying its cost in seed, then placing the card back side up, generally in order to either increase the player's own crop or decrease another's.

In addition to outnumbering rivals' crops, players can also score points if they are able to finish with their crop in certain formations. The game plays quickly so you can challenge anyone at any time, so let's settle the sibling rivalry once and for all and kick off this FARMily Feud!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Layering, Multi-Use Cards, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Rainbow
description:
Rainbow is a quick-playing hand management game where players play solo cards, sets, or runs to win points on cards in the center of the table.

The cards that were played in the previous round are the NEW points available to win in the next round. Most points at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Prey
description:
Prey is a 12-trick trick-taking game where 3-4 players play the first six tricks with one side of numbers (predators), then FLIP their cards over to play the final six (prey). You must follow suit if you can.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to win your assigned number of tricks(determined by dice roll), twice.

Can you manipulate your hand (and, the upside down cards in your hand!) in clever ways to win?

—description from the publisher

name: W Krainie Legend
description:
Trumpets, backpacks, cups, frying pans and other things were lost near Łysa Góra, the castle in Kórnik, in the Tatra Mountains and other wonderful places. Or maybe Mr. Twardowski took them on his way to the moon?

W Krainie Legend', players take on the role of fairy-tale detectives whose task will be to find items as quickly as possible. The task is not easy, because there are plenty of objects on the boards!

name: Small Wars: Mohicans
description:
Small Wars: Mohicans is the first game of the Small Wars series. Covering the French and Indian War of the mid-18th century, it is based on a popular 1983 Canadian boardgame called Mohawk. Mohicans starts in 1754 and continues to 1760, which historically was the year after the conquest of Quebec by British forces (a founding event in the creation of modern Canada).

In Mohicans, the powerful regular forces of Britain fight for control of north-eastern North America against the mixed regular and irregular forces of the French and their local allies. The forces of both sides are bolstered by local militia units and other irregular forces, such as the famous French Couriers des Bois or British Rangers, and the arrival each year of more regular reinforcements from Europe.

While the British have the edge in firepower and numbers, the French have better mobility and their Indigenous allies can make effective use of terrain, particularly the massive forests that covered eastern North America at the time. The British are also more vulnerable to having their supply lines cut off.

Both sides seek to curry favour with the powerful but neutral Iroquois Confederacy, as an alliance with them is an enormous strategic advantage. With each major victory on the battlefield, one of the six tribes of the Iroquois will offer its support to the winning side. Get the support of all six tribes, and the Iroquois will join the fight.

To win the game, the British must hold three of the French cities and towns of Louisbourg, Frontenac, Duquesne, Montreal and Quebec (and at least one must be Montreal or Quebec). If they don’t do this by 1760, the French win by default.

The French can also win by holding the British cities of Albany and either New York, Boston or Philadelphia. This will be a tall order for the French but they can take comfort in the fact that the British, like NATO 250 years later have the watches, but the French have the time…

Combat occurs at the different locations, after the seasonal movement has been processed. It covers different battles, such as ambushes in woods, landings, raids on enemy villages and towns, field battles or forts assaults.

During the Winter between each of the 7 years of the war, reinforcements are received, militias and Indians are mustered and forts can be built.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Point to Point Movement

name: Operation Merkur in 90 Seconds
description: Set in the 20 May 1941 airborne invasion of Crete. This fast playing game features variable forces for each side, drift calculation for the Fallschirmjäger's air drop, and communication problems on the Allied side. The game has a small footprint and low counter density - you'll want to play several times to experience the different paths to victory.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Tango
description:
It takes two to tango, but only one dancer will stand tall in this trick-taking game for two players! In Tango, players play cards (both from their hand and from their face-up display), in order to perform the best possible dance steps.
Plan ahead as best you can, but remember your opponent knows some of the steps you will take! Will you be named lord or lady of the dance?

—description from the publisher

name: Sunrise at the Studio: Potter Specialties Mini-Expansion
description:
The Potter Specialties Mini-Expansion adds private scoring goals drawn during setup and revealed over the course of play.

Draft private scoring goals during setup, then reveal 2 of 3 cards during the course of play. Find new ways to score that may shape more of your decisions as you work on your pottery projects!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Snowfall Over Mountains: Another Winter's Day Mini-Expansion
description:
Another Winter's Day Mini-Expansion adds new scoring cards and a tool card with a corresponding 1x1 tile.

Find more challenges when it comes to arranging the tiles around your cabin, and discover some of the strategies to use the Animal Guide tool card at the right moment!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Once-Per-Game Abilities, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Shot&Spin!
description:
Shot&Spin! is a Print & Play golf game designed for solo or group players, bringing the challenge and strategy of golf right to a printed sheet.
Utilizing a unique combination of simple physical components such as a pencil, a stopwatch, a ruler and a paperclip players navigate through various game maps representing golf holes, each with its unique challenges including fairways, roughs, bunkers, ponds, and trees.

The aim of the game is to complete each hole with the fewest strokes possible, maximizing your score. Players choose from different types of clubs (Woods, Irons, Wedges, and the Putter), each with specific distances and shot times. Accuracy is key: players must estimate the distance by eye and mentally calculate the time to "hit" the ball towards the target. However, if the shot isn't precise enough, the "Spin" factor comes into play: spinning the paperclip on a table determines the unexpected outcome of the shot, adding an element of randomness and fun.

Shot&Spin! boasts a great replayability, ensuring that no two games are ever the same. This dynamic quality stems from the game's diverse course maps, each presenting unique obstacles and strategic decisions. Players are constantly faced with different challenges, requiring adaptation and tactical thinking with every round.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Battalion: War of the Ancients
description:
Take charge of the formidable Roman legions and their allies. Command the powerful crossbowmen of the Han dynasty as they traverse unfamiliar deserts. Steer the renowned Greco-Bactrian cavalry, and fight for every oasis. Direct Hannibal's diverse array of mercenaries, elephants, and the Sacred Band of Carthage.

To lead is to walk the tightrope. Choose a faction, consider its ranks, assemble them into units, and as they fight, carefully balance their orders and sustain your forces in the field. The unique traits of each rank tile will make your units stronger, but combine too many and your units will become unwieldy.

Battalion: War of the Ancients is an accessible two or four-player game. Command a wide range of units from four playable historical factions, each with their own strengths and weaknesses. Employ faction-specific tactics cards to outmaneuver your opponents. Compose your unique forces with rigor. Judge the tempo of battle with precision. Seize victory for your people!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Gruszka
description: Gruszka (eng. Pear) - a single promo tile acting as a replacement HQ for any faction. Once per turn a player may choose its special feature out of other available HQs (player places chosen HQ next to the board as an indicator). This includes only universal features such as: additional initiative, higher initiative, increased melee attack, increased ranged attack, additional toughness, mobility, rotation or push back. Originally available at the Neuroshima Hex championship in Poland in January 2020 during PortalCon 12 and presumably up to two years earlier during Pyrkon. It is the other version of The Pear originally released in 2015.

name: Zoo On
description:
Come have fun building the most fabulous zoo with your beloved animals! Cross breathtaking scenery, travel between different regions to collect a host of animals. Develop your parks and collect points by challenging your friends to become the undisputed king of the most sensational Zoo. Who will be crowned the Big Winner of this game for the general public?

We start with 5 cards in hand. You take turns drawing a card from one of the different decks and placing one in play. Either in your Zoo or by penalizing another player. If you cannot play, you must discard a card. The possible cards to obtain are enclosures, habitats, food, animals or actions. We build our zoo by superimposing an enclosure, a habitat, food and up to a maximum of 2 animals per park. The points are written on the animals. The Big Winner is the one who gets 50 points first.

—description from the designer

Venez vous éclater en construisant le zoo le plus grandiose avec vos animaux adorés! Traversez des décors à couper le souffle, voyagez entre différentes régions pour collectionner une ribambelle d'animaux. Aménagez vos parcs et amassez des points en défiant vos amis pour devenir le roi incontesté du Zoo le plus sensationnel. Qui sera couronné le Grand Gagnant de ce jeu pour Grand Publique?

On commence avec 5 cartes en mains. À tour de rôle on pioche une carte dans l'un des différents paquets et on en dépose une en jeu. Soit dans son Zoo ou soit en pénalisant un autre joueur. Si vous ne pouvez pas jouer, vous devez défausser une carte. Les cartes possibles d'obtenir sont des enclos, des habitats, de la nourriture, des animaux ou des actions. On construit notre zoo en superposant un enclos, un habitat, de la nourriture et jusqu'à un maximum de 2 animaux par parc. Les points sont inscrits sur les animaux. Le Grand Gagnant est celui qui obtient 50 points en premier.

—description from the designer (French)
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tags, Take That

name: Tajemství těla
description:
Look at yourself with different eyes. Exploring the human body is endless fun. Did you know that the human body produces enough heat in half an hour to bring about 4 litres of water to the boil? That our heart pumps up to 10,000 litres of blood a day? That we need 17 kinds of muscles to smile, but 43 to frown?
The human body is such a fascinating machine that it still offers us hundreds of mysteries and curiosities. The board game Mysteries of the Body reveals some of them through nearly 900 questions.
The board game Body Secrets is based on the popular Czech TV show of the same name.
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: B17 Twenty Five Missions: Avro Lancaster
description:
Avro Lancaster is an expansion for the game B-17 Twenty five missions.

Content


In this pdf you will find the new British AVRO LANCASTER bomber with the corresponding modifications for the game.
Five exclusive missions to play with the Bomber.
Mission Report Sheet.
Sheet with information on some small modifications to the game.


—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: Pokemon Pokemon Board Game Get Battle Adventure
description:
Get Pokémon and win in battle!
Mix and match the field according to the number of people and the time of play!
Choose your favorite field from the 4 fields and play alone or in combination!
There are 15 patterns in total.
You can play it in a short time, and you can also enjoy the mini game of battle games and evolution games.

How to Play
When you turn your turn, sprinkle the dice and proceed with the number of pieces you put out!
Go through the field and get the Pokemon Chips! There are 200 different Pokemon chips!
Pull "Battle" on your event card and battle with the collected Pokemon Chips!
You can also use item cards to power up.
When you get more than 20 points of the Pokemon chips you get, it's the last battle on the Rival Road!
Who can defeat their rivals first?
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Great Race: Swiss Crew
description: An additional crew allowing you to play with five or more players (with the expansions).

name: Die drei ??? Labyrinth: Team Edition
description:
In Die drei ??? Labyrinth: Team Edition, the famous trio of investigators and a supporter work together against Victor Hugenay, who has struck Rocky Beach again and stolen the most popular cover paintings of the Die drei ?? cases.

Round by round, the players turn the pages of a Die drei ??? book to find out what obstacles Victor puts in their way. Can they manage to use their skills to move the walls of the labyrinth and find all the stolen paintings before the final page of the book is turned and Victor’s plans succeed?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: CookieRun Braverse Trading Card Game
description:
CookieRun Braverse Trading Card Game is a trading card game based on the Korean mobile game IP CookieRun.
In the game, players use a deck of cookie cards, item cards, trap cards and field cards to fight the opponent, each cookie card has a health point and will be defeated if the HP reduce by 0. When a player has totally 10 ranked cookie cards defeated, he will lose the game.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Video Game Theme

name: Star Wars Villainous: Revenge at Last
description:
In Star Wars Villainous: Revenge at Last, players choose to play one of two iconic villains from the Star Wars galaxy: Darth Maul or Captain Phasma. Depending on their villain's unique power, players will use their villain's "ambition" to perform actions that power effects based on the villain's use of the Force, strategic leadership, or sheer luck. The game also incorporates villain-specific missions and rules for iconic ships and transports from all corners of the Star Wars galaxy.

Villains in Star Wars Villainous: Revenge at Last can be mixed with those in Star Wars Villainous: Power of the Dark Side or Star Wars Villainous: Scum and Villainy or used on their own in this game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Sardines de Marseille
description:
In this fast-paced family card game, you align sardines in your fish cans. Play wisely to create combos in order to outrun your opponents and prevent them from stealing fish in your open cans.

The winner is the first to close 3 fish cans, a can is complete when a lid is laid on its third sardine.

name: The Great Race: Indian Crew
description: A complete crew representing India and its will for self-determination of its people. This was a KS Exclusive additional crew allowing you to play with five or more players (with the expansions).

name: North Africa '40: The 1940 Expansion to North Africa '41
description:
The legend continues with North Africa ’40, the prequel expansion to North Africa ’41. This expansion covers September 1940 to December 1941. Scenarios cover both Operazione E (the Italian invasion of Egypt; 12 turns) and the Allied counter-offensive, Operation Compass (6 turns). Both scenarios can be extended through December 1941 for an Operazione E full campaign (32 turns) or an Operation Compass full campaign (26 turns).

Can you as the Allied commander bag the Italian 10th Army? Will you be ready for theater whiplash, the Middle East Command operational shift to Greece in February 1941? Will you be prepared for the entry of Rommel and the German panzers?

Can you as the Italian commander find an answer for the enemy heavy armor, the Matilda tanks? Will you find solutions to the grave errors your historical counterpart made? Will you have the coastal road open for the arrival of Rommel and the DAK blitzkrieg to the Suez Canal?

The answers to those questions you will find in a journey filled with tension, excitement, and rich World War 2 history!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Detective Conan Card Game
description:
A trading card game based on famous Japanese Anime/Manga Detective Conan as 30th anniversary of Detective Conan series.
In this game, players use their own partner card and character cards to collect evidence to solve event. By reasoning and action, the player who collect enough evidence to solve the event will win the game.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip

name: Banapples
description:
The game with TWISTS but no TURNS!

Race to plant all cards from your Seed Pile, and see who can play the most cards into the Canopy. It's a game of speed, precision, and competition - a game with twists but no turns! Do you have what it takes to be not only the fastest player, but the best?

—description from the publisher

Banapples plays like competitive solitaire with player interaction. The red and yellow "tree" piles alternate colors while descending, and the scoring piles are one color only and ascending. You are allowed to play to other player's scoring piles, so you could potentially block them from scoring the card they wanted to score, but everything goes so fast that no one feels like it was mean. Everyone plays at their own speed, real-time, with no turns, until someone's "seed" pile runs out. Then it's time to score the cards at face value.

One round lasts about 15 minutes. A full game to 500 points lasts about an hour.

—user summary

name: BUDIZZ
description:
Harvest, protect, cooperate: adventure is just around the corner!
Play as Jagos the druid bumblebee, Grizel the witch fly or one of the four other pollinators. Together, play your cards to gather pollen from flower to flower. But beware of the predators and dangers that threaten the garden. The first player to run out of cards ends the game!

Try to get the best score with each new game and help protect biodiversity.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Multi-Use Cards, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Can of Worms
description:
An action game full of fun for little math solvers: Counting has never been so FUN.

Flip a Number card face up. Pick worms from the can and align them on the ruler to match the length of the worms with the number on the card. When a player gets the exact number they place the worms back in the can and spin it for the next player to try and match a new Number card.

If you pass the number, the player gets a worm token that will allow him to add or subtract 1 from his next worm length. The worms are put back in the can without spinning it, making it easier to memorize the placement of the worms.

The first player who gets four cards wins the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Deathgorge – Zondara's Gravebreakers
description:
Zondara Rivenheart lost the love of her life – Ferlain – to a terrible curse that left him a snarling beast. Now she will stop at nothing in her efforts to save him. A stolen tome has unlocked the secrets of necromancy to this desperate wizard, and led her to believe that she might find a way to restore her beloved amongst the frozen graves and lost dead of the Deathgorge.

Put the 'romance' back in necromancy with Zondara's Gravebreakers, a flexible warband featuring two powerful characters supported by a trio of Deadwalker minions. Zondara's powerful spells and Lost Ferlain's bestial strength make them the still-beating heart of the warband, while the three grave-robbing zombies – Pikk, Cracktomb, and Toyle – providing the power-couple with extra opportunities to gain glory and accumulate upgrades. This set includes a full Rivals deck to use straight out of the box, and the models are all push-fit – so you can get playing in no time.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: DIMOI Friends
description:
DIMOI games are much more than entertainment; they are designed to be conversation catalysts, facilitating authentic connection among players. By exploring a variety of captivating subjects, these games provide an ideal platform to discover new perspectives, rediscover precious moments from the past, or simply share experiences with loved ones.

The Friends version of DIMOI transcends ordinary conversations among friends. It invites exploration of emotional territories, triggers spontaneous laughter, raises profound questions, and even prompts moments of intense reflection. Each card serves as an open door to exciting new topics, encouraging participants to engage authentically and deepen their bonds of friendship.

With DIMOI Friends, create hours of engaging conversations. Disconnect from screens and spend an unforgettable time exchanging and rediscovering each other among friends with original, deep, daring, or unusual questions.

Learn new things: test your knowledge about your friends by sharing memories, juicy anecdotes, and reflect together on your desires, motivations, aspirations...

To play and replay: during a dinner with friends, as a pre-dinner game, at a party, in the car, on vacation... DIMOI is the perfect card game for adults to spend an exceptional time with friends!

name: Homefarming: Das Spiel
description:
Make delicious food at home — in a playful way! — in Homefarming: Das Spiel.

Based on an idea from best-selling author Judith Rakers, this game challenges players to cultivate their own little garden. After three garden years, that is, three rounds of play, players tally their points: Who harvested the most and who used the space in their garden most cleverly? Who had the pests and seasonal effects under control? And who has collected some chicken friends to bring extra points?

The cards provide helpful information not only for playing the game, but also for growing a real garden.

name: FOLLOW ME: The Infantry's Game – Platoon Attack
description:
FOLLOW ME: The Infantry’s Game is a game of military strategy and domination. It was developed to teach junior military leaders, both commissioned and non-commissioned officers, to maintain situational awareness on the battlefield while orchestrating the elements of combat power with their designated units. It would be wise for players of this game to apply the principles of warfare when planning, coordinating, and executing their game strategy.

This game is played on a gridded game board by two or more players who use FOLLOW ME game pieces to maneuver and fire on their opponents in order to accomplish a chosen game objective. The game pieces represent the warriors, leaders, supports, and assets that are employed on the field of battle, and their fate is determined by a roll of the dice. The game ends when the chosen game objective is accomplished by the winning player.

Mechanically, the game centers around formation-based grid movement and dice-based fires adjudication. Units moving in a formation near a leader are more mobile and effective than those operating alone, but they those benefits require staying close to a command piece.

This game was designed in 2019 and initially released in 2024. It is based on the designer's experience in the US Army with the goal of creating realistic and instructional models of squad-level and platoon-level combat on the modern battlefield.

name: Decisive Battles Korea
description:
This game is based on several battles in the early stages of the War to Resist US Aggression and aid Korea in 1950. The game supports 2 players, one commanding the People's Volunteer Army and the other the United Nations Army.

The game contains 5 fierce battles with different styles. The battles range from the cold icy fields of North Korea to military fortresses, the island of Taehwa-do and the surrounding rough seas.

—extract of the description from the publisher (translated)

The game contains a booklet with 5 small games about the Korean War. While postcard-game style counters are provided in the booklet mounted counters are available for this game.

Game 1: Bear Trap (Chosin Reservoir)
Game 2: Turkey Feast(Battle of Kunuri)
Game 3: Horse Hunter(Battle of Unsan)
Game 4: Chief's Fortress (Siege of Chipyong-Ni)
Game 5: Eagle strikes the Sky (Air Battle of Taehwa-do)

name: Beware the Ides of March: The Liberators' Civil War
description:
Beware the Ides of March is an operational hex-and-counter game covering the Liberators’ Civil War – the conflict which saw erstwhile allies Mark Antony and Octavian team-up against Brutus and Cassius. It was here that Rome’s fate was decided once and for all: would the republic be restored, or had it fallen irrevocably to despotism?

The war between the Second Triumvirate and Caesar’s assassins was decided in two battles a few weeks apart - but it didn’t need to happen that way. Designer John Theissen (Antony and Cleopatra, Campaign of Nations) presents players with an operational sandbox. It models the realities of the conflict: the logistical challenges of supplying an army in the ancient world, the uncertainty of combat, and the dangers of sea travel. You will need to be bold, but every action carries with it significant risk, and just as was the case historically, you are not protected from the consequences of failure.

Theissen’s designs are some of the most approachable and streamlined in operational gaming. Rolls on tables simulate sudden storms, external invasions, internal revolts, and the effects of plague. Together these create texture and give context to your decisions.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Red Flag Over Paris: Censorship Variant
description: The Censorship variant limits the risk of an extremely bad hand, and offers an interesting decision space when it comes to hand management.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Political

name: Candy Eggsplosion
description:
Halloween’s here and so are the neighborhood’s impish kids that every Halloween night go on a wild hunt for fresh candy and squeaky clean houses to “decorate” with the peculiar yellow of egg yolk to all those neighbors that don’t satisfy their candy requests. In Candy Eggsplosion you and your friends take the role of these kids' friendly neighbors and you’ll do your best to bribe them with candy, make them happy and the best of all… keep your house clean.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Events, Layering, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Shuppa
description:
Shuppa is a card-collecting game in which you try to collect as many cards as possible by matching lollipops of the same color, Candy Crush-style.

To set up, each player gets a hand of seven number cards (which come in four colors) and two action cards. Two rows of number cards are laid out, with each row having three cards more than the number of players.

The game lasts seven rounds. In the first round, reveal three number cards from the reserve. Each player then chooses and reveals a card, marking it with their player token, with all cards then being placed in a row above the existing cards. Players then claim any group of at least three cards in the same color if the card they played is part of this group. (Player order is determined at random by the left or right arrow on top of the card deck.) After a group is claimed, drop any cards that have an empty space underneath them, which might possibly create a new group that is claimed by the active player. If a player doesn't claim a group, they take an action card from the deck. Place a number card from the reserve at the bottom of any empty column.

The next six rounds play out similarly: Reveal three number cards; everyone plays a number card, then claims a group, if possible. Now, though, anyone who doesn't claim a group can either draw an action card or play an action card. The action cards let you "eat" a card from the play area to score it, move a card to another column, or swap two cards. Ideally these actions will let you score groups.

After seven rounds, tally your score, with multicolor cards being worth 2 points and every other card 1 point.

name: Púkkum
description:
Two games in one: with Pukkum you must use your visual memory to form chains of figures. The more figures you remember, the more points you will earn, but be careful! Your opponent can alter your strategy at any time.

Tottam' is a fast and competitive game that combines the visual-spatial intelligence of Pukkum with the dynamics of card games: form shapes with your pieces, block your opponent's pieces, or steal them. You can play as a team.

name: Eye 2 Eye Duel
description:
A fast-paced, dueling card game in which two players use bluff, cunning and dexterity to defeat their opponent.

The game is divided into rounds, ending with a shootout.
Before starting the round, players look through the cards they have received and arrange them in their hand in a way that is convenient for them. During the game, players can keep their cards in sight, but they MUST constantly look into each other's eyes.
During the round players are playing and moving cards face down to build piles of cards.
During a shootout, each player places their free hand on a selected pile of cards on the table as quickly as possible.
Depending on the cards in the stack, one of them may cause a wound.

The game continues until one player receives a second wound.
mechanics: Real-Time, Secret Unit Deployment, Set Collection

name: Golem Needs Pie
description:
You have recently created a golem from the finest mud and stone in the land, but have accidentally inserted a scroll for a shopping list instead of your originally planned evil deeds. The golem now is only interested in procuring slices of pie and will not stop crashing through walls until they 1) get all the pie or 2) run out of steam. Can you ensure that the golem, made from your hands, leads a fulfilling life?

How to Play

Game Start: Start your game on the Golem space.
Movement: Cross off an available Steam to roll 1d6. You must move the full amount rolled. You may not backtrack on any spaces moved through on this turn.
Pie: If you move through any number of Pies, mark that many in the Pie scoring area. There are 8 Pies per game board.
Bonus: If you end your movement on a Pie, mark the Bonus scoring area in addition to the Pie scoring area.
Breaking Walls: You may cross off an available Steam to break a wall while moving. Sometimes this may be the only option you have to ensure you complete your full movement.

Game End

The game immediately ends if you have run out of Steam, all the Pie has been collected, or you are unable to complete your full movement. If you are unable to complete your full movement, your score is 0.

—description from the designer

name: Armada: Seas of Dread Supplement
description:
Ahoy there captains! Seas of Dread is a supplement book for Mantic's game of epic naval warfare: Armada.

Add extra levels of fun and excitement to your games - With all new scenarios, rules for sea monsters and random events as well as interactive terrain ~ and more! The book also expands on the naval background in the world of Pannithor and introduces the next wave of fleets to be released for the Armada game.

—description from the back of the box
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame

name: Navia
description:
Navia es una alocada carrera río abajo en la que los clanes rivales compiten por el control del bosque.

Cada primavera, con el deshielo y las lluvias, los ríos del Norte se convierten en peligrosas pistas de carreras acuáticas. Nutrias, tejones, erizos y zorros compiten por lograr el favor de la diosa Navia y extender su dominio sobre el territorio durante todo el año, hasta la próxima primavera.

Lidera a tu clan a través de rápidas corrientes y peligrosos obstáculos. Roba, sabotea, usa poderes ocultos, ataca a tus rivales y logra el favor de la diosa Navia. Todo vale para ganar. El problema es que tus rivales harán lo mismo.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

Navia is a wild downstream race where rival clans compete for control of the forest.

Every spring, with the thaw and the rains, the Northern rivers turn into dangerous water racing tracks. Otters, badgers, hedgehogs, and foxes compete to win the favor of the goddess Navia and extend their dominion over the territory throughout the year, until the next spring.

Lead your clan through fast currents and dangerous obstacles. Steal, sabotage, use hidden powers, attack your rivals, and earn the favor of the goddess Navia. Anything goes to win. The problem is that your rivals will do the same.

—description from the publisher

name: Ha Fatto La Battuta
description:
In this game, the designer and artist is a famous italian cartoonist, known with the nickname of Pera Toons.
There are 20 cards depicting a funny joke involving two or three characters. Then there are all cards with a single character depicted on them that are drawn by players. When a player has the two or three characters belonging to the target funny-joke card, he or she can claim it and score points. In addition there are special cards that allow better interactions among players.
A "bomb card" is shuffled in the deck and, when its' revealed, the game ends and the player with most points wins.

Metti insieme gli elementi giusti per una battuta, gli altri giocatori ti ostacoleranno, ti anticiperanno, ti faranno arrabbiare... ...ma tu farai lo stesso! Una sfida esplosiva... perchè prima o poi... TIC-TAC-TIC-TAC...

name: Il Gioco Dei Mimi
description:
There are 50 cards depicting either an animal or an action, with nice and funny drawings perfectly understandable by very young players (3 years old). The first player secretly look at the top card and try to mimic the animal or the action to have the other players guessing. The player which guesses the card wins it and in turn look at the following card and mimic.

After all cards are played, the player with the most cards wins the game :-)

Il tradizionale gioco dei mimi fatto su misura per i più piccoli. Vince chi indovina il maggior numero di imitazioni. E tu sai imitare una rana?

name: Horror on the Orient Express: Investigators Unveiled Expansion
description:
Investigators Unveiled Expansion turns every character you meet in the base game into a playable character. Suspects from the main game can now be played as Investigators, bringing it up to a total of 10 playable Investigators for you to choose from. Moreover, it works both ways - with this expansion every Investigator can be also turned into a Suspect. Every game can have a completely different set of possible cultists!

The Investigators Unveiled Expansion contains the following new components:

78 Skill tiles
6 Investigator portraits
6 Investigator Profession tiles
4 Suspect boards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Novel-based

name: Ninja All Stars: Ninja Practice Demo Kit
description: The Ninja Practice Kit features a full-color poster playmat which includes a play space and fully guided demo. Nine fully-assembled Void Shrine team Ninja All-Stars models, six custom elemental dice, and a mini-token sheet allow players to see the quality components which make up the Ninja All Stars experience. Exclusive Void Shrine art cards are included.
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Moving Multiple Units

name: 40 Bridges
description:
40 Bridges is an abstract strategy game played on a grid of squares and octagons. Players try to win by either being the first one to move a piece into the opposing corner square, or by capturing all of the opponent's pieces.

A piece may move to an adjacent space of the same type it started on (square or octagon) or jump over any adjacent friendly piece. Capture occurs by surrounding an enemy piece on three separate sides.

name: Escape the Dragon
description:
Kids were walking along the river and stumbled upon a sleeping dragon. A rough river separates them from home but the power of friendship, quick wits and a little magic will help them overcome all obstacles!

In this cooperative game you will roll dice and decide the best way to use them together. The Bridge dice will tell you how the kids can move forward and the Spell die will help them go faster and lull the dragon to sleep. To win, lead the kids across the river back to their village before you run out of Dream tokens and the dragon wakes up.

Every turn you roll 3 dice: 2 of them indicate what kinds of bridges the kids can walk on, the 3rd one allows you to cast a spell. Spells help you reroll the dice, choose bridges and walk silently without disturbing the dragon.

If at the end of your turn at least one kid has reached the village, the dragon keeps seeing the same dream as before. If no one has reached the village during your turn you have to discard a dream token. When you run out of dream tokens, the dragon wakes up. Get all the kids back home before that to win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Make a Mess: BMB edition
description:
The Bite Me B**** edition
The Miley Cyrus version of Make a Mess: transforming the version suitable for all publics into a provocative eccentric and deliberately unorthodox game.
For adults only.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Murder in Rain Mané
description:
Try this free short version murder mystery to understand the concept.

Languages: English and Swedish (both versions included)
Players: 1-4
Time: ~30-40 minutes
Difficulty level: 2/5

Plot:
Welcome, Detective, to Rain Mané, a small town on the outskirts of France about 200 km from Paris. Rain Mané is celebrated for its rich artistic heritage and renowned art community.

In this seemingly idyllic place, the truth needs uncovering. Tonight, you find yourself in the middle of a story where a crime has been committed. The year is 1926. Eleanor Leroy, a prominent figure in the art community, has been found dead. The police are overwhelmed by the motives surrounding the death of Eleanor.

Considering your impressive past as a detective, you are appointed the role of lead investigator on this case. The police need your help figuring out who among the characters of Rain Mané is responsible for this particular crime. You need to trace the web of relationships, uncover motives, and get to know the suspicious characters who inhabit this town. Your tools include suspect profiles, their statements, a police report, and evidence material.

The storm is brewing, Detective. And the truth awaits your intuition.

—description from the publisher

name: Millennium Blades: Multiverses Beyonder Mini-Expansion
description:
This mini-expansion contains:

One character, L’oree, who has abilities that focus around cards with flavor text. She also has her own unique deckbox that she can claim at the start of each deckbuilding phase (even if she sold or traded it away).

Five promo sets themed around other Level 99 games:
Bullet Heart
Cool Animal Facts
Bullet Star
Space Chase
Adventures at Argent

Additional accessory and deckbox cards for the core set.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Real-Time, Set Collection, Simulation, Trading

name: Horror on the Orient Express: Consumed by the Void campaign expansion
description:
Consumed by the Void Campaign Expansion invites you on a scenario-based campaign journey through a real nightmare. Face new, powerful enemies, work hand in hand with a mysterious detective, and see for yourself what awaits you in the grand finale!

Also contains (non-exhaustive list):

1 new detective mini
3 new starting landscape tiles
some new monster minis
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based, Trains

name: Beyond the Event Horizon
description:
Beyond the Event Horizon is a diesel-punk inspired 4X space tile game that focuses on larger, multi-player combats and customizable ships. It focuses less on civilization building and focuses more on fast-paced, competitive gameplay.

Enter through a black hole into uncharted space. Discover new planets to capture them for resources and tech. Use this tech to upgrade your ships with basic upgrades and special upgrades found in space. You can then customize your three different ship types to create a superior fighting force and dominate your opponents in large battles. Battles can have dozens of ships, from multiple players all fighting for control of an area, and the battles move so quickly you'll have lots of opportunities to come back for a second chance at winning.

You can use planetary enhancements to develop and defend your planets. During each round marauder ships will enter through new placed wormholes to attack and when defeated, they drop new special upgrades to enhance your ships. These wormholes open up the battlefield as you can travel through them to access different parts or the map. The tiles are placed in a new spot every game, so find new strategies to win.

Beyond the Event Horizon features streamlined rules with complex, engaging strategy. This is a great game for beginners of 4X space tile games, with still so much for long time lovers of the genre. Fast paced and action-packed, it's not "Space...The Final Frontier" it's "Space...THE FINAL FRONT LINE!"

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Resource Queue, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement, Variable Phase Order, Zone of Control

name: Spectrum
description:
A 2 to 4 player game where the objective is to be the first to make two sequences of five connecting tiles. In order to do so, players must make use of their cards strategically, placing their tiles in a square that matches the shape and color of the card they played that turn.
Special cards with game-changing effects are also included, incentivizing players to use them at the appropriate time to thwart the opopnent's plan and gain the upper hand.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Horror on the Orient Express: New Monstrosities expansion
description:
This expansion comes with three completely new types of Monsters. During setup you can decide which Monster you want to use—the green one from the core box or the green one from the New Monstrosities expansion. You can mix and match, but you should alway stick to having three different colors in the game.

In the New Monstrosities expansion, you will find:

7 flying Monster minis on transparent bases
5 abducting Monster minis
3 Flower Lady Monster minis
3 new Monster cards with new Monster abilities


There are 3 types of Monsters in the core game — each with a unique color and a name. They attack the train during the game and they are dangerous to the Passengers, but each in a different way. Monsters appear alongside the train—when they are placed next to the car with no Passengers, they will move forward with the aim of reaching the Locomotive. When the Monsters attack, you will notice very quickly the unique kind of threat each of them pose to your journey.

The new red monster looks to be a very calm woman with a strange haircut, but don’t let its appearance fool you! As soon as this creature notices potential victims, it becomes clear that the woman's body is a twisted disguise for the real creature hidden underneath. She metamorphosizes during the game and reveals her true face—a bloodthirsty plant-like beast that will try to kill everything in its path.

The new blue monsters are winged creatures that spread insanity among the Passengers. How do they do that? They kidnap people from the train and take them on a very unpleasant ride, during which their victims are treated to life-like visions of their own darkest memories… The Passenger is then returned to the train, but never their previous state of mind..

Green insects move in swarms, searching for a warm and cozy space to begin their reproductive process… That’s why they can enter the train cars! It’s quite inconvenient for the passengers, because these monsters cause the train to become even more crowded and dangerous.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Novel-based, Trains

name: Arnaque, bluff et diamant
description:
Master strategy, bluffing, and betrayal to achieve your goals!

You are a gang of professional scammers, but which of you will be the best? The one who will succeed in recreating a legendary jewelry heist from 1939, the culprit of which was never found!

Be careful, during the game your friends will try to trap you... But after all, weren't you planning to do the same to them?

Develop the best strategy, collect the essential elements for your scam, avoid the authorities, bluff your opponents and win the victory!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Maniez la stratégie, le bluff et la trahison pour arriver à vos ﬁns !
Vous incarnez une bande d’arnaqueurs professionnels, mais lequel d’entre vous sera le meilleur ? Celui qui réussira à reproduire un mythique vol de bijoux qui date de 1939 et dont la coupable n’a jamais été retrouvée !
Soyez prudent, au cours de la partie vos amis vont essayer de vous piéger… Mais, après tout, ne comptiez-vous pas leur faire la même chose ?
Mettez au point la meilleure stratégie, collectez les éléments indispensables à votre arnaque, évitez les autorités, bluffez vos adversaires et remportez la victoire !

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Follow, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Race, Take That

name: Inroads
description:
An easy to play, competitive road building table top card game suitable for families and fun for everyone.

Each player tries to build a road from one end of the playing area to the other. The deck is made up of a variety of road cards that must connect, and action cards which have different effects.

The game is combination of chance and strategy and suitable for all ages.

—description from the designer

name: Sherlock Holmes: Mystères à Sorrowdale Manor
description:
A macabre evening at Sorrowdale Manor! Lord Horace Fairchild, the tea and coffee magnate, has just committed suicide. A few minutes later, his son-in-law is found poisoned. And finally his prestigious diamond - the Celestial Moon - mysteriously disappears. Are these events linked or completely independent of each other?

Play as Detective Holmes or Dr. Watson, tracking down clues, interviewing witnesses and using your deductive skills. Make the right choices to solve these three investigations, because you are the hero!

Sherlock Holmes: Mystères à Sorrowdale Manor is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Book, Comic Book / Strip, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based

name: Age of Brigade (ボードゲーム)
description:
Age of Brigade is a card game modeled after the epic medieval militarized Europe.

Mercia was unified for the first time in 200 years by Ethelbert, the man of the generation, and just as the people's hearts stabilized, he suddenly disappeared during a hunting trip.

The king is dead! Who killed him? Rumors spread, and kings and feudal lords from all over the country rose up in the name of vengeance, and in an instant, the world of military forces returned.

You are one of the "pretenders" who have proposed to become the next High King. Tame more than 60 corps and units gathered near the capital and survive repeated battles large and small.
publishers: Southern Cross Games (サザンクロスゲームズ)

name: Ukraine Battles 2014: Ilovaisk & Debal'Tseve
description:
Initially scheduled for Modern War #68 (September 2023), Ukraine Battles is a grand tactical two-player simulation (battalion-brigade level) of the battles fought in the Donbass in 2014-2015. The game system incorporates the tactical and operational lessons learned from the operations in Ukraine, including tactical and operational drones, improved sub munitions, expanded range and lethality of artillery and MRLS systems, improved thermobaric ammunitions, Russian Battalion Tactical Groups, artillery radars, PSYOPs, Special Forces (Spetsnaz) as combat force multipliers, or networked Anti-Aircraft (AA) systems. The system simulates armor superiority, reactive armor, Shtora systems vs. Anti-Tank (AT) missiles and Rocket Propelled Grenades (RPGs), defensive positions and pre-arranged artillery fire, as well as the difficulties of command control and coordination of hybrid armies formed by regulars and militias.

Each game turn represents two to three days, each hex represents 10km or 6 miles, and combat units range from battalions to brigade sized units.

name: Origins & Ends
description:
Origin's & Ends is the final game of The Blackbrim Trilogy, the sequel to Blackbrim: 1876 (Game I) and Reager's Return (Game II).

You've expertly foiled plot after plot, but each time Reager has slipped just beyond your grasp. Now, new information has come to light that may finally give you the upper hand. You return to the origin of your conflict to reveal hidden secrets that were previously just beyond reach. Along the way, you enlist the help of an old friend and embark on what you hope will be the final saga of this journey...

﻿﻿Origins & Ends contains one full storyline made up of two parts, with dozens of puzzles to decipher and clues to crack. It also contains a Blackbrim pin upon completion of the game! Play with a group or on your own for hours of fun.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Divee!
description: Divee! is a modern game in which traditional dice games are adjusted so that they can be played easily without using paper or a pen. It's based on traditional games that have been enjoyed for a long time, and it's fun with origami!

name: Blood Bowl: Gnome Team – Card Pack
description:
Gnomes are one of the most unusual teams to play Blood Bowl. What they lack in size, they more than make up for with tricks, illusions, and playing pranks on the unwary and unwitting.

Ready to build your dream-inducing team? This deck of 44 cards helps you focus on your game and keep track of your stats and special rules. Gnome team coaches have five positions available for hire, plus three Star Players, and these cards will ensure you have everything you need to hand during your games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Spike! Journal Issue #17
description:
This issue includes:

Trifling Tricksters
Vital background knowledge of Gnome teams in Blood Bowl, including a breakdown of the positions they play – Linemen, Beastmasters, and Illusionists, and the forest friends they bring to the pitch, including Woodland Foxes and Altern Forest Treemen.

Famous Gnome Teams
Thrilling tales of the Glimdwallow Geezers (not to be confused with the Glimdwarrow Groundhogs), Anti-Moot Meddlers, and more improbably-named teams.

Team Spotlight: Glimdwarrow Groundhogs
Hailing from one of the largest known settlements of Gnomes, this team has broken out of the bogs to play actual games across the Old World, becoming a firm fan favourite for their antics and plucky spirit. While highlights might be a stretch, you'll learn all about their history, team rating, and 2501-2502 lineup.

Star Player Spotlight – Rowena Forestfoot
Known as the Guardian of the Forest, this unlikely champion rides on the back of a stag. More focused and level-headed than many of her team-mates, she’s a dependable and agile asset to the Gnomes.

Dirt from the Dugout
Mindy Piewhistle exposes a scandal involving a Gnome team’s memorabilia, which may be too good to be true.

Star Player Spotlight – Rodney Roachbait
This Gnome is always angling for his next big catch. His mastery of the fishing rod proves quite handy, even if the balls end up punctured from time to time.

Gnome Garden Leagues
Fancy a casual game that’s big on magical hijinks, if not stunning feats of athleticism? Try your hand at using this set of rules for playing in the Gnome Garden Leagues.

Mystical Forest Blood Bowl Pitch
Includes rules for using the Mystical Forest Blood Bowl Pitch in your games, including special rules for a Forest Floor crawling with critters, a mystical Healing Glow, and Gnomish Portals. These rules are also included with the GnomeTeam - Double-sided Pitch and Dugouts Set.

Gnome Balls
Includes background and rules for 2 unique balls – the Oversized Acorn and the Gnomish Idol ball.

Coffin Corner
Spike! Journal's obituaries column commemorating those players who are no longer with us, whether trampled on the pitch, torn apart, or possibly eaten.

Chat with the Rat
Ace Skaven reporter Hackspit ‘the Scribbler’ Quillchewer tries to get to the bottom of an important question – what’s the difference between Gnomes and Halflings.

Pro Playbook: A League of Their Gnome
A thorough breakdown of what it takes to coach the Gnomes to an unlikely victory, including how to hire a team and develop them over time.

Star Player Spotlight – Akhorne the Squirrel
Don't make the mistake of underestimating this bite-sized bruiser. While the Gnomes are well-gnome for bringing their woodland pals to the pitch, this particular player puts the crit back in critter, racking up an impressive tally of casualties.

Dungeon Bowl Update: Gnome Teams
Provides a narrative and rules update for players to use your Gnome team miniatures in games of Dungeon Bowl.

Mighty Blow! – Oh Gnome You Didn't!
In this comic strip, Bob plumbs the confused shreds of his addled memory to piece together what little he knows about playing against a team of forest-dwelling Halflings.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Stack-a-Cash
description:
Stack-a-Cash is 3-in-a-row style game played with coins.

The game was made as a challenge to see if a game could be made to fit on one side of a business card.

To play the game you need a 3x3 board and six coins.
You need 2 large, 2 medium, and 2 small coins. Denominations are irrelevant.

One player plays heads, the other plays tails.

All six coins are common to both players.

On your turn you can

place a coin
move and/or flip a coin


Coins can be stacked big to small.
You cannot move or flip a coin that was just moved, flipped, or placed.

Game ends as soon as someone makes three in a row of the same side (heads or tails) on the topmost layer of coins.

Be careful you don't lay traps for yourself, the game is trickier than it looks!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Square Grid

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – Today the Rebellion Dies Squad Pack
description:
The Today the Rebellion Dies squad pack includes Iden Versio and the elite units of the Inferno Squad to create a strike team for the skirmish miniatures game Star Wars: Shatterpoint.

The Inferno Squad has proven its prowess in numerous clandestine missions, carrying out assassinations and lightning strikes to protect the Empire's most important secrets.


Multilingual squad pack for the skirmish miniatures game Star Wars: Shatterpoint
Mission team with Iden Versio, Gideon Hask, Del Meeko and Imperial Special Forces
Beautifully modelled miniatures that are ideal for dedicated miniature players, newcomers to the hobby and for painting alike
Contains 5 highly detailed, unpainted miniatures, 4 command cards, 4 battle style cards and 4 unit value cards


—description from the publisher

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – Real Quiet Like Squad Pack
description:
The Real Quiet Like squad pack includes Han Solo, Chewbacca and a Rebel strike team to create a strike team for the skirmish miniatures game Star Wars: Shatterpoint.

Featuring Han Solo along with the fiercely loyal Wookiee Chewbacca, who wields a mighty bowcaster and uses his tremendous muscle power on dangerous missions, this Rebel strike force fights to restore freedom to the Galaxy.


Multilingual squad pack for the skirmish miniatures game Star Wars: Shatterpoint
Mission team with Han Solo, Chewbacca and a strike force of elite Rebel commandos
Beautifully modelled miniatures that are ideal for dedicated miniature players, beginners to the hobby and for painting alike
Contains 4 highly detailed, unpainted miniatures, 3 command cards, 3 battle style cards and 3 unit value cards


—description from the publisher

name: Tropicarta
description:
Stories tell of the legendary c, a bird said to bring everlasting happiness and wealth beyond measure to those able to sate its hunger. If the rumors are to be believed, these rare creatures dwell on an uncharted island where they make their nests and rest their wings.
Determined to seek your fortune, you track down leads and somehow manage to make landfall upon this virgin isle. To your delight, you quickly stumble upon the quarry you seek—the elusive joybeak!
Before long, however, you realize your new feathered friend is far more demanding than anticipated. To satisfy its unending hunger, you have little choice but to wander the jungle with the joybeak perched upon your arm in search of the berries it desires.
Do happiness and wealth await you at the end of this trial? There is but one way to find out...

—description from the designer

name: Sitting Ducks: Ent-Bindung Promo
description:
Expansion card for Sitting Ducks saying:

"Place any duck on an adjacent duck, these ducks are connected. The connected ducks are moved like a duck, placed in the crosshairs and removed as long as they are in the field of fire."

"Lege eine beliebige Ente auf eine angrenzende Ente, diese Enten sind verbunden. Die verbundenen Enten werden wie eine Ente bewegt, ins Fadenkreuz genommen und entfernt, solange sie im Schussfeld sind."

name: Soul Strain
description:
Soul Strain is a card game for 1-4 players, enhanced by dice rolls, perfect for quick 15-20 minute sessions. It's designed for easy setup, offering simple, stress-free rules, and a dynamic and flowing gameplay experience.

Soul Strain uses the mechanics of Pentaquest card game with some variations. Specifically, the target combinations on the cards are different, the player has a ticket that acts as a wildcard, the score is based on the combinations of cards retained and not on their number, there are 48 cards with combinations to beat instead of 42, there is no [+/-] symbol, and instead of having the two symbols Sun and Moon, there is only the Vinyl symbol.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Hedge Mage
description:
Build a hedge maze of polyominos to prevent your rival from stealing your gnomes, all while navigating your other neighbor’s maze to nab their gnomes.

It’s a wizard vs. wizard prank war and no gnome is safe! But this is a neighborhood of moderately powered Hedge Mages, with only two powers: grow shrubs, and animate garden gnomes. To sneak into your neighboring mage’s yard to yoink their gnomes, while keeping another rival mage from snagging yours, it’s going to take both powers you’ve got. Harness your horticulture magic to gather the greatest gnome collection!

- Construct a magical(ish) hedge maze to keep your gnomes in!
- Navigate your neighbor’s ever-growing labyrinth!
- Enchant neighboring gnomes, spark them to life, and steal them away to victory!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Pick-up and Deliver, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Valhalla: Solo Mode Expansion
description: This expansion contains 20 cards (4 different monsters, 5 cards per monster) and challenges solo-players. The difficulty level is high enough and demands exact calculation and some luck.

name: Tess
description:
Tess is a game of tactical tiling. Players compete and co-operate(sometimes inadvertently) to create colourful patterns.

Each player starts with a set of tiles of different colours and shapes. And the game proceeds with each player placing a tile onto the board adding to the pattern. There are two competing objectives, one to maximise the number of colours the tile is in contact with, and the other is to complete patterns present on cards they have drawn from a pile.

The resulting pattern every time is unique like a snowflake.

—description from the designer

name: The Walking Dead: Surrounded – Under Siege
description:
The more ground you cover, the more danger you find. The arrival of hard-eyed mercenaries promises a breakthrough against the surrounding threats, but only if you can keep everyone together long enough to make your escape.

6-card expansion for The Walking Dead: Surrounded, that adds Mercenaries, explosives and a new Swap ability.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: License to Laugh
description:
License to Laugh is a party game that hinges on your ability to be creative in an attempt to make the other players laugh, or merely please the judge.

A round begins with the judge drawing three letter cards at random. Once all of the players have seen the letters the timer is flipped and they have one minute to write a phrase. The phrase they come up with has to begin with the three letters drawn in the order they are shown on the plate, articles (a, an, the) prepositions (in, on, with, of) or conjunctions (and, but, or) can be added to the phrase to get your thoughts across better. Other then these exceptions, players aren't allowed to add additional words. It is up to the group to determine how vulgar or family friendly you will play. Once time is up, the judge reads the entries aloud and chooses a winner. The criteria for picking a winner is up to the judge, players can feel free to plead their case. Each letter card has a score associated with it and points are awarded according to how many are shown on the plate for that round. The letter cards are set aside and the role of judge moves to the next player. The game ends when a player reaches the finish on the board.

Like a lot of party games, the goal of License to Laugh is for everyone to have a good time, a laugh, and maybe stimulate conversation. Unlike other popular party games, License to Laugh puts the creativity completely in the players hands, no prewritten responses here! This ensures each game is unique to whichever group you have assembled.

name: Cold Case Detectives: Fall #1 – Tödlicher Sommer 1998
description:
If a murder cannot be resolved, one speaks of a cold case.

As Cold Case Detectives, you take over such cases and solve crimes that have remained unsolved for years.

This game is designed like a realistic investigation file.
View and analyse newspaper articles, evidence, photos, documents, digital materials and a lot more.

Case #1 - Summer 1998
It is summer 1998 in the small town of Rudensberg. The 19-year-old Bernd Zöller is found murdered in the outdoor pool.
Immerse yourself in the late nineties and find out who is responsible for the murder.

General:

Use over 40 realistic documents and objects and work like real investigators to cooperatively find the murderer.
With videos, soundtracks, special websites and many other interactive content.


Important: you need internet access. The story is only playable once, but the material is not destroyed and can therefore be given away to friends.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Dominion: Rising Sun
description:
We journey now to the islands to the east – or west, depending on where you are relative to them. Here your title is Emperor. They tell you you’re just a figurehead, though you can still order whatever breakfast you want. They may be right; you did get that breakfast. Your ceremonial sword and armor are made of paper. The samurai never let you into their tea parties, and the ninjas are always tying your shoelaces together. And the epic poem they wrote about you is only 17 syllables long. Rice has been adopted as currency, and no-one seems to even be trying to get your face onto the grains. But when you wake up each morning and look out over the land, life doesn’t seem so bad. Now, what’s for breakfast?

This is the 16th expansion to Dominion.

It has 300 cards, with 25 new Kingdom card piles. There are Shadow cards that leap out from your deck, and Prophecies that will someday happen and change everything. Debt and Events return.

—description from the publisher

name: Bori Wars
description: Bori Wars is a survey-based card game in which players or teams try to match the most popular answers to survey questions posed to Puerto Ricans. Split your group and compete to see who wins the most points.

name: Endless Winter: Gaming Promo Card
description:
Originally available from backing Secret Cabal 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Discard 2 cards from your hand to your discard pile and draw 4 cards from your deck into your hand.

name: Fly Wiz
description:
Take on the roles of witches and wizards and challenge each other to a broom race!

Each turn, draw a number of movement cards — which include actions like advancing, taking mana, and rolling the die — equal to the number of players and line them up in a row. Players then choose a card from their personal deck of numbered cards and reveal them simultaneously. These played cards are lined up in order beneath the movement cards, and each action is resolved from the highest-numbered card to the elowest. However, if two players play the same number (resulting in "butting"), they do not get to take an action and receive mana instead. Mana, which can be obtained in several ways, allows the player to roll the movement die to advance. This functions as a catch-up mechanism, with the first-place player paying 6 mana to roll and the fourth-place player paying 1 mana. The player who reaches the goal fastest wins.

In addition to the basic rules, there are advanced rules where player characters each have unique abilities as well as special actions on each space of the race course. There are also cooperative rules where players work together to escape the dragon!
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Cooperative Game, Events, Variable Player Powers

name: Long Dark Sea: Weakness Expansion
description:
The Weakness Expansion includes 18 alternative weakness cards that can combine or replace the core game Weakness cards to change the difficulty of the game.

Weakness cards make the game more interesting, affecting your hand management. The crew members are not superhuman, so they can be affected by the horrors of the incursion. Combine different weakness types to increase the immersion of the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Long Dark Sea:  Bounty Expansion
description:
Hunt the most wanted enemies and complete objectives as a team and your crew will obtain additional benefits during the raid stage.

The Bounty expansion introduces and additional game mode where players work together as a team to complete an objective.

The bounty cards are reversible cards with an objective in front, and a supply type on the reserve. When the incursion team completes the objective, flip the card. At any time any during their turn, any player can claim the reward with benefits for all the team.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Long Dark Sea: Contracts Expansion
description:
Sign your own contract to complete individual objectives and obtain large amounts of resources and credit on the Nova Nasau Black Market.

The Contracts expansion introduces and additional game mode where players can choose their own individual contract in a push your luck mechanic. When the incursion step ends the players can check in the black market phase if they completed the contract, to obtain resources and loot.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Long Dark Sea: Dark Side Expansion
description:
The Dark Side Game Mode introduces 52 alternative copies of enemies, locations and events with the dark back cards to make even more difficult and unpredictable the core game.
The dark back card mechanic makes the game more unpredictable because you don’t know what are in the other side of the card and also makes the enemies more hard because they are affected by eclipses on the Luminara System.
This expansion is designed for those who are not afraid of the dark.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: UNO Disney 100
description: The special 'Mickey's Movie Madness' rule forces players to name 4 characters from a chosen Disney movie or they must draw 4 cards!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: 箱庭少女 / Deep Forest (Hakoniwa Shōjo / Deep Forest)
description:
In a miniature garden world created and closed off by a witch's curse, 13 girls whose memories were stolen fell into darkness and became puppets of the witch. Work together, recover the girls' memories, escape the witch, and save everyone!

In the cooperative game 箱庭少女 / Deep Forest (Miniature Garden Girls / Deep Forest), players take on the role of birds in a miniature world. At the start of the game, only the players and the witch move around the board. Girls may appear as themselves when their memories are revealed, or they may enter the game as marionettes, still under the witch's control. Shadows serving the witch may also appear to threaten the players. The witch and her allies roam the map to capture players, and the players lose if they are all caught.

Once a girl has her memory back, players may lead her to the church, the one safe space. Rescuing a girl grants the player special abilities that will help as the game continues. Once all the girls have been rescued, players must escape through the Gate of Liberation. But be careful: If you are captured and the other players have escaped, there will be no one to rescue you!

If players are captured, or if a player is captured after all the other players have escaped, players receive the game's bad ending. If the players rescue all the girls and escape the miniature garden world, they receive the normal or the good ending depending on their score.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Backpack Hazard
description:
Backpack Hazard is a competitive puzzle game in which players draft item cards and stuff them into backpacks in a world where a zombie pandemic has broken out.

Each round, one of the two item cards dealt is passed around to the next player, and the two item cards are stuffed into a backpack.
The backpack is 3 x 5 squares, and the item cards have items drawn within 2 x 3 squares on both sides.
You can rotate the cards as you place them, and you can stack them on top of or under already placed item cards. However, you cannot stack them so that they protrude from the backpack or hide items.
The top of your backpack depicts the unique bonus score you get at the end of the game. You can also place item cards to hide bonus scores, but you will not receive any bonuses for doing so.
There are four types of items: guns, ammunition, herbs, and keys, and you score points for meeting each of these conditions. Guns and ammunition must be in pairs of the same color, herbs can be stacked, and keys must be connected to the same key.

After the second round, the achievement phase is played at half time. Players with 10 or more points on items only will receive an extra bonus point at the end of the game.
On the third round you may rearrange your item cards.
After the fourth round, the final scoring phase takes place. The player with the highest total of items and bonus points is the winner.

—description from the designer (translated)
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Sorcerer: Tatsu Character Pack
description:
Tatsu grew up in the Sengoku period, a time of constant war. A descendant of a noble clan, she was raised in Konomine Castle, and became one of the court ladies there.

Her life of privilege was interrupted when a large army led by Ouchi Teruhiro attacked the castle. With their lord and his army off on raids of his own, the defense of the castle fell to Lady Ichikawa. Knowing her few remaining warriors would not be enough, Lady Ichikawa armed Tatsu and the other court ladies and prepared them to defend the castle against Teruhiro's army.

Tatsu was only 17, and this was the first time she raised a sword. But to her surprise, she felt no fear in battle. Instead, a thrill energized her and she fought ferociously. After 10 long days of battle, Teruhiro's army fled, but not before Tatsu suffered a vicious gut wound.

The days that followed were pure agony as her wound festered. This continuous intense pain brought about her awakening in a thunderous blast of sound and force that left several dead and a hole in the castle wall.

Unaware of her sorcerer’s heritage, Tatsu was confused and frightened. She fled the castle, and was presumed dead.
