A tile based tactical skirmish game based on the Realms of Norse Mythology.
Each realm is comprised of unique Norse characters and their wondrous abilities. The game allows you to pit these against each other in a bid to claim total victory. The victors will reshape the World in their own form.

Each Realm has a choice of Heroic or Epic play styles that focus on either raw power or tactical advantage. Heroic has simple abilities but is harder hitting. Epic adds advanced abilities and lore based content. Overall the game is balanced to mix Heroic and Epic styles together. Experienced players can involve themselves in the valorous abilities and tactics of Epic and still have a balanced fight against new players learning Heroic.

Each realm has nine individual card stock figures mounted on a base. Movement and combat in the varied terrain hexes is fuelled by an Action Pool. Combat uses-twelve sided dice that can be modified with Fate Cards. The winner is either the Realm with the last ruler standing or who has filled up their Blood Cauldron up with the sanguine fluid of their enemies!

The War of the Nine Realms is a tactical skirmish game for 2-4 players, aged 10 or above. Game time is 60 minutes and the complexity is 7 ( on a scale of 1-10). Varied board layouts, Heroic and Epic play styles, alternate victory goals, combine to produce a game playable time after time.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Moskva
description:
This is a French wargame on Operation Barbarossa 1941.

Re-implements:

MOCKBA: La battaglia di Mosca 1941
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Championship Drag Racing: Top Fuel Edition
description:
From the publisher's description:

"After years of trying, I’ve finally arrived at a final product in which I’m extremely happy, and I think captures the sport as best as possible. And while rolling a game of Championship Drag Racing will take a bit longer than a 4.5 second Elapsed Time, I really think the flow of the game is done very well. The average gamer should easily be able to knock out an event in a single sitting while experiencing all of the drama and excitement of a real-life drag racing event."

"Anything that can happen in a real life drag racing event; can and will happen with the same frequency in Championship Drag Racing. Drivers will red-light, have tremendous reaction times, blow up their engines, and even crash with the same frequency as the year represented. And as with any replay game that is worth its salt there are allowances made within the confines of realistic frequency for ANYTHING to truly happen."

"In general, your results will be very close to the on-the-track action of the season represented. However, keep in mind, that this game simulates hundreds of variables that can occur in any race. As with any sport, sometimes pure luck can be the deciding factor. That’s no exception with Championship Drag Racing. On the whole, you’ll experience very realistic results. But, within the confines of a single qualifying run or elimination race, anything can truly happen!"

"Championship Drag Racing: Top Fuel Edition gives you every Top Fuel Racer that made a successful qualifying attempt in 2005. You also get all 23 circuits rated by lane making the lane choice strategy just as important as real life. A full schedule, complete points standings, complete final ladders for each event, as well as a list of drivers that attempted to make every field are included."

The standard game is printed in black and white. The Deluxe edition of the game is printed in full color.

name: Makin' Movies
description:
MAKIN' MOVIES is a card game about collecting the right actors and money to make a movie.

You are a low budget movie producer and your goal is to compete against other players to be the first to collect enough money and the right actors to make your movie. Use your money to protect your actors from other players, or hire their actors! It's a simple card game with many options and different ways to win.
Each turn every player has 3 actions which represent; Holding auditions, casting for roles in your movie and hiring actors from other players.

The game concludes with the winning player naming their movie or giving a quick advertisement trailer for their movie based on the strange collection of actors they have hired.

The FREE Print and Play game contains 44 actor cards, 12 money cards, 8 scripts.

Retail Version contains 50 actors, 12 money cards, and 10 scripts.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: (Self-Published), Everingham Games, Print & Play Productions, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Jakie to Flagi?
description: Flag - based trivia game. Contains a board with world map depicting 193 countries and 193 flags, as well as 100 cards with flag/name/population/capital/language/area.

name: Jurassic Parts: Black Market Promo Card
description: When you earn amber for completing dinosaur fossil sets, instead of placing the amber in your pool for spending, place it on this card instead. You cannot use the amber for the rest of the game. At the end during final scoring, every amber placed on this card will score 2 points instead of the usual 1.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Set Collection

name: Winnie the Pooh in the Honey Heist
description:
Overview: Help Winnie the Pooh and his friends collect honey from the beehives

Players: 1 - 100+
Game Time: 25 minutes
Items needed: 2 six-sided dice

The game is played over 12 rounds, with players playing simultaneously, trying to earn the most points by placing numbers into runs and sets in each beehive. One die will be used for Winnie the Pooh, while the other die will be one of his friends coming to help. All players will use the same dice pool for each roll, however each player determines how to use the dice.

Gameplay: Each Round you will roll 2 dice and then use each die to place a number in any open hexagon in any beehive. One die will be used for Winnie the Pooh, using the number on the die for a hexagon space. The other die will be used for a Friend, which will also place a number in an open hexagon space. The goal is to make number runs and/or sets of the same number in each beehive. The longer the run or the larger the set, the more points you will earn.

Round Summary:

- Roll 2 dice - Roll the 2 dice. Write the numbers in the current round’s track. The round tracker is just used as a helpful reference. (Over a game you will mark 24 numbers, filling all the beehives. It will be 2 numbers each round, over the 12 rounds)

- Use one die for Winnie the Pooh
Choose one of the dice for Winnie the Pooh. Write the number on the die in any open hexagon space in any beehive.

- Use one die for a Friend
Use the other die for one of Pooh’s friends, using whatever their special ability is. Some friends will give you a choice between two numbers. Some friends will look at Pooh’s die and then make another number based off of that number. Write the number in any open hexagon in any beehive. Also, mark an X over the leftmost heart on the friendship track under the friend you chose. Note: You may choose a friend more than three times, there just is not any additional bonus.

- Repeat this until you have completed 12 rounds

Scoring: The goal is to make number runs and/or sets of the same number in each beehive. The longer the run or the larger the set, the more points you will earn. You can use each number you wrote once for a run and once for a set. You can use the number already in the center of each beehive in multiple runs or sets. A run is three or more numbers that are connected and continuously increasing by one. A set is a group of two or more numbers that are connected and all the same number.

End of Game:
Total all your runs, sets, furthest star on the honey/bee track, and also all stars earned from friends. Total these points and the highest score wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Floats McGoats
description:
The game that floats yer goats! A seafaring goat crew was navigating treacherous waters when their boat capsized! The ship broke apart, leaving wood strewn throughout the waves. To save the goats, players must build a raft from the wood. Each player fights to outsmart the others in a quest to get their goats on the raft. But watch out for the shark lurking in the waters... In this captivating game of strategy, it's every wee goat for themself!

SAVE THE GOATS: Build a raft and rescue your shipwrecked goats! Use strategy to oustmart your opponents, but watch out for the SHARK!

STRATEGY BOARD GAME: On your turn, either add a goat to the raft, or roll the 12-sided die and take the action shown. The die has actions including: Add a Raft Stick, Goat Fight, Goat Love, Shark Attack, and other twists.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Stacking and Balancing, Take That

name: Starship Command II
description:
This expansion set for Starship Command added two players and a number of additional cards and rules, such as Fighter Squadrons and Carriers.

Expands:

Starship Command
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Dallas
description:
This is an updated version of Cartel by the game's original designer, Philip Orbanes. In the late 70's Phil had added a game of random event cards to Cartel to add variety to the game. In Dallas, those cards are added, the board is also slightly changed in the new theme, which is based on the Dallas TV show.

Players take turns bidding on and buying companies on the board. Larger networks of adjacent companies create higher payouts. Players can also risk taking on debt to pay higher prices, hoping the resulting network pays for the liability of the debt. A deck of random event cards adds a random element, "Dallas Press Events," to each turn (making the game different from the original Cartel).

The winner is the player that acquires the highest net worth, adding together current cash plus the value of their network of companies, less the cost of repaying their debt.

While the game has a theme based on the popular TV shows, only the companies, e.g., Ewing Oil, appear in the game. A very few of the characters are mentioned in flavor text that appears in the rulebook. None of the stars of the show are pictured and the graphic design does not pick up on the TV shows look and feel either.

name: Bastogne
description:
Bastogne is an Operational level Solitaire board-wargame covering the German siege of the town of Bastogne during the "Battle of the Bulge", specifically the period 18-26 December when the town was surrounded. Bastogne is based on Dien Bien Phu (Modern War #17), but there are some significant differences.

You (the player) command US forces, while the game system controls the Germans.

The game is a race against time. You must hold out until relieved by Patton’s Third Army. If not, the Germans take the town and possibly gain a better outcome for the "Battle of the Bulge".

While a Solitaire game, Bastogne can also be played by two or more players, each taking charge of different aspects of the US defense. For example, one player can be overall commander, others command various defensive sectors, and another take charge of air and artillery.
Components: 22x34 inch map, 176 die-cut counters.

World at War #56, Fall 2017

name: Квилт (Quilt)
description:
So, each player is an unsurpassed master and will create a real work of art today, while earning as many victory points as possible. Quilt is a game for all family members, great for both beginners and experienced players who can enjoy finding a tactical game plan and making various combos.

The essence of the game:

We pull out pencils from the bag and distribute them among the needle beds, and then take them apart for ourselves.
We color, with the received pencils, the cells of our quilt.
Activate chains of effects and collect bonuses.


It turned out to be an unusual logic game in a tempting warm cover.

name: Small City: Character Meeple Expansion 1 – The Political Activist
description:
This is the part#1 of the stretch goals unlocked thanks to the KS Campaign. It contains :

One new character meeple called The Political Activist 22mm with one sheet of rules
2 Official Variants :
The peaceful mayor : He can collect votes instead of blocking the building.
The parks : The parks are now eligible to be upgraded. Parks level 2 and 3 can not be built anymore though.

One Standardization chart numerated and signed by the designer Alban Viard that explains the relation between the tiles, the money, the Vote points, the pollution and the mini-meeples.

name: The White Flame
description: The White Flame is a scenario pack for the Star Trek Starship Combat Game which details the exploits of the Emperor's own 123rd Assault Flotilla. This Klingon Battle Group patrols the uneasy border of Klingon, Federation, and Romulan space. Included are unit history, organization, personalities, and combat readiness, as well as fifteen scenarios, pitting the White Flame against Orion, Romulan, and Federation opponents in a series of deadly encounters.

name: The Bermuda Crisis: Discovery Dawning (Second Edition)
description:
At its core, The Bermuda Crisis: Discovery Dawning is a free-form card game about skill acquisition and management. Players accomplish this by drawing resources they then spend to obtain various abilities.

Over time you'll use the various resources you've collected to build and upgrade base camps. These camps specialize in (1) defense & resource efficiency, (2) game control & magic, and (3) trading & secret missions. Striking a balance between focus and diversification is the biggest challenge players will face.

You win the game by acquiring victory points, but there are two alternate endings. As the game progresses, an imaginary hourglass counts down the island's doom. If time runs out, a victor is chosen via the collection of "nature points." The third way a game can end is if a player collects all three pieces of Brinehorn's Scroll, which are scattered randomly throughout the island and unlock the esoteric history of The Bermuda Triangle. Both alternate scenarios create palpable suspense as players race towards their preferred ending.

Ultimately, The Bermuda Crisis: Discovery Dawning is easy to learn but challenging to master. It appeals to different personality types and finishes on an exhilarating note. You and your gaming comrades will want to explore the island time and time again!
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Unsurmountable: Expansion Collection
description:
A compilation of two previously released and two new expansions for Unsurmountable:


Unsurmountable: Big Climb
Unsurmountable: Dual Peaks
Unsurmountable: Acclimatization
Unsurmountable: Rescue Mission
mechanics: Chaining, Network and Route Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dice and Slice
description:
It's time for a pizza party, and everybody wants a slice! In Dice and Slice, you roll the custom Dice to slice up your very own pizza! Use your Pencil to copy dots and lines from the Dice onto your Scoresheet, making "cuts" in your pizza. Slice the biggest pieces possible and add the right toppings to score big and WIN!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Paper-and-Pencil, Turn Order: Progressive

name: LOTTO
description:
Each lottery master has different methods to get the prize number but getting the number aren't enough. They also need to find the Lotto with that number. Only the fastest one will get that Lotto. It doesn't matter how much Lottos you buy. The only thing that matters is what lottery number will be drawn.
" Hold on your cards and Win the lottery in LOTTO. "

Setup
1. Each Player takes a set of Number cards with the same color.
2. Randomly select 16 Lotto cards for the game and put the remaining cards in the box.
3. Place selected cards face-down in the middle of table.

How to play
1. Draw 1 Lotto card and place it face-up next to the deck.
2. Each player shuffles their Number cards face-down.
3. When everyone is ready. 1 player starts
Countdown from 3 then look at their Number cards
and try to make a stack of cards that satisfy condition
of the revealed Lotto card.
4. When you finished making stack reach, out and try to place your hand on the Lotto card as fast as you can. First player to reach the lotto card wins the card.
5. Other players can decide to Challenge. That means the challenger thinks your stack is not satisfy the condition. If there are multiple Challengers, discuss until there’s only one challenger.
• If the stack is Incorrect (ex. wrong number , wrong order ,or cards not on the stack) The challenger take that Lotto instead and also randomly take
1 Lotto card from the challenged Player. If that player doesn’t have any Lotto card, that player can’t take the Lotto during next round (But he can still Challenge)
• If the stack is correct, the challenged player still take that Lotto card and randomly take Lotto card from challenger. If that player doesn’t have any Lotto card, that player can’t take the Lotto during next round (But can still Challenge)
6. Each player takes their Number cards back and reveal the next Lotto card.
The game ends when all 16 Lotto cards are taken.

name: Rommel & Tunisia
description:
"Rommel & Tunisia" is an operational wargame of the World War 2 campaign in Tunisia. Units are at battalion to brigade size and the map covers from the Libya-Tunisia border to west of Tebessa Algeria.

600 counters
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: The Korean War
description:
The Korean War is published by Sunset Games, and was originally made by Epoch games.

Turn length: 1 week
Unit Size: Regiments or Divisions.
Players: 1-2
Playing Time: 6 hours
Solitaire Suitability: High (on a scale of Low-Medium-High)

A game on the "Mobile" period of the Korean War covering 6/25/50 to 10/15/50.

Components include:

(1) 22x34 map
(132) counters
43 page rule book (in English).

Moderate complexity and fairly attractive.

name: Warmachine: High Command – Faith & Fortune: Escalating Conflict
description:
EXPAND YOUR COMMAND
Bolster your armies with Escalating Conflict, an 84-card expansion for WARMACHINE High Command Faith & Fortune! Escalating Conflict contains 5 copies each of 16 different cards, plus 4 additional warcaster cards, to bring new strategies to your Retribution of Scyrah, Convergence of Cyriss, Highborn Covenant, and Four Star Syndicate decks.

This set contains:

21 Retribution of Scyrah cards
21 Convergence of Cyriss cards
21 Highborn Covenant cards
21 Four Star Syndicate cards
1 Rule reference card
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Full Count
description:
Description from the publisher:

In 1982, Korea launched professional baseball with six clubs. And the legendary heroes that have appeared so far ... they appear in the game.

Last year we published a game called HandsKit with social funding. Many gamers participated and released at the time.

I am going to introduce a new game based on that experience. If the handkets were a difficult dexterity game that requires skill, this is a highly accessible Dexterity game.

This game is a baseball game, and the key mechanic is a striking box.

There is a wooden box with a hole in the center and a bevel inside the box. If the cube ball dropped from the top and entered the bore-shaped hole correctly, the blow was successful.

If you drop it too low, it is likely to be a foul because there is not enough potential energy, so you have to fall as high as possible. It is the same principle as marbling when I was a child.

The higher the ball is dropped, the farther the ball goes. But the probability of passing through the hole will be that much.
It is a high risk high return concept using gravity and position energy.

name: Persuasion
description:
The Victorian courtship card game of deduction, catfishing, and conceding power.

Content Warning: This game presents marriage and independence as win/lose scenarios, and suggests relationships with unhealthy power dynamics.

While attending a party, you meet some suitors, full of potential wealth, standing, and passion. You’ve detailed your desires in your diary, and now you must discern who meets your needs by reading the trait cards they mail to you.

Your cards describe actions, but only the players you court will perform them. Each round, you share a card with a player, and they’ll choose which of your cards to leverage. When you find the one, send them your ring! They must reciprocate for you two to become engaged, so you must persuade them you’re compatible with their desires!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Semi-Cooperative Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers

name: Montenotte 1796
description:
Montenotte 1796 is the first game of a new series on revolutionary and napoleonic campaigns: La Grande Tactique.
Units are divisions and brigades, a strength point equals 1000 infantrymen or 500 cavalrymen. A hex is around 6 km (3,7 miles) and a turn is a day.

Units are hidden from the enemy (on their reverse side) to preserve the fog of war. Activation of formations is determined randomly but the player with initiative gets a special advantage. Battles are resolved on the map and include tactical advantages and disdvantages, units can march to the sound of the guns.

Command, morale and fatigue rules complete a medium complexity system.

(from the publisher - translated)


Montenotte 1796 est le premier jeu d'une nouvelle série consacrée aux campagnes de l'époque révolutionnaire et impériale : La Grande Tactique.
Les unités représentent des divisions et des brigades ou équivalent, un point de force égale 1000 fantassins ou 500 cavaliers , la distance séparant chaque hexagone représente à peu près 6 km et le tour de jeu équivaut à une journée.

Les unités évoluent face cachée sur la carte afin de préserver le brouillard de la guerre, l'activation des différentes formations se fait de façon aléatoire mais le joueur qui a l'initiative possède un avantage à l'activation. Les combats ont lieu sur la carte et il est possible de manœuvrer tactiquement et de renforcer une attaque par une marche au canon.

Des règles de commandement, moral, de fatigue complètent un système de complexité moyenne.

(from the publisher - de l'éditeur)
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Deep State: Ultimate Deep State Mini-Expansion
description:
Ultimate Deep State is a promo mini-expansion that you can add to your games of Deep State.

The highest stage of a Project development brings world dominance. It may take radical forms that knock out any competition. No matter how powerful the ‘Committee’ is, it is vulnerable to its own subdivision heads.

Victory in a World Domination Project, including the total neutralization of the ‘Committee’ and all its structures, costs more and brings higher risks. Its reward is a clean slate... while sitting atop the world as its one and only ruler.

The Ultimate Deep State promo mini-expansion allows for instant victory when you reach Stage V in any Project, instead of winning with Influence. Each Stage V has higher requirements only experienced players can meet.

There is also a "soft" version — with less difficult requirements, Stage V grants more influence and no instant victory.

This expansion contains overlays for Stages V for the 4 base set Projects and the 6 Projects from the Global Conspiracy expansion. It is fully compatible with all modules and mini-expansions from the Deep State: Global Conspiracy expansion. It is designed for 1–5 player games. It comes packaged in its own zip-bag.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Political, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hand Management, Market, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Revolver Noir: Rogue Agents
description:
Not every shape in the shadows is a rival investigator; there are a host of other dark figures skulking around the mansion. Each has their own purpose, and the tools to accomplish the job.

In this 4-card expansion, you will receive 4 double sided role cards (2 for each player, allowing them to choose any of the 4 roles - including the same role as their opponent). The roles introduce new challenges and provide new abilities, which will mix up games in a fun new way.

name: Let's Start a Band!
description:
Let's Start a Band! is a board game in which you manage your own band by hiring musicians, writing your own unique hits, and rising high on the charts. Keep your band members happy and make them famous. Make them too famous, though, and they will leave your band and start their own career. Bummer, dude.

It is a special game, because only 100 games are made. To make this possible, the cards are printed and carefully laminated. Besides cards, there´s a game board, player boards, lots of wooden cubes, tokens, a 4 sided die and more. The game comes in a cool looking metal box.

name: Russo-Japanese War
description:
Russo-Japanese War consists of 198 pieces , a 59 x 98 cm map (printed in Japanese) and 12 pages of rules (in Japanese). Turn length is a month and units are brigades and divisions.

No. of Players: 1-2
Playing time: 4 hours.
Solitaire Suitability: High (on a scale of Low-Medium-High)

Reprinted as Historical Simulate War-games Series 005 (Chinese Version) by AURORA GAME STUDIO in 2020.
publishers: Aurora Game Studio (China), Epoch, Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社)

name: Felithian Finance
description:
Felithian Finance is a game of stock accumulation, coupled with a 6 by 6 grid upon which corporate markers are played.

Players are dealt 4 cards from a deck of 110 cards. There are 10 shares each of 10 corporations. Each player's turn consists of buying a new share and playing a corporate tile on the 6 by 6 board. Tiles on the board increase the value of shares held. By judiciously playing tiles, players can augment the value of the corporations they control and thwart the growth of the holdings of others. Dice are rolled to determine if dividends are played. Eventually the game comes to an end and the player with the most galactic credits (money) is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Square Grid, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Hexade
description:
This game is played with the same set of Havannah (another game by Christian Freeling): an hexagonal board (size 8) and two sets of stones.

Players take turns placing a stone of their color on the board.
Goal of the game is forming "a perfect six", which means creating:

six stones in a straight row, or
six stones in a compact triangle, or
six stones in a small hexagon.


Captures are possible: you can capture two adjacent opponent's stones sandwiching them between two of your stones.

Online Play


Gamerz (turn-based, play by email or play by web)

name: Tug Boat
description:
Move your barge around the board from port to port by pushing it with the Tug, but make sure not to hit any buoys and sound the alarms.
Play passes from one player to another whenever a buoy is hit and the alarm sounds, or when the marble reaches the end of the ramp. The first player to get all four of their loads to their final ports wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Nautical, Transportation

name: Tangled Tales Starter Set: The Gatekeeper Chronicles 1 – Nightmare Unleashed Adventure Deck
description:
This cool, new hand-held electronic reading game lets kids determine the outcome of their favorite stories by choosing what path the characters will take. Kids can make the game different every time they play!

Includes a deck of 79 original story cards and a deck of ten Easter egg story cards, one memory card and instructions.

Expanded by:

Tangled Tales: The Gatekeeper Chronicles 2 – The Dungeon of Havenrock Adventure Deck
Tangled Tales: The Gatekeeper Chronicles 3 – Pirates of the Black Grotto Adventure Deck
Tangled Tales: Nancy Drew – Mummy's the Word Adventure Deck
Tangled Tales: Edgar & Ellen – The Eerie Wax Museum Adventure Deck

name: ASL Comp: Tigers to the Front!
description:
Tigers to the Front! is a module set on the Eastern Front of World War II between June 23rd and June 28th The scenarios primarily feature the German 121st infantry division and the 502nd Heavy Panzer Battalion as they defend against attacks by the Russian 1st Shock Army.

Contents:
22"x34" map
10 scenarios

Tigers to the Front! is not a complete game. Ownership of Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1 from the ASL game system is required to play this module.


May 2012- Panther Line is released.

This update to Tigers to the Front includes new color die-cut counters, two additional scenarios, new art, the new layout, all errata input and the usual balance tweaks. The action brings you right into the turrets of the Pzkw VI Tigers of the 502 Schwere Panzer Abteilung, 94th Grenadier Regiment, and 1st Shock Army and other hard-fighting combat elements. You receive all the vehicles used in the scenarios in camo-colored editions, plus a new set of German MMC/SMC counters in new poses and uniforms—to provide a unique Eastern Front gaming experience.
The set includes 12 scenarios, a Special Rules booklet, two sheet of color die-cut counters (296 counters in all), and an historical map of the Panther Line positions. Ownership of Beyond ValorTM is required but owners of the recent CH Berlin release "Final Days" will have all of the Gun and infantry counters needed to play the scenarios in a 'CH only' counter presentation using the counters provided in ASLComp Panther Line.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Battling Space Ships
description: In Battling Space Ships players draft cards to build space ships - up to three per round. Completed ships can be sent out to carry cargo, attack other players' ships or bases, or attack neutral targets in the space lanes. Points are awarded for successful attacks and for carrying cargo, but completing ships is also worth points and larger ships are worth more. The player with the most points after two rounds wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Sharing
description:
All you’ve ever wanted to do in life is to connect all the locations where there are parties so that everyone can deliver gifts to each other...how fun is that? You know, of course, that people who build railroad companies are the most generous people in the world. They love to help out their competitors, with a motto of “all for the greater good” while having boatloads of fun. In this expansion, you’ll share track with your opponents while they share track with you. And all it takes to share? A share!

Yes, you’re still competing with other players to move all the gifts everyone has gotten for each other to the correct party, but you’re doing it with a wink of your eye and a fun little skip to your step. Sure, there’s still only one winner, but it’s really about how many friends you make while playing...and doesn’t that make everyone a winner?

Sharing is for 3 to 6 players who really care about other people.

If you find the “regular” Sharing rules for Ted Alspach’s Sharing Steam/Age of Steam expansion too competitive for your tastes, try this softer, more pleasant expansion map (on the reverse side of “Sharing”). You’ll be guaranteed to make more friends in Steam/Age of Steam than ever before!

What if Steam/Age of Steam was a truly cooperative game, like Shadows over Camelot with out a traitor? Or if no one had to die in Clue, so you could just mosey around that neat mansion talking to your friends? Or if there were no diseases in Pandemic, or no ghosts in Ghost Story? Wouldn’t that be fun? Sure it would!
Ted Alspach’s *Really* Friendly Sharing is for 2 to 10 players who don’t have some horribly recessive competitive gene.

In Ted Alspach’s *Really* Friendly Sharing, you work as a team to build a railroad. Many of the aspects that cause unnecessary tension in Age of Steam have been removed, like money and the AoS auction, so you can focus on laying track, making deliveries, getting VPs and having fun!

The 2010 Essen Aos/Steam map pack from Bezier Games features 8 new maps, including 6 mounted ones on 3 double sided expansions. These maps can be preordered from www.beziergames.com and will ship in October 2010. The “bonus” Sharing map is only available through preorders. Expansion #1: California Gold Rush & Underground Railroad, Expansion #2: Amazon Rainforest and Sahara Desert and Expansion #3: Atlantis and Trisland have been previously announced.

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Gargoyle Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Gargoyle Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #6.2: The Gale Force Gate.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Soyuz '81
description:
Soyuz ’81
What If The Soviets Had Invaded Solidarity Poland (S81 for short) is a low-intermediate complexity two-player wargame covering the possibilities inherent within the first month of that never-run operation. The Soviet player is cast in the role of aggressor, attempting to make work a classic strategy of “converging columns” advancing from around the periphery of Poland. His success or failure will be reckoned on his ability to bring that country to heel without having to expend an inordinate amount of military and political power to do it.


Published with Modern War #38

name: Roller Derby Final Jams
description:
Roller Derby Final Jams (RDFJ) is essentially a race game based on the sport of Women's Flat Track Roller Derby.

RDFJ components include skater cards depicting jammers and blockers from two rival teams. Players will use custom dice and team assist disks to navigate their jammers past their opponent’s blockers in order to score points before time runs out in last few remaining jams of a closely contested derby bout.

Optionally the game can be customized by removing the skater cards that come with the game and then substituting trading cards available from some roller derby leagues. This allows players to simulate competition between actual roller derby teams.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: Kokonana!
description:
Every year at the Temple Festival, the best runners have a race across the Nanakoko river. To do this, they have to find stepping stones in the water, after which they must open the mystical temple with the right key. Kokonana is a lively race game in which good memory skills are useful, but not absolutely necessary. Missions are accompanied by a loud "Kokonana!"

Who will remember the best way over the river and be the first to the mysterious temple?

name: Face à Face
description:
Get rid of your cards by finding words that start with the same letter!

Two teams of players face each other and play at the same time. Players must place cards like dominoes. Each card has 4 drawings. A card can be placed next to another, provided that the 2 drawings that face each other correspond to words that start with the same letter. For example, a tractor next to a television: "tractor - television!" The first team to have played all his cards wins.

name: The Day of Waterloo: 1815 AD
description:
It might be the most written about battle of all time… but tactically, it was one of Napoleon’s worst efforts.

After Napoleon’s return from Elba, he watched his peace efforts spurned and knew that four large armies would eventually invade France. In a precarious position at home as well, he elected to move quickly, hoping for a powerful spoiling attack against the two closest armies that would rally some of his former allies and, even better, encourage the “Seventh Coalition” to negotiate.

His movements with the Armée du Nord shocked both Wellington and Blucher and hinted at the old brilliance of mind. But when it came to the battles… it seemed the imagination was no longer there. Ligny was a bludgeoning match, Quatre Bras a lost opportunity and bad staff work and communications caused failure at both. Dispensing a third of his army to “chase Blücher” (without Grouchy managing to find him), he took the rest to deal with “the Sepoy General” that he at least pretended to disdain. Wellington expected a flanking attack (and 25% of his troops missed the actual battle in preparation for it). What he got was “a pounding match.” Though he had claimed his troops made up “an infamous army, very weak and ill-equipped, and a very inexperienced Staff,” they bore the brunt of the best Napoleon could throw at them for 8 hours and turned the tide.

And yet, it served as the completely final end to over 20 years of near-constant warfare, in one of the few periods in Western history defined by a single person’s name. “The Napoleonic Era.” And may be the most written-about battle in history.

Designer Ed Wimble has focused solely on the 24 hours of June 18th, 1815. Leadership and morale are key, while tactical ability and artillery bombardment are both highlighted. It is, after all, a pounding match. The game includes both basic and optional rules, with the opportunity to test some variables regarding smarter troop dispositions or operational planning, as well as giving the French the opportunity to begin the battle sooner (and deal with more severe mud).

The game offers a historical set-up scenario plus variants for both set up and reinforcements. With the variants, it’s possible that Grouchy may fully live up to Napoleon's order to pursue the Prussians and fatally delay their appearance on the battlefield!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: 9 Lives
description:
9 Lives is a card game where you'll be playing as a cat and the goal is to be the last cat standing. The game features quirky scenarios and funny artworks of cats doing crazy cat stuff. Its a game ideally played by friends and family during gatherings.

The game can be played by 2 to 5 players and can go from 15-30 minutes. You will be playing as a cat with 9 Lives and the goal is to eliminate other players before you own nine lives runs out. There are two decks in the game: the Paw cards, which allows you to play tricks and actions to give you the advantage; and Karma cards, which simulates the scenarios that happen on a player's turn. The game features an exciting balance of strategy and randomness which leaves keeping guessing how to play smarter on your next game.

—description from the designer

name: School of Sorcery: Pet Pack
description:
Wizards, like many, rely on furry friends to help us make it through our daily lives. As a wizard at the School of Sorcery, summon the powers of Orinitin, Sloankai, and Cranaj as you attempt to gain friends and influence at the school. Along with these pets come five new cards with unique powers.

The School of Sorcery Pet Pack includes one instruction card, three pet cards, and five new sorcery cards. The pet cards introduce a new mechanic into the game, while the five new sorcery cards--Slingshot, Icarus Stone, Flaming Sword, Curse, and Cloak--introduce new powers to the normal game.

To use the pet cards, place them face-up in the supply. If you play the "cast no crystals" card, you send a crystal to one of the pets. If both players have a crystal on the pet card, the crystals are removed. If only one player has a crystal on a pet card, that player befriends the pet and may use the pet's power once per round. Orinitin allows you to take a crystal any time your opponent wins a card. With Sloankai, your score is increased by one for each crystal. Cranaj allows you to adjust a die up or down one pip.

To use the new sorcery cards, shuffle them into the deck and play normally. The three immediate use cards are Slingshot, Icarus Stone, and Flaming Sword. With Slingshot, you remove all crystals from one location (if you have fewer VPs). Icarus Stone allows you to remove one crystal from any location. After getting Flaming Sword, you flip the top card in the deck and use its power (but only if it is a one-time-use card). The two one-time-use cards include Curse and Cloak. Curse allows you to turn an opponent die to any result and Cloak allows you to remove an opponent crystal from the portal.

-description from designer

name: Watch on the Oder: January 1945
description:
Watch on the Oder: January 1945 is a hypothetical two-player game allowing the players to examine the strategic possibilities inherent in the campaign that may have taken place had Hitler decided to send the forces he used historically in the Ardennes to the eastern front. Both sides’ orders of battle are entirely historic within that context. Each of the eight game turns represents four days, and each large hex on the map equals 20 miles. The map runs from the Oder River on the west to the Riga-Pinsk line on the east. Units are German corps and Soviet armies. The turn sequence is I-Go-U-Go, but both players decide if their force will move and fight or fight and move. Playing time is about three hours, and is easily adapted for solitaire play. Complexity is low-medium. The German has to strike hard and fast at the beginning in order to weaken the inevitable Soviet counteroffensive.

World at War #82 February-March 2022

name: Solo Camp Pocket
description:
Solo Camp Pocket is a small card game where you can enjoy a day and a half of solo camping. There are lots of activities such as using your favorite gear, cooking meals, bonfires and kayaking. Of course there is not enough time to do everything.

The goal of the game is to have the most fun (points) as you can while camping. You only have so much time to camp so you need to make good use of your time. All the while weather can change, accidents can occur, and things can waste away your time.

The game is played by dealing a 3 card hand. Activities require different amounts of time, food, and gear; all of which you must pay for from your hand. For more expensive activities, you can obtain more resources by discarding cards or carrying over cards to the next turn (where you are dealt 3 more cards). You do this until the cards run out, ending the round. 2 more rounds are played and a cumulative score is counted. Try to beat your high score!
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

name: Alphabeasts Attack!
description:
Alphabeasts Attack! is a co-operative word tower defence game where players need to work together to think of the best words to defend the world from the onslaught of the Alphabeasts.

Each round, Alphabeasts will attack individual players as well as the middle of the playing area. Players will then think of one word to fight off as many Alphabeasts as they can. An Alphabeast can only be defeated if the letter is contained in the word, and an Alphaboss can only be defeated if the word fulfills a specific condition.

Each Alphabeast that is not included in a player's word becomes a scar, which is the defeat condition of the game. Defeated Alphabeasts can be scavenged for brains, which is the victory condition of the game. Will you fall to the Alphabeasts or can your team come up with the words to prevail?

-description from publisher
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Spelling

name: Hokm
description:
Hokm is an old trick-taking card game from Iran usually played with four players in fixed partnerships; however there are 2 and 3-player variants. It is part of the Whist family of card games and similar to spades, but there is no bidding, and trump is declared every hand.

The object of Hokm is to be the first team or player to win 7 points. It's the most popular card game in Iran. Deal and play are anticlockwise.

The word Hokm literally means "command, order" but in card game jargon, it's Persian for trump suit.

Hâkem
At the beginning of each hand, one of the players becomes Hâkem. Hâkem literally means "ruler, governor" and in card game jargon, it refers to a player having certain privileges in the game. In Hokm, these privileges are:

- To be the player who receives the first cards dealt.
- To be the player who makes trump (i.e. chooses and declares what suit will be trump) for the current hand.
- To be the player who leads to the first trick of the hand.

Players and Cards
Hokm can be played with 2, 3 or 4 players. If with four players, two players normally team up against the other two.

The game uses a standard 52-card deck. Within each suit, the cards are ranked from highest to lowest: A K Q J 10 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2

name: Siege of the Citadel: Brotherhood Expansion
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Siege of the Citadel: Brotherhood Expansion adds the Brotherhood faction to the game including a sixth player board (and rules to expand the game to six players) with Nikodemus and Crenshaw as your heroes.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Storytelling, Variable Phase Order

name: 人喰い屋敷 (Hitokui Yashiki)
description:
User summary
『人喰い屋敷』 (Hitokui Yashiki) in English is 'Man-Eating House'. Man-Eating House is a trick taking game for 3-4 players with a theme of haunted house.

This game uses a deck of 44 cards, which consists of three suits (Green, Yellow, Red), and 14 ranks (1-14), plus Green 0 (Dog) and Red 15 (Old Man). Cards ranked 1-3 (with a child figure on the card), ranked 12-14 (ghost figure on the card), Dog, and Old Man are honor cards. You score points by taking these cards.

Each round, players play a card under trick-taking rules (must follow suit, no trumps). Basically, the player who played the highest rank, regardless of which suit, wins the trick. But there are several exceptions. One example is that if you and other player play a child of the same suit, both of you take that child card and score one point, instead of being taken by the winner of the trick.

In a four-player game, you win the game with your partner if your team takes honor cards more than your opponent team.

In a three-player game, the player who played Old Man (Red 15) competes against the other two. The Old Man wins if he captures three children of different rank or he takes 11 honor cards. Otherwise the other two players win the game.

Publisher's summary
3~4人のプレイヤーがお化け屋敷の掟に従ってカードを出し合い
子どもやお化けが描かれた得点札を集めるトリックテイキング・ゲーム。

ツタ・おふだ・骨の3スート。マストフォローでノートランプ。ランク（0～15）で決着。最も高い数字を出したプレイヤーの勝ち。※フォローできなくても

ただし、場に出たカードの組み合わせによっては「役」が成立し、例外的な処理が発生する。（子どもカードが2枚以上出る→「逃げる」，武器カードとお化けカードが出る→「戦う」）また、「特殊カード」が出たときは、カードのドラフトが行なわれたり、「役」の処理が打ち消されることも。

3人用は、骨の15のカードをプレイした1人対その他2人のチーム戦。正体隠匿要素あり。4人用は、2対2のペア戦。得点札を多く獲得したチームの勝ち。

name: Sale con Fritas!
description:
This expansion adds one die, and tokens representing soda and fries.

The new die is rolled together with the other three, and depending on its face of the target can change, or the winner can take an additional token. The final scoring is changed, rewarding having different tokens.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Wer war's?: Limitierte Jubiläumsausgabe
description:
In Wer war's?, known as Whoowasit? in English, players must find the magical ring that was stolen from the wise king by the evil wizard. Playing against a running clock, players move their playing pieces through the various rooms on the game board to uncover clues to who stole the precious gem. Along the way, talking animals help players solve the mystery of the stolen item with the help of a treasure chest that randomly supplies clues on behalf of the animals. Whenever players meet animals, they must feed them so the animals — that can be understood only by children — can provide the clues that advance gameplay. The clues supplied by the electronic treasure chest ensure that no two games are alike. All players must work together to find the stolen ring, and they win or lose as a group, depending on whether they can master an assigned task.

Wer war's? Limitierte Jubiläumsausgabe is a tenth anniversary edition of the 2008 Kinderspiel des Jahres winner that contains the original game described above as well as Wer war's: Das Kartenspiel.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Deduction, Electronic, Fantasy

name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Defence Against the Dark Arts: Dobby the House-Elf Promo Card
description:
This promo card was handed out during GenCon 2019.

This Ally carries the following ability:

Once per Turn: You may banish a card in the Classroom.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Take That
publishers: KOSMOS, Rebel Sp. z o.o., REXhry, The Op Games

name: Green
description:
Green is the first game of the GreenGreenerGreenest set. Green, Greener and Greenest are three games that use the same set of components.

Green is a game for 3 players derived from The House of the Flying Blades and brother game of RED and BLUE, by the same designer, that uses a non-transitive capturing mechanism.

Depending on the set, you’d have:

Basic: a 6×6 board, 15 black pyramids, 20 green pyramids, 15 white pyramids.

Advanced: a 6×9 – 9×9 board (using one or both pads), 30 black pyramids, 45 green pyramids, 30 white pyramids.

Gameplay overview:

The board starts full of pyramids. Players in turn capture (mandatory) other pyramids or stacks of pyramids orthogonally so that:

- Black can only capture Green
- Green can only capture White
- White can only capture Black

The game ends when all players pass in succession. The player with the highest combined height of controlled stacks wins the game.

Please refer to the rulebook for detailed rules.

name: The Shield of Achilles
description:
The war at Troy has been waging for 10 years now. Achilles, hero of the greeks prepares to avenge his dear friend Patroclus. In order to do so, Achilles' mother, the goddess Thetis ask the help of Hephaestus (you), blacksmith of the gods to create a new shield for him.

During the course of the game, you will craft the famous shield depicting scenes of ancient greek life. Your objective is to score more points by crafting the shield than the points on your discarded dice by the end of the game. These discarded dice values represent the scrap metal that Apollo steals away from you to create arrows for Paris, who is destined to kill Achilles.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Twilight Imperium: Armada – Incursion
description:
Incursion introduces several new elements to your Armada game, including Mine Ships that can lay and sweep for ship-mines; and missiles, that launch and behave like torpedoes, but can only target squadrons and torpedoes.

Expands:

Twilight Imperium: Armada
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: DIG: Dragon!
description:
Dare enter the Dragon's lair and grab the treasures it contains. Loot as long as you want and find plenty of wealth and rare equipments, but beware not to wake the Dragon up or you will lose everything. Push your luck at its finest!
DIG: Dragon! comes with a new kind of recruit: the Specialists, strong and determined females you can hire to DIG more efficiently as well as new Companions to help you on your quest.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Aarakocra Troop Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Aarakocra Troop Expansion Pack includes six pre-painted miniatures and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #4.1: The Howling Chasm.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sport of Kings
description:
Choose your horse and jockey and roll dice to run the race. Horses have varying characteristics and various decisions (eg, when to whip the horse) are made.

Quoted playing time is for one race.

Extended by:
National Hunt (The Chasers)
National Hunt (The Hurdlers)
Great Racehorses
Cheltenham Gold Cup Winners (replay extension)

name: Germania: Drusus' Campaigns 12-9 BC
description:
Germania: Drusus' Campaign 12-9 BC is a Strategic level Solitaire board-wargame about the Roman Conquest of Germania, the lands inhabited by the Germanic tribes at the end of the 1st Century BC.
The player represents the Governor with two objectives.
The first is the public one of conquering Germania as far as the river Visurgis (Weser) and establishing a new Imperial Frontier.
The second is increasing his personal fortune.
The activities of the Germanic Tribes are determined by a set of rules.

This solo wargame was published in the magazine Slingshot #128 by Society of Ancients. The player takes the role of the Roman general Drusus trying to conquer and pacify ancient Germania, the game systems (charts and tables) simulates the rebellious tribes.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Infiltrate
description: Infiltrate is a quick strategic tussle. In this Icehouse game, two players build 15-point armies, and then try to get one of their units to the enemy's home row first. On each turn, you must move two of your pyramids. Each type of unit has special abilities. Smalls can only move by pushing another pyramid ahead of them. Larges can capture smalls or other larges. Mediums are uncapturable. With many options for army building, and a user-defined setup placement, it never plays the same twice.

name: Santiago de Cuba: El taxi
description:
12 tiles expansion for Santiago de Cuba.
Promo item at the Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2013.
publishers: Festival Internacional de Juegos de Córdoba, Jugamos Tod@s

name: Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Vault of the Askara Promo Card
description:
Vault of the Askara is the October 2013 promo card for Ascension.

Enlightened Construct
Once per turn, you may copy the effect of the next hero you play this turn.

Cost: 4 Rune
VP: 4 points
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Rivet Wars: Clockwork Soldiers vs. Plague Troopers
description:
A kickstarter exclusive set of three Allied Clockwork Soldiers and three Blight Plague Troopers with their exclusive figures, and cards with special abilities.

Plague Troopers can bolster your defense, infect. Clockwork Soldiers can bolster special abilities and dash. However, neither can take strategic objectives.


3 Clockwork Soldier figures
3 Plague Trooper figures
Game cards
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Socken zocken: Active Kids
description:
How cool is this! You're allowed to make a complete mess with your socks! Slip into the role of little sock monsters, run between the various laundry baskets and quickly distribute your socks. You'll be exhausted and out of breath! But watch out: there are some important sock rules, and dirty socks create additional chaos. The first player to get rid of all their socks wins.

How to play:


Hold your set of socks in your hands and stand with your toes touching the box.
Give the start command "Socken zocken!" together.


After the start command everyone runs to the laundry basket of their choice with their socks.

When you reach a laundry basket, look inside. What color is the sock in the laundry basket? The color of the sock shows which laundry basket you need to run to next. Before a player can continue they need to place one of their socks in the laundry basket.
The game ends when one player has placed their last sock in a laundry basket and is then the first to place their hand on the sock monster on the box. Sock strong!

name: Antony and Cleopatra
description:
John Theissen’s streamlined approach to operational warfare in the nineteenth century in games such as Hood’s Last Gamble and Campaign of Nations has won him a number of admirers. Now he turns his attention to the last war of the Roman Republic, to the marching of Legions and the sailing of fleets, to the rise of Augustus and the fall of Marc Antony and the savvy Queen of Egypt, Cleopatra.

In "Antony and Cleopatra" each player must raise troops and build ships, using these military forces to enact their will and conduct campaigns against the enemy. Along the way, they will face the challenges inherent in ancient warfare: the difficulty of keeping troops supplied, perilous storms at sea, the spreading of plagues, and the opportunistic assaults of Rome’s external enemies. As the war wears on, both sides will attempt to chip away at the other’s prestige and standing. If your prestige falls low enough, your troops and provinces might defect, tipping the balance. And should it fall to zero, you lose this high stakes battle. The winner shall rule over an empire. The loser? Well, as Octavian said before Cleopatra’s son was strangled, two Caesars are one too many.

The spoils of victory and the consequences of defeat might not be quite as serious as all that when the troops are made of cardboard, but Antony and Cleopatra allows you to refight this epic contest for ultimate power in the relative safety of your home or gaming club.

Though somewhat more granular and detailed than Mr. Theissen’s other games for Hollandspiele, this remains a quick, compelling, and accessible exploration of this fascinating subject.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Dream Catcher
description:
Catch the dream by touch! Can you guess the picture by tactile associations? In this vivid game you will exercise your sense of touch and challenge your teamwork and intuition.

Dream Catcher is a cooperative game, where you will witness whimsical stories and will try to “catch a dream” — to identify the picked story by touch.

Every round, the lead player picks a Dream card and handles specially selected Touching cards with raised pictures to the other players. The lead player’s goal is, without saying a word, to help the other players guess the picked Dream card. The core goal of the other players is to discuss the pictures they can feel on their Touching cards and to collectively choose one of the Dream cards.

You will flip Night tokens for correct answers and discard them for wrong answers. To win the game you need to have as many flipped Night tokens as possible by the end of the game.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Targeted Clues

name: 18Tokaido
description:
This expansion for 18Chesapeake has the following key differences:

No auction, privates are available for purchase by players starting in the first stock round; purchasing a private counts as a buy action.
There are seven railroad corporations are in the game. In a two or three player game, one of them is removed at the beginning of the game. The Yokohama-Shinbashi Line is always in the game.
Private companies can only be bought into corporations at face value.

Trains export after every set of ORs up to and including the first D train.

No bank; game ends either in bankruptcy or 3 ORs after first D train comes out. If the D train is exported, game ends after next set of ORs. If the D train is purchased by a corporation, a stock round will happen first, then one last set of ORs.

—description from publisher
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Market, Network and Route Building, Ownership, Stock Holding, Tile Placement, Victory Points as a Resource

name: The Stars at War
description: The Stars at War is a supplement for the Starfire (3rd Edition) game system. The Starfire series always contained a "Future History" of "historical" information and 'historical battles" in the future. This supplement for Starfire (3rd Edition) included the scenarios and "history" covering the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd Interstellar Wars, plus the Gorm-Khanate War.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment
publishers: Starfire Design Studio, Task Force Games

name: Magenta 1859
description:
The Battle of Magenta, June 4, 1859, was the first major clash between France and Austria during the Second Italian War of Independence. Magenta 1859 recreates it using the same rules as Solferino 1859 and Reichshoffen 1870, as well as the same scale (one hour per turn, 600 meters per hex, brigades). Unlike its siblings, the game has almost no special rules.

Napoleon III commands the French and, though scarcely comparable to his uncle, well overmatches the Austrians' sluggish and late arriving Count Gyulai. Unfortunately for the French, Napoleon enters far away from the bulk of his forces and takes a long time to get within command range. Until then, formations may move effectively only when their commanders make successful initiative rolls, and the largest French corps suffers from an initiative penalty for the first several hours. (Its commander, General Mac Mahon, moved slowly while waiting for a Sardinian division to come up to cover his open flank. This caution did not, however, prevent him from becoming the hero of the day. The Emperor rewarded him with the title "duc de Magenta".)

The battle starts at 10:00 a.m. and lasts 10 turns, with many brigades not arriving until the afternoon. The forces (and the map) are only about half the size of those in Solferino, and the victory conditions are simpler: Each side gets one Victory Point for each hex it holds in the town of Magenta (which has three) plus one for each demoralized enemy corps.

name: Hot War: Battle for Oil
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The year 1990, the planet Earth: The world is very much like our own recent past, but with no perestroika, no glasnost, no relaxation. American presidents continue to refer to the Soviet Union as the "evil empire", and the Cold War lingers on a thousand fronts throughout the world—from tiny tropical states to the headquarters of the intelligence agencies. Almost without warning, the next armed conflict erupts in the Arab East, at the center of the world's power depot. And this time, the fight is not only for how a small Persian Gulf country will live – as a socialist or capitalist state – but rather much more is at stake: control of the world's largest oil reserves!

Welcome to the world of The Hot War: Battle for Oil, a fascinating board game with miniatures based on Konstantin Krivenko's unique war gaming system Art of Tactic. This game puts you in command of modern troops and the powerful equipment of war in battles fought with state-of-the-art technology; it's also the first foray for the Art of Tactic system into a desert theater of operations, allowing players to explore any historical battle from the Africa campaign of Rommel to the Iraq War!

The Hot War: Battle for Oil starter set includes everything you need to create the first armed conflicts between the Soviet and American armies. Each side is represented by seven units: three motorized infantry platoons, two APCs, one tank, and one helicopter each. Motorized infantry units can be further customized and reinforced by machine guns, anti-tank missiles, and air defense systems. Before each battle, the commanders must choose where to position their reinforcements: Should you spread them out among your platoons, or attach everything together into one overstrengthed unit?

Like all Art of Tactic games, The Hot War: Battle for Oil uses specially-designed laminated cards for every unit. Each unique unit card displays all of the information a commander needs to use it in the field. The laminated coating allows players to write their orders directly on the unit card, easily cleaning them again before the next round. Players don't take turns, but instead simultaneously plot secret orders to their forces, then resolve them at the same time!

name: Operation Icarus
description:
Description from the publisher:
Operation Icarus is a simulation covering a hypothetical German campaign to occupy Iceland in World War 2.

name: Miseries of the Night
description:
"Miseries are set to invade the Waking World. You must stop them before they consume the night".

Miseries of the Night is a one player roll & write game about slaying unseen terrors in the night. Each turn, the player rolls dice to determine the number and location of new Miseries. The player then navigates around the board, trying to put down Miseries before new ones rise up. Players use dice rolls, tactics, and special abilities in battle to stem the inevitable tide of darkness.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Map Reduction, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Set-up

name: Budapeszt 1945
description:
In January 1945 Germans made last offensive in WWII trying to de-blockade Budapest in Hungary.

The game uses rules of the "WB95" (Great Battles 1939-1945) system designed for dealing with large battles of World War II. Counters represent regiments (Germans) or divisions (Russians), one hex represents about 2500m, one turn represents one day.

name: Gothic Invasion: Mini Expansion
description:
Gothic Invasion Mini Expansion contains one new Gothic leader (Farnobius) tile, plus its individual board for use in Gothic Invasion and 8 Special Ability Tokens for the Leaders.

The Goth player must choose which Leader to use at the beginning of the game: Saphrax or Farnobius. Farnobius's unique trait allows him to draw four cards each season and after looking at them to discard one.

The eight special ability tokens (four per faction) are used instead of playing a card and are one time use only. They are distributed at the beginning of the game either randomly or by player assign (players must decide).
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Soupe de nombres
description:
In Soupe de nombres ("Soup of Numbers"), you must be the first to get an Objective Number.
To achieve this, combine the cards in play by applying different mathematical operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division), but use as little as possible!
The first players who wins 5 rounds is the winner.
—description from the publisher (translated)

À chaque manche, les joueurs s’efforcent d’être les premiers à obtenir un Nombre Objectif en combinant les cartes qui composent le Plateau de Jeu à l’aide de différentes opérations mathématiques (addition, soustraction, multiplication et division) et en utilisant le moins de cartes possible. Le premier joueur qui remporte 5 manches (sans se tromper) gagne la partie.
—description from the publisher (French)

name: Castle Panic: Tower Promo 2018 Tabletop Day
description:
New Promotional Tower for International Tabletop Day 2018.
When this tower is destroyed, roll die. Damage that # of monsters 1 point.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Terristories
description:
You play a member of a colony who just arrived on a new planet. You go to discover this territory as hostile as surprising, to try to settle permanently. Can you get along with other players to achieve your goals?
A semi-cooperative management and negotiation game developed in partnership with a scientific research center.

You start by choosing a planet and a goal (which consists in levels of social, economics and ecology you need to meet to make the planet viable).

Each player choose a role from the four available ones and take their own stack of projects and one individual objective, all specific to their role.

Each turn is composed of 6 phases
Phase 1 : Players increase their influence by spending resources to add people or stations to the planet.
Phase 2 : Players choose a project from their hand. Everybody then discusses to choose only one to fund.
Phase 3 : Players collect resources (1 or 2 if on a tile with one of their stations). If the last resource of a tile is taken, then it is turned over and it will not produce any resource anymore.
Phase 4 : During this phase one event (negative or positive) happens. Negative ones can be countered with sustainable development tokens (gained thanks to some projects)
Phase 5 : Players pay one resource for each of their people on the board.
Phase 6 : The planet regenerates its resources (1 or 2 per tile)

If a player meets his individual objective, he wins alone, if the main goal is achieved, everybody wins, if neither of these conditions is met before the end of the eighth turn then everybody loses.

name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Defence Against the Dark Arts: Confundus! Promo Card
description:
This promo card was handed out during GenCon 2019.

This Spell carries the following ability:

Opponent discards a card at random. If it was a Hex or Spell, gain 1 [INFLUENCE] and draw a card. If it was an Ally or Item, gain 1 [ATTACK] and 1 [LIFE].
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Take That
publishers: Rebel Sp. z o.o., REXhry, The Op Games

name: Duck, Buck, Moose
description:
In Duck, Buck, Moose you'll compete with up to 3 of your friends on a hunt for furry woodland creatures in this totally not-serious card game of skill, sabotage and luck. Journey into the wilderness, collecting licenses and gear and search for that prized buck (or just knock off a few rabbits). Gun jam your opponents or spook their animals to stay in the lead.

During the game players will spend 3 actions on their turn to collect Hunter or License cards, play Action cards and go on hunts in attempt to score Wildlife points; all while trying to stop others from doing the same.

As the game continues, Wildlife will be scored with new ones taking their place. When the last Wildlife card is revealed, all players will have one more full turn. At the end of the game, players add up their scored Wildlife points minus any unfulfilled Licenses. The player with the most points wins!

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Open Drafting, Take That

name: The Zorro Dice Game: Equipment Pack #1
description:
This has 4 Common Equipment and 2 Premium Equipment. It contains:

Mirror
Restraints
Donkey
Fireworks
Medicine
Torch


Was available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Saloon Showdown
description:
Saloon Showdown is an unsettled boardgame where up to 7 gunslingers of all ages will try to collect the bounties on the heads of others, challenging each others in epic duels, truels and Mexican standoff!

Reflexes and speed of thought will determine the most skillful gunslinger... but there are also other, more devious ways to win!

...Do you feel lucky?

Starting from the player on the left of the dealer, the game proceeds clockwise in turns. In their turn each player can choose 1 of this actions: draw a card, cash the loot (discard some type of cards to earn dollars) or threaten somebody.

Threatening someone with a gun starts a brief "bluff or not" phase, which can lead to the heart of the game: the Duel.

In the Duel, two players must exchange their cards and be the quicker to shoot the other correctly, by guessing 3 things:

the color of the gun to take;
the zone of the body to hit;
the sound of the gunshot.


The correct information is the one that is most present on the cards in front of the player.

In the game there are also two variants of the Duel, which involve 3 players (Truel) or up to 5 (Mexican Standoff).

By playing cards and winning Duels, you earn (or steal) money.
The game ends when a player has $130 on his Loot zone, or when he has 3 Wound tokens (which you get by losing Duels).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Real-Time, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Shuffle Puck
description:
Shuffle Puck is played in a similar way to air hockey.

Two players each hold a wooden handle and aim to hit the puck into their opponent's net.

Game is played on a wooden board of 130 X 70 CM or the smaller variant 90 x 45 cm

The game is usually played to 7 points.

name: Circus Break
description:
Circus Break is a fast-paced card flipping game, which involves players competing with each other, in order to obtain a key to escape from the circus that is run by a horrible owner.

Each player receives a unique character at the start of the game, which needs to be hidden until you wish to use the characters' abilities.
You will need to identify turned-over cards and use them wisely to process the game, read more cards, obstruct others etc. , and eventually be the first to escape the circus by using the key.

Our game contains different character abilities, varieties of action cards, random game-changing events. This will create countless situations and make our gameplay more exciting and fascinating.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Kill Steal, Predictive Bid, Race, Role Playing, Take That

name: Peak Oil: Spillover
description:
Welcome to the near future. Welcome to Spillover, the first expansion for Peak Oil.

Spillover enriches and diversifies Peak Oil by adding variant cards, which change the fundamental rules of the game, and new Demand, Risk, and Security markers. You need the base game to play.

The variant cards introduce new ways to play Peak Oil. They're divided into the categories General, Agents, PR, Endgame, and Scoring, depending on the aspect of the game that they affect. In each game, you can use up to one from each of the five categories, allowing for up to 42 millions of different combinations (made up number).

The new cardboard markers can be used with or without the variant cards. There are new refineries to ship oil to, new dangers to be found on the shipping routes and new Security markers.
categories: Economic, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Political
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: Assault on Galactus Prime
description:
Death Throes of a Galactic Empire

Euro Game #7

"Now my fellow pilots and I wait for the word to attack and destroy the Ion Supercannon that protects this hated world from invasion by our ground troops. Its loss will turn Galactus Prime into lowly Dorrus once again. And though we are united, there is a friendly rivalry amongst us for the honor of being the one who brings the supercannon down. We all want to be that pilot – that hero."

This is it! The final battle to destroy the Evil Empire that all began many years ago as a small uprising. Now the rebellion is almost complete as the final assault begins on the Empire’s Planetary Capital, Galactus Prime.

Assault on Galactus Prime is a 2-player race game of deck-building and glorious die rolling. Can you recruit the pilots necessary and lead the Attack Run that will bring down the planet’s greatest defense, the Empire’s massive Ion Supercannon? For when it is destroyed, the ground assault can begin and the remaining defenses of Galactus Prime removed, and then the Evil Empire will be swept away into oblivion!

Game Data:

Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 1 on a 9 scale

Game Components:

• One 6-page full color Rules booklet with Examples of play
• One 8.5” x 16.5” map
• One Presidential Favor card
• One Pilot Worlds mat
• One Player Aid sheet
• 80 units and markers
• 60 Deck cards
• Designers Notes and Galactus fiction within!
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Poorman's Trivia
description: This trivia game was designed in response to the first trivia games to hit the market, these trivia games depended on a predetermined set of questions; Poorman's Trivia has no set of questions, instead the players think of trivia questions as part of the game. The game is designed so that the questions asked are not too tough for the group playing. The files section includes the full rules as well as a score sheet.

name: Heat of Battle:  FireFights!
description:
'FireFights!' scenarios are small, intense scenarios compatible with the ASL game system or any other tactical level wargame. All aspects of the game system are covered - with infantry, armor and artillery set in a variety of terrain and theatres.
Variety and re-playability are key components of FireFight Packs. Each scenario has a variable Order of Battle and most have variable entry turns and reinforcements. The reinforcements, when received, are historically accurate as to equipment available to that particular unit while it was in combat. Fog of war is also enhanced through set up and Scenario Variables. As a bonus each FireFight scenario comes with its own historically based 8 1/2 by 11 inch map for playing.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Fizzbin
description: A game made up on the spot by Captain James T. Kirk, played by William Shatner, during the Star Trek episode "A Piece of the Action". The game was described as a card game with an increasingly confused set of rules, remotely connected to Poker, intended to allow the Enterprise crew to gain control of the situation. Multiple versions of the full rules have been posted online and the game is played by Trekkers at most Star Trek conventions.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Emmerlaüs: Abundance
description: Fixed deck of 50 additional cards to play with Emmerlaüs: Duel of Mages and/or its other expansions (Communion, Destiny, Power).

name: Putin Moves South
description:
Putin Moves South is an operational-strategic level two-player wargame covering a hypothetical struggle between Russia and a coalition of opposing states to gain control of Central Asia, encompassing the area from the Russian frontier to the Persian Gulf.
