Combatants include, Russian, NATO, Chinese, Iranian, and various Central Asian States including the Persian Gulf countries.

The game system models the situation at the highest strategic level. Using a variation of Ty Bomba's Putin's War (MW #29). Units represent operational task forces of corps size; Special Forces; airpower, and cyberwar. The game system models operations in a vast theater with limited infrastructure and with coalition forces that all have divergent political aims.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: H.D.P. 4: Hasta Donde Puedas
description: Expansion that adds more cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Dice Fishing: Taiwan Tilapia promo
description: A single card that was handed out to buyers of Dice Fishing in Essen in 2018. The English name is not on the card, but was announced by TBD.

name: Quin
description:
Quin is an abstract tabletop strategy game, taking place in a sci-fi quantum realm. Players control a variety of quark particles, 17 on each side, made of 9 types, each with distinct speed, powers and capture abilities. The goal of Quin is to reach First Sight, Center, with your Light, or to capture your opponent's Light.

Your pieces are always faced away from your rival, making deception and memory two of the most important skills in play. Use a piece's special abilities - like Memory that swaps places with another piece, Time that can move an opposing piece backward, Peripherals that can circle the sides of the board, or Shadows that reach far and capture everything - and you risk revealing your strategy. In Quin, your choices, and how well you know your rival, are what determine your fate.

The magnetic Quin board is based on a traditional grid, if you can imagine that grid warped into a circle by a black hole. As such it is made of 5 Sight Lines, crossing the board at the center, 8 gold Rings, a Horizon Line, and the Iris. The Iris is just 2 spaces around the center, where most pieces have to pass if they want to get to the other side, and it is a neutral zone, where powers don't work. In the middle of it all is First Sight, Center, and the goal of the game.

It's only 5 moves to center, from the start, but you'll never take the same route twice. Awaken your Memory, look out for the thief of Time, and beware the Shadows - they're far faster than Light.

-description from publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Memory, Science Fiction
mechanics: Chaining, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Memory, Moving Multiple Units, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Movement, Physical Removal, Point to Point Movement, Race, Variable Set-up

name: Cheesy Heist
description:
Players take turns sabotaging their friends and collecting cards while hoping for Cheese until someone decides to unleash the Cat! Everyone drops their cards face-down on the table, and the real heist begins. Players take any card they want, no matter to whom it belonged previously! They use their sixth sense and deducting skills to steal precious Cheese while looking directly at the scared eyes of their friends. It’s madness, you would say, but there are a lot of ways to win this game!

The first one to collect 5 Cheese cards and get rid of all Cat cards from their hand wins! But in the end, players will still be friends, because there are no harsh feelings in this game.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hot Potato, Interrupts, Memory, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Det dårlige selskab: udvidelse #2 – Ekstra dum!
description:
A new expansion with 240 extra stupid cards and three different types of bonuscards.

Includes 10 blank write-yourself cards, so you can include your own stupid cards.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: The City: The Expanded City
description:
An expansion to the new edition of Tom Lehmann's The City.

Adds 33 more cards, including 16 new ones: Neighborhood Pub, Waterfront, Auto Race Track, Tourist Attraction, Church, Fast Food Outlet, Fashion District, Café, Hotel, Upscale Bar, and more!

Rules are unchanged except: Survey now draws 7, not 5, cards (to deal with the larger deck).

Expands the game to 6 players.

—description from the publisher

name: Smart Darts
description: It takes more than a steady hand and an eagle eye to win at this dart-based trivia game. Players or teams compete to score points by throwing their magnetic darts at the target. To score points, you must answer questions based on the color-coded category you land on. Show your skills by trying to land on your favorite category such as Sports, Geography, Arts & Entertainment, and History. The first player or team to score 300 points wins the game!

name: Spider-Man Swing into Action
description:
A 3 dimensional board game where Spiderman swings from a web suspended between 4 towers above a rotatable disc simulating a manhole cover.

Bad guy discs are located on points adjacent to points on the manhole discs.

Movement is controlled by a single deck of cards. players take turns to draw a card and follow instructions. after use the card is discarded, when all the cards have been used the game is over.

Cards instruct to move yourself, a bad guy disc swing spidey or rotate the central disc. the object is to collect as many bad guys as possible before the card deck runs out.

the winner is the player with the most bad guys.

Spiderman swings around and seemingly at random chooses a bad guy to be collected.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip
mechanics: Area Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Pep Airways
description:
Pep Airways puts 3-4 players in charge of planning trips for people in the heyday of jet setting.

Pep Airways is played over two rounds, with players drafting destinations and setting up trips. But trips require flights, and each player has a limited number of flights at their disposal. The player planning the best and most efficient trips wins the game.

name: Rally Round the King
description:
VOTED TMP's BEST FANTASY RULESET OF 2010!

Your troops are tired and slowly giving ground. They've fought hard all day against an infinite number of enemy troops. They've done all that you've asked of them and more. They've covered themselves with both blood and glory and look to you for victory. The fate of your nation hangs in the balance as you desperately search for that one spot to launch your final attack.
There! Gathering your personal horsemen you draw your sword for it is now or never. The battle rests on your strong right arm, the arm of a Warrior, King, and Hero.

"Typical fantasy game," you say?

"We say no!"

Welcome to the world of Rally Round the King (RRtK). Populated by Heroes and Demons and everything in between, Rally Round the King takes you to the mythical land of Talomir.

It's a land where dozens of nations vie for dominance and we've created it just for you. Like other games we've provided you with Army Lists that describe your troops and how to assemble them for battle. But any game allows for fighting individual battles. We've taken it farther, much farther.
We've provided an elegant yet simple campaign system to link all your battles together to insure that every battle means something. Where the chance of victory in your next battle hinges on how you did in your last. With the Rally Round the King campaign system you are the Commander of the Army one minute and the King, or Queen, the next.

Rally Round the King is a fantasy miniatures rules set which features single base units with multiple figures. Basing can be adapted to single figures if desired. The rules feature the famous 2 Hour Wargames reaction system adapted to a mass combat engine. Rules for Command Control, Magic, Heroes and rich fantasy world with 20+ army lists and detailed campaign materials. The system can easily be adapted to almost any mass combat campaign scenario as well as historical situations.

Now you can tell the whole story, your story. Now you can build your empire with both sword and diplomacy.

The trumpets call, your horse is ready. Will you have what it takes when they Rally Round the King?

Historical Army Lists are now available as Rally Round the King: Armies & Campaigns 3000 BC to 1500 AD.

name: King of the Goblins
description:
Goblins are sneaky, cowardly, short-tempered creatures. They are fearful to take up arms against anyone but can get vicious if their backs are against a wall. They constantly feud with rival tribes for resources, land and title. They are so devious and lazy that they would rather steal resources from a neighboring tribe than produce them on their own. They are so untrustworthy that they would rather stab someone in the back than look at them. Welcome to the unpredictable world of King of the Goblins.

King of the Goblins is a game for 2-5 players in which each player represents the leader of a tribe of Goblins vying for the title, King of the Goblins. To acquire this title, players must collect as much Gold as possible. To collect Gold, players must do a number of things. New land must be opened up in order to build trade houses that produce different types of resources. Resources are used to build more trade houses or traded for Gold. In addition, powerful cards can be played to turn the tables on the other players. The tribe with the most Gold at the end of the game is the winner and the tribal leader is declared King of the Goblins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Set Collection, Take That, Trading

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers Deck-Building Game – Gandalf Promo Cards
description:
Set of 2 extra cards for Cryptozoic's The Lord of the Ring: The Two Towers Deck-Building Game.

- Gandalf: A playable over-sized hero. Card text: "You start the game with 'Turn of the Tide' in your deck."

- Turn of the Tide: 10th card for starter deck for a player with 'Gandalf' as their hero. Card text: "+2 Power. / You may discard the top card of your deck."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Rivet Wars: Sturmrad vs. M7 Boss
description:
M7 BOSS: "After seeing the effectiveness of the Blight Landkrieger, the allies decided to accept proposals for a bipedal mechanized armored tank of their own."

Sturmrad: "With the monowheel drive system and suspension proving themselves to be both reliable and effective, the Blightun Empire decided to repurpose this design for a fast moving gun platform."

Two new vehicles with their own special abilities to use with the game Rivet Wars.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Vrock Demon Expansion Pack
description: The Vrock Demon Chalthazar is the competitive prize for Month 1 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Rage of Demons. The prize includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Won by the Sword: Update Kit
description:
Won by the Sword: Update Kit consists of the following:


a 16-page "revised 2016" rulebook
a 32-page "revised 2016" playbook
two 4-page "revised 2016" card stock tables and rule summaries
16 errata counters with 6 being blank in various colors
54 playing cards
plastic bag for shipping and holding the above contents
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Paleolithic: Seafarers
description: In Seafarers, the second expansion for the game Paleolithic, time advances to the Iron Age when navigation starts to flourish. This expansion adds up to three types of tribal upgrades, a new culture, and a international trading system for players to experience the rapid progress of the times!
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Animals, Children's Game, Civilization, Dice, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Worker Placement

name: Hora fugit facta manent (fan expansion for T.I.M.E. Stories)
description:
Somebody has already tampered with history during 205 N.T. Your mission is to save the emperor from being killed and thus fixing the timeline.

...
BEFORE YOU PRINT (a note from the designer):
This is a very long scenario, 325 cards, separated in three decks. There are nice checkpoints to stop and proceed at another time. The entire scenario will take about 5-9 hours.

It is playable with 2, 3, or 4 players. It is recommended to play with 4 players, or at least with 4 receptacles.

The scenario might not be for children: in later phases there are some references and also visuals of gore. There is also marginal sexual content, which serves historical accuracy (one of the receptacles is a prostitute).

The scenario will not be sent to Space Cowboys, because I don't think it fits their strategy due to its length.

The scenario is available in English and German. It's also available as a Steam workshop item in Tabletop Simulator.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Puzzle, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Profile in Courage: PT-109
description:
By July 1943, the US Navy, Army, and Marines had worked their way up the Solomons against heavy Japanese resistance. At the height of the battle for control of New Georgia, and more specifically the reduction of the powerful Japanese airbase at Munda, the US Navy established a base for Patrol Torpedo (PT) Boats on Rendova island. The Japanese, desperately intent on clinging to their position at Munda, were operating a steady line of supplies and troops that staged out of Rabaul. Using barges, and Destroyers of the Tokyo Express, the Japanese poured troops and supplies down “the Slot”, first to Vila on Kolombangara, and then on to Munda in New Georgia. It was the PT Boats at Rendova that were tasked the dangerous mission of patrolling each night in the Blackett Strait, where they tried to disrupt this Japanese supply line. One of the young PT-Boat skippers was 26 year old Lt. John F. Kennedy of PT 109. This solitaire play game is based on his exploits in the South Pacific during the months of July and August 1943.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Find the code! Pirateninsel
description: Players embark on an exciting pirate treasure hunt and find a padlocked treasure chest. To crack the combination, they must cooperate to piece the jigsaw treasure map together, solve the riddles on the riddle card and move the wooden figure the correct number of squares in order to open the valuable treasure chest.

name: Crime Files: Das letzte Kapitel des L. Birkenwald
description:
Become a criminal police officer!
The detective game for up to 4 people, with realistic evidence such as laboratory reports, newspaper articles and fingerprints.
Use the evidence to solve the mysterious environmental scandal in Hensfeld.

There is no time limit - it all depends on the skill of the investigator.

name: Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield Chilling Reign
description:
Seize the advantage with Pokémon of the frozen lands, including the powerful Ice Rider Calyrex VMAX and Shadow Rider Calyrex VMAX—plus the Galarian forms of Articuno, Zapdos, and Moltres—in Sword & Shield—Chilling Reign! Phantom hauntings, howling blizzards, and wild battles—expand the realms of your Pokémon strategy with new powers and new possibilities. Press on despite ghostly opposition, and claim total victory in the land of spectral snow with the Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield—Chilling Reign expansion!


Over 190 cards
Dozens of Pokémon originally discovered in the Galar region
15 powerful Pokémon V and 8 enormous Pokémon VMAX
New Single Strike and Rapid Strike cards
More than 25 Trainer cards and 3 new Special Energy cards


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Hizuru
description:
In this Japanese legendary tale, you and your friends must work together in building up your party, while journeying towards the place where the demons resides.

If players are able to defeat all the demons, they will be victorious. If they are unable to do so, and the demons get the upper hand, the demons will win.

How to play: There are 2 main phases:

The Exploration phase:
The starting player rolls the dice, and each player moves their character the number of spaces of the dice. Reveal the token that you land on and resolve its effect.

The demon battle:
Once players reach the area where the demons resides, the battle will begin. Players choose the character they wish to fight with. Taking turns, each player attempt to battle the demon using their abilities (and sometimes dice), if they are successful they can fight the next demon. If they are unsuccessful, the next player can attempt to defeat that demon. Once all the demons are defeated the players win.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fighting

name: まじかる☆キングダム (Magical Kingdom)
description:
In the land of bread and magic, the queen has a dream: to create an ideal kingdom. Roll dice, gather resources, and use the power of your character and your tableau to build a kingdom worthy of praise!

This game uses the same system as Magical Bakery: A Conglomerate from Today, but includes additional content in its box to allow for more variety in setups and different potential for tableau building. (Note that each game is separate, and the two games cannot be combined.) Over the course of the game, you will gather resources and use them to play cards to your tableau, earning yourself victory points and additional abilities. The game ends after one player has at least 20 VP in their tableau; the player with the most points wins the game!

On your turn, you will roll three dice (or four, for one character), with seven different types of actions available. Dice can be used to acquire cards from a common market to your hand or to generate resources in three different types (gold, influence, and magic). Resources and dice together can be used to play cards from your hand into your tableau, or to build a legendary card. Resources can be used on their own to refresh the market or be converted into the other resource types. And cards in your tableau can be used to generate special effects. Use a combination of luck and strategy to build an engine that will push you ahead of the other players in the game in order to bring the most renown to yourself and the kingdom.

Cards are Chimera size (58x90mm).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Cluellage
description:
You have a frog, a birch, and something that looks like a mountain. Try assembling those into the Eiffel Tower. Or a New Year’s Eve. Or Charlie Chaplin! Guide your opponents with your meaningful collage to the secret word and guess the other players’ masterpieces. What could this yellow and blue-striped nonsense mean?

Cluellage is a game about guessing words through collages.


Every player gets a screen, dice, 6 tokens numbered 1 to 6 and 5 cards with abstract pictures.
They roll the dice behind the screen to know the word that they will show.
Players put the top card from their stack in the middle of the table and simultaneously try to select the best one for them.
They try to explain a given word using 5 cards they got in the previous phase.
You receive 1 point for each correct guess and 1 point for everyone who guessed you correctly.


After 3 rounds the player with the most points wins.

name: G.I. Joe Deck-Building Game: New Alliances Bonus Box #4
description: A promo pack for G.I. Joe Deck-Building Game's Transformers crossover expansion containing two new cards (Grimlock and Dinobot Rampage) and a dual-layered Ark board.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Singapur
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Two town builders have competing projects that vie for the most beautiful skyline, with the winner being the one who can see more houses when his game plan is realized. Singapur invites you to dream big – but only the one who is wide awake during play can win.

name: ICECOOL: Artifacts
description:
Originally available as part of Promo Pack C from Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter Campaign.

Includes 4 cards.

At the beginning of every round, the catcher is the first to pick one of the artifacts to use this round. Then everybody else, going clockwise from the catcher, picks one. If playing with four, the last player does not have a choice and takes the last artifact.

Each artifact is usable once a round. When you take it, place it with the active (glowing) side up. Once it has been used, flip it to its inactive side (not glowing).

Ancient clock - Lets a player reset the turn he just made, by placing all the pieces in the positions and places they were before he made the flick. Then take the turn (flick) again.

Trap - At the beginning of the round (when the player chooses this artifact) player places the trap anywhere on the board, when any other player touches the card (slides on or over it), the card is removed and becomes inactive. The player who placed the trap flicks the other players penguin in any direction he wants.

Teleport - At the beginning of the round (when the player chooses this artifact) player places the teleport anywhere on the board. At the start or end of that player’s turn that player can place their penguin on that card. After you move away from the card (by taking a flick or being bumped off) it is removed from the board and becomes inactive.

Platform - At the end of this player’s turn he may place the card on top of a spot where boxes make a T(connection point of three boxes) and one of these boxes must be the one where players penguin is. This card becomes a platform onto which the player places their penguin on. Player starts his next turn from the platform then the card is removed and becomes inactive.
​
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: 1838: Rheinland
description:
1838 Rheinland is an 18xx game designed and self-published by Wolfram Janich.

It is intended to be a short game, obviously located in the area of one of the most industrial area of Germany, the Rhine valley from Bonn to the RuhrGebiet (Essen).


mainly a variant of 1835 (trains X+x, last share is 20%, nationalization, corporations floated with 50%) with 1830: Railways & Robber Barons features (stock market, privates auction)
6 corporations
the Rhine can only be crossed in a few places in main cities (this represents the fact that the Prussian army did not allow, for defense reasons, the building of bridges over the Rhine)
special bonuses: coal mines and steel mills
small map (around 60 hexes)


A revised version has been published as 18Rhl: Rhineland.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Ruby Rush!
description:
In Ruby Rush, the players represent prospectors trying to cash in on a sudden up-cropping of rubies in the nearby landscape, while deterring the opposition.

The deck is 26 cards, and every card has a ruby value. Most of the cards are action cards that allow players to "Dig" up more cards, steal from other players, etc. Being too greedy can result in a cave-in, eliminating the player from the game. When the deck is exhausted, the remaining players total their rubies, and the highest value wins; or if all but one player is eliminated, that player wins immediately.

The skill sets involved are risk management, and to a lesser degree, card-counting and bluffing.

Game rules include a variant for 4-5 players with the addition of another set of cards with the same game play.

name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Gondor in Flames
description: Gondor in Flames is a supplement for The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game, it includes rules for the armies of Elendil, Osgiliath, the fiefdoms of Gondor and the Dead Men of Dunharrow.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame

name: Normandy 1944: A Bloody Summer
description:
Normandy 1944: A Bloody Summer is a two players divisional scale wargame, which depict the combats of the Normandy campaign from June to August 1944.

It includes two scenarios and one campaign game:
- The first scenario covers the drive to Cherbourg, one of the first of the Allies’ objectives.
- The second scenario starts at the end of July and covers the great Allied offensives, Goodwood & Cobra
- Finally, the campaign game covers all of the operations up to the end of August with the reduction of the Falaise pocket.

1 Turn per week.
6 Kilometers per hex.

Normandy 1944 is a new and redeveloped Deluxe version of Normandie 1944 (Vae Victis #27).

name: 5150: Fighter Command
description:
In 5150 - Fighter Command you can command a flight of combat spacecraft fighters. You're the eyes and ears of the fleet and lives depend on you doing your job. Your job is simple: sweep the stars of the enemy. For you it's not who the enemies are but where they are. Your missions will range from patrolling in front of the fleet, to attacking the enemy when you find them, to defending the fleet. You'll be fighting a variety of Races and Factions who want nothing more than to take you out. In 5150 - Fighter Command you'll find:

Rules for squadron level fighter and spaceship combat. Dynamic mission, combat and dogfighting rules let you play head-to-head, co-op and solo. Take the helm as any of the primary Factions and Races in the 5150 Universe. Pre-generated scenarios and missions for quick-start battles. Complete campaign rules let you run your Fighter pilot or Ship's captain through an entire story line.

5150 - Fighter Command can be played solo, same side with everyone against the game, and of course head-to-head against your friends. Playable with any ship models, in any scale, this easy to learn yet tough to master game is perfect for the casual or battle hardened space gamer.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Rivet Wars: Baby Girl
description:
Babygirl is no baby girl. "At a young age babygirl demonstrated amazing powers of concentration and mental toughness. For this reason she was brought into the Court of Assassins where she was trained to be a warrior and killer. Today she is one of the most deadly assassins on the face of Rivet. Her fierce combat skills are only matched by her beauty."

This was a KS Exclusive figure for Rivet Wars. Babygirl has a special assault action.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: iKnow: Wielki Test Wiedzy
description:
Another version of popular quiz game iKnow, based on popular polish TV show "Wielki Test Wiedzy"

In the trivia game iKNOW, you get to test what other players know while trying to score for yourself. The game includes 1,600 questions in four categories, and each question comes with three hints at three levels of difficulty that reveal the answer piece by piece. Do you think you'll know the answer first – or should you let other players give the question a try?

iKNOW also includes a betting element that gives you a chance to win no matter how much – or how little – you know as long as you know who does or doesn't know. Do you think that your friend knows his sports forwards and backwards? Do you know that geography is your spouse's worst stumbling block? Place your bets for or against your friends, and collect the winnings.

name: Hipp Hopp Hippo
description:
The monkeys try to cross the river on the backs of the hippos, but sometimes a hippo dives and the monkey falls in the water.

On your turn you roll one die to move a monkey and another die to slide one of the hippos.

name: Aleph Null: Promo – The Penis Tree
description:
Promo card for Aleph Null handed out at Spiel 2022.

Cost to summon: 2

Effect while in play:

Sacrifice -> Choose 2 different effects:
- Discard or scrap 1 card.
- Sacrifice 1 card from your hand.
- Gain 1 Magic Power.
- Draw 1 card.

It replaces the "The Weeping Tree" card in the deck.

Aside (from Tony): During playtesting, this alternative art version was used and we joked - with Matthias of Frosted Games - that it could not really be printed in the final version. As it turned out, I arrived on their booth for Day 1 of Spiel 2022 to find they had printed it as a separate promo card...in English and German (Penisbaum) versions! It's functionally-identical to 'The Weeping Tree' but with Alex's version of a REAL Medieval manuscript cartoon - there are lots of this sort of thing out there on those old books: done by miffed/horny monks!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based

name: 1848-1849: Hungary Fights for Freedom
description:
After the 1848 Revolution, Hungary became a modern democratic country. However, as part of the Austrian Empire and consisting of numerous ethnical groups, the transformation caused serious political and social conflicts as well. These led ultimately to internal revolts, then a full-scale war with Austria.

1848-1849: Hungary Fights for Freedom is a solitaire (one-player) game in which you, the player, represent the government of Hungary – centred around the person of Lajos Kossuth – during the 1848-49 War of Independence. Your goal is to defend revolutionary Hungary against the enemies approaching from different directions, who are controlled by the rules of the game.

The game aims to recapture the political, social and economical side of the conflict as well as the military one, in a format that is easily playable in under 1 hour.

1848-1849: Hungary Fights for Freedom was inspired by Victory Point Games’ popular States of Siege series.

This is a Print-and-Play game, which means all components are freely downloadable! If you try the game, feel free to write your opinion in the form of reviews or AARs!

There is a VASSAL module for the game (in Hungarian only) that can be downloaded from https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qSUVNZzF1Sd-RQRPLK4ZNdMHwTV....

For Hungarians: A teljes játék letölthető magyar nyelven a https://sztrategosz.blog.hu/2020/06/27/verrel_vivott_szabads... címről.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Magic: The Gathering – Dragon's Maze
description:
Description from the publisher:

A massive puzzle spans the city-world of Ravnica, and all ten guilds race to be the first to crack the mystery. Rumors abound that whoever navigates the maze of clues could command world-shaking power. Will your guild take the prize?
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Von Manstein: Battles for the Ukraine 1941-1944
description: "Von Manstein: Battles for the Ukraine 1941-1944" is an Operational level simulation of land warfare in South Russia during the 1941-1944 period. The map covers the Ukraine from Stalingrad West, and parts of Poland and Rumania. Uses a single Ratio Combat Results table to determine outcomes of battle. Provides Air War points to be allocated. Units are essentially Division and up. Game contains 8 different scenarios (from 6 to 12 turns). Rules are about 5 pages (with specific additional items in the scenario) and 200 counters
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Superfut
description:
Superfut is a football game for two players. The aim of the game is to score a goal against your opponent and to defend your own goal, using a die to make your moves. The player who scores more goals wins; in the event of draw, the winner can be decided by penalties.

In start of the game, players place their footballers on the game board, either using the standard formations on the tactics cards (recommended) or by taking turns. On his turn, a player rolls the dice to move his footballers with or without the ball on the board or shoot. Footballers may be moved horizontally, vertically or diagonally. It is possible to kick, pass and dribble. To score a goal, the ball has to be kicked over the line in front of the opponent's goal mouth.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Monkey
description:
Kurgill the Wizard has gone crazy. Watch out, as you and your fellow monkey climbers must escape his hazardous spells. Bananas, faeries and anvils, oh my! You never know what Kurgill will throw at you next. Only the Treetop is safe. Climb as quickly as you can, battle to knock each other down, dodge the traps, and above all, beware of the Gnome. It’s a race to the top.

Monkey is a fast-paced, goofy card game where the odds are against you. It can be played with up to 4 players and even includes a solitaire mode. Each player is a monkey who starts at the bottom of the collective “Tree.” Four cards make up the “Trunk” of the Tree and three cards make up the “Treetop.” Each turn starts with you drawing a card into your hand from the draw pile, then flipping over the top card of the “Spell Deck” (usually this “spell” harms you, but you might get lucky!). Finally, you get two Action Points (APs) to spend during your turn. You can spend APs to draw cards, to attempt to climb up the Tree (ie. to the next position up), or to set traps to impede the progress of other players. Each Tree card (whether a Trunk or Treetop card) has a number (1-10, 15 or 20), which is colored (yellow, blue, green, red, black or multicolored). Each time a player attempts to climb a Tree card they combine cards from their hand until their sum exceeds the number on the Tree card. But there’s a twist: color matters! If the Tree card is red, yellow, green or blue, then the player may use anything except that color in their attempt to climb. (For example, if the Tree card is a yellow 10, a player could combine a blue 6 and a green 5 to beat it. However, a player could not have used a yellow 15 to beat it since the Tree card itself was yellow and such "color matching" is not allowed). There are two exceptions: Black can only be beaten by black, and multicolored cards can be beaten by any cards.

Just when you think you have it, Kurgill the Wizard might prevent you from climbing, or even worse, might send you falling back down the Tree. The standard gameplay will keep you entertained, but in case you want to mix it up, Monkey also has three variations: “Insane Mode,” in which you remove the main good cards from the Spell Deck; “Super-Tree,” in which each player has their own Trunk to climb but a shared Treetop from which they can oust other players; and finally “Krazy Kurgz,” in which Kurgill the Wizard joins as an opponent to all players, to wreak havoc along with his birdie minions. Monkey is a great family game, quick to pick up, and always entertaining!

name: Near and Far: Pandoran Box Promo Card
description:
A promo card given out as part of the Man Vs Meeple 2018 Kickstarter campaign and later from the Promo Paradise 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Card text:

When you build a camp, roll a die and gain: (1) coin, (2) Gem, (3) -1 rep, (4) green banner, (5-6) -1 heart
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Schaumermal
description:
Schaumermal is a board game aimed at simulating a federation football (henceafter simply called football) match. Each player manages a team of 11 players (10 players and a goalkeeper) on a rectangular board with the lines of a football pitch printed on it and overlaid with a grid.

In a regular game, the two players set up their teams (of 10 players and a goalkeeper) in their halves. One side is nominated the home team (the other, the away team) and starts off the game. The game is played in turns. During each turn, the team in possession of the ball passes or kicks the ball, and moves 3 players. The opposing team then moves 3 of its players to interfere with the other's play. Different playing positions of the team (e.g. striker, dribblers, etc) move differently.

The aim of the team in possession of the ball is to put the ball into the net of the opposing team (thus scoring a goal), and its opponent aims to stop it from doing so by blocking the paths towards goal and tackling opposing players to gain possession of the ball. Whether a ball is kicked accurately to its target location or how much it deviated off-course is determined by the roll of a die. The results of tackles are determined by comparing dice rolls.

The game lasts until a pre-determined time elapses (in which case the team who has scored the most goals wins) or a team has scored a pre-determined number of goals (and wins). The game includes rules for variants such as Hocus Pocus cards that allow players to change the events of play, customization of each individual player (introducing ability points and skills), and league play.

name: Basileus
description:
Basileus is a an introductory level tactical medieval wargame. This is the fifth module of the "A la Charge!" series.

Each turn is composed of 6 phases:

Movement of Player 1
Combat of Player 1
Movement of Player 2
Combat of Player 2
Check victory conditions
Advance the Turn Marker

Five battles are included:

Arcadiopolis, 970 (Byzantines vs. Rus/Bulgars/Pechenegs)
Dorostolon 1, 971 (Byzantines vs. Rus/Pechenegs)
Dorostolon 2, 971 (Byzantines vs. Rus)
Dorostolon 3, 971 (Byzantines vs. Rus)
Beroia, 1122(Byzantines vs. Pechenegs)

Many wargame concepts are introduced like Zone of Control, moving from hexagon to hexagon, command, firing long distance or close combat (melee), checking morale and retreating.

A battle lasts between 30-60 mins.

name: Carcassonne: The Bets
description:
With this mini-expansion you place bets on how many tiles a road or a city will consist of upon completion. Influence these areas in your favor and get the extra points.
Components: 10 betting place tiles, 36 betting chips, 1 rule.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
publishers: Devir, Hans im Glück, Swan Panasia Co., Ltd.

name: Horse Trader
description:
The game consists of four different, but similar, 40-piece puzzles, four stand-up partitions to isolate and hide each player's puzzle area, and a picture card for each of the four puzzles. The puzzles are paintings of four different horses, with each in a similar setting, but in a different season.

The puzzle pieces are mixed and distributed facedown, with 40 pieces to each player. Each player sets up a partition to hide his pieces. The horse pictures are mixed facedown and one is dealt to each player. Each player places his picture in the holder slots of his partition; this is the puzzle that player must assemble.

To start the game, players turn over their pieces and begin assembling their puzzles. At any time and throughout the game, any player may offer to trade one to four puzzle pieces. When another player agrees to trade that number, they immediately trade those pieces facedown. At any time, a player may call out “Hold Your Horses,” and designate right, left, or across. All players must immediately pass one puzzle piece in the direction specified.

Trading continues until one player completes his puzzle. The game may be played by three players by removing one complete puzzle before beginning.

Note: This game was produced by the Springbok puzzle division of the Hallmark Card company. There is no date on either the box or the instruction sheet, so the production year is approximate. Naturally, there is no information regarding who designed the game. It was sold only through Hallmark Card dealers.

name: Cross
description:
Cross is played on an hexagonal board with 2 to 10 hexagons per side (6 is the standard size).

Start: The board is initially empty.

Play: Red places one of their pieces at an empty cell then Yellow may elect to swap colours in lieu of making the second move (swap option).

Players then take turns placing a piece of their colour on an empty cell.

Aim: A player wins by connecting three non-adjacent board sides with a chain of their pieces.

A player loses by connecting two opposite board sides with a chain of their pieces (without also connecting three non-adjacent sides).

Each corner cell belongs to both sides that meet there.

name: RiddleCraft
description:
On an archaeological expedition, you discover the ancient tome of riddles that you had long been searching for—sadly, its pages are torn to shreds beyond hope of reassembly. Your hopes dashed, you decide to raise your spirits by using the fragments of riddles that remain to hold a contest of wits and riddle-making with your friends at the local tavern…

As players lay down cards, a single riddle slowly gets more and more complicated. You must decide whether to add more to the riddle or to challenge someone to answer it.
You can choose some of the riddle’s clues, but don’t get caught without an answer!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Flip and Find's Diner
description:
Flip and Find run a diner that is in complete chaos. Orders are pouring in and they can’t remember where they put their ingredients! In this memory game, players flip tiles to find the ingredients to complete orders to collect money (more complex orders are more valuable) and tips.

The game is set up by dealing 25 tiles face-down in a 5x5 grid, and dealing 5 order cards face-up below the grid.

On your turn, you flip over 4 tiles from the grid. If the ingredients revealed match the ingredients required for one of the orders, you collect that order and the money along with it. If you reveal a tip tile along with the ingredients to complete a recipe, collect a tip card. The value of which you will keep secret until the end of the game. Each order card also includes a special ability which will be available for a one-time use on a future turn.

Tiles used to complete orders are discarded and replaced from the tile deck and completed order cards are replaced with new orders from the order deck.

The game ends after a player has successfully completed 5 orders. Players finish out that round, so each player has had an equal number of turns, and the player with the highest combined dollar amount from completed orders and collected tips wins!

name: Dance of Muses
description:
Are you ready to become the masters of the nine Muses?
In Dance of Muses you will guide the Muses to perform the perfect dance and fulfill the will of Apollo.

Every time a Muse performs a dance step, the value of their die increases.
Use Muse skills to change the values of adjacent dice!
The game ends as soon as the die on a Muse reaches the value 6.
The die on each Muse who has executed the will of Apollo (keeping its die on the indicated value) automatically becomes a 6.
Compare your dice with other players and find out who did the best dance!

Dance Of Muses is a 2-4 abstract strategy game, designed by Marco Baglioni and David Trambusti and illustrated by Sara "Sbilemi" Marino.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Dice, Print & Play
mechanics: Grid Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Slide/Push, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Into the Pocket!
description:
Publisher's ad copy: "'Into the Pocket! is a wargame about the German attempt to rescue the desperate forces trapped in the Stalingrad Pocket. It appears in the third issue of Yaah! magazine:

It's an honest-to-gosh, hex-and-counter, odds-and-CRT, column-shiftin', panzer-pushin' Eastern Front WWII wargame. Can three desperate Panzer divisions punch a hole in the Stalingrad Pocket big enough to save the encircled 6th Army? Or will they be overwhelmed by a seemingly endless supply of Soviet forces? It's good ol' fashioned historical wargaming at its finest, harkening back to the era when gamers were gamers, and the fate of the world hinged on a +2DRM with 3:1 odds!

It's a small footprint game, ideal for newbies, played with 88 counters and a gorgeous 12x18.5 inch map illustrated by rising star Ania Ziolkowska. A background article about German military tradition by Sean Chick rounds out the package."
publishers: Banana Games, Flying Pig Games, Tiny Battle Publishing

name: Eleven: Unique set up deck
description:
A deck of 8 cards allowing for an asymmetric start of the game. Each card is double sided with a positive effect on the one side and negative effect on the other. Each player draws 2 cards and choose which of them they should play on positive and which of them on negative side. This decision gives that player head start in one direction, and impact slightly the rest of the game.

This is an optional module for Eleven: Football Manager Board Game increasing the variability of the game. Without it, all players start the game symmetrically.

name: Paulus 6th Army
description:
Paulus' 6th Army is an operational level simulation of the Soviet encirclement operation named "Operation Uranus" and the German escape attempt from Stalingrad from 19th November to 24th December, 1942.

This game represents the first significant operational victory of the previously inferior Soviet Red Army over the Wehrmacht. For this reason, the battle of Stalingrad in often referred to as the "turning point" of the World War II. But in this game, the German player has more options of command than Friedrich Paulus, the commander of German 6th Army. So the German player may conduct withdraw from Stalingrad with his troops as he chooses and may defend more effectively than the historical static situation.

(source: Six Angles webpage)

name: Flint & Steel
description:
(from publisher:)

Flint & Steel Miniatures Rules for the American Revolution & Age of Reason

Flint & Steel continues the standard of excellence in wargaming established by Clash of Arms. More than an outstanding set of rules, Flint & Steel brings together in one source a wealth of information for this exciting period of warfare. No need to have miniature figures in order to use and enjoy these rules. You can easily get started right away by making your own units from templates provided inside.

Special Features:
For 5mm, 15mm, 20mm, 25mm, and 30 mm figures
Comprehensive rules that play quickly
Ratings and details for almost 700 individual American, British, German, French, and Indian units from the American Revolution
Unique, simple command and control system
Ratings on over 500 different types of units for 26 different armies from 1740-1789
Performance data on 50+ different artillery types
Recreates battles in North America, Europe, and the Far East
Ratings and details on over 300 leaders of the American Revolution
Optional rules to fully recreate a wide variety of maneuver battles
Introductory scenarios from the American Revolution and Seven Years War
Includes unique scenario generator

Contents:
Size: 40 page soft bound rules book with full color cover plus a 64 page unit and weapon data book.
Examples of Play: Included.
Diagrams and Illustrations: Included.
Complexity: Moderate, figure templates allow play without miniatures.
Players: Two or more recommended while solitaire suitability is excellent.
Author: Richard J. Kane.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Royal Armies of the Hyborean Age
description: A variant of FGU's Broadsword rules designed to "make possible the recreation, on a table top, of the type of battle described in Robert E. Howard's Conan stories." There are rules for magic and a section giving descriptions and army lists of the forces of the various nations of the Hyborian age.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Star Fleet Battles: Commander's SSD Book #8
description:
An expansion for the Star Fleet Battles: Commander's Rulebook.

Contains 46 SSD (Ship System Display) sheets for Star Fleet Battles, included are SDD's for Repair Freighters, Armed Freighters, Planetary Defense Systems, Cargo Tug, Commercial Platform, System Activity Maintenance Station, Dreadnoughts, Carriers, Battle Cruisers, Command Cruisers, Cruisers, Destroyers, Escorts, Police Gun Boats and Scouts.
2-Orion, 14-Klingon, 12-Romulan, 8-Lyran, 2-Planetary Defense Bases, 2-Misc. ships and 6-Freighters

This SSD book is product number TFG3021.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Trilogía del Destino: Tyranos
description:
Every family has important members while others keep unnoticed. In this strategy game the players try to be the leader. To accomplish this they will have to use their cards very wisely. They must be the first in getting rid of all the cards, because if they do not the consequences can be high, very high. The most insignificant members will be used by the others and will discover that maintaining so low profile will do his victory something more difficult to reach.

Cards in this game represent warriors trying to be the most powerful of all, and be able to rule above all the others.
At the beginning of the game, all the cards are given to the players. Each turn they will have to try to get rid of them. But to do it they must follow some rules. Each card has a number on it that represent the strength of the card. When a player plays some cards, then the next one can beat him only with a set of identical card of more strength.
Some cards have special abilities that allow them, for example, to be played with other kind of warrior, get rid of cards from the hand, etc…

For ages 8+

name: Panzer Grenadier: Hopeless, But Not Serious – The Austrian Federal Army, 1934-1938
description:
Hopeless, But Not Serious is a supplement for the Panzer Grenadier system based on the actual actions of the Austrian Army against Socialist and Nazi militias in 1934, and potential battles foreseen by the Jansa Plan in 1938. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of our Eastern Front, Road to Berlin, Battle of the Bulge, Elsenborn Ridge and Cassino '44 games and our Edelweiss and Sinister Forces supplements to enjoy all of the scenarios. There are 16 scenarios, two each from the Austrian Civil War and Nazi Uprising of 1934, one based on the only actual combat between German and Austrian units in 1938, and the other 10 drawn from potential battles considered by the Austrian General Staff that did not actually occur.

Hopeless, But Not Serious is sold via PDF download as well as in a professionally published edition with mounted, die-cut counters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Imperial Harvest: Merchants & Magic Expansion
description:
Components:
• 1 Rules card
• 3 new character cards (Merchant, Dryad, and Wyvern)
• 8 Merchant Deck cards (introduces new item mechanic)
• 8 wood Imperial Servant (gold) character tokens
• 8 wood Northern Raider (silver) character tokens
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Our God Was My Shield: Jackson's Valley Campaign
description:
Our God Was My Shield is the first game in John Theissen's American Civil War Operational Series (ACWOS). This series of streamlined card-assisted operational sandboxes builds on Mr. Theissen's work in titles such as More Aggressive Attitudes, Objective Shreveport, and Hood's Last Gamble. Those games had slightly different and not entirely compatible rulesets - each one needed to be learned from scratch. But titles in the new ACWOS share a common core ruleset: learn one game, and you'll know how to play the rest of them. This ruleset is flexible enough to allow each game to have its own geographic and temporal scale and Combat Results Table, as well as special event cards unique to that campaign.

Specific units and their strengths are hidden from your opponent as you perform a tense dance of cat-and-mouse maneuvers. When you attack your opponent, there's always a chance they might slip away - or, they might be able to concentrate additional forces, turning what you thought would be an easy victory into a near-run thing, especially if your own forces fail to coordinate. Knowing when to attack and when to hold back, when to run and when to make a stand, are paramount, and as ever, subject to the fortunes of war.

The subject of our first title in this series is Jackson's famous 1862 Valley Campaign, which saw him eluding and harassing three Union armies through a combination of boldness and deception. It is perhaps an ideal subject with which to debut this system with its emphasis on maneuver, bluff, and nerve.

—description from the publisher

name: Wild Assent: Shadow of the Silvestrem
description:
Wild Assent’s Shadow of the Silvestrem expansion adds new Assents and Seekers for the players to field in both game modes as well as exciting new gameplay options to add to the variety provided by the core game.

It includes:

3D terrain miniatures to replace all of the obstacle tokens for both game modes (excluding the Pits).
A new type of Gladiator in the Arena mode: Mercenaries. Mercenaries are treated like Creatures, but they are more traditional humanoid Gladiators and move as squads of three.
Drusus, Champion of the Silvestrem, who can be a player character in either the Arena or on the Hunt. Drusus is not an Assent; his Arena troupe must consist of only Mercenaries.
Vareclea, the owner of the Silvestrem herself, Wild Assent’s first playable summoner and three of her vile Torments.
Boss fights. Players can join together to take down the Fire Lord, Twin Dragon, Drusus or Vareclea in these new cooperative Arena and Hunt mode brawls.
A solo prologue for the core game’s story-based campaign, showing how Zaxos, Fani, Illithena and Berlyne met and became Seekers.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Team-Based Game

name: Hunt A Killer: Class of '98
description:
In Class of '98, you play a six-episode murder mystery as private eye for Gray Investigations. Your boss was at her high school reunion in the small town of Chestnut Falls when local pharmacist Charles McDonagh is found murdered in his car on the side of the road.

The local sheriff is out of commission and asks Ms. Gray and her team to assist his inexperienced underling.

Of course, the pool of suspects is large with everyone coming back for the reunion, and Charles's seven old pals, the Hacky Pack and his wife are all suspects. Can you sort through police reports, witness statements, and physical evidence to find the killer?

Do you have what it takes to Hunt A Killer? Immersive, story-driven board games for you to play alone or cooperatively. Sort through evidence, decode ciphers, piece together clues, and catch the killer.

Hunt a Killer: Class of '98 Box Set contains 6 episodes, each in its own box.

Difficulty: 2/5 - Medium
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Legend of Hexdom
description:
A fantasy roll and write solitarie (but also can be played as a coop or competitive experience) where you explore a world of hexes, adventuring for loot, increasing your stats until you are ready to raid the castles and defeat the bosses.

With different classes, each hero has its own set of powers (and weaknesses).
You can find treasures, gems, relics and gifts to assist you in your journey.

Only needing a pen/marker and three six-sided dice and one of Hexdom maps. Our initial campaign promises more than 250 maps in the starting package and we hope to build a community to expand even further.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Soccer Replay
description:
Soccer replay/simulation game.

Brief outline of the game system

The Team Cards provide Attack and Defence Ratings, for home and away matches, for each team. Theses Ratings are based on the average number of goals scored and conceded in each match and are the built-in guarantee of accuracy of results. The respective Ratings for the two teams involved in a match are cross-referenced on a Chart to obtain a Goal Rating for each team. These Goal Ratings serve two purposes. Added together they indicate which Elapsed Time Card to use (this controls the average time lapse between potentially dangerous attacks and thus determines whether the match will be high or low scoring), and when cross-referenced against each other produce the number of the Match Card applicable, this Card providing, on average, the correct ratio of attacks between the home and away team. Five dice are used to re-create, with the help of the twenty Action Cards, the important moves in the match. No attempt has been made to simulate every pass and tackle, the game concentrates only on the decisive moves, the ‘highlights’ of the game. This action is controlled on the Stadium Card which incorporates a playing pitch containing a Mid-Field and twenty lettered Attack Zones for each team and a Defence State Track on which is recorded the current ‘tightness of each team’s defence.

Each Action Card lists six attacking options and used in conjunction with the dice rolls determines the development or break down of each attack. The Goal Attempt Cards come into play when a scoring chance occurs but the result of such attempts depend to a large degree on the current state of the opponent’s Defence which will need to be probed and confused by the build-up preceding the shot or header at goal.

The Team Cards also show the team’s line-up and substitutes, and this is used to keep track of the player currently in possession, receiving or intercepting a pass, committing a foul, etc. etc. Finally, the Timing Chart is used to record the passage of time and to trigger off ‘tactical options’ which can result in players being pushed forward or pulled back depending on the state of the game. The Referee’s Card is consulted in the event of fouls to decide if disciplinary action is taken against the offender, and this also incorporates the Short handed Chart and Substitution Chart.

name: Cry Havoc: Secret Objective Promo Pack
description:
Originally offered through Dice Tower's Season 13 Indiegogo campaign

8 different end of game scoring cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Caribbean Star
description:
Caribbean Star is a commissioned game from James Ernest for the game design textbook "Rules of Play", by Katie Salen and Eric Zimmerman.

Caribbean Star is a card game played with a standard deck of cards. The opponents are competing magicians on a cruise ship, and each strives to perform the best magic shows. Some of the cards represent magic tricks, and others mistakes. Still others determine when the shows will be performed.

name: Binary Playing Cards
description:
The Binary Playing Cards are the first and unique playing cards in binary numbers and logic gates as suits.
You can play the new games studied for these cards or traditional games, as they are very similar to the traditional playing cards.

The publisher has rules of four different games.

- Binary (by Carte Binarie)
- Hamming (by Carte Binarie)
- SolBit (by Carte Binarie)
- FastBit (by Angelo Porazzi)
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Game System, Math, Number
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Mountains Aflame: The Austro-Hungarian South Tirol Offensive, May - June 1916
description:
"Mountains Aflame: The Austro-Hungarian South Tirol Offensive, May - June 1916" is an Operational level board-wargame about the Spring 1916 Austro-Hungarian offensive on the Italian Front, aimed to drive to Vicenza and the Veneto plain, west of Venice, cutting off the whole front in Carnia and along the Isonzo river.
One player controls the Austro-Hungarian forces, the other the Italian forces. Each player attempts to achieve, or maintain, geographical objectives to attain the victory.

SCALE: 2 Km per hex, 2 days per turn, brigade size units

Mountains Aflame contains the following items:
- a A3 (27,9 cm x 42 cm) map
- 140 counters, to cut and mount.
- a Rule booklet
- a Player Aid Card

(from the introduction)
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: ROY G. BIV
description:
Think game, think science, think fun!

In ROY G. BIV players will compete in a family style, head to head set collection game, which involves a science themed learning experience.

Be the first player to collect and play a colorful array of seven cards that represent a rainbow and WIN!

Players will draw and play cards which represent the 7 colored components of a rainbow from a common draw pile, in a race to be the first to make their rainbow appear!

Successful creation of a rainbow is accomplished by playing a card of each color, in order (Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo and Violet), to form a set of cards deemed a rainbow. But beware, opponents can rain on your parade, and influence how long it will take your rainbow to appear!

name: Ascension: David, Prophetic Guide Promo Card
description:
David, Prophetic Guide is an Ascension promo card featuring July 2013 Ascension Immortals tournament winner, David McNamara.

Cost: 5 Rune
Value: 3 Honor
Effect: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your deck in any order.

name: Pawn Voyage
description: Pawn Voyage is a race game where family and friends battle each other for their place in paradise. Stranded and alone in a life raft, players must stay afloat while attempting to get all their pawns to paradise before anyone else does. It won't be easy though, the other players will be doing all they can to Trade Places with you, Challenge you for your position or sending you flying across the board to a random location. You will find extra help along the way with Additional Turns, Shortcuts and a Mega Roll to get you into paradise even quicker.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hero Detected!: Time Twist
description:
This expansion not only increases the card count!
This expansion has some new gameplay mechanisms:

New skills - Construction pension

Out with the old, new capabilities sacrifice others 'Construction pension' is introduced.
This new capability is gets the player a new ability that gives him the power to recreate something of the past!

New Properties - relics

The existing four properties remains outside the new property is added.
Artifacts property cards have construction skills and pension conditions must be met when changing to a new card!
(Card-play mechanism has reference to MTG)

And ... the new cards!

New Magic! New monsters! The new facility! New resources!
And the new warriors and adventurers to threaten you, they are added to this expansion!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Maze, Video Game Theme

name: Greenland: Sea Sámi
description:
An expansion for Greenland, Greenland: Sea Sámi adds one tribe to the game — the Sea Sámi — along with the possibility of playing the game with four players.

The Sea Sámi were talented boat builders, praised even by the vikings, and research shows that they hunted whale very early, probably several thousand years ago. It's likely that they visited Greenland regularly, and as a snow-adapted people (probably being the inventors of skiing) the Sámi may also have had settlements on Greenland. As a Sea Sámi, you have access to daughters who use skiing and magic drums.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Negotiation

name: Hangtown: The Tailings Pile
description:
The Tailings Pile expansions pack adds new character roles into Hangtown, such as the the Rustler, Town Drunk, Madame, Foreman, and Desperado.

It also includes The South Fork, which is an additional worker placement board. The back side of it has a final scoring aid.

You must have a copy of Hangtown in order to use this expansion. It is not a stand-alone game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Orbital
description:
Mini Expansion for Neuroshima Hex 3.0 Base game.
Only a one tile expansion.

Originally available at the Neuroshima Hex championship in Poland.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Crystal Hall
description:
You are leading a guild of adventuring wizards through the Infinite Forest on a quest to find the magical Crystals of Power. If you can collect all four crystals, your guild will be the mightiest in the land.
The Infinite Forest is a dark and mysterious place. Suddenly you emerge into a sun-drenched clearing and your eyes fall upon a fantastical building. At Last... Crystal Hall.
You approach with caution and the doors slowly creak open. Before you is a glittering chamber and the very air seems to shimmer with magic. You sigh with relief ... until you see a host of other figures wearing brightly coloured hats and you realise: The battle for the Crystals has begun!

Crystal Hall is the magical strategy game that encourages players to lead their wizard-shaped counters around the hall in a quest to uncover the four magical crystals that are hidden among the 36 face-down tiles. To win the game, you need to collect 4 Crystals of Power, each of a different color. To do so, you must position your wizards so that they are on a tile showing a Crystal of Power at the start of your turn.

Each turn is comprised of 4 phases: Gather, Magic, Discovery and Draw. In the Magic Phase, you are given 4 units of Magic Power which you can use to move your wizards and attack others. Certain magic tiles can increase or reduce this total.

During the game, wizards flip a multitude of magic tiles to discover curses, potions, spells, Crystals of Power and other surprises. During the Draw Phase, you get a spell card, which can help you with your quest.

Do you have what it takes to be the most powerful wizard in the Crystal Hall?

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: 信仰通貨 (The Faith Of Currencies)
description:
信仰通貨 (The Faith Of Currencies) is a game from Japan, where players are currency traders trying to maximise their wealth. But the value of the currency depends on how much faith each trader has in the religions. Players are trying to promote the worship of one deity, whilst also preparing to switch allegiances if the deity falls from favour.

The game has a market board to show the relative exchange rates, and a track board to show how the faith is fluctuating, using small cubes for each religion (the rulebook is called Prayer's Guide).

There is a deck of cards which is used to calculate the player's score at the end of the game. At the start of the game, two cards are dealt up to move two prices. Then the deck is shuffled and players are dealt three cards. Four more cards are dealt up to form a draft.

The game has a huge stack of crisp bank notes, beautifully illustrated in the style of real banknotes, to represent each religion. The Esoteric Order Of Dagon is the US dollar, and the Euro (Zeus), Yen (Amariti) and Yuan (Communism) are also used, along with a Flying Spaghetti Monster coin (banknote). The backs of the notes are blanked, so players cannot know what anybody is holding. Players are dealt two notes of each of the five types at the start.

The game is played over a series of rounds, one more than the number of players. In a round, a player may trade currencies with the bank, or change their faith, or adjust the market prices.

When a player trades currencies, they sell what they want from their supply and buy from the bank at the current rates. The number of banknotes exchanged then alters the faith in each currency.

For example, a player might sell 2 Communism at 12 each, and buy 3 Amariti at 8 each. This moves the Communism cube along the faith track two places, and the Amariti cube moves three places. The Communism cube is now on a +1 space, so the price rises to 13. The Amariti cube is now on a +/-2 space, so the player can move the price up or down two places, for example up to 10.

Moving these cubes triggers the round ending. When a faith cube has lapped and reached its starting point, the day's trading ends and a new round starts.

A player can change their faith by discarding and drawing cards from the open supply or the top of the deck. Each religious card shows an effect on the value, dependent on the number of cards held (1,2 or 3). The value of the religion is based upon different factors, such as how much the price is, or how much total currency is held, or for the FSM, how many sets of notes you can form.

The final action a player can take is simply to move a faith cube, and adjust the market price accordingly.

Players continue to take turns carrying out these actions, until the round ends, and after the final round ends, players calculate their scores. A player's score depends on how many of which faith card they hold, and the relative prices, and how many banknotes they hold. Once calculated, the player with the most points wins.

By the open trading of banknotes and open adjusting of prices, other player's might deduce what hidden faith cards a player holds. But a player could be bluffing and trying to manipulate the market whilst holding different faiths in their hand. As the market develops, a player will want to switch their faith to maximise their final score.
user summary
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Investment, Market, Open Drafting, Stock Holding, Track Movement

name: Cards Against Humanity: Picture Card Pack 1
description:
If a picture is worth a thousand words, then this pack has over 30,000 words! That’s more words than the Bible.

- Comes with 30 all-new cards to seamlessly mix into your game.

- Each card has a picture on it, and sometimes words too!

- We can't believe we didn't think of this before.

~Publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Vendée Militaire 1793-1794
description: Fatherland is in danger! In the west, the Vendeans refuse to fight at the borders and demand their good priests. A terrible war begins! March 1793, the popular revolt and its charismatic generals, Cathelineau, La Rochejaquelein or Charette, upset the young republic. It pulls itself together with Kléber or the terrible Westermann and Turreau. With the game Vendée Militaire, experience a breathless countdown. The Whites must end the war quickly, unlike the Blues, instruments of Jacobin terror.
categories: Age of Reason, Card Game, Napoleonic

name: Bismarck Solitaire: Deluxe Edition
description:
Command the pride of the German Navy in Bismarck Solitaire by Worthington Publishing. Lead the German ships Bismarck, Prinz Eugen, and U-boat support as they take on the determined Royal Navy with one goal, Sink the Bismarck!

It's a sea hunt game. As the German commander you are hunting convoys and British warships. You are also hunted by the British Navy that outguns you and has every ship and aircraft it can muster looking for you. It is played by a crafty AI BOT that is focused on only one thing, Sink the Bismarck!

The game comes with a double sided game board with enhanced graphics. One side of the board is the North Atlantic at a strategic level with its convoys and all the British warships involved in protecting them from the Bismarck. The other side of the game board is of the Denmark Strait where the Bismarck needs to breakout into the Atlantic and British ships are there to stop them before the make the open seas.

Win by sinking enemy ships, raiding convoys and making it back to port in France before being sunk yourself.

—description from the publisher
categories: Educational, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Grid Movement, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Pizza Box Football 2007 Expansion Game Booster
description:
The expansion builds on the Pizza Box Football game system. Offenses and defenses can call more aggressive plays, and players can play for their favorite team.

All 32 teams from the 2006-2007 season are modeled after their strengths and weaknesses. How will you shut down Indy's powerful passing? Penetrate Baltimore's stalwart defense? Slow Tennessee's running QB?

This game includes 2 cards for using the expansion game play calls on offense and defense. Beware of the defense's blitz! Watch out for the screen pass!

Teams are updated every year, and 2 free teams are made available for free download for players who want to play the Big Game before it happens.

Expands:

Pizza Box Football
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Race to Baghdad: 2003
description:
Drive on Baghdad: 2003 is a solitaire game in which the player takes command of Central Command Forces during Operation Iraqi Freedom. Your goal is to defeat Saddam Hussein’s forces in such a manner as to prevent a post-campaign insurgency from breaking out.

The system plays the Iraqis. You will have to deal with a variety of situations, such as: battling Republican Guard divisions, safeguarding your lines of supply, sandstorms, etc., all the while keeping up the momentum in your drive on Baghdad.

The game has two levels: Standard Rules, which give a quick-play game, and the Optional Rules, which add more realism at the expense of increased complexity.

While this is a solitaire game, more than one can play as a team, making decisions by consensus, or with different players managing operations along each vector of Advance.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters

Modern War #20 - Nov Dec 2015
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Nuclear Armageddon
description:
Nuclear Armageddon is a war game of three to five players played on a world map (game board). Although the object of the game is to be the only player left on the board, the game encourages players to conquer large areas, build empires, manipulate up to date military equipment, and enter into political conspiracies with each other that are similar to those going on in our present day world (1985).

The 32.00” by 48.00” plastic game board consists of 55 water areas and 50 countries divided into seven groups or “regions.” Each player is provided with plastic playing pieces consisting of 60 cities, 12 jet aircraft, 12 tanks, 6 nuclear plants with cooling towers, 9 oil derricks, 3 Trident submarines, 3 New Jersey Class battleships, 3 Nimitz Class Nuclear Aircraft Carriers, 5 small “#2” silver missiles, 4 large “#5” gold missiles, and one black “Infinity Missile” (looks like an old fashioned Atom Bomb).

Also provided are 9 custom made black dice, five “Chopping Blocks” (for keeping track of dice rolls), 56 colored and numbered chips (one for each country and six wild card), a chip value counter, 5 “extra turn” chips, 75 miniature plastic mushroom clouds (hydrogen bombs), 50 Act of God cards, and a rule book.

Turn order is determined by relative game position. Dice are used for resolving attacks and have symbols on them instead of numbers. Whenever you rolled mushroom clouds on all the dice you were rolling you draw an 'Act of God' card, which adds and destroys pieces and other factors. The most attractive part of the game is the custom made plaster mushroom clouds, 75 of which are included with the basic set, to keep the game’s name true to meaning.

Available expansion kits include; Cruise Missiles, “#8” Missiles, Air Transports, Capitols, Spies, and Dictators. There are also custom made “War Room” sets, and “intermediate” sets with standard cardboard counter pieces available. Pieces of the game and player part sets are all individually available, and customer specified (custom) colors for playing pieces are offered as well.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Kursk 1943: End of the Blitzkrieg, The Northern Pincer
description:
Main issue game contained in Alea Magazine issue 31.

Kursk 1943: The Northern Pincer, the End of Blitzkrieg (Part I) is a regiment-brigade simulation of the offensive of the 9th German Army during the battle of Kursk.
categories: Dice, Fighting, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Counterbluff
description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards. Both players are dealt ten cards, and then they play one card face up in their turn till both have 5 cards played or one of them folds. In the first case the winner is the player with the best Poker hand and his score depends on the number of cards played, at the rate of 1 for the first card, 2 for the second, and so on. Then they draw till ten cards and continue and the next round starts.

1) Play one card at a time face up, alternating, starting with non-dealer/winner, up to five cards each.
2) Other player either Folds, or plays one card face up into his tableau.
3) Players can’t go beyond five cards each, i.e. a full poker hand.
4) Winner scores for the number of cards played by both (see scoring table), and both hands get filled back to 10 card, cards off deck one at a time starting with winner.
5) Leader instead of playing first card may declare “low ball”, putting five cards face up or face down.
Other player then either folds (15 pts to leader), put 5 cards face up (lower poker hand wins 30), or discards by putting five cards face down (5 pts to leader if leader’s cards face down, 15 pts to leader if leader’s cards face up).
6) Game ends when a player has fewer than 5 cards in his hand.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Buck: Legacy (1st Edition)
description:
Set in the fantasy kingdom of Loria in an age of magic and Steampunk where Ponies, Pegasi and Unicorns live and fight alongside each other.

With the emergence of the Nagapon, a destructive race of pony-snake hybrids threaten Loria. The citizens must call upon the might of the Adventurers to eliminate enemies that threaten the security of the kingdom.

Buck: Legacy is a card based Dungeon Crawling RPG where players create their character from 3 pony races and 10 adventurer classes. Gameplay revolves around fighting monsters and earning gold pieces to purchase equipment to add to their inventory.

Players can be freely co-operative or competitive. Players aim to win by collecting the most medals, which are awarded for fighting monsters, travelling distance and defeating bosses.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Fighter Squadron 6 Expansion Pack
description:
