Federation Attack Fighters were utilized by the Federation throughout the Dominion War. Fighter Squadron 6 is one of many squadrons of Federation Attack Fighters ordered by Captain Benjamin Sisko to employ tactical pattern theta and single out the Cardassian ships in order to punch a hole through the Dominion lines so that the Federation ships could reach Terok Nor.
The Federation attack fighter was a type of starship, employed by Starfleet as an attack fighter during the Dominion War.

This expansion adds a new Fighter Fleet miniature and a new set of cards to Star Trek: Attack Wing

Star Trek: Attack Wing – Fighter Squadron 6 Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 11 expansion packs from WizKids Games.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Kaosball: Ringer – Gnome Mercy and Footie
description: Expand your favorite Kaosball team's roster and boost their scoring potential with these brand new Kaosball Ringers. Ringers are powerful, all-star players that can fight, steal, score, and even use unique special abilities. Combine the right Ringer with your favorite team and unleash an unstoppable force onto the Kaosball field.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management

name: Ember: Light and Dark – Prismatic Pack
description:
LIGHT AND DARK is a pair of expansions that supercharge your game with twenty new cards across two exciting packs - each packed with game-changing mechanics. There's a lot to deal with in Light and Dark!

The Prismatic Pack boosts your creatures' abilities and adds a whole new collection of magical monsters to Conjure. Prismatic cards are creatures of divine light; each card has two magical abilities.

The Prismatic Pack contains the cards of light, the healers and protectors of the Emberverse. The cards are all designed to protect play, to mitigate card effects and card loss. All the standard cards have two powers - a first in the Ember universe.

Three of the Prismatic cards provide 0 VP (Victory Points) on their own, but their VP are instead dependent on the cards you have in play.

Then you have Iridia, the Elemental Prismatic Dragon, whose powers focus on protection, of increasing your powers, and defending your forces against the powers of the Spectral. Each Elemental Dragon has an legendary power which can be used if you control all three parts of that dragon, in this case, Irridia's ability allows you to give a creature you control +1 VP whenever any other player modifies a creature with a +1 VP or -1VP token. Powerful!

Contains:
6 Creature cards
1 Artifact card
1 Three-part Dragon
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Yummy Yummy Pancake: Promo Boards
description:
Combine Yummy Yummy Pancake: Promo Boards with the Yummy Yummy Pancake base game to enjoy an even more exciting gaming experience!

What changes?

The aim of the game when using boards changes: Be the first to complete your board with the appropriate pancakes.
During set-up, all pancakes are put face-up on the table, so the chef gets to choose which toppings will be placed in the frying pan.


How to use the boards?

Each player starts the game with a board and must complete it accordingly. The chocolate pancake is now a joker and can be used as any topping, but you can't move it once played on your board.
If you get pancakes you don't need, place them face-down in the designated space. If full, you must exchange three of them with one remaining pancake from the table to add to your board.
Small tip! For easy gameplay, use the board's face with only four tokens to match.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Memory

name: Magic: The Gathering – Ixalan Planeswalker Deck: Huatli Dinosaur Knight
description:
Includes:

2 Sun-Blessed Mount
1 Goring Ceratops
1 Burning Sun's Avatar
2 Kinjalli's Caller
4 Huatli's Snubhorn
2 Raptor Companion
2 Tilonalli's Knight
2 Frenzied Raptor
2 Territorial Hammerskull
2 Bonded Horncrest
2 Pterodon Knight
2 Shining Aerosaur
3 Huatli's Spurring
2 Slash of Talons
2 Lightning Strike
2 Rallying Roar
4 Stone Quarry
11 Mountain
11 Plains
1 Huatli, Dinosaur Knight
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Purrballs: Catventure Card Game
description:
The Purrballs find themselves in a strange and mysterious place! How’d they get here? How do they get back home? What’re all these clothes they’re suddenly wearing? No one really knows, and it seems like our curious purry pals aren’t sticking around to find out. A grand Catventure awaits!

In the Purrballs: Catventure Card Game, players compete to gain the most Experience Points (XP) by the end of the game. Each player starts with a party of eager Catventurers, each with an ability, a Speed value, and their own way of scoring XP.

Every round, valuable Loot cards are drawn from the Loot deck and laid out into the pool, together with several dangerous Monsters. Players secretly choose a Catventurer from their party to play. Each offers a powerful ability that gives you an advantage, but Speed determines who picks Loot first. Will you choose a sneaky Rogue, with its high Speed value? Or perhaps a Soldier, able to fight off Monsters and claim their rewards?

The game ends when all the loot has been taken. Referring to the Loot cards they've collected, players count up the amount of XP scored by every Catventurer in their party. The player with the most XP wins the game!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Storm in the East: Operation Barbarossa
description:
Storm in the East: Operation Barbarossa depicts the largest and most dramatic military campaign in recorded history: the German invasion of Soviet Russia. Germany and its allies had almost five million men deployed in three army groups along the 800 miles of the Soviet border. As dawn broke on 22 June 1941, the first Axis formations crossed into the Soviet Union and smashed through units charged with defending the border. Taken completely by surprise, many were captured or killed while asleep in their barracks. As the dawn bled into a new day, the Luftwaffe bombed airfields in western Russia destroying much of the Soviet air force on the ground, and German bombers attacked cities from Riga in the north to Odessa in the south.
The invasion had achieved a total strategic surprise. At first, Stalin and the Soviet High Command were in a state of denial. It was many hours before they accepted the reality of the situation and started issuing orders allowing local commanders to re-group and mount counterattacks. Their paralysis only added to the chaos and confusion of the Soviet units at the front. It looked as though Hitler’s confident prophesy to his generals was going to be realised: “You have only to kick in the door, and the whole rotten structure will come crashing down.”
​
But it didn’t. Four months later, the Soviets were still fighting tenaciously and the character of the war had changed. In sight of Moscow, the Axis blitzkrieg had run its course: a war of manoeuvre and mobility had become war of attrition; a bloody slog as autumnal rains heralded rasputitsa and roads became quagmires. The vision of a rapid victory envisaged by Hitler had vanished.

The historical outcome of Operation Barbarossa was the consequence of fateful decisions and extraneous events which conspired to produce a campaign unsurpassed in drama or scale. We hope Storm in the East: Operation Barbarossa does justice to History by presenting players with difficult strategic problems and choices which faced the Axis and Soviet High Commands, and to Reality by demonstrating that the historical result was only one of a number of equally plausible outcomes.

—description from the publisher

name: Hempels Sofa
description:
There's so much junk in Hempel's house! And right in the middle of it all is Hugo Hempel, who is making his way through the chaos.

In Hempels Sofa, the players try to help him reach the objects they are looking for. To do this, they need to keep track of things, have a good memory, and not step on each other's stuff. The first player to pick up four objects wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Alien
description:
10 of the most dangerous aliens in the galaxy have escaped from prison on Mars. And you as a bounty hunter, must capture them!

10 de los alíen más peligrosos de la galaxia se han escapado de la cárcel de Marte. ¡Y tu como cazarrecompensas, debes capturarlos!

name: Tenpenny Parks: Fast Pass Mini Expansion
description:
Improve your actions in Tenpenny Parks with the Fast Pass mini-expansion. The expansion includes rules and four fast pass tokens -- Arborist, Banker, Contractor and Realtor. Players gain a special bonus when placing their worker on a space featuring a fast pass token.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Income, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Fairy Ring
description:
A ray of moonlight shines in the clearing. The fairies wake up and stretch their wings. Mushrooms pop up from the ground, forming a circle. The first fireflies start to land. Magic is returning to the forest; now it's time to prepare for winter...

In Fairy Ring, you want to create a mushroom village to house the fairies in the clearing. Guide your fairy carefully, from village to village, through the fairy ring to gather as much mana as possible. You have two seasons to develop your village before winter begins. Each decision counts towards winning the game.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cultist Chaos
description:
Cultist Chaos is a card drafting game for 2-6 players. Each player leads their own cult and gains points by collecting magical items, gathering sacrifices, and summoning powerful deities to defeat their opponents.

It is a compact party game consisting of only cards, and only taking 15-25 minutes per round.

name: Paperopoli
description:
Paperopoli is an Italian boardgame published only to be given as a gift to subscribers of "Topolino" (the Walt Disney comic-book in Italy) in early '80.

It takes the movement system from Monopoly (roll and move on the square board). On every move, something may happen, like shares values going up or down (out of 6 possible types of commodities), starting a betting round that let players win or loose money, or opening the market to let players sell/buy stocks.

A kind of Monopoly somewhat less luck-based and stock market-oriented.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Zombie Plague: The Cellar
description:
The Cellar PDF expansion introduces an extra deck card and Board.

The Cellar is a relatively small stand alone board, which only has a single entry/exit point which may be barricaded. It also introduces a new Search Square, which must be searched to qualify for the 100% Search completion ruling.

Based on the cellar scene from Night of the Living Dead, The Cellar gives players the opportunity of a Safe haven or venturing into a deathtrap.

Expands:

Zombie Plague
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Print & Play, Zombies

name: Slavika: Zmora
description: Slavika: Zmora, a promotional card for Slavika that's available at Spiel 2012, features Zmora – "Bane" in English – a monster that does not count against the monster limit in a location.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Tholia One Expansion Pack
description:
Tholian starships are small starships of characteristic shape, utilized by the Tholian Assembly during the 23rd century. These vessels are armed with plasma torpedo-like weaponry, but their most powerful weapon is the so-called "Tholian web", which is "weaved" by two or more Tholian vessels around an enemy ship, trapping it. The web can then be contracted, destroying the vessel inside.

The Star Trek: Attack Wing – Tholia One Expansion Pack is the competitive prize for "The Tholian Web" episode during Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Defense Three Kingdoms
description:
Tower defense game themes of Three Kingdoms.

The player become a strategist of Shu. player need to defend player's country from the Wei and Wu army that appear one after another. Protect the base from which the enemy comes to attack, the player has to fight off the enemy if the country will have to decline.
Really, the player defeat all of the army, or will be able to pass through to protect the country?

name: De Treinrovers
description:
The game is played in two games. train robbers and police.
The train robbers have struck and gotten a large spoil of loot. Now they have to escape the police.

At the beginning the train robbers decide in which postbag the money is hidden and who is the chief robber. Out of that combination they make a secret codeword. Next to that they remove the clue card with the filled bag out of the pile of clue cards.

The police have to find the chief robber and the right postbag. they start on the police station on the board. The train robbers start with all the postbags on the railway bridge. They both move through the roll of the dice. The train robbers can seek refuge in their hideouts where they are safe from the police. Whoever steps onto one of the orange dots on the board can draw a clue card which can contain a clue for the police or an escape for the train robbers.

Whenever a policeman stops on a spot where there is a train robber he takes him straight to prison. There he can be interrogated. Each train robber can be asked only one question after being captured. The first captured robber gives up the codeword thus eliminating 2 of the 6 postbags and robbers. On each of the next arrests they can ask after one of the four traits with a does he have ...? yes/no question.

The police have 30 minutes to find the right robber and postbag otherwise the train robbers have escaped.

name: Speed Circuit: Grand Prix de Belgique
description:
Grand Prix de Belgique (Nivelles, Belgium). This is an official Avalon Hill expansion map for the Speed Circuit game. Also contains specifications for 1977 formula one cars to allow them to be used in Speed Circuit.

Was an insert in All Star Replay magazine Vol. 1, No. 2. The reverse side of the track sheet had the South African Grand Prix course.

This is an expansion for Speed Circuit.

name: Warhammer: Chariot Wars – A Supplement for Ancient Battles
description:
From the publisher:
Seven detailed lists cover the greatest empires of the ancient Middle East - 2500 BC to 500 BC: the age of chariot warfare.

Each list covers one of the following great empires and nations, including allies and opponents, historical background information, and descriptions of troop types:


Sumerian & Akkadian.
New Kingdom Egyptian.
Hammurabic Babylonia Empire.
Hittite Empire.
Mycenaean Greek and Trojan Armies.
The Israelites.
Assyrian Empire (including Babylonians).


Chariot Wars is also a source book of historical information for each army list, including detailed time lines of historical wars and campaigns which make use of controversial new research. There are also notes on tactics, painting, military organization, and color plates.

Expands:

Warhammer Ancient Battles
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Korsun Pocket 2: Little Stalingrad on the Dnepr
description:
This is Jack Radey's update of his original monster game of 1978. Two Soviet Fronts surround a German Army in the Ukraine and a ferocious battle takes place as the Germans try to break the encirclement and the Soviets seek to crush both the rescuers and the beleaguered troops in the Korsun Pocket.

Contents:
• 12 counter sheets of 200 die-cut backprinted counters each
• four 25 x 38 inch game maps
• six German Order of Battle Charts — III Panzer Corps, VII Corps, VIII Flieger Corps, XI Corps, XLII Corps, XLVII Panzer Corps
• ten Soviet Order of Battle Charts — 1st Ukrainian Front, 2nd Ukrainian Front, 5th Guards Tank Army, 2nd Tank Army, 6th Tank Army, 4th Guards Army, 27th Army, 40th Army, 52nd Army, 53rd Army
• one 24-page Rules Booklet
• one Scenarios Booklet
• one Commentary, History, and Designer’s Notes Booklet
• two double-sided 22 x 34 situation maps (25 January, 1 February, 10 February, one blank for planning purposes)
• two 11 x 17 player turn record track cards
• two player chart and aids cards
• one six sided die
• box

(from the Pacific Rim Publishing web site)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: World Powers
description:
"Card, Bidding, and Stock Ownership Game for 2-6+ players."

"Each player is a large Multinational Corporation.
Players invest in different World Powers."

"World Powers represent Nations and whole Regions.
There are 9 different World Powers players can invest in."

"The basic monetary unit is the Treasury Token. The player with the most Treasury Tokens at the end of the game is the winner."

name: Colonial Adventures!  Fortunes Won & Lost
description:
From the website....

"Zanzibar!

Just saying the word makes you think of far off places and high adventure. Okay, maybe not so much if you’re a Poor Bloody Infantryman but for an Officer and a Gentleman the “Age of Imperialism” (1850 – 1914) was the best of times.
A time where young men could garner fame and fortune in dark and dangerous lands. A time where heroes could be made in a day. And a time where death could come swiftly and from unexpected places.

Colonial Adventures allows you to recreate these “dirty little wars” of European expansion on the tabletop. Refight the heroic stand at Rourke’s Drift or try and change the result at Isandhlwana. But it isn’t just about the British and Zulus. It’s also about the French Foreign Legion, Berber horsemen, Imperial German forces, Masai warriors, the Russian army, Pathan tribesmen, and much more.

Whether you’re an experienced Colonials player or a novice just starting the period, Colonial Adventures is right for you. Here’s just a few reasons why.


In the book you’ll find over a dozen armies to choose from and another twenty online.



We’ve included “open ended” scenarios to fight new and unique battles every time you use them.



You can play solo, all on the same side against the game, or head to head.



We provide online support to answer any questions you may have as they come up and usually in less than 24 hours.


So have a seat, grab a spot of tea, and get ready for hours of fun. Welcome to the world of ...

Colonial Adventures!"

These miniatures rules are available in print and PDF.

name: Elfenland: Back to the Roads
description:
Special printing for "Stadt-Land-Spielt" (German parlour games day) 2013.

This expansion to Elfenland adds magic spells and sea monsters.

The sea monster is an obstacle on a river or a ferry route. The magic spell "double transport" allows for a second means of transport. "Change" lets you exchange two means of transport.

Contained in the 1999 edition of Elfengold.
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Adapt3
description:
Adapt3 is a variant of Adaptoid for exactly three players.

In Adaptoid, Black was both White's prey and White's hunter, but in Adapt3 these roles are separated! Each player now has two opponents, but only one of them is his prey: White hunts Red; Red hunts Black; and Black hunts White. This means that the next player in turn is your hunter.

Gameplay is the same as in Adaptoid with some minor clarifications.

name: Peloponnes: Sikyon
description:
Peloponnes: Sikyon is a promotional civilization tile (number 14).

Sikyon starts with 9 coins, 9 food, and 3 inhabitants. Its special function is protection against Tempest. During income, Sikyon gains 1 food but loses 1 wood and 1 stone.

Sikyon has also been included in the Peloponnes: Heroes and Colonies expansion.
categories: Ancient, City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game

name: Donner Party
description:
In 1846, the Donner Party got snowbound in the High Sierras. Only half survived the winter. Who will you eat to be one of them?

Each player has a family of settlers (color coded), and a few hirelings or settlers outside that family. While individually named, all of these actually represent several people (you are not playing all 81 settlers).

You get points for each settler you have alive at the end of the game, with bonus points for healthy settlers, oldest settler, youngest settler and an intact family. Things you do in the game cause you to accumulate "Shame", which are cards with random values that you draw but do not look at, and whoever has the highest Shame at the end of the game loses, regardless of their score.

Play proceeds in rounds, moving through a chronologically stacked Forage deck that represents the winter of 1846. Each round a player has a personal forage step, and then there is a group forage step. In the latter, players bid to acquire extra food and the bid is how much Shame they are willing to draw to get that food. The number of group forage cards available in a turn is always less than the number of players, so someone gets left out every time. Additionally one of the group forage cards is dealt face-down, so you do not know what it is. Ties in bidding are broken by the party leader, a role which rotates around the table. Players who do not get a forage card in the group step get to draw an Action card instead.

Then, everyone feeds their settlers, with weakened settlers costing less food than healthy ones. But weakened ones also do not forage as well. Losses from hunger have to follow a few simple rules, like none of your settlers can starve to death until all of them are weakened.

In addition to forage, there are action cards that players can acquire through the foraging process. These are the nasty things like murder and grave robbing and such. These can be played at any time and generally give you food, but unlike Forage cards, have an inherent Shame cost to play them.

This process continues until either the Forage deck empties or the "final rescue" card is drawn during March 1847. Since some cards are randomly removed from each game before play, you never know exactly when the game will end or what the weather will be and thus cannot plan for it.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Push Your Luck

name: Arte de Batalla
description:
Art of Battle is a quick confrontation between two Strategists. Each one will choose two Heroes with different abilities, and those Hreoes will lead an army to achieve the objective: To defeat the opponent's Heroes. In addition to being able to select these magical characters, they will decide how to conform the army that will join them, being able to choose between Warriors, Lancers, Archers, Crossbowmen and Horses.
Before starting the bout, they will have the freedom to secretly design their own terrains, making each game a different game.
But it is not under control: chance will take care of the displacement of the troops and the resources of each strategist: these will play a fundamental role at the moment the battle is unleashed.

Español:

Arte de Batalla consiste en un enfrentamiento rápido entre dos Estrategas. Cada uno elegirá a dos Héroes con distintas habilidades, los cuales encabezarán un ejército para lograr el objetivo: Derrotar a los Héroes del oponente. Además de poder seleccionar a estos mágicos personajes, decidirán cómo se conformará el ejército que los acompañará, pudiendo optar entre Guerreros, Lanceros, Arqueros, Ballesteros y Caballos.
Antes de comenzar el combate tendrán la libertad de diseñar en secreto sus propios terrenos, haciendo de cada partida un juego diferente.
Pero no odo está bajo control: el azar se encargará del desplazamiento de las tropas y los recursos de cada estratega, que jugarán un papel fundamental en el momento en que se desate la batalla.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Fantasy, Medieval, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Stronghold (2nd edition): The Great Shaman
description:
The Great Goblin Shaman joins the siege.
Move into the world of ghosts, resurrect the dead, use their powers, and watch the stronghold fall. This unique add-on will allow the attacker use dead bodies to play black magic, creating new monster and poison.

The invader, instead of rejecting killed units, assigns them to selected shamanic magic effects. This way he gains new opportunities to influence the situation on the board.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Fate of the Elder Gods: Beasts From Beyond – Ghoul
description:
Promotional monster given to Kickstarter backers and handed out at Gencon 2017.

When an Artifact card is placed on the bottom of the Artifact deck, you may discard a token from the Ghoul to draw the bottom 2 cards of the Artifact deck and take 1. The other Artifact card is removed from the game.

(From Kickstarter Update #36:)

About Cult Cards, Azathoth, and the Promotional Monsters

[...] As for the Shan and Ghoul promo cards, there are not associated miniatures for these cards (although we’ve joked that the Shan is included in the Beasts From Beyond box, it’s just too small to see!). These can be included in any game that uses the Monsters from BfB.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Unstable Unicorns: Cosplay Unicorn Promo Card
description: The Cosplay Unicorn is the TeeTurtle promo card for the 2018 convention season.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Geode
description:
Geode is a competitive tile-laying game to create four-part geodes that yield scoring opportunities at game end.

It is 1922 and the Geologists Society of Europa has been sent to explore the deepest recesses of newly discovered Gelogia, a country rich in minerals and gemstones.

Each turn you will place a tile on the grid to try to to create a complete geode out of four matching coloured tiles. Each geode you unlock gives you a choice of three score markers, each with a chance to grant Victory Points at the end of the game.

—description from the designer

name: Thieves Den: Wizard's Tower Promo Card
description:
This promo provides a new location card to the game.

This promo comes with two copies of the location card and a rules card. In a 2-player game, only use the card with the moon icon. In games with 3+ players, use both cards.

The location's ability is: pay 1 thief to gain two wild treasures.

This card introduces a new location type--Wild location. This location can represent any of the other five location types. The location type chosen is selected at the end of the game.

This promo was available in Game Trade Magazine #234 (August 2019).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Worker Placement
publishers: Daily Magic Games, W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH

name: Unstable Unicorns: Steampunk Unicorn Promo Card
description:
Released in November 2019 at convention Booths for the 2020 year reward. Card is printed in the 2nd Edition style.

Card text:
Magical Unicorn card
When this card enters your Stable, you may bring an Upgrade card from your hand directly into your Stable.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Ultimatch
description:
Cooperate to match cards and make your way up the pyramid as a team in this exciting, colorful, addictive game. Make clever matches by number or color. Will you use 1 card or 2? Addition or subtraction? Mix colors (yellow + blue = green)? Will you risk a card now or save it for later? Can you guess what card the other player needs? Make a perfect match of both number and color to feel the thrill and gain the rewards of an Ultimatch!

Ultimatch includes both public and private cards and requires the kind of clever decision making about when to use cards that seasoned card players enjoy. Silently trading 1 card facedown with 1 other player keeps all players engaged throughout, introduces a push-your-luck element, and calls on players to read each other. Will you risk trading a card with another player? If so, who is likely to know what you need? Is your card better to keep for later use? The thinking goes quickly as do the turns. Every match is a mini-win, and win or lose, players keep coming back for more.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Matching, Trading

name: Trick & Snipers
description:
You can't win just by taking tricks!

The ‘7’ super card is covered in gold foil.

A very simple trick-taking game with special win conditions such as ‘Taking the 7’ or ‘Make 13 by playing another suit’.

In this game you must-follow the lead suit. Tricks are won face down (not worth any points), or face up (worth 1 point) if the trick is won by a special win (including a 7 or adds up to 13 if suit wasn't followed).

The winner is the one who achieves two points first wins face down!

There are two conditions for special wins: taking a seven, and having a card in a different suit that adds up to 13 against the maximum card in the lead suit.

Game includes English rules

name: Warmachine: High Command – Invasion of Sul
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In the year 606 AR, the Sul-Caspia War began with Cygnaran forces laying siege to the Menite stronghold of Sul, the City of Walls. What followed was a brutal, protracted war of street-to-street battles that ended with devastating losses for both sides. The commanders of this momentous campaign shaped the history of the Iron Kingdoms. How will you fare in their place?

Customize your deck with powerful new cards and take command of the pivotal events of this historic war in the Invasion of Sul campaign expansion. Recreate one of the wars that changed the face of the Iron Kingdoms, and rewrite history!

Invasion of Sul is the fourth expansion for Warmachine: High Command and the first "Campaign" expansion.

Requires Warmachine: High Command core set to play.

name: Immortals: Queenie 1 – New Tribes
description:
Immortals: Queenie 1 – New Tribes is a mini-expansion that adds two additional tribe choices to the Immortals base game: Reptiles from the Dark Realm and Gnomes from the Light Realm.

To use them, mix the new tribe tokens with the tribe tokens of the base game.

name: Federation & Empire: F & E Module 1 – Special Operations
description:
Special Operations includes Statis Field Generators, Electronic Warfare, Light Tugs & Tug Pods, and Auxiliary Carriers.

Two scenarios are included - Koval's Lighning and Thunder Over Kzintai.

16-page rules folder, 4 new fleet charts, 2 set-up charts, 324 die-cut counters, and special scenario mini map.

Expands:

Federation & Empire
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: SuperFooty Table Soccer
description:
SuperFooty Table Soccer is similar to the classic Subbuteo table-top soccer game. It is played on a large cloth playing field, with teams of players that are represented by miniature men mounted on smooth round bases. The figures are made to kick the ball by flicking their bases, which causes the figures to slide around on the pitch, hitting the ball. The rules simulate nearly all details of a soccer game including ball possession and passing, throw-ins, goal kicks and corner kicks.

The SuperFooty Classic Edition contains the cloth playing field, two complete teams (10 outfielders and 1 goalkeeper, each), two goals with nets, two balls, and instructions. Figures are hand painted in the colors of Argentina, Brazil, England, or Italy.

From the game insert:

SuperFooty is a skillful and exciting table soccer game for two players. Great technique, clever tactics and quick thinking make for the closest simulation of real soccer around!

SuperFooty is for friends, for families, and for the most passionate there are National and World Championships for boys, girls, men, and women.

Are you up to the challenge?

name: Goblins vs Gnomes
description:
Goblins vs Gnomes game takes you into a fantastic world where two small but very stubborn nations are fighting for possession of the treasure! Gnomes mine gold with solid picks and indomitable character, the Goblins are unique seekers, brilliant designers, and pranksters.

This is a roadbuilding board game with roles. Players before the game choose a character - a Goblin or Gnome - and pave the way for gold or the dragon using tiles with tunnels.

The whole match is held in a climate of mutual suspicion since there is a place for bluffing and for hidden scamps. However, the game is extremely fun, hilarious, tastefully and stylishly designed. Furthermore, the short matches and simple rules have made it a hit among friends and family get-together events.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Role Playing, Tile Placement, Traitor Game

name: Objective Munich: 7 Days to the Rhine, Volume 2
description:
Objective Munich: 7 Days to the Rhine, Volume 2 is a two-player alternative history wargame intended to investigate the operational parameters that would have been in place during the first four days of fighting in that border area of West Germany had the Soviet Union decided to try to attack sometime in the early 1980s. It was during that timeframe the Warsaw Pact achieved a possible decisive “correlation of forces” between their militaries and those of the West.

This game is the second volume of the AFCENT (Allied Forces Central Europe) Series. Each single-volume game uses the same system and will be playable alone or mated to other games in the series. Each hexagon on the map represents 2.5 miles (four kilometers) from side to opposite side. The Warsaw Pact regiments, while the units of maneuver on the NATO side are battalions. Air power and electronic warfare counters and rules abstractly represent, the effects of one side or the other gaining temporary superiority within those sub-realms of conflict. Each day of real time consists of one nighttime and two daylight turns.

Components: One 22" x 34" map on one sheet & 280 counters
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Zone of Control

name: Dead Apocalypse
description:
Dead Apocalypse is one of the first fully cooperative deckbuilding games of strategic survival, set during a present day zombie apocalypse. Staying alive is your only goal in this game, and you must work with your allies to search for human survivors, abandoned locations, and lifesaving equipment to fend off the zombie horde. Teamwork is the key to victory, for if you can't trust your fellow players none of you will reach the CDC... alive!

Dead Apocalypse is a fully cooperative deckbuilding game, meaning all players strive for the same goal and either win together or lose together. Players will begin the game with the same starting decks consisting of a handful of survivors, a base camp location and some equipment. Players will take turns playing their hand to gain damage, occupy locations, use abilities and cure infections. Gaining damage allows the player to defeat ghastly Zombies who are protecting invaluable equipment, or surrounding a location, or even trapping other survivors. Once a Zombie is defeated, add the resources to your personal deck to be used for another turn. Though don't think Zombies will go down without a fight. The Zombie stack of cards holds surprise attack events which will force a player to have to defeat Zombies that match the type of event. If a player does not have the sufficient resources to defeat all Zombies, other players have the opportunity to assist in combat to help even the odds!

Dead Apocalypse is 1-4 players so if there isn't someone in your company you still have the opportunity to try to fight for survival all alone. Don't fret though because there are other game variants for those seeking an easier game or a more competitive game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Air Power
description: Miniatures rules designed to simulate aerial combat during World War II. For two or more players. Statistics are given for over 100 aircraft.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Buena Vista
description:
Sub-title is "The Battle for Northern Mexico, February 22-23, 1847" with Artwork by Mark Simonitch & Stuart Rose, as well as assistance from Mark Miller, Gary Miller, & Mark May.

The Game is contained in a Ziploc "Baggie" with a 22x34" 7-Color mapsheet, 100-Glossy Color Cardboard Counters, a Large Rules Booklet, 2-Casualty & Ammo Record sheets with a reduced planning mapsheet printed on the reverse(1 for EACH Player) while it is suggested that copies be made of these, and Players will need to provide their OWN writing utensils & ORDERS paper as well as at least (1)-10-sided DIE.

The mapsheet is primarily TAN & Light TAN overall, with Light BLUE & BLUE water features, RED Road lines, GRAY Slope hexsides, Gullies, & Higher Levels, and BLACK print for "the Narrows" & Buena Vista buildings. Included on the mapsheet are: the Game Turn Track; Terrain Effects Chart; a 4-Part Impulse Track; the "Mountain BOX"; the "Saltillo BOX"; 2-Gun Fire Tables(Case & Ball); a Small Arms Fire Table; a Fire Value Modifiers Table; and a Morale Modifiers Table.

The game Counters are GREEN with large WHITE Unit Symbols and BLACK print for the Mexicans & BLUE with large WHITE Unit Symbols and BLACK print for the Americans. There are also informational counters in both GREEN & BLUE colors as well as WHITE with BLACK print.

The scale of the game is 90 yards across for each hex, a Strength Point represents 25 Men or 1 Gun, and a Turn equals 20 Minutes split into (4)-5 minute impulses. A Game Turn Sequence consists of the following: 1.RAIN phase(only on Turns 27 through 31); 2.1st Impulse-a)Reinforcement phase, b)Command phase, c)Cavalry Charge Initiation phase, d)Tactical Movement phase, e)Charge phase, f)Simultaneous Fire phase, g)Shock phase followed by 3 MORE similar Impulses as the latter detailed previously. Once the 4 Impulses are completed, then there is a Strategic Movement phase, a Rally phase, and a Mountain Skirmish phase rounding out the Turn. It is during the Command phase that Players will write out and conduct activation of their Orders, which require a certain number of Impulses before they arrive at their intended destinations.

The Rules go into details such as Sighting, Force Marching, Multi-hex Units(line extension), Stacking, Facing, Formations, detaching Rifle Companies(U.S. only), Attacking in the Mountain & Saltillo Boxes, Casualty marking, Ammunition depletion, Routing, Rallying, Special Rules such as RAIN, Mexican Units besieging Saltillo and their conditional release as well as the American's Forces there, Optional Units, and Resupplied Mexican Forces continuing the battle beyond the "actual" time limits. There are 2 Scenarios: 1.February 23, 1847 starting turn 10 to turn 40; & 2.February 22 & 23, 1847--40 turns long beginning with turn 1. An extensive Historical Notes is written up accompanying this with Bibliography & designer's notes and an Example of play with commentary.

This appears to be another attempt at introducing a "miniatures" based concepts & game mechanics into a conventional cardboard counters game. Although the thought processes involved are more adept at producing the desired effects of delayed Orders implementation than some previous games, only devoted wargamers could adequately appreciate this facet of play. This is definitely NOT for the casual wargamer, but more for the dedicated Historical "feel" for the era enthusiast.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Verdun: The Game of Attrition
description:
Verdun: The Game of Attrition by acclaimed designer John Hill is the first limited edition DTP title from Cool Stuff, and represents a true upgrade to this classic Conflict Games release. Verdun is limited to 100 hand-numbered copies only.

The game comes in a plastic bag with a full graphic makeover highlights this release, including a new map and two new player aid cards. The more-than-full-color map has been enlarged from its previous 16x20" size to a full 22x34" (in four sections). Four sheets of mount-them-yourself counters (totals 2 double-sided sheets; mounting boards included) and a six page rulebook round out the package. Numerous tracks and markers lacking in the first edition have been included and the counters have been made double-sided at last.

name: TurboFire
description:
This is the first of the AutoVentures published, a series of auto-combat adventure modules by Aaron Allston.

This module provides a rich setting for Grand Prix racing in the year 2012 suitable for use with Battlecars, Car Wars and Highway 2000. Sample characters, motives and plot ideas are included, allowing for the easy add on of role-playing elements.

Included are a map of the racetrack and surrounding area, maneuvering charts for Car Wars and Battlecars (for the high top speeds) color counters and the game booklet itself.

The book has several pages on general background of 2012 and racing in this environment. Full details for eight countries worth of racing cars (with stats for each game system) are included. Extra rules include those for traveling at high speeds and details for equipment to use. Finally there are guidelines for converting between the three game systems.

Playing out an entire race in the scale of these games would be tedious an boring. Therefore TurboFire provides a framework to play out the race in a general sense – abstracting the race itself so players only need to drop into regular game scale for skirmishes that occur as cars near each other.

This item also exists as a rpg entry: TurboFire
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Racing, Science Fiction, Sports, Transportation, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Simulation

name: SuperSystem
description:
From publishers website:

SuperSystem (S2) is a fast-paced, skirmish-scale superhero miniatures battle game designed to simulate comic book clashes between heroes and villains. Playing a game with SuperSystem requires the following: a copy of these rules, painted miniatures, around 20 six-sided dice, copies of the SuperSheets, pencils, and a roughly 4' x 4' playing area. SuperSystem can be played with 2 or more players, but works best with 2 - 4 participants.
categories: Book, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Warship Commander 1967-1997: Present Day Tactical Naval Combat Revised and Updated
description: Sub-titled: "Present Day Tactical Naval Combat". Beginning with an excellent introduction about the evolution of 'Ships' from the "Post WW-2" era up until the 'present'-(circa 1979), and with some possible 'future' contingents. This is a set of RULES for use in conjunction with "Modern Naval Miniatures"(or 'counters') up to a scale of '1/1200th'-although others can be adapted for use as well. This is slightly larger than the norm-('11'&-3/4 by '8'&-1/2) sized "Rulebook" compilation, of 70-pages in length, with a 'slick'-cover for the contents. There is a 'section' which details just what will be required to enable any "playings" for this. Interspersed within the "Rules" are some "Tables" for comparison & explanations, with 'examples' also being shown. From page '42' and on, there are various "Charts", "Tables", the "Tactical Data Display"-sheet 'example' provided, the 'Bibliography', "Designer's Notes", with the "Table of Contents" on the last back '2'-pages for this. The scale given is '1'-vessel per 'mini' OR "counter", '2'-minutes per Turn, '1'-inch = 2,000 yds(m)-can also be scaled where more room is permitted.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Math Magic 2
description:
Math Magic 2

The challenge continues - The same rules and strategies apply as in the original Math Magic™ but the challenge continues with Square Values, Cubes, Square Roots, Cube Roots and Joker Tiles.

name: Down with the Empire
description:
From the publisher:

Down with the Empire is a game that uses a common theme of science-fiction sagas: A Stellar Empire that has gone rotten, and a rebellion that rises to bring it down. It is primarily a two-player game, although it is possible to have more than one player per side by dividing forces or tasks. The game can also be played solitaire. The game system is inspired in the old Freedom in the Galaxy game from SPI.

There are two major factions in the game, each controlled by a player. The Stellar Empire owns everything at start, and strives to maintain the status quo through its military might. The Rebel Concordance player owns nothing but a few characters and spaceships at start, but by causing unrest and rebellion throughout the Empire, he hopes to get resources that will allow him or her eventually to meet the Empire on equal terms.

The game presents you with action at very different scopes. First, you have to administer 50+ planets on a grand-strategic scale, with social, economic and political aspects that are tightly intertwined and can be handled in very different styles.

Then you will be in charge of large military units; starfleets formed by individual starships ranging from tiny fighters to mammoth battlestars, and ground units (legions, brigades and divisions) to slug it out on planet surfaces. War in space is a very complex affair, since you can't establish battle lines or prevent the enemy from hyperjumping to any location on the map… He who defends everything defends nothing, goes the maxim, and quick response is the key to victory.

Finally, the heart and soul of DWTE are the individual characters. As in all great space adventures, the huge starships may bumble about, but they do not determine the fate of the rebellion saga as much as the astounding contributions of a handful of heroes. The characters perform missions through which they hope to sway the people to join and support their cause, undermine the plans of the enemy and further their own side's goals. During the missions characters face all sorts of dangers, including firefights with lasers blazing against enemy soldiers or monsters, cantina brawls with unruly civilians, getting lost in wormholes, or such everyday occurrences as meteorites falling on your head!

Key Points:
A grand-scale science-fiction strategy game, which at the same time has a very detailed combat system with individual spaceships and ground military units, and a role-playing aspect with individual characters performing heroic deeds.

The wide variety of events in the game and the ramifications derived from players' choices and styles of play ensure that no two games will play alike.

It is a large game with a moderately high level of complexity, but once the rules are learned the game itself flows easily and the on-map counter density is not high.

Component List:
Full-color Stellar map
Full-color Rebel and Imperial Starfleet Displays
Over 1,400 counters
Over 200 Character, Item and Stellar Event cards
4 sheets of Charts and Tables
Campaign Scenario
108 page Rules manual
20-, 10- and 6-sided dice (not provided) are necessary for the PDF version of the game

Target Audience:
DWTE appeals especially to SF-buffs with an interest in space adventures and sagas, although its fascinating game system will be interesting and challenging for any gamer. The rules are written in a clear language with extensive explanations and examples of play. They have a logical, easily-referenced order and should not present any special difficulty even for inexperienced players.

Game Formats:
Virtual Tabletop
PDF Download

What is a Virtual Tabletop Game?
Our line of Virtual Tabletop games are powered by the Vassal Engine.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Political, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Ragadorn Alehouse Brawl
description:
Ale-House Brawl was included in the Magnamund Companion, an encyclopedia about the world of Lone Wolf by Joe Dever. It is a turn-based boardgame that also can be played as a simple role playing game. The game takes place in a tavern where ten characters attempt to complete given objectives, usually to kill some other character. The game looks rather simple, it includes rules for combat and movement, but can often produce absurd and very entertaining situations.

The game was re-published in Roleplayer Independent (Volume 1, Issue 12 - Nov 1993).

The game can now be downloaded for free from Project Aon.
publishers: (Unknown), (Web published), Beaver Books, Symbiosis Publishing Ltd

name: Oilboom
description:
Translated from the box in Norwegian:

Six oilbillionaires from six differnet corners of the world gather around a table to once and for all decide who is the better finacial genious amongst them. By the table there are som chairs left for you and some friends. If you accept the challenge, you receive a start up capital of 200 million oildollars and if you invest them celverly, you might be the one who runs away with the title of the world's wealthiest oilbaron.

In this game there are lots of possibilities: You may bet your money on the Stavanger oil exchange, drill for oil with cowboys from Texas, rise up through an old shipyard in Nordmøre or simply gamble on rock solid Arabian drill experience.

The choice is yours. But, remember that for an aspiring financial genious there are lots of dangers lurking. The dream of easy money at the game's casino might end in ruin. A fictious hotel chain is ready to set you up, and decreasing stock values may drag you under.

But these minor details don't naturally, worry you. You are a financial genious and know how to stay away from such issues.

...so what are you waiting for? Find your place at the table! The rumour has it that a new

OILBOOM!

is about to flood the finance market.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Meld
description:
Meld takes place in ancient Macedonia, with one player representing the invading Goth culture from the north, while the other player represents the entrenched Macedonia culture. Both players look to expand their holdings, spread their culture, and strengthen their military forces.

Meld is an abstract game that mixes in an economic/resource managment element. The game features a modular board, so no two game boards are every quite the same. Couple that with variable win conditions, and you have the makings for a unique experience each time Meld gets to the table.

This is the first Edition of Meld, and is presented in a portable Small Box Games' box, and each of the 25 available copies are signed and numbered.

http://www.smallboxgames.com/meld.html

name: Adventures in Jimland
description:
Where anything can happen.

Standalone adventure game of strategy, about exploration and discovery in an unknown land. The game resembles somewhat the venerable Source of the Nile inasmuch as the player makes discoveries (plants, animal life, mapping uncharted territory) and must return back to civilization to cash in.

Game requires some means of marking terrain, Also, each player will require one D10, a D6 and a D3 (extrapolated from a D6). A blank map and an expedition roster are provided and those may be reproduced.

name: Aces & Eights: Shattered Frontiers – Showdown
description:
From the book:

This amazing supplement provides rules for any roleplaying or tabletop simulation of a Wild West shootout, and is both incredibly realistic and easy to use. As well as including a special Shot Clock combat simulator and Silhouette for fast and accurate shooting - where even a near miss can be deadly - Aces & Eights: Showdown provides both basic and advanced fighting and brawling rules. Whether you prefer a quick duel in the streets or a massive gun battle raging through town, this is one western book you can't afford to miss!
mechanics: Role Playing, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Spies&Spooks: The Cold War Edition
description:
Set in the 1980's, Spies&Spooks is a spy-themed strategy card game in which each player secretly assumes the role of one of eight spy characters. Each player also receives one of eight coded Assignments, which is decoded in the spy's Passport. The combination of the Secret Assignment with the Secret Identity determines how each player can win the game.
Secret Assignments are to gather specific Secret Cards (ie. Missile Secrets, Political Secrets, Computer Secrets, Trade Secrets etc) and smuggle them out of each game by combining them with various Smuggle Cards (Dead Drop, Diplomatic Pouch, Radio Transmission). Assignments carry varying rewards based upon their difficulty.
Depending on their Secret Identity traits, spies may also steal cards from each other, set bombs as traps, kill each other with Dagger Cards, expose other spies identities and/or assignments, or place them in detention in attempting to be the first spy to complete his or her Secret Mission.
Due to the many various combinations of Identities with Assignments, the game is constantly presenting new and different possibilities for players and has great replay value.
A player wins the game by being the first spy to complete his or her Secret Mission. Multiple hands can be played successively, constituting the Great Game.
Source: Publisher Statement
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Political, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Role Playing

name: Loop
description:
Loop is a semi-cooperative abstract strategy game for up to six players or teams.

Play involves laying cards to build colored loops, with longer loops worth more points at the end of the game. Players accrue victory points for loops of certain colors, so building a red loop, for example, will gain either single, double, or no points for each player.

Each player has their own hidden agenda - even though they will naturally work together to build a loop, each of their six Victory condition cards is different, awarding different multipliers for each color. Each loop you help to build will gain points for other players too, so some network blocking/redirecting strategy will be needed to make sure you come out on top.

Suggestions are included for team play and for family gaming.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Team-Based Game

name: Confrontation: Wolfen Army Book
description:
From the back cover,

"The Army Book: Wolfen is a supplement for Confrontation: the Age of Rag'narok. It contains everything you need to play with or battle against the sedentary packs (Wolf)"
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: 221B Baker Street: The Master Detective Game – Set #6
description:
An additional set of cases for 221b Baker Street. This package comprises cases #101-120 and includes case cards, a clue and answer book, and solution checklist.

101. The Adventure of the Alphabet Spy
102. The Adventure of the Mockingham Maze
103. The Adventure of the Errant Ear
104. The Adventure of the Vanishing Virgins
105. The Adventure of the Palace Wing
106. The Adventure of the Claustrophobic Cleric
107. The Adventure of the Mysterious Skull
108. The Adventure of the Christmas Carol
109. The Adventure of the Queensbury Quandry
110. The Adventure of the Musical Murder
111. The Adventure of the Hygienic Hermit
112. The Adventure of the Whispering Wall
113. The Adventure of the Cryptic Criminals
114. The Adventure of the French Confection
115. The Adventure of the Whimpering Waif
116. The Adventure of the Mathematician's Murder
117. The Adventure of the Pirated Pigeons
118. The Adventure of the Cadbury Runestone Part 1
119. The Adventure of the Cadbury Runestone Part 2
120. The Adventure of the Broken Bobbies
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based

name: Detective Graves Against The Mastermind
description:
In this two player deduction, trick-taking card game players take it in turns to play Detective Graves and the Mysterious Mastermind who is planning to commit the crime of the century. Detective Graves must uncover the clues that will lead to the elimination of suspects and reveal the identity of the mastermind behind the plot.

Game play takes place over five locations, players take it in turns to play cards from five different suits and after a certain number of turns in a location the player with the highest score wins, either providing a clue towards the identity of the Mastermind (points for the Detective Player) or resulting in that particular piece of evidence being lost forever (Points for the Mastermind player). Some cards may also be used for special abilities, but they often must be discarded to achieve this.

The game is played over two sets, each player taking one turn as Detective Graves and one as The Mastermind. Points are scored for collecting/protecting evidence and correctly deducing who the Mastermind is. The player with the highest score at the end of the two sets is the winner!

All files are available in the file section. There are tokens that can be printed out in the Gallery.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Midsummer
description:
Hamlet, Romeo & Juliet, Macbeth, Prospero and other mortals have strayed into the forest on Midsummer night. The Summer and Winter Courts of Faeries are hunting the mortals to feed on their passions and emotions, whilst hidden by glamour. However, the Fair Ones do not agree who gets to play with each mortal.

Midsummer is a game of hidden roles, intrigue and auctions for 4 to 9 players. It takes 30 to 60 minutes to play.

Each turn the faerie players compete to hunt a mortal from the one of Shakespeare's plays, then auction the mortal off to the other faeries for favours. At the break of day, faeries score points based on the emotions of the mortals they have claimed. The objective is for the court you are in to score the most points at the end.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Mythology, Party Game

name: Cap de Colla
description:
Cap de colla és un joc de taula de cartes i daus que representa i difon la cultura castellera d’una forma divertida, dinàmica i enginyosa.

Cap de colla is a boardgame that uses cards and dice to spread the human towers culture in a funny, dynamic and clever way.

The purpose of the game is scoring the most points by doing human towers typical of catalan culture. The game is played in five regular rounds plus a column round. Each regular round is divided in two phases.

In first phase, called "assaig" (something like "erzatz"), cards are dealed and traded until most players have assembled enought cards to build a human tower.

Then a new phase called "a plaça" (literally "to the square", but it means performing), each player must perform the towers by using the dice : thay have to roll over difficulty of their tower to build the tower, and if the tower is succeful, they score a "trial" token and can try to "unbuild" the tower. The trial tokens earned in past rounds can be exchanged for rerolls. Each round has a scoring process : first player to complete a tower, succesful builds and unbuilds score points according with the difficulty of the tower. After the five regular rounds are played, players can try to build human columns (called "pilars") with excess trial tokens and score points according to column difficulty.

The player that scores most points, adding score of all rounds is the winner.

name: Flag Dash: Deluxe Upgrade Pack
description:
The Flag Dash: Deluxe Upgrade Pack adds four limited-edition characters & upgrades your pieces for Flag Dash. Shake up the board with the Pool Shark's break shot, retrieve the flag with the Writer's pet monkey, and more!

NOTE: For some weird reason, the expansion cards are 0.5cm narrower and slightly darker than the base game cards.
mechanics: Action Queue, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: '65: Action Card Expansion
description: Action Card expansion! A 9-card Action Card set with unique Action Cards, such as Double Strike, Sneak, and Tactics. These cards will expand the standard deck with abilities unique to the opposing forces NVA/VC or United States.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Obscenity: A Shameless Adult Party Game
description:
Obscenity is a shameless adult party game where you play in teams against the clock to describe or act out as many dirty phrases as you can without repeating any of the words on the cards.

It's a simple, fast-paced game which will make you laugh so hard it's quite possible a little bit of wee will come out.

The game contains 924 naughty words and phrases, many of which you should already know. Your less innocent friends and / or the power of the internet will help you to discover the meanings of the rest.

Each box of Obscenity includes 308 cards, a 60 second sand timer and game rules.

Obscenity can also be played as a drinking game and the drinking rules are included with the game.

Due to the naughty nature of the game, we recommend that it's played by people who are 17+ years of age.

name: Egghead
description: A tense and exciting general knowledge game for two or more players, aged 7 and above.

name: Time of Legends: Joan of Arc – Sam the Blacksmith Promo Card
description: Originally available for backers of The Dice Tower Kickstarter 2019.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Religious, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Fairy, Unicorn, Mermaid, Princess, Kitten
description:
Fairy, Unicorn, Mermaid, Princess, Kitten (F.U.M.P.K) is a game in the style of the family classic “go Fish”.

F.U.M.P.K combines a crowd-pleasing theme with A colourful design featuring art from renowned Kawaii artist “birduyen”.

This card game for 2 - 6 people is easy to teach, fun to play and delivers a satisfying twist to the classic set collection format.

Play time is around 15 minutes and is accessible for players aged 6 and up.

Each player plays their turn in order which is made up of the Action Phase and the Build Phase.

In the Action Phase, players will try to increase the amount of cards in their hand. To do this they have a number of options: name a card that they want and ask a player to hand it over, if that player has it in their hand they must give it up. They may draw a card, either from the Draw deck or the top card of the face up Trade pile, or they may choose to discard a princess in their hand onto the Trade pile and draw cards equal to the vale of the princess they discarded.

In a Players Build Phase, they will try to play a set, featuring a princess card, and enough follower cards to match the symbols on the princess card. They may only play one set per turn, it they do, they are rewarded with a card from the Draw deck. Each princess card has a value from 2 - 4, the first player to play 12 points worth of princess sets wins the game.

-description from designer

name: Call of Katulhu
description:
A head to head 2 player game to attract the most cats to play with you by utilizing your cat toys the most effectively.

Players will have a selection of various cats each round to battle over with matching hands of 6 classic cat toys. Each unique cat requires certain toys in a specific order for them to be attracted to play. But be aware that your opponent can thwart your plans to attract cats by removing your toys before you get to use them. Do you go all out trying to attract higher point scoring cats or do you go for a cheaper one allowing you to play defense? Winning this game depends on how well you can read your opponent and recognize patterns that will be constantly changing. Think Rock-Paper-Scissors meets Chess.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Matching, Pattern Recognition, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dice Forge: Dice Tower
description:
Description: A brand new card for use with Dice Forge!

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Explorers Pack.

Set-up (lock): Put the Dice Tower on Athena Island (2 and 3). To place this card on an island, place it straddling between cards so that it covers the portal of the island. To play, you only need one copy of the Dice Tower.

Effect: When the active player wants to complete an Heroic Feat on an island with the Dice Tower, he has to defeat the Dice Tower first. To do so, he places his Hero pawn on the Dice Tower Portal then rolls the dice like he was getting the divine blessings, except he has to pay the resources shown on his dice instead of winning these, all in order to defeat the Dice Tower (paying rules apply as for the Minotaur—See Dice Forge rules).
categories: Ancient, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Palatial
description:
You have inherited a palatial stately home, but sadly it’s in a terrible state of repair. The house is falling down and the grounds are being reclaimed by nature. You must tackle this fixer-upper before you can move in. Protect the historical features and cover up the worst of the blemishes to gain the most points.

One player rolls two dice. Play is simultaneous. Each
player plays at the same time on their own scoresheet. Each player chooses how to use the two dice. Other players may make other decisions.

One die shows the location (area) for the construction while the other shows the shape of the area that can be renovated.

Each player fills in their chosen shape type within their selected area. Players should aim to cover the squares containing the triangles and leave the squares containing the circles uncovered.

If you can't draw a shape, you must cross off a 'no throw' box. The game ends when someone has crossed off all three of their 'no throw' boxes. The player who is furthest through their renovation wins.

You just need 2 dice and a pen. To play, you write directly onto the scoresheet.

Any number of players can play the game. Palatial is also ideal for playing online via videoconferencing.

—description from the publisher

name: Dice on Mars
description:
Roll&write game in which we have to adapt, explore and colonize Mars. Using the dice pool we perform a number of actions: increase the amount of water and oxygen, raise the temperature, extract resources, build colonies, explore the planet and plan scientific discoveries. Very complex mechanics in very simple rules.

Each turn we roll a pool of D6 dice. We then use them to trigger various actions on the playing field.Each active area in the game requires the use of dice of a certain value (e.g. discovering an invention of dice 5 and 6) and sometimes additional elements. In the game we use 2 types of add-ons: inventions (that we have to discover) and raw materials that we have to extract on the game map (by drawing an appropriate shape). We can also build a base (which we also draw so that it doesn't occupy the same place with the mines) and explore the surface of the planet using the rover. The most expensive (but also bringing the most points) element is to build an observatory. After 8 game turns we count the points and the player with the highest sum.

-description from designer

name: 白雪姫のアップルーレット (Snow White Apple Roulette)
description:
Protect Snow White from the Queen and the traitorous dwarf.
Introducing a fiery social deduction game where you can enjoy deduction and psychological warfare.

Game feature #1: The definitive version of the social deduction system that does not require a game master.
The Snow White camp, the Queen camp, and the Third camp are decided by the distributed character cards.
Be aware that apple tiles will be passed to each player, and if you have a poisoned apple at the end of the game, you will die.

Game feature #2: "Story cards" greatly influences victory or defeat.
Each character has a favorite food item (apple or mushroom).
Each player can deduce the other players' characters by playing the story cards.
It is OK to tell a lie during open conversations.
Since the play progresses according to the story cards, even quieter people can enjoy and play easily.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game
publishers: Gotta2 (ゴッタニ / Gottani), JJ Board game

name: Ortrick
description:
Otrick contains rules for playing a trick-taking game with either 2 ("Violet") or 4 ("Scarlet") players; in the case of the latter, it is a 2v2 team game.

The game uses two decks of cards, one which represents the possible suits and one which represents the possible ranks. (There are additional cards for determining the trump suit, teams, and roles.)

In Scarlet, if one person on a team plays a suit, the other must play a rank. One of the teammates is assigned to be the "boss", and when their team wins tricks, this player will always then lead. (These roles rotate at the end of each round.)

In Violet, the remaining cards are dealt to a strawman player, and each player will play 2 cards to every trick, one from their own hand and one from the shared strawman.

For both rulesets, your goal is to win either 0 to 3 or 7 to 8 tricks. Some cards and suits may also be worth points. The person/team with the most points wins.

name: Tiere der Welt: Wissensreise durch die Wildnis
description:
In this exciting puzzle game, children learn about the animals of the world. The players guess which animals are hidden behind the puzzle cards. In the process, they discover more and more animal characteristics and abilities. Players discover the different characteristics and abilities of the animals to figure out which animals are being searched for on the puzzle cards.

The puzzle cards in the game each depict four animals and four traits, with all traits always applying to only one of the animals depicted. At the beginning of the round, the traits are covered with a marker. A player can make a trait available to all or - once per game - to himself alone. Afterwards, players can make a guess as to which animal the already visible properties apply to. Once a player has guessed, the player is out for the round. After the fourth hint at the latest, everyone must have guessed. All players who have guessed correctly receive points according to the difficulty of the puzzle card and advance accordingly many spaces on a track. When a player has gone around the track once, the game ends and that player wins.
mechanics: Matching, Push Your Luck, Race, Voting

name: Squabblin Goblins: Shoot the Moon
description:
Nothing spells trouble like an airborne goblin. That poor moon doesn't even know what's coming.

A 2 Shoot the Moon cards expansion for Squabblin Goblins.

If you control one Shoot the Moon, -5 points. If you control both, +8 points.

name: Treta na Selva
description:
Treta na Selva (Jungle Rumble) places the animals of the forest in a rumble where the best defense is to attack!

And let's face it, we won't be missing a good break-up full of likeable characters and funny powers.

This game is a fast pace card game up to 7 "fighters".

Each turn players will try to mtach the cards in the rumble area, if not, they will resolve the área by taking damage (ouch!!!) and lower their life points.

In your turn you can :
- Play the same card in the área OR
- Play a special card.

If you can´t play neither you must resolve the área and apply all effects of the cards.

The last player stand win the rumble!

name: Seasons' Keepers
description:
The co-operative game Seasons' Keepers has five replayable adventure modes. Each features a story, encounters, and special missions. Read the introduction card for your adventure, then turn the cards on your desk to move around. Collect the objects in the hiding places, and travel from one season to another thanks to the portals of the book, but do not delay in accomplishing your missions because the wolf is on the prowl and your time is running out!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Moving Multiple Units, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: 迷宮メイカーズ (Labyrinth Makers)
description:
Maze Makers is a game where players add walls and treasures to other players' mazes. Once the mazes are ready, they are, one at a time, taped to the table and a large piece of paper with a small hole is placed over the entrance to the maze. The active player then uses their marker to draw their way through the maze, moving the aperture of the large piece of paper as they do so.

Players have 1 minute to complete their maze. They gain points for finding the other players treasures and returning home; they lose points if their marker path runs into any walls. Players can also gain points for having treasure on other players' mazes go unclaimed.

The person with the most points wins.

name: Camping with Sasquatch
description:
Camping With Sasquatch is a light card game with a ROAR! Literally. Play cards to complete sets. Sets = Points. Points = Sweet, sweet victory. Sets can either be three of the same card, or three different cards of that suit.

But watch out for that wild Sasquatch! Sasquatch can help you complete a set or you can play Sasquatch on your opponents. Rush to slap down the right card to avoid getting stuck with the elusive Sasquatch!

Camping with Sasquatch is a quick-paced, strategic card game that combines elements of rummy and slapjack. But you decide, will you play nice or will you turn the Sasquatch loose on your friends?

—description from the publisher

name: Amigos and Insurrectos: The Philippine Insurrection 1899-1902
description:
Following Dewey's naval victory, US Officials negotiated with Spain over the surrender of the Philippine capital, Manila, while simultaneously negotiating Filipino independence with Aguinaldo. When US forces occupied Manila, Aguanildo's own larger, and initially better armed veteran force squared off with McKinley's expeditionary force. There followed four years of "official hostilities" (Guerrilla activities dragged on for more than a decade after McKinley declared end to the war). Hostilities raged across the central island of Luzon and several other major island. After Aguinaldo's capture, his regular forces melted into the bush and US troops faced its first major guerrilla war in the Pacific. As with later foreign adventures, it was not a popular war at home.

Amigos and Insurrectos is an area movement game for two players (a US and a Filipino player). Three scenarios will be offered: an eight turn - STAND UP FIGHT, represents the clash of regular forces; an eight turn - INTO THE BUSH, representing the guerrilla phase of the conflict, and a 15 turn CAMPAIGN GAME, combining both. Regular forces will be represented on the regimental level. Abstract jungle movement will be available through guerrilla movement boxes and movement between islands will be possible though trans-island boxes. Originally designed as a Card-Driven game, random historical events will occur based on objective and turn based triggers. Victory will be based on a point swing track that in the extreme, could see Filipino collapse or US withdrawal. This is a topic shown very little attention in the gaming hobby. Luckily, Olivier has seen fit to feature it in the upcoming issue #11 of BATTLES MAGAZINE.

name: Zurvivors
description:
Zurvivors is a card game that will challenge your fears and put you in the middle of a city taken by the zombie apocalypse.

Your goal as a survivor is to flee through the city streets until you reach the rescue helicopter within 6 hours, but if you are caught by the zombie horde, you should help your new comrades exterminate the human race.

To advance on city streets, survivors must reveal cards to compose one of 3 personal goals, giving advantage to those who complete first.

Various supplies can be found on city streets and stored in your backpack if you can get them.

Each survivor has a different ability that can be activated once per round, making the match even more exciting.

If some unarmed survivor meets the horde wandering the street, that's not a good sign ... for your friends.

You will become a zombie of the horde that will play in favor of eliminating the survivors!

Would you and your friends survive for 6 hours?
Time is decisive, so hurry! Before it's too late.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Glonk Le Choc des Aliens
description:
Glonk Le Choc des Aliens is a small print (150 for the moment) game, self-published by a French designer. Rules are in French.

The game use the mechanics of the finger pitch to simulate a galactic war, each wood circular pawns representing a flying saucer. The mechanism of controlled pitch is the same developed in Pitch Bowl.

Each player control an armada and each armada consists of a spacial base and 8 to 12 flying saucers, with different powers :
- The Sinistrum Empire (malice, trickery),
- The United Worlds Organization (defense),
- The Zorgs (brutality),
- The Space Pirates (speed),
- The Little Grey Ones (technology,teleportation),
- The Invaders (number)
Each have their own powers to take the advantage.

The goal of the game is to destroy the other and reaching 7 points. You earn 1 point by killing an enemy flying saucer and 1 point for an enemy base.

For this, the flying saucers can project their opponents in the black hole or asteroids, use certain powers, boarding enemy ships or launch heroic assault against them.

The official blog ( http://glonk.sosblog.fr/) offer a campaign for two players based upon 1st trilogy of Star Wars : Pitch Wars.

Rules in English available.

name: Im Schutze der Burg (Limited Edition)
description:
For editions of A Castle for All Seasons that contain the expansion A Castle for All Seasons: Winter Cards.


Players use cards from their hands to take actions. These are revealed simultaneously and then resolved in a set order. One of the cards allows a player to pick the cards back up into their hand, allowing them to reuse cards previously played.
