The remaining three disasters affect the Rover player's cards in the corresponding order.

So, if the disaster is a sandstorm, the player who chose "Run" will take damage. Actions may be canceled after the Emergency.
In addition, players should be aware of Astronaut Aki.

The Oxygen is limited. You have to find materials from the asteroid and supply the oxygen before it runs out.

Find and assemble the Spaceship parts before all Rovers are destroyed! And let Aki return home! Then, players win the game!
categories: Adventure, Electronic, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Movement Points, Programmed Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Wizard x Wizard
description:
Wizard x Wizard is a Wizard battle, guess and cooperative game. Players are MaddishIsland Wizards. You can use your own 15 kinds of spell and equipment in 15 rounds. Players can cooperate with each other and start up many kinds of Magic-Combine. The wizard who wins the most has to join a War of Supreme Wizard with limited ability. If you pass the trial, then you can be the real Supreme Wizard!

How to paly:
Wizard x Wizard is a Key word in this game. When you already choose the spell you want to cast, you need to put your spell in front of you and say : Wizard x Wizard, then wait for your opponent. When your opponent say Wizard x Wizard and get ready, then you can put the spells on your Caracter Board and then begin to judge the effect of spells.

Every wizard has 15 kinds of spell and 1 Exclusive Equipment. Spell Cards have Attack Spell and Support Spell, Attack Spell can divide into 2 kind, Magic and Physical Damage. Magic Damage is golden frame, and Physical Damage is silver frame. If the type of Damage is the same, the damage of each other will be canceled out. (The wizard with less damage will take damage.)

When you play team-up mode, only one wizard can cast spell, so you need to communicate with your teammate to decide what spell your team want to cast. But it’s a guess game, so you can’t let your opponent know what do you think. You can use our wands to communicate with your teammate.
You can use different wizard’s Exclusive Equipment to make different combo or use Magic-Combine to double the spell's effects.
The game will over when one team’s Life become 0 or after 15 rounds, the team with more Life will win.

Another special rule of this game is : the wizard who win the most will become Quasi-Supreme and join the last Supreme Battle. You need to fight with other wizards by your own. If you win, you will be the real Supreme!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Talisman Sorcerers Tower Expansion (fan expansion for Talisman)
description:
Fan created expansion:

The crown of command has been stolen by an evil Sorcerer. And at the centre of the land of Talisman stands his ancient, ruined tower. In ages past it belonged to the Wizard who ruled the land, but now it is the lair of the Sorcerer. This expansion set contains a new three-dimensional game board representing the tower, and 32 Sorcerers Tower cards to add a different ending to every game. Now, to win the game, you must battle your way to the top of the tower past hideous monsters and cunning traps, and defeat the Sorcerer in mortal combat.

Expands:

Talisman
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy

name: Similo: History – Bessie Coleman promo card
description:
Promo card at Spiel '21. Was also available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Bessie Coleman
Text: First African American women to become a licensed airplane pilot.

name: Die Siedler von Catan: Hispania Edition
description:
This pre-printed map for Settlers of Catan depicts the peninsula of Spain and Portugal.

The game is played using the normal Settler rules and components, with a few additional rules printed on the map. That rules differ if 3-4 players or 5-6 players are playing.

Also playable with 2 players if combined with Catan: Traders & Barbarians
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Network and Route Building

name: Totemic: Feather and Fang
description:
This expansion consists of all stretch goals unlocked throughout the Totemic KS campaign.

Totemic: Feather and Fang contains 7 additional spirits and 14 specific aspects.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: El Mundo Oscuro
description:
El Mundo Oscuro (The Dark World) is a game of strategy, odds and luck. The goal is to eliminate all players using two or more cards that you will have in your turn. Set at the end of the Victorian era, "The Dark World" invites you to use all your influence to wrest victory from your opponents, including the world.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Gods
description:
In this strategy boardgame from Israel you play the role of a god, designing the races you will control and trying to win over the world. The board is an unadorned hex map. Pieces are nicely-made round counters and there are also quite a few beautifully-illustrated cards. Players win by killing enemy creatures or managing to acquire special items/points.

Fast to learn, and forty-five minutes or more to play (shorter or longer depending on specific victory goals and optional rules used).

name: Quick Wit
description: A pack of 52 cards bearing all letters of the alphabet (except X and Z) in the center and classifying words at the top and bottom is used to test the quickness of each player's wit. A classification is read from one card and a letter is then quickly exposed on another. The first player to call a word in that classification beginning with that letter wins a card. When the pack is all used the player having the most captured cards Wins the Game.

name: Nach Stalingrad: Fall Blau, juin-novembre 1942
description:
Vae Victis issue 54. One of Vae Victis's more ambitious efforts, this game requires an extra page of counters and an extra map to cover the southern Caucasus.

This issue also includes counters and a scenario for "Lock 'n' Load," covering the French experience in Vietnam in the early 1950s, as well as new Japanese counters and map overlays for Champs de Bataille.

As with all Vae Victis issues, this issue is entirely in French. Translations of the main game rules are typically posted onto the internet within a few weeks of publication. All counters come unmounted, and must be glued onto cardboard and cut out prior to play.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Pyrrhic Victory: Legion vs. Phalanx, 280-275 B.C.
description: The game covers the invasions of Southern Italy and Sicily by Pyrrhus, and his campaigns against Rome and Carthage. One player takes the role of Pyrrhus and his Greek, Siracusan, and Tarentine forces, while the other controls Rome and her allies. Carthage is a neutral power that can ally with either side.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Blazing Jets
description:
Building on the successful foundations of Biplane Barmy, Blazing Jets is a game of modern aerial combat, with the emphasis on quick play (ten minutes or less) and tactics over luck.

This game is purchased in as a printable download in PDF format from RPGnow.com.

Rules included : 81 page book, USAF Jargon Guide, 286 Counters, Rules for Vietnam and Gulf War I, Maneuver Charts, Play maps
categories: Abstract Strategy, Aviation / Flight, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Scotland the Brave II: The Epsom Offensive – June 28-30, 1944
description:
(from the back of the package:)

SCOTLAND THE BRAVE II covers events that took place to the north of StB I. including the first day of action for many British soldiers. 26th June 1944, was the baptism by fire of 15th Scottish division and its support arms. Only two of the Division's nine infantry battalions·- the 2nd Argylls and the 2nd Gordons - were Regular Army units, and those had not seen battle (the Argylls had spend much of the early pan of the war in the remote Orkney Islands). Likewise the armored units featuring in these scenarios. 31st Tank Brigade comprised two Battalions (7th and 9th R.T.R.) of highly trained and enthusiastic young men, keen to serve their country and attracted by the infantry tank units' emphasis on training and workmanship rather than the smartness and drill of the traditional cavalry. They would face the ultimate challenge from the best Hitler's war machine had to offer on the battlefields of Normandy 1944: Panzers from SS Hitlerjugend. SS Hohenstaufen and the 2nd Panzer Division Wien.

SCOTLAND THE BRAVE II includes a well-researched historical game map of the battlefield, special rules, ten new scenarios and two Platoon Leader 2.x campaign games. As a special bonus, CG 3 links the maps from StB I with StB II for a giant Normandy battlefield You will also receive a designer's notes booklet. Everything is included to play using your existing rulebook and game pieces.

Ownership of ASL, Beyond Valor and West of Alemein are necessary to play this game.


Scotland the Brave II is an expansion for the Advanced Squad Leader game system and can be linked to Scotland the Brave: The Epsom Offensive – June 28-30, 1944.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Operation Weserübung: The Invasion of Norway
description:
Operation Weserübung: The Invasion of Norway covers the German invasion of Norway in 1940 during World War II. The game covers all aspects of the invasion, including land, naval, and air operations as well as the British and French involvement.

Operation Weserübung is a two-player or three-player game, with one player taking the Germans and the other player or players taking Norway and Great Britain/France. The game is regimental scale with each hex representing approximately 20-25 kilometers with turns representing four days. The combat system is roll-to-hit and the entire game system is based on the system from World War II in the West. This game is also a preview of what the system for World War II in the West: Ultimate Edition will look like when it is published in late 2007. Turn phases include the Air Phase, the Naval Phase, the Combat Phase, the Movement Phase, and the End Phase. The game includes everything from air interception to naval-air combat, from parachute drops to amphibious assaults. While the game strives to be an accurate simulation, the level of enjoyment and ease of play is also a priority.

The game is a medium to low complexity and should be easy to learn relatively quickly. The game can take approximately 5-8 hours to complete.

Operation Weserübung contains approximately 225 mounted counters in easy-to-cut strips. All historical land and naval units are represented in the game and individually identified. Divisional leaders are also included as well as an Admiral. All ships larger than a destroyer are individually identified and included, and air units are divided into counters representing a few squadrons of each type of aircraft. The Germans can call on the Messerschmitt Bf109 E, Messerschmitt Bf110 C, Junkers 87, Heinkel 111, and Junkers 52 during the game, while the Allies have a few Gloster Gladiators, Fairey Swordfish, Vickers Wellingtons, Capronis, and Hawker Hurricanes to try to stop the invasion. All air units have images of the aircraft on the counter while naval units have the historical profiles of the ship represented.

Counters are all two step and as shown in these pictures, have values on the top and bottom edge of the counter. Thus, the facing of the counter is important. This is similar to the system used in Distant Foreign Fields but a departure from the Second Edition of World War II in the West. Look for this feature in the Ultimate Edition of this latter game

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 4 days
Hex: 12-15 miles / 20-25 kilometers
Units: Regiments

Game Inventory:
Three 12 x 18" full color mapsheets
Ten single-side printed non-diecut counterstrips (240 5/8" counters)
One 24-page Operation Weserubung spiral-bound rulebook
One Player Aid card
Two 10-sided dice

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2-3 or more
Playing Time: 5-8
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Odisea Espacial
description:
In "Space Odyssey", the players are technician-astronauts. Their mission is resolve all damages (of different sources) of a space station in a short space of time, because the auto-destruction is ON!!!

This Spanish game (around the middle of 80's) have plastic components of great quality. In this cooperative game each player select a character (pilot, mechanic, robot...) specializing in repair one class of damage. It's (probably) the first game in Spain with the mechanic of selection and specialization of characters.

En "Odisea Espacial" los jugadores son técnicos especialistas que han de reparar todas las averías (de diversos tipos) de una estación orbital en muy poco tiempo ya que... ¡¡La Auto-Destrucción se ha puesto en marcha!!.

Este es un juego español de mediados de los 80 con grandes componentes de plástico, y donde se experimentó (tal vez pioneramente) con los diversos papeles especialistas de los jugadores (piloto, mecánico, robot...) a la hora de resolver , cooperativamente, los diversos tipos de avería.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: GHQ
description:
From the rules: G.H.Q. is a Strategic war game for two players, one player representing the Allied Armies and the other the German Army. The theater of War is the Western Front and the territories of countries adjacent to that front. The Object is to occupy ONE of two capital cities of the opponent.

On the map the principal towns are shown as red circles and connected together by thick red lines which represent the road and railway systems. Towns with black centers are Corps garrison towns and the associated units are marked on the map. The units (armoured, motorized and infantry corp) are represented by different shaped wooden pieces with Flags attached.

The Germans always go first and movement is governed by a roll of the dice. The roll will be between 1 and 3 and the number thrown indicates the number of units which may be moved. Armoured corps can move 3 spaces, Motorized 2 and Infantry 1 space. Destruction of units is based on having units adjacent to the target enemy, 3 friendly units are required to kill an armoured unit, infantry and motorized are destroyed by two friendly units in adjacent towns. For every enemy unit destroyed the player gets another roll.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Universal Fighting System: Darkstalkers
description:
When it comes to card games, you know you're the best. Now prove it with fist-pounding bone-breaking attacks and perfectly timed blocks of the Darkstalkers™ Collectible Card Game.

As part of the Universal Fighting System (UFS), the action flows quickly between players as punches and kicks are thrown and grapples and throws are executed with deadly precision. You are one of the characters from Darkstalkers™ and you will become the champion!

Each booster contains 10 Darkstalkers CCG cards which are 100% compatible with the entire library of UFS collectible card games. Players need at least 1 UFS starter deck to used the cards within.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Time's Up
description: Children's educational game for learning to tell time. Adjust clock faces to match the 54 cards depicting various times. Four different player clock faces in a range of difficulties can be chosen from, depending on the ability of the children playing.

name: Call of Cthentacle
description:
Call of Cthentacle is the 'successor' to the highly successful, and terribly sticky, card game, 'Hentacle'.

This time you're playing against each other for the dubious honour of dishonouring various 'Investigators' who either don't know what tentacular fun they're letting themselves in for, or know all too well...

Re-implements:

Hentacle
categories: Card Game, Horror, Humor, Mature / Adult

name: Bobby Hull Hockey Game
description: Similar to the Munro Hockey game from 1931. This one of course is much more modern with a metal frame and metal players. This game has a automatic puck drop, scoreboard, goal lights that actually light up (requires 2 D-size batteries). The game also came with double players which could be used when you pulled your goalie for an added skater near the end of a close game. The game featured metal players from various original teams in the NHL.

name: Empty Erlenmeyer Experiment Expansion
description:
E4 (Empty Erlenmeyer Experiment Expansion) is the first official expansion for Experiment.

This expansion gives the players new options to choose and new strategies to play the game.

E4 introduces a new card type: the special lab card.

Special lab cards are mysterious, no player may look at them before taking them. You never know what you are going to get ... it might be a double colour joker but it can also be a normal one colour flask or even an empty Erlenmeyer.
The card remains hidden for your opponents so they won't know what you have until you use it.
An empty Erlenmeyer can even give you in certain situations the edge of winning a close game with half a point.

E4 also adds 6 new secret lab cards for even more fun.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: にゃんこあーてぃすと (Cat Artists)
description:
There are seven cats with the artist of the cat lover. The cats are very active in the house.
One day, he sleeps without closing the door of the studio.
"The door is openned into the closed room now!"
Cats dive into the studio.
Cats are walking over the palette and paints, and full the footprints in the studio. Almost like the artist.
The players keep the hand as possible!
The turn player puts the card one by one in three locations, and then draw the cards. However, the player can draw only
the number of the matched color with the played cards at each location.
When the hand is two cards or less, the player drops out from the round, and receive the penalty card.
When the player collects the specific set of the penalty cards at the end of rounds, the game is ended. The winner is the player with the fewest number of penalty cards.

From the rule of the second edition.

name: Blue Moon: Wind Spirit
description:
Promo 904 for Blue Moon.

A Leadership card that allows you to discard one of your opponent's active Support cards.

It is not affiliated with a people and costs one moon.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Somalia Pirates
description:
Somalia pirates haunted the Gulf of Aden. Many merchantmen have constantly being hijacked.
There are four shipping lines in the Gulf of Aden. Nobody knows where the pirates will occur. Even those experienced businessmen are not sure that they can avoid them. Once encountered the pirates, besides resort to the Navy, the use of wisdom is also needed.
As a pirate, you have to hijack merchantmen to earn ransom. But in face of a strong Navy, you need brain to maintain your results.
The Navy has a strong fighting power, but in face of flexible pirates, power alone is far from enough.
In the Gulf of Aden, merchantmen, pirates and the Navy battle every day. Now starts your own story by following the rule of “the powerful, the king”...
categories: Adventure, Age of Reason, Nautical, Pirates

name: 221B Baker Street: The Master Detective Game – Set #7
description:
An additional set of cases for 221b Baker Street. This package comprises cases #121-140 and includes case cards, a clue and answer book, and solution checklist.

121. The Adventure of the Butlers' Convention
122. The Adventure of the Carved Corpses
123. The Adventure of the Eye of the Tiger
124. The Adventure of the Suicidal Opera Star
125. The Adventure of the Random Murders
126. The Adventure of the Missing Missionary
127. The Adventure of the Disinherited Daughter
128. The Adventure of the Death Row Murder
129. The Adventure of the Baby Cakes Kidnapping
130. The Adventure of the Indiscreet Politician
131. The Adventure of Moriarty's Challenge
132. The Adventure of the Balloonist's Demise
133. The Adventure of the Scuttled Ship
134. The Adventure of the MX Missives
135. The Adventure of the Doctor's Last Lament
136. The Adventure of the Happy Medium
137. The Adventure of the Baffling Autopsy
138. The Adventure of the Blackmailed Poker Players
139. The Adventure of the Conference of World Leaders
140. The Adventure of the Infiltrated Embassy
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based

name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Fallen Realms
description:
There are many armies that fight for the Dark Lord, including several realms of men. Some, like the Easterlings, followed the path of darkness willingly and worship Sauron as a divine being; whereas others were cast out of their homes and fight alongside it him out of revenge - men such as the Haradrim. Amongst these mighty armies of Evil Men lie the Uruk-hai, a different race altogether. Bred in the fire pits beneath the fortress of Isengard, they are stronger, braver and better armoured than any Orc could ever hope to be. With these armies fighting alongside those of Mordor, there is little hope for the Free People of Middle Earth.

This 48-page Sourcebook for The Lord of the Rings contains all the rules you'll need to field an army from The Fallen Realms (including the Uruk-hai, Haradrim, Easterlings and the Variags of Khand), as well as detailed background information and scenarios.

You must possess a copy of The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game in order to use the contents of this book.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Garage Sale
description:
It's summertime and that means it's garage sale season! It's time to get rid of your old junk and buy some new junk. In Garage Sale, players simultaneously put up items for sale and negotiate to buy them from each other. The goal is to collect sets of items while maintaining cash flow. The catch is that once you feel you are done collecting a particular set, you can't go back and add to it!

The game of Garage Sale is played over four rounds. In each round, there is one turn per player. On a turn, each player puts up a card from his hand for sale. Players then negotiate to buy those cards using coins and dollars (represented by face-down cards from a player's hand). Once all negotiations are done, one player is allowed to add cards to his storage pile. The cards stored will add to his income this turn (cards and coins) as well as adding to his final score at the end of the game. The scoring is based on the amount of stored cards, bonus stars, sets of colors, and remaining coins.

name: Draw Blood
description:
Draw Blood is a rummy-style card game for 2-3 players, with a deck that consists of 54 cards: three types of monsters (Vampires, Werewolves and Water Monsters), three "Kill" cards (for killing your opponent's Monsters), and 36 numbered blood cards.

Like most rummy games, the object of Draw Blood is to be the first player to get rid of all the cards in your hand. To do this, players can lay down melds of sets and runs; unlike other rummy games, however, you can't just lay down melds whenever you want. You must play a monster card first. Knowing when to play monsters is a key strategy, but you also have to figure out when to kill your opponent's monsters to prevent them from laying down their own melds.

The numbered blood cards come in two colors: odd numbers are black and have a skull in the right corner, while even numbers are red and have a heart in the right corner. You can kill your opponent's monsters with a Kill card or a three-of-a-kind of skulls. With a three-of-a-kind of hearts, you can bring one of your monsters back to life. Blood cards can also be played as melds for points, and deciding whether to play for points or to kill your opponents becomes a key strategy in the game.

The first player to play out his cards ends the hand, then everyone tallies his score. Whoever first reaches a preset point total wins!
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Civicus
description:
Your humble tribe has struggled generation after generation for mere subsistence. After eons of hunting and gathering, feasts and famine, war and peace, your people have finally entered an age of innovation.

With the advent of horticulture, your tribe has settled into a sedentary way of life and through this change, idle minds have begun to develop new ways of understanding and manipulating the world around them. Great advancements are being made in subsistence, government, technology, culture, commerce, diplomacy, and warfare.

This sea change has inspired a need for guidance and through careful consideration your people have elected you to lead them into the future.

Civicus is a civilization themed, tile placement and area control game in which players compete for territories, resources and exotic goods. These essential elements of the game are earned, maintained, and developed through sound logic, thoughtful tile placement, and strategic planning.

Each round the players will take turns placing new terrain tiles. Strategic tile placement is crucial for a player’s success, as this aspect of the game determines the geographical matrix for game play and dictates resource and action point generation. Resources and action points are required for nearly every aspect of the game, including settlement and temple construction, attribute development, and wealth generation.

Throughout four ages, the players will compete for territory control, by building and developing settlements. In turn, these territories will provide the players with the raw materials required for cultivating a great and powerful nation. The greatness of your nation is determined, in part, by a preset scoring system which focuses heavily on settlement construction, exotic good control, as well as, fortune and fame.

The nation with the most victory points at the end of the fourth age wins!
[Crowds cheer… fireworks erupt… enemies conspire]

name: Heifer Heist
description: Heifer Heist is a family friendly board game that gives a spin on the classic alien-cownapping tale. Aliens who have crash landed on Earth find themselves in a need of organic material to power their tools to fix their ships, and fortunately they've landed in a field of cows! Of course, the farmer isn't pleased about the aliens "borrowing" his cattle. The aliens must dodge the farmer while racing to be the first to gather 10 cows and escape. The players must guide the aliens through the farm, collecting cows and returning them to their own ships. The farm is a set of tiles, initially upside down, which are revealed as the players progress. The game allows for both competitive and cooperative play.

name: Mutiny
description:
You are the crew of the HMS Defiant. One of you is planning a mutiny. The Mutineer's goal: to survive while the others attempt to discover you.

Players take on the role of one of the 8 crew members on the ship: Chaplain, Boatswain, Quartermaster, Surgeon, Navigator, First Mate, Master Gunner, or Cabin Boy. Roles are public knowledge, but the identity of the mutineer remains hidden. Over the course of two rounds, players try to discover the mutineer through discussion, accusation, denial, and special actions. The game ends with a vote to convict one player guilty of mutiny. If the mutineer is voted guilty, all the other players win. Otherwise, the mutineer wins.

Each role has unique abilities that may help reveal the mutineer or allow them to exert control over the the voting. Since any player could be the mutineer, an accusation could be helpful, or a clever attempt to re-direct suspicion elsewhere. Mutiny is a social game with a minimal rule set. The game instead relies on player discussion and interaction to drive the game.

name: Trickster: Symbiosis
description:
Trickster is a fun and easy-to-learn card game for 3-7 players, lasting about 15 minutes. Each Trickster set features its own heroes and new ways to play. Find the set that’s right for you... or mix together characters from different sets to customize your own game!

A Trickster set has 49 cards with seven heroes, each with their own simple effect on play. A hero appears in seven different suits, each a color of the rainbow: Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo, Violet. Each hero and suit combination appears once in a set.

The first player of each round may play any card from her hand. The second player in the round is called The Trickster, who may also pay any card from her hand. Any subsequent player that round must play a card that follows the pattern set by the Trickster. (If the first two cards are Yellow, then everyone must play a Yellow card.)

If you cannot follow the pattern, you must collect cards played this round into your personal scoring area. If everyone was able to play one card, then the Trickster collects the cards.

The goal of Trickster is to have the fewest cards by the time any player has emptied her hand. Whoever has the fewest cards is the winner... with one exception! If you have more cards of a suit than any other player, you may ignore those cards when scoring.

'Trickster: Symbiosis' is a highly strategic set featuring characters from the biopunk setting Symbiosis by Steven Sanders.

name: iKNOW: in Europe
description:
Win points by answering the question correctly on the level of your choice and earn more by guessing the other players’ success.

Contains fascinating questions about European countries and cultures. Decide how many hints you need and bet whether your opponents know the right answer or not. Remember, that wrong bet can lead to losing precious points.

Comes in a handy, compact size!

Can be used as an extension of the original game or as a stand-alone game!

name: KIKA
description:
KIKA is a simple color-matching game for 2-4 players using rhombus-shaped tiles. To start, place the tiles on the table, choose a first player, then have that player choose one tile and place it in the playing area. Each player then takes turns choosing a tile from the supply (or one of their own tiles, which are also endgame points) and placing it next to tiles in the playing area.

If the tile you place matches one or more adjacent colors, you score points. For each point scored, take any one tile from the supply and place it face up in front of you. These are your tiles, and each is worth +1 point at the end of the game.

The game immediately ends when the last tile is taken from the table and placed. Count your tiles and add any endgame points. The player with the most points wins.

KIKA includes a rule sheet and seven rules cards. (Most of the rule cards are optional as the recommended minimum age for the game is 2 + the number of cards used.) You can choose 972 different combinations, with elements of deduction, memory, area enclosure, push your luck, and more. Try them all to discover your gamer DNA!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Enclosure, Memory, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Juggernauts:  Panzerkeil vs. ArtKor, Kursk 1943
description:
Description from the designer:
German korps, Russian army level ... generally. 31 German-Axis and 42 Russian units/pieces. Ferdinands, 503th and 505th Tiger Abs/Bns, 10th Panzer (Panther) Brigade. Panzerkeil panzerkorps formation statuses (unless/until they are Disrupted). 4 Russian Artillery Preparation Korps. No Retreat! and Pressed Attack options. 26+mis/42kms per hex. 10 5-day turns enabling Russian counter-offensive. For Panzerkeil formations possible post-DE second attack after tactical advance. Blitzkrieg/Proriv/Penetration movement phases.

For Kursk, quite fast and simple. Good 4-player game if larger map used.

Another of my free print-and-play games on Coatney History ... while it lasts - while *I* last - I am 70 now.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Fate Foretold
description:
Description from the publisher:

Fate Foretold is a tarot-inspired strategy card game where players race against one another to take control of Fate itself. Fate Foretold is honed and crafted to inspire hours of fun and epic gameplay for you and your friends. Gather around the table and take a turn at tempting fate. Use your wits and all the luck you can gather to make it through victorious! Pledge allegiance to kings, gain a spell from a witch, heed warnings in constellations, and use the power of the Four Horses of the Apocalypse to bring ruin to your enemies and emerge as the victor! Fate Foretold is a brilliantly illustrated creator-owned card game designed for 2 to 6 people.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Variable Player Powers

name: Tinker, Sailor, Soldier, Spy
description:
Recruit team members and gain experience before adventuring through the world.

You are the lowly Tinker. A strange wizard has charged you, the Sailor, the Soldier, and a Spy with defeating an evil that has taken over the world. He gave you 36 magic amulets for your journey. Your company of four will recruit new members and master events before leaving on your adventure ridding each location of evil.

Tinker, Sailor, Soldier, Spy is a solitaire Decktet game inspired by Friday.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Novel-based, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Norsaga: Kickstarter 2017 Promo Cards
description:
10 promotional cards from the associated Kickstarter campaign: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/meromorphgames/norsaga-...

2 cards that expand Norsaga
Saga: Goddess of the Mists (Might, Faith, and so much Lore)
Saga: Goddess of the Mists (Might, Faith, and so much Craft)

2 cards that expand Norsaga: Into the Myths
Fae Legend: Gael the Winterwose
Ghost Legend: Yldivard Ash-Coat

6 cards that expand/combine Norsaga: Into the Myths and Norsaga: Odds and Endings
Heirloom - The Empty Mask: Fimble
Immortal - Guardian: Thrice-Woke Omhar
Immortal - Guardian: Ulwilda Fading
Immortal - Guardian: Agmind the Intrepid
Immortal - Guardian: Soul-catcher
Immortal - Watcher: Unsung Donwen

Gameplay
The 2 Saga cards function identically to other Saga cards.

The new Ghost Legend and Fae Legend hybrids combine traits from various hero cards seen in Norsaga: Into the Myths.
The Ghost Legend obeys all rules for both Ghosts and Legends. In your hand it is considered to be a card with black, white, green, red, yellow, and blue colors. It can be played onto any family tree, and must immediately receive an inheritance marker after being played. Until it leaves play it counts as a black card and a white card in addition to the color of that inheritance marker. The inheritance marker may not be removed until the Ghost Legend is dismissed.

The Fae Legend behaves similarly to the Ghost Legend, except for the differences between Ghost and Fae cards. When the Fae Legend is played onto a player's family tree, that player must then swap it per normal Fae rules.

The new Wanderer Guardians and Fae Watcher can be shuffled into the deck of Immortals to provide additional variety.
The Wanderer Guardians have more flexible unlock tracks, allowing you to unlock them in either 2 or 3 steps. While on top of a hero on your tree, the Guardian's traits are used.

The Fae Heirloom can be shuffled into the deck of Heirlooms to provide additional variety.
Do not use this card if you are not playing with Fae and Skalds. Once the Heirloom is restored, your youngest Hero gains the Fae's Lost trait. This does not cause any additional swapping to occur when playing to that spot on your family tree.

The Skald Watcher has a flexible unlock track that requires you to have a Ghost or Fae on your tree, followed by a Skald. Do not use this card if you are not playing with Ghosts/Fae and Skalds. Once unlocked, the Skald Watcher allows you to use any of the four basic 1st-generation embellishments.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Postcard DUNGEONS CO-OP
description: This additional new card includes another diabolical dungeon, treasures, and rules changes for playing the game together cooperatively to defeat the DARK LORD, an evil presence invading from a neighboring postcard.

name: 'Nam
description: 'Nam is a Vietnam War Tactical level miniatures wargame, based on Battlefront's Team Yankee ruleset, designed for larger scale battles and offensives between 1965 and 1972.
categories: Civil War, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Twilight of the Gods: Season of Apocalypse
description:
Aggression and Negotiation's rivalry bursts into open conflict with the introduction of Indra and Hermes in Season of Apocalypse. Backed by potent new epic creatures, including Alexander the Great and Melanippe, the Black Mare, the roiling conflict between pantheons threatens to encompass the entire globe and lay waste to all that exists. Will this be the final battle of the gods? Only time will tell.

Season of Apocalypse contains 50 cards, which are made up of 19 brand new cards (each having multiple copies), and 4 cards previously seen in the core set.

-Description of the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Viper Legion – Unit Expansion
description:
Deliver death from afar with the Viper Legion – Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! These cunning circumspect warriors may prove more dangerous than the Uthuk's demons or berserkers as they use their poison-tipped arrows to strike the heart of their enemies from great distances. Learn the secrets of the serpents and purge the unworthy from the world!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Skruuvi
description:
Skruuvi is a Finnish relative of Auction Whist (which is essentially Bridge without a dummy).

Like Bridge, it's a four player, partnership trick taking game. Players bid how many of the thirteen tricks their partnership can win (or, unlike Bridge, lose). Also, players can communication information about their hands through their bids (and, unlike Bridge, the cards they can exchange) with a system of conventions. Here are the main differences:


Players get to exchange cards with each other. There are two ways of playing Skruuvi depending on how players exchange cards: Kitty games and No-kitty games.


- In a Kitty game, players receive 12 cards; the four undealt cards is the kitty. The highest bidder adds the kitty to their hand, then gives any four cards to their partner. The partner adds these cards to their hand, then gives one card to each of the other three players.

- In a No-kitty game, players receive 13 cards. The highest bidder gives any four cards to their partner. The partner adds these cards to their hand, then returns any four cards back to the highest bidder.


Players optionally play several rounds of Bolshevik, where one player attempts to win or lose all 13 tricks (without a partner).



Players can bid misere, which is a bid of how many tricks a partnership will lose (without a trump suit).



As mentioned, there is no dummy!



As in Bridge, the lowest bid is to win 7 out of the 13 tricks. However, the lowest bid you can win the auction round is 11 tricks! (Or for misere bids, to lose 11 tricks!) In No-kitty games, the lowest bid is to win 12 out of the 13 tricks.



A game of Skruuvi lasts 24 rounds. Each player plays with a different partner for 8 rounds each.


—user summary

name: Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Cylon Heavy Raider (Combat/Transport)
description:
The Heavy Raider is a Cylon multifunctional spacecraft, used to attack colonial ships and transport Cylon fighters on boarding missions. Like a Cylon Raider, this spacecraft is sentient and self–flying. It can also be piloted by Centurions or human–form Cylons, but its lack of windows forces the pilot to rely on electronics only to navigate.

The Heavy Raider Combat/Transport has a thick armor, can resist intense enemy fire, and it is equipped with more powerful weaponry than a standard Raider. It’s also a troop transport, perfect to carry Centurions onto planet surfaces or aboard human Battlestars.

Contents:
1 Ready–to–play model
1 Gaming base
1 Ship card
Maneuver deck
Set of pilot cards
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Deadly Discovery
description:
Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2019 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
This deck focuses on green and black energy. Its mix of creatures and straightforward effects makes it particularly friendly to beginners.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Movie Plotz: Cult Films
description:
Movie Plotz: Cult Films is the 3rd in the line of standalone Movie Plotz games that allows your group to create hilarious fake movie storylines, then pitch them out loud for maximum laughs. Movie Plotz was designed as a very effective team building event that has evolved into a party game where everyone contributes to the fun.

Players begin with a simple plot (a simple sentence) then draw cards to modify the movie concept. With each draw, players get to redo the pitch and make it even more exciting. In the end, the final plot will be a guaranteed hit!

The game lasts for approximately 20 minutes, until all cards have been played. If you are playing the Last Man Screenwriting variant, the last player standing wins.

This one features 12 cards all based on famous cult films like Pulp Fiction ("Rearrange the order of the scenes."), Office Space ("Add a main character's coworker to the story."), or even The Room ("Make the movie worse.").

—description from the publisher


Each card was also delivered monthly in the 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ packages.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Animal Realms
description:
Animal Realms is a card game that is played over 5 rounds and whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins.

At the start of each round, every player draws randomly seven animal cards. Each player chooses one of their cards as their goal card that shows how many animals they have to catch during a round to score points. The person who resembles an animal the most becomes the starting player.
In a player's turn they have to put one card from their hand face-up in front of them. Each of the seven different animal card has a different card effect so players need to use the cards in their hand cleverly to catch animals of other players or interfere with them.
As an example the tiger can catch all the sheep that has been played before it or if 3 players in a row play a mouse they all get to keep the mouse they've played face down in front of them.
Each animal card has also a point value that is checked during scoring.

name: Hideous Abomination: Robots & Rot
description:
Not hideous enough for you?

Freshen up those stale monstrosities (or push them further into decay) with this expansion that adds new ways to play and deeper strategy to Hideous Abomination! Rot tiles make other tiles useless. Robot tiles are automatically bolted down and resist Rot. It's a disgusting new dimension to the game!

—description from the back of the box
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Medical
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: El Pasajero
description: El Pasajero is the perfect game to have in the glove compartment of the car. It consists of two decks of 40 cards, one for the route and one for the city, with illustrations that children must find looking through the window. It can be played alone, in teams, or among all the passengers. The best antidote to long journeys and the "how far to go ?!".

name: Hour of Need: Bystander & Minion Upgrade Pack
description:
Replace the minion and bystander tokens in your Hour of Need games with highly detailed miniatures and new gameplay options!

This expansion adds 18 miniatures and 4 reference cards, allowing players to add more visual flare to their games by replacing the minion and bystander tokens with detailed figures. Additionally, this expansion adds new gameplay elements ion the form of special minions and special bystanders, providing minions and bystanders with special abilities!

The box contains:

9 minion and 9 bystander miniatures
2 minion reference cards that give setup and special rules for Bruiser or Operative minions.
2 bystander reference cards that give setup and special rules for Fierce and Fleeing bystanders.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Shiranui
description:
Shiranui is a trick-taking game where you hand out 8 cards from 5 types of cards with numbers from 0 to 7.

The person who puts out the card with the lowest number will be the winner and earn points.

But then, the person who is given a card with a low number will be an advantageous luck game.

In Shiranui, you can increase the number of the opponent's card by using the tokens distributed.

Are you going to use the given tokens to get in the way of the other party...

Do you use it to increase your points...

It is a troublesome game where the timing and usage of using tokens affect the victory or defeat.

name: Cartaventura Odyssée: Le Secret des Pharaons
description:
Cartaventura Odyssey is a collection of narrative card games for the whole family. Experience great historical adventures with multiple endings! Your objective: complete the 3 chapters of the story and discover all the secret cards by making the right choices.

In Cartaventura Odyssey: The Secret of the Pharaohs, set off on a fascinating journey through ancient Egypt to protect the ancient kings and their treasures!

—description from the publisher

Cartaventura Odyssée est une collection de jeux de cartes narratifs destinée à toute la famille. Vivez de grandes aventures historiques aux multiples dénouements ! Votre objectif : terminer les 3 chapitres de l'histoire et découvrir les 10 cartes secrètes en faisant les bons choix.

Dans Cartaventura Odyssée : Le secret des pharaons, laissez-vous emporter dans un voyage fascinant à travers l'Egypte antique pour protéger les anciens rois et leurs trésors !

—description from the publisher (French)
categories: Adventure, Book, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Titles
description:
Titles is a movie-themed atmosphere and general culture game in which you will have to guess a movie title from a card.

At the start of the game, each player draws 5 cards and 1 other card is put in the center. On your turn, you had to choose between "play 1 of your cards then pick a new one" or "discard 1 to 5 cards and draw as much".

The game ends, when a player reaches 30 points. At the end of the game, we end the round so that everyone has played the same number of times, and the one with the most points wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: TIC TOC
description:
Make way for the funniest CROCODILE in history !!!

Here is Tic Toc, ready to make Captain Hook and his Pirate Crew escape to help you achieve victory.
But if you want to be him, the villain of the villains of the Island that is not there? So here's Smee making Peter Pan run wild with the Lost Boys ...

Everyone knows about the noble deeds of Peter Pan and how he managed to defeat Captain Hook with the precious help of the Lost Boys and the glittering Tinker Bell… but let's face it, the real hero of the story can only be him: TIC TOC. The one who, when approaching, with only the ticking, makes the most fearless captain tremble with fear!

Quick and easy fairy tale card game with old-fashioned graphics. A beautiful journey through time for adults and a beautiful setting for children.

Draw cards, put your team on the table until you can start Peter Pan with 6 Lost Boys cards or Captain Hook with 6 Crew cards. But watch out for Smee who will take away your good team or Tic Toc who will make your bad team run away. Don't worry, the Pirate Treasure and Tinker Bell will come to your aid ...

—description from the designer

name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2019
description:
Core Set 2019, also known as Core 2019, is the 18th Magic core set. It is the first core set to be reintroduced under the Three-and-One Model and was released on July 13, 2018.
Core Set 2019 contains 280 cards (20 basic land, 111 common, 80 uncommon, 53 rare, and 16 mythic rare) and includes randomly inserted premium versions of all cards. 25 additional cards are found in the set's planeswalker decks. These are numbered #281/280 to #305/280. A unique Buy-a-Box promotional card numbered #306/280 is also considered to be part of the set. In addition, 8 common and uncommon cards from the Ixalan, Rivals of Ixalan and Dominaria sets (numbered #307/280 to #314/280) have been printed in the Welcome Decks with the Core Set 2019 expansion symbol. The common taplands sometimes replace a basic land in the land slot of booster packs. 181 cards are new, the rest is reprinted.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Clank! Legacy: Acquisitions Incorporated – Mister Whiskers
description:
The Legacy version of Mister Whiskers offer with pre-order of Clank Legacy or in Conventions.

Cost 1
1Vp
The dragon attacks
or
-2 Clank
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck
publishers: Dire Wolf, Penny Arcade, Renegade Game Studios

name: Now or Never: Enemy Tile – 2021 Dice Tower Promo
description:
Originally available as part of Pack B from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

This adds a new enemy token to the game. It has 16 health, rolls for damage, and rewards 1 XP, 1 Crystal, and 1 villager.

name: MapleStory iTrading Card Game
description:
MapleStory iTCG is an interactive trading card game based on the MapleStory MMORPG. The Maple Story iTCG lets you play a character leading a party to duel with your opponent. The object of the game is reduce your opponent's HP to 0 using skills, items, and monsters.

The MapleStory iTCG plays much like its online counterpart as characters battle monsters and level up yet adds the unique element of character versus character combat. The game is available in starter sets and booster packs. Boosters contain 9 cards (including one code). Starter sets contain 34 cards (including one code), one booster pack, game rules and a CD-ROM with the MapleStory online game client.

Each pack contains at least one Online code card which can be redeemed for exclusive content in the MapleStory MMORPG.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: Dicetris
description:
Dicetris is a roll'n'write game based on Tetris for 1-4 players.

Each round starting player rolls 5 coloured dice(1 green, 1 yellow, 1 blue, and 2 white) and draws a block shape card. Each player in turn places selected die on the card. There are only 4 space available on each card.

Next, players try to fit the dice shape onto their scoring sheets. Shapes can be rotated like in Tetris. New shapes have to touch the bottom of the scoring field or any previously placed shape.

Spaces on the scoring sheets give VPs if they have a matching colour with dice (white is not a colour) or matching value. Values of the dice can be modified, but will cost you VP. Perfectly matching shapes (scoring all 4 fields) let you score one additional field for free.

At the end of the game, players get points for:

the number of scoring fields in 2x2 squares,
the number of scoring coloured field,
fully filed rows,
unused dice modifiers.


The game is played over 10 rounds. The player with the most VP wins.

Tha game was an add-on in the croudfunding campaign of Adam Kwapiński's book "Głowa pełna gier"
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Kaosball: Ringer – Zorra
description:
"Hah! You like that? Don't pretend you're not impressed."

Zorra’s not happy unless she’s got her team standing beside her and the bodies of their opponents heaped around them.

Kickstarter and convention exclusive Ringer.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Kaosball: Ringer – Tycho
description:
The team over at Penny Arcade were cool enough to let Gabe and Tycho play Kaosball.

Tycho has the following ability:
If Tycho deals damage during a fighting contest, he may deal the same damage to an enemy target adjacent to the target.

Tycho is a Kickstarter and convention exclusive Ringer.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Monarchy: The Game of Kings
description:
From the back of the box:

The game of Monarchy: The Game of Kings is gripping and ingenious. Play to win whilst you develop knowledge and cunning, tracing connections between British rulers through the last ten centuries. Featuring great images from the National Portrait Gallery, London, this is the classic card game for adults and children alike.

For 4, 3 or 2 players, Ages 7 and up.

Contents: 42 game cards, rules, scorecards and picture information

www.wittyinventions.co.uk

Overview from the rules card:

The object of the game is to score the most points by collecting a combination of complete sets of names, houses or jubilee monarchs.

name: Dungeon Storming: La Tana di Gwarl
description:
From the back of the box:

"Alone, in the depths of the dungeon, surrounded by monsters. A warrior and a mage against a host of savage orcs. Rich treasures await you, with which you can get new weapons, armor, spells and scrolls. Do you will become so powerful to deal with the Troll Gwarl and become heroes?

A collaborative game for two players or solo. It can be played with more players by combining two or more sets of Dungeon Storming!"

The game is played by moving the miniatures of your heroes on the map, room by room, battling the monsters with a simple roll of a die, dodging the traps, collecting treasures and magic objects, until the heroes reach the last room and try to overcome the boss monster (the heroes can exit the dungeon and buy new objects with the money found).

The map and the layout of the rooms for this dungeon are fixed (all the tables for the encounters, treasures and magical objects are printed on it), but it can be played with four levels of difficulty.

name: King of the West: The Vigilant
description:
There’s somethin’ in the town of Backwater that don’t belong. It fills the air with energy, like it feels before a storm. Except this storm ain’t one of wind and rain, but bullets and blood.

King of the West is a weird west themed area control card game. Three different sets of characters will be available at launch. One set can be played as a 2-3 player 18-card area control game, but multiple sets will allow for up to 9 players with the modified rules variant.

For the area control variant setup, nine building cards are randomly played on a 3x3 grid to make up the town. Six buildings are generic locations and the other three are the unique target locations. Since they are played randomly, the location of these target buildings will be different in every game.

Players can take three actions on their turn: Claim a Building, Move, and Shootout! Shootouts are how you remove opponents from the buildings you want. You do this by trying to get into your opponent's head and outthink them using a nuanced rock-paper-scissors combat system.

The game ends when either a player starts their turn controlling all three target locations or they are the only player controlling any buildings in the town.

With multiple sets and a larger player count, your still fighting over buildings, but instead of gaining a new location every turn, you are limited to what you start with. Players can't be eliminated though and when you run out of your buildings, you can steal someone elses. Other than that, combat works in the same way and the winner is the last person (or team!) left with claimed buildings.

—description from the designer


King of the West card game set 1: The Vigilant, including The Drifter, The Gambler, The Baron, and their locations.
categories: American West, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: The Code Agency Sonderermittlung Krimispiel Fall 1: Flammen im Theater
description:
For the whole family - interactive and cooperative Murder Mystery board game for adults and children from 13 years.
Solve the riddle - Follow the exciting story of the burned out Figaro Theater in this riddle game.
Realistic Material - Work your way through 25+ realistic documents and examine real finds from the burned theater.
Fun for everyone - the criminal case can be solved alone, in pairs or in a team with up to 6 players.
Gift idea - The crime game is also ideal as a gift for Escape Room fans and friends of exciting board games.

name: Pax Romana
description:
Game included in Vae Victis 91
Pax Romana is a small game about the defense of Roman empire. It can be played solo or in teams of players. this game is designed to allow players to search for the best option between defending and expending the Roman Empire.

Contains:
1 A4 map
73 counter to cut and mount
2 pages rule
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Quest: Zeit der Helden – Wolfsjagd
description:
Game description form the publisher:

Quest: Zeit der Helden - Wolfsjagd, the first thematic extension for Quest: Zeit der Helden - Angriff der Orks, offers an exciting new adventure and provides the Questmaster with many other figures of his own stories. This time, the heroes fall into the clutches of a terrible werewolf – and must keep themselves from succumbing to the werewolf's curse.

A new heroine supports the players in pursuit of the beast, as well as ten wolves and ten robbers, the most villains ever in a Quest game! Luckily, the heroes have access to new magic items specifically for hunting werewolves.

The strength of both the heroes and the Questmaster will continue to grow with each quest, the players continuing with their heroes from the original game. This personal development across multiple games will continue in future expansions.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Tixel
description:
Tixel is a combinatorial game for two players. The name comes from the playing pieces, which are basically pixels (squares) with a curved indentation on one of their edges. Tixels are "directional", meaning that their orientation is relevant.

On a turn, a player can either place a new tixel or move one of her own tixels already on the board. A tixel can be "active" or "inactive"; only active tixels, which are at a 45º angle, may be moved. Making tixels inactive is done by moving next to or passing an active tixel.

Chaining moves is important as this temporarily unlocks three additional move types (aside from placing or moving a piece). If a tixel that is moved is made inactive at its end position — i.e., it's sacrificed — a player can take an extra move if she so chooses; aside from placing or moving a tixel, she can now remove a tixel from the board, activate an inactive tixel, or pivot an active tixel to reorient its hollow side.

Tixel: Tix Expansion Pieces consists of four extra pieces for each player. These expansion pieces are different from regular pieces in that they are completely square instead of being hollow on one side. For each expansion piece used, remove one tixel from the game. The expansion pieces can be used to add variety to games, but they can also be used to handicap a stronger player. Simply give the stronger player more expansion pieces compared to the weaker player. With two expansion sets, the original Tix game can also be played on the Tixel board.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Tile Placement

name: Split the Loot
description:
After successfully raiding a commercial galleon, it's time to split the loot! As one of the pirates, you want to get the most valuable treasures. But the whole crew must agree how to divide the booty. Convince your companions that your share is really not so big...

Split the Loot is a card game in which during each round players divide treasures (16-18 cards each round) using an unique "reversed bidding" mechanic. The active player makes an offer stating which cards he would like to take and places bid markers on them. The other players in clockwise turn order either accept the offer or make an counteroffer by removing the markers from the cards; as you can only remove markers the counteroffer will be a subset of the initial offer. Once all players agree to an offer the bidding player gathers the cards with markers on them and drops out off the round while the other players continue to divide in the same manner the cards available in this round .

Besides gathering treasures player may gain action cards that provide a one time bonus during the game.

The game ends when players divide among themselves the whole Treasure Deck, which depending on the number of players will take between 5 and 7 rounds. The players count up the points from their gained cards. Different cards score in different ways - while you want as much Rum as you can gather, if you found a couple Cannon balls you really should look around for a Cannon...

While the card titles are printed in Polish the game is totally language independent and the rules are printed in both English and Polish.

—description from the publisher

name: Forlorn Struggles: Operations Gemse and Südwind
description:
Forlorn Struggles is a DualPak game. It comes with two separate games in one package.

Operation Südwind is a two-player/solitaire game recreating the mid-February 1945 German offensive against the Soviet Bridgehead across the Garam River, in what is now southwestern Slovakia. It commenced on the morning of February 17. The German attack spearheads included a total of 44 formidable Tiger II tanks. Subsidiary attacks from across the Danube helped weaken the Soviet positions. 7th Guard Army defended stubbornly but was barely reinforced and by February 24th the Germans cleared the bridgehead. The Germans won a clear-cut operational victory but they incurred hard-to-replace losses. In the grand scheme of things Operation Südwind was a localized, and only temporary setback ,for the Soviets.

Operation Gemse is a two-player/solitaire game recreating the fierce early March German offensive in Oberlausitz and lower Siliesia against the unsuspecting Soviet 3rd Guard Tank Army commanded by General Rybalko. Securing Lauban and the surrounding area was deemed critical for a possible relief of encircled Breslau. However the planned grand encirclement anchored on Naumburg soon proved too ambitious. Instead on March 5 the Führer-Grenadier and Führer-Begleit Panzer divisions completed their reduced pincer movement and met up in Sächsisch-Haugsdorf. By March 7th, the encircled Soviet 7th Guard Tank Corps was almost completely destroyed.

name: Games n' Fun: Forest Feastival
description:
Description from the publisher:

The summer feast is coming up in the gnomes' forest, and for the forest animals there is nothing they like more! The gnomes have prepared a variety of fun games such as a race up to the fairground, balancing leaves on their heads, an amusing searching game, and a flower memory game. Who wants to join in the feast of the forest gnomes and animals?

Spiel-Spaß-Kiste: Wichtelwaldfest is a box packed full of games and fun that offers endless playing.

name: Expancity: Dice Tower Cruise Promo Tile
description:
This tile was given out at Dice Tower Cruise 3. The art features the Independence of the Seas cruise ship.

"Keep this Cruise tile aside at the start of the game. The first player to score 12 or more points on any building, places the Cruise tile as a free action, connected to at least one tile by road. Tiles may not be played on the water sides."
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Simulation, Tile Placement

name: Sittuyin
description:
The traditional chess of Burma (Myanmar) appears to have all but died out, supplanted by international chess. This is one of the most unusual regional variations of the game. The pawns are set up in staggered formation near the center of the board, and the other pieces are deployed ad lib behind the line. Pawns are promoted on different ranks of the board depending on their file.

It's doubtful that the rules were ever completely standardized. The standard account in English is given by Pritchard in his Encyclopedia of Chess Variants.

name: Millennium Wars: Kashmir
description:
Millennium Wars is a Games Magazine 100 Honoree for 2004. It is a series of strategic-level, two-player simulations of possible current and near-future conflicts.

Millennium Wars: Kashmir, presents potential war in the near future between India and Pakistan over the disputed Kashmir border region.

Contents:
140 Double-sided, full-color die-cut counters
One 11" x 17" Full-Color Map
One Twelve-Page Rulebook
One eight-page Tables reference book
One four-page Scenario book

The rules cover information warfare, air superiority, random events, political events and special ops, in addition to strategic movement, combat, reinforcements.

Expanded by:

Millennium Wars: Air War

name: The Vicksburg Campaign
description:
April 1863
Union General Ulysses S. Grant embarks on another attempt to wrest control of the last major Confederate stronghold on the Mississippi River from the rebels; the fortress city of Vicksburg. Numerous other attempts have failed miserably. The ill-fated campaign from the north, short circuited by that devil Forrest's raid on Grant's supply lines. The jinxed canal, dug through the swamps in an attempt to bypass the city's guns. Now another plan is in motion. Grant will march his Army of the Tennessee through the Louisiana swamps, sneak his ships past the rebel fortress in a daring run of the gauntlet, conduct the largest amphibious invasion in U.S. history, separate himself from his supply base, wedge himself in between two rebel armies, and seize control of the city from the east! All the while battling politicians and public opinion as much as the Confederate armies. Somehow, his daring plan worked, and the Mississippi once again flowed unvexed to the sea.

But things could have been different. Find out how....

This operational level game uses the block unit system to re-create the limited intelligence of the actual campaign. Players maneuver their forces without adequate knowledge of their opponents strengths or even location. The game board spans the campaign topography, from the swamps of eastern Louisiana to the mountainous terrain around Jackson Mississippi. A point to point movement system is employed on a 20 x 24 playing map. Limited command abilities and critical supply wagons are key to managing your armies and achieving victory.
mechanics: Action Points, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Seek Out, Close With, And Destroy.
description:
From the publisher website:

This is Iron Ivan Games's new supplement for small unit and vehicle skirmish for modern battles. New rules cover Command and Control, Fire Doctrine, Rabble Factor, plus new equipment like ATGMs, Body Armor, Night Vision, and more. Extensive section on the use of helicopters, and modern aircraft. Also included are two conflict modules, War at the Bottom of the World: The Falklands (British and Argentine Forces), and Militia Wars of Somalia (Somali Militias plus US Rangers and Delta Force), which include appropriate infantry, artillery, vehicle, helicopter and aircraft entries. 52 pages in all. The main Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers: Infantry and Vehicle Small Unit Skirmish Wargaming in WWII rules are required for play.

Expands:

Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers: Infantry and Vehicle Small Unit Skirmish Wargaming in WWII
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Swords and Scimitars: The Crusades – Field of Glory Gaming Companion
description:
The fourth army supplement for the Field of Glory miniatures wargame. This supplement covers the epic conflict between the Christian west and Islamic east. There are eighteen separate lists, each with a sample starter army and point cost chart for making your own force.

The book itself is 64 pages printed in full color with photos of miniatures and paintings from various other Osprey books used throughout.

Armies included:
- Komnenan Byzantine
- Post Latin Conquest Byzantine
- Seljuq Turk
- Cuman
- Georgian
- Fatimid Egyptian
- Sicilian
- Cilician Armenian
- Syrian
- Early Crusader
- Later Crusader
- Ayyubid Egyptian
- Lusignan Cypriot
- Romanian Frank
- Catalan Company
- Ilkhanid Mongol
- Mamluk Egyptian
- (Later Alan)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Acropolis
description:
"Card game for 2-6 players. Each player takes the role of a prominent citizen of a newly founded Greek Colony. Players make money (Drachmas) by trading goods at the market (Agora). They then use this money to construct the important buildings of their Fledgling City State."

The game includes two card decks, the Agora Deck and the Build Deck.

The 48 card Agora Deck contains cards representing goods that can be traded in the marketplace. There are four cards for each of the twelve types of commodities.

The 15 card Build Deck contains cards from the three types of Construction Categories: Military, Civic, and Religious.

"The game ends when all 15 cards of the Build deck have been claimed. At the end of the game, the player who has the highest score in the most Construction Categories wins."
categories: Ancient, Card Game, City Building, Print & Play

name: Shuffleboard
description: Very small game recreating the favorite outdoor game.

name: HFP: Hard Furry Pets
description:
Hard Furry Pets is a card game in which players become little anthropomorphic animals who try to charm sweet girls of wavering morality. You can choose from two roles: a Hard Furry Pet (HFP) or a Moralizer. The former will try to drive the object of their desire down the road of damnation and dissoluteness, while the latter will pursue the route of light and purity (or something like that).

The game is designed for 2-6 players. Due to the sensitive subject matter, it is not recommended for children.

Objective of the Game

You must embrace your role as a Hard Furry Pet or Moralizer. You will be given an obsession: a particular kind of girl, eager for your attentive charm. Your goal is to subdue your obsession by satisfying her every need in three different categories: romance, morality, and will.

Your requirements in each category are represented by the numbers and symbols on the bottom of every card. You will use a stunning variety of objects, costumes, romantic locations, and humorous events to wear down her resistance until you achieve the goal of every Hard Furry Pet: the conquest! Because of their inherently different natures, Hard Furry Pets and Moralizers must use different numbers and abilities.

The first player to fully satisfy the needs of his obsession and complete his conquest is the winner!

name: Colonial Battlefleet: Core Rules
description:
Colonial Battlefleet is a game of tactical starship combat.

Take control of a task force of starships from your colony world and lead your fleet to victory or die a horrible death in the cold vacuum of space! Anything from a stealth destroyer to a mighty battleship is yours to command.

Colonial Battlefleet features easy to learn rules and exciting game play with minimal time spent waiting between turns. Shooting and damage resolution is easy and yields plenty of carnage. Best of all, Colonial Battlefleet is not a "luck of the dice" game. Although the rules are very straightforward, the game offers tremendous tactical depth and your command skills will be put to the test! There are no cumbersome or complicated systems to slow down play. All your attention will be focused on outmaneuvering and outwitting your opponent - not trying to remember rules.

The core rules come with a rich background which includes three playable factions. In addition, rules for creating your own factions are provided, and the system will support starship combat from any sci-fi setting. Technology trees allow you to easily tweak the rules to match the style of starship combat from your favorite books, movies, or TV shows.

Features of Colonial Battlefleet include:

-Fast and simple movement, shooting, and damage resolution
-Balanced fighter rules with minimal bookkeeping
-Adaptability to any sci-fi setting
-A robust yet easy to use starship construction system
-More than thirty unique weapons, defenses, and special equipment to outfit your ships
-Eighty hull sizes grouped into five categories from destroyer through battleship for maximum flexibility in creating your own designs
-Ten starship roles like 'Flagship', 'Battleline', or 'Screen' that define each ship's purpose and gives them bonuses that are relevant to that mission.
-Six technology trees for customizing races
-Optional rules for boarding actions, black holes, planets, warp storms, relatavistic distortion, the dangers of simultaneous warp point transit, and more!
-Full color double-sided counter sheets for missiles, asteroids, mines, warp points, planets, black holes, grape shot, and strategic bombardment rounds

The game is available as a PDF download.

Customers with Excel can take advantage of the point-and-click starship construction tool that is included with the files. You can even save your classes and print off entire fleets in mere minutes.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: OXYGIN
description:
In OXYGIN, players make words from letters of the same suit, and "Gin" when they have a hand full of words. A bonus is received for playing the longest word.

The game is played in rounds with players taking multiple turns per round. The first player to begin the game is the player to the dealer’s left. A player’s turn is comprised of three steps (take a card, discard a card, and declare "Gin" if possible) and once completed, the next player going clockwise has their turn, and so on. This continues until the endgame is triggered for the round by a player who declared "Gin" during their turn. All players reveal their hand and any words are challenged (if needed). The player with the longest word wins the hand.

name: Ph. D. The Game
description:
Ph. D. The Game is a card game that places players directly in the middle of a graduate school scientific research lab. Players are required to draw, play, and discard cards, competing with each other to be the first member of their lab to graduate.

Getting publications accepted is never easy but Lab Member Cards and other graduate school themed Action Cards such as "Committee Meeting" and "Your PI Lost Funding" will either help you or hurt your other labmates. When you obtain enough Figure Cards, you can submit your publication for review (which will not always get accepted of course!).

Get enough accepted publications and you will become the first member of your lab to graduate with your Ph.D.!

This game truly embodies both the stress and accomplishment of going to graduate school.

"Much more fun than grad school."
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That
publishers: (Self-Published), Letiman Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Battle Merchants: Bribery & Double Talk Promo Cards
description:
Bribery & Double Talk are two new kingdom cards to add to your games of Battle Merchants.

Bribery: Immediately use a Bonus Craft card that hasn't been claimed by a player. You may Forge a Vorpal Weapon for 10 plus 1 for each missing level of Craft, minus discounts.

Double Talk: Perform a Sell action. Take Reward Tiles from your Reward spaces of both races involved in this battle, if they are available.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Gornarus Expansion Pack
description:
A Gorn starship was a type of vessel utilized by the Gorn Hegemony during the mid-23rd century for conducting raids. The Gorn ship was designed with four nacelles, and its class configuration was unfamiliar to the Federation prior to the late 2260s.

This expansion adds one new ship and a new set of cards to Star Trek: Attack Wing

Gorn Starship Independent Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 13 expansion packs from WizKids Games.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Kreechta Expansion Pack
description:
The Kreechta is a Ferengi D’Kora-class ship. Under the command of Daimon Bractor, the Kreechta encountered two starfleet vessels performing a battle simulation in the Braslota system. Thinking that the U.S.S. Hathaway had something of value on board, the Kreechta immediately attacked the U.S.S.
