Over three successive throws, choose whether to keep or discard each die in order to win points, gain energy, restore health, or attack other players. When you attack, if you're outside Tokyo, you hit whoever is in Tokyo; if you're in Tokyo, you hit everyone else! If someone's health drops to 0, they're out of the game. (You can't heal damage while in Tokyo, and the only way to leave town is to have someone attack you...which might put you at death's door.)

When you gain energy, you store it in cubes, which you can use to purchase power cards, which have a permanent or temporary effect.
categories: Dice, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, King of the Hill, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Northern Branch: Firm With Brownies
description:
The Brownies head north!

In this sequel to Firm With Brownies, the players will establish new firms in the north, building farms, pubs, factories and merchant exchanges. The game builds on the production & buy/sell action system of the original, but adds a new complication: Dung cards that are worth negative points if left in your hand, but which can be used to make fuel or fertilizer to gain other benefits.

Northern Branch is the third game in the Brownies series from Studio GG's Shun and Aya Taguchi and plays 2-4 players in 30 minutes.

—description from the publisher

name: Gone Bunkers
description:
Gone Bunkers is a strategy card game. Players take turns building the ultimate hand until someone draws a war card and cannot defeat it. The deck is made up of all types of cards such as; troops, zombies, landmines and of course nukes! Even though your goal is to survive and fight off the war cards, it doesn't mean you can't nuke the player sitting next to you and destroy half their hand.

How to play:
Players take turns by drawing and playing cards until a WAR card is drawn from the deck. Once a WAR card is drawn, that player must defeat that WAR card. Be diplomatic to avoid the WAR, try to fight or be destroyed.

Taking your turn:
Gather all your cards into your hand and look at them. Do one of the following:
1. Draw from the draw pile. If it is a WAR card you can either play Diplomacy card and avoid the WAR or go to WAR and use your troops to defeat the WAR card. You must have the same or greater attack value (attack values are on troop cards) to win the WAR. If you cannot beat the WAR card's value, you lose.
2.Play a card FACE UP on the discard pile and follow the instructions on the card. Note: Zombie cards are placed in front of players not on the discard pile.

Winning the game:
Players will take turns drawing cards, builing their armies and surviving wars. Once one person loses all their cards then the person with the highest attack value (count up your troops attack values) left wins.

Gameplay variations:
Fight to the Death
Play until there is only one player left

15 Round Limit
Play 15 rounds and whomever has the highest attack value left wins

Gameplay Modes:
2 Player Mode
Start with 7 cards each. Each time a WAR card is drawn and a player wins at WAR or plays Diplomacy, put that WAR card back into the deck at random. This will ensure a player loses without the going through the entire deck.

Safe Haven Mode (Fan Favorite)
Do the same initial "Game Setup" except before putting the WAR cards back in the deck, place two cards, per player, face down on the side. Then, complete the regualar game setup and put those extra cards, per player, on top of the deck. This will ensure that each player gets two "safe" turns before a WAR card can be drawn.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Hot Potato, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Free At Last
description: This is a card driven wargame simulating the Civil Rights Movement set in the South in the 1950s and 1960s. This is a free print and play game with all files available for download from BoardGameGeek.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Blekoteco
description:
Mental agility Game for all ages. Answers before time runs out the four responses to the initial guilding you each die, or think about it more and accounts for as many points as possible.

Each player must provide himself with a pencil and paper, where he writes his name. Then 10 cards of categories are shuffled an place face down within reach of all players.

In Turn, each player rolls the 4 pairs of dice, in sequence, rolling an alphabetical dice with a number dice. This will determine how many points will be scored for a valid word starting with the obtained initial letter.

Then, a dice is thrown for selecting the active category. The dice is marked with six symbols wich corresponds the categories in the cards. The the first card is revealed and now every players know in wich category they must find words, and every player have a minute (an hourglass is provided with the game) for writing only a word per initial letter of the selected category.

It's not mandatory write a word for each initial letter. When a player considers that his answer finished, puts his paper facedown in the middle of the table. After a minute, the papers are revealed in the order they were put. If a word is repeated, it only scores for the first player that wrote it.

The process is repeated ten times, once for each card of categories. The player who scored more points wins the game.

name: Kaosball: Ringer – Gabriel
description:
The team over at Penny Arcade were cool enough to let Gabe and Tycho play Kaosball.

Gabe has the following ability:
Gabriel may redirect any amount of damage being dealt to an adjanced friendly figure to himself (event if it is more than enough to kill him).

Gabe is a Kickstarter and convention exclusive Ringer.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Lost Bible
description:
Lost Bible is a take on the game Lost Legacy with the story and characters from the game Bible Hunter. It contains two sets of 16 cards: The Dead Seas Scrolls and The Last Supper. It also contains a promo card for the latter, Crucified Christ.

It plays the same way as the previous games in the Lost Legacy family. However, unlike the other sets, the cards in this game may not be mixed and matched with any of the previous sets as they have a different card back bearing the Lost Bible title.

Rules Summary

Lost Bible is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2–4 players. You start the game with one card in hand from a deck of sixteen cards. On a turn, you do the following:


Draw: Draw the top card from the deck and add it to your hand.
Play: Choose one of the two cards in hand to play and place it face up in front of you.
Effect: Carry out the played card's effect, after which the card is considered as discarded.
End: If there is at least one card left in the deck, the turn goes to the next player; if not, the investigation phase starts. Using the investigation speed indicated on the card each player has in hand, players take turns guessing which player (whether yourself or someone else) holds the "Lost Bible" card; this card might also be in the "Ruins", a location that holds one card at the start of the game and possibly acquires more cards during play. The player who guesses correctly wins; if no one finds the "Lost Bible" card, then everybody loses.

name: WHAM
description:
Set up your garden in any size and shape, then defend it from pesky moles who are up to no good. How long can you keep the increasingly aggressive pests at bay? Show them who's garden it really is. This board can be arranged any number of ways for variable difficulties.

SETUP:
Connect the Blinks in any arrangement, so long as they are connected. Double-click any Blink to begin the game.
Any mole that completely disappears into the grass will end the game, and the cluster will flash red. In addition, a player who gets three strikes will end the game. Double-click any Blink to return to setup and double-click once more to try again.


GAMEPLAY:
During the game, waves of red moles will pop out of the ground. Moles pop up fully red, but countdown quickly before fading to black. Before they disappear back underground completely, a player must click a mole to “whack” it. The mole will flash white, then that Blink will return to normal.
As the game progress, waves of moles will appear and disappear faster and faster. If at any time a player whacks a Blink that has no mole on it, they get a “strike,” shown as a flash across the garden.

WIN CONDITION:
If you are able to last for 30 rounds, the garden will flash white and you win! Double-click any Blink to return to setup. Double-click to start

This game is played with Blinks, the world's first smart tabletop game system.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Elapsed Real Time Ending, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition

name: Bleak Moor: Smugglers & Wreckers
description:
Bleak Moor is a single player card game that forces you to enter into the unsavoury world of wrecking – the despicable act of luring ships onto treacherous rocks so you can plunder their cargo.

Your nightmare begins with the delivery of your first ransom note. It details a ship that is about to set sail, the amount of cargo it carries, and the price you must pay for this information.

Starting with a limited amount of cargo you must first recruit help from an untrustworthy bunch of smugglers. Each smuggler has a unique ability, some bad habits, and a limit to the amount of cargo they can carry.

Together you must then attempt to lure a ship onto the treacherous rocks, known as The Devil’s Teeth, in the hope that you can salvage more cargo. With the turn of every card however you risk encountering survivors or being discovered by the patrolling Redcoats.

Over the long winter months you will receive six of these ransom notes, each varies in difficulty and makes mounting demands upon you. Only by managing your resources and salvaging the right cargo will you be able to meet all six demands.

Fail to meet any ransom demand and your life will most certainly be in danger, meet all six and you might just live to see another summer!

-description from designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Commodity Speculation, Force Commitment, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: War Plan Crimson
description:
A complete remake of the original game. Tiny Battle Publishing's game has new art, refined rules, die-cut counters.

---

AMERICAN TROOPS ADVANCE ON MONTREAL

MARINE LANDINGS THREATEN HALIFAX, COUNTERED BY ROYAL NAVY

MONTREAL, September 1, 1939 (Roto-Reuters News Service, Earl Dixon reporting):

American President-for-Life Hugh Johnson's threats over securing unfettered access to the St. Lawrence River became deeds yesterday as troops of the American 1st and 27th Divisions lurched across the border into Canada. Elements of a United States Marine Corps brigade are reported to have landed at the small town of French Village, west of Halifax, and are advancing on the city.

Canadians were summoned to defend their homeland by the newly-appointed Defence Minister, John E. Mitchell.

"We will not permit these American scoundrels to pave our paradise and put up a parking lot," Mitchell warned. "All true Canadians will rise to defend our unique culture and way of life in this, our country's hour of need." (Mitchell was shortly thereafter the subject of a Vote of Censure by the Legislative Assembly of Quebec for having failed to make his remarks in French.)

Meanwhile, all units of the Non-Permanent Active Militia in all Militia Districts have received mobilization orders, though transport and equipment are lacking. Volunteer battalions have spontaneously formed in Montreal and Halifax as university students, local police, townsmen and farmers band together to resist the invasion. And the majesty of the British Empire has begun to make itself felt: a battalion of British troops are reported to have arrived at Quebec City; even more encouraging are sightings of Royal Navy and American ships engaged in heavy exchanges of fire off Halifax.

---

WAR PLAN CRIMSON is a simulation game of a hypothetical invasion of Canada by the United States some time between 1935 and 1939. The game is for two players, one representing the leader of the armed forces of the United States that could be deployed against Canada (the US player) and the other representing the commander of the Canadian and British forces that would defend against a foreign invasion (the Commonwealth or CW player).

In reality, both countries have enjoyed cordial relations but it is also historical fact that the United States Army did make plans to invade Canada, in the context of the ‘Rainbow’ war plans where potential enemy countries were referenced by colours (Japan was orange, Britain red, and Canada crimson - whence the title of the game). In most cases these plans were created, studied and maintained in order to keep staff officers sharp, but the strategic priorities of an actual plan submitted for consideration in 1935 (seizing Halifax and Montreal in a quick campaign before Britain could intervene decisively) are the obvious ones and have been used as the basic framework for the action in this game.

name: Kaosball: Ringer – Gojira
description:
Gojira has chased Mr Awesome all the way from distant shores! It doesn't help to be speedy if there's no where to go.... time to face the terrible might of Gojira!

Gojira's ability reads:
If Gojira wins a contest, he may crush his space (putting a damage token on it) and move adjacent. Figures can't enter a space with a damage token on it.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Ambition
description:
Ambition is a trick taking standard deck playing card game. It was invented by Indie designer Mike Church whose stated goal was to create a trick game where the role of chance ("hand-luck") was as small as possible.

The usual object is to avoid taking the most points in a round and, secondarily, to score as many as possible up to that. (That is, if the 120 points split 42-34-25-19, it's best to be the '34' and worst to be the '42'.) Bonuses, known as Nil and Slam, are given respectively for taking no points or for taking 75+. Thus, almost any hand dealt has some strategy: few terrible hands exist.

Ambition is as much a game of players, and the interactions of their varying strategic objectives, as of cards.

For improvement's sake, the inventor has updated the game several times since its first publication in November 2003. The most recent rules were published in July 2012.

name: Severed Union 1861-1865
description:
Severed Union 1861-1865 is a historical miniature wargame, which is the first release from Gordon & Hague War-Games. The game uses 10mm pre-painted wargame miniatures to allow players to relive the greatest battles of the American Civil War. This game is a turn based in which each player will take turns moving, firing and charging. There are multiple ways to win according to what style of game you are playing. There are "take and hold" battles where you must capture key objectives around the battlefield in a specified amount of turns or simply play a "total destruction" game where you must destroy the enemy and run them from the tabletop!

The miniatures are 10mm in scale and pre-painted and are ready for battle right out of the box. The Severed Union Rulebook is free to download from our the Gordon & Hague website. There is an advanced 40 page rulebook for veteran war-gamers and there is also a 4 page quick-start rulebook for newcomers and children.

The game mechanics are based mainly around dice rolling and measuring. Maneuvering your units is also very important as you receive bonuses for being on high-ground and in or behind protective cover such as fences, buildings and forests.
categories: American Civil War, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units

name: Obbedisco!
description:
The campaign of Bezzeca was a daring mountain warfare campaign, waged by Italian general Giuseppe Garibaldi.
He led his group of volunteers, the " Corpo Volontari Italiani," against Austrian General Kuhn’s forces in Trentino.
Garibaldi’s Red Shirts were stopped only by the end of the hostilities between the two states, and the General’s famous reply to the King’s telegram ordering the immediate end to military operations, a terse and concise "Obbedisco" (I obey).


This operational level game uses a Chit drawing activation method to create uncertainty in initiative and a combat system that stresses fatigue over real casualties. Obbedisco! include variable movement of units, leader initiatives, morale, force march, fortifications, supply, etc.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Symetra
description:
Symetra is a hexagonal-card, glass bead strategy game where players battle for the opportunity to join Symetra, an ascended being who travels worlds, in battling a high tech evil on her home planet of Orbworld. To prove their worth the challengers must show their skill in wielding Symetra's reality-shaping interfaces that give the user access to the different elements, emotions and energies of the cosmos at a quantum level.

The challengers must actualize their potential energy, represented by their unique colour of glass beads, by fusing, combining and charging cards in the matrix. Once cards are energized in the matrix players can use their unique actions to shape their victory. The player with the most actual energy at the end of the game wins.

Symetra has many different play modes including short and long games, teams, draft, tournament, solitaire and oracle.

Symetra includes 60 unique hexagon-shaped cards, 300 glass beads (6 different coloured sets of 50 beads each) and a detailed rulebook.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Perplexus Warp
description:
Perplexus Warp brings a whole new shape and challenge to Perplexus'!

Roll the ball to the staring point, then flip, twist and spin the ball along the path. Slide the WARP DRIVE to move along the rail. If you fall off, start over! If you make it to the end, enjoy your triumph - then try racing your friends!

This Perplexus includes 80 challenges including Warp drive, pivot, double track, basket and wicked stairs.

name: Pizza Express
description:
Pizza Express contains six themed party games, all different but all tasty, all good, and all healthy.

'Presto!' is a game of speed and visual acuity in which we will compete to be the first to get the ingredients of the recipe, even taking them away from rivals.

'Pizza Crush' is a spatial vision game in which we will try to get the ingredients for our recipe from a common matrix that will vary with each player's decisions.

In 'Mamma mia!' we will have to be the fastest in assembling the pizza slice requested by customers.

At 'Another slice, please' we will force our luck to be the first to deliver 5 correct orders to customers.

'Oh sole mio!' encourages us to collect sets of ingredients and complete orders of different value to be the winner.

Finally, 'La ricetta de la nonna' will force us to squeeze our brain to remember grandmother's mythical pizza recipe amidst the constant sway of ingredients.

The six games that make up Pizza Express have a more complex version so that children and adults never get bored and always find a challenge to face.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Neptun: Queenie 3
description: You get a scoretrack and each player gets a mosaic board (which depict the 15 cities on the map in a 5 x3 grid) and 15 mosaic tiles (= the 15 different cities). Whenever you fulfil a contract, you can put the corresponding mosaic tile on your mosaic board. At the end of each round, you get 3 points for a complete row and 1 point for a complete column.

name: Just Chocolate
description: In Just Chocolate, each player has their own deck of ingredients cards. These cards are played in turns by building either horizontally or vertically on previously played cards. The goal is to have the most points accumulated by completing blocks of chocolate. Ingredients can either be 'unknown sources' or 'ethical sources', with 'ethical sources' scoring more points.

name: Problem Picnic: Attack of the Ants – Mini-Expansion
description:
The Problem Picnic: Attack of the Ants Mini-Expansion includes a few small expansion picnic cards originally offered as stretch goals for the Kickstarter campaign, but were not reached. As a result, these were offered again as an add-on after the campaign, so fans could get them anyway:

Bluebird
Wine Bottle, which includes a cardboard wine bottle obstacle and stands.
Frisbee, which includes a cardboard Kids Table Flyin' Disc.
Blueberry Pie, which includes a cardboard pie.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Fantasy Warlord
description:
Mass combat 25/28mm miniatures rules for fantasy battles. Like Warhammer.

The rules was supported in the short-lived RPG magazine, Red Giant.

name: 宿命の旅団 (Fellowships of Fate)
description:
宿命の旅団 (Shukumei no Ryodan) Fellowships of Fate is a card game with a theme of island exploration. You lead a group of nine adventurers, explore secrets and find relics of the island.

Each player has an identical deck of nine adventurer cards. Each adventurer card has one greater effect and one lesser effect written on it. At the beginning of each round, players choose four cards from their deck to form their hand.

During your turn, you play an adventurer card. If you play it for the lesser effect, it is resolved immediately. Otherwise, its greater effect is resolved at your next turn. Other players may counter the greater effect by playing the same adventurer card on their turn.

Depending on the card played, you gain resources, spend resources to accomplish a quest, find a relic, or encounter a fate.

After the fourth round, the highest scorer wins the game.

The game was designed by WY Games (WYゲームズ) collectively.
user summary

宿命の旅団は、未踏の島を舞台とした対戦カードゲームです。
あなたは個性豊かな九人の旅団の意思となって、冒険の手はずを整え、旧文明の遺物を探し出し、島の秘密を追究していきます。このような彼らの活躍を綴り、最も雄大な旅行記を完成させた旅団が勝利します。
団員たちは皆各分野の俊英です。時に力を振り絞り伝説的な偉業に挑戦することができます。それを成功させるには、後手番の方が邪魔が入りにくいでしょう。見事伝説的な偉業を成し遂げれば、更に後手番に回ることが出来ます。伝説は、次なる伝説を呼ぶのです…。
publisher's summary
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Travel

name: Duel Master 1: Challenge of the Magi
description:
Similar in some regards to the Ace of Aces book series, Duel Master takes 2 players, each with their own book, into competition with one another. Play is paragraph based, with each player making their own choices about what they want their character to do.

In "The Challenge of the Magi", each player takes on the role of a mage (specializing in one of five types or colors of magic), putting themselves forward as replacement for the recently deceased head of the council. Who shall rule is determined by ritual duel to the death in the Rainbow Land - a series of interconnected dimensions, each filled with its own denizens and incorporating its own magical laws.
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Armies of Chivalry
description:
From the publisher:
Armies of Chivalry contains army lists for use with Warhammer Ancient Battles.

The lists will enable players to recreate battles for some of the greatest conflicts of the Age including The Hundred Years War, The War of the Roses, The Burgundian Wars, The Ottoman expansion, The Northern Crusades and The Wars in Eastern Europe.

The book includes special rules for recreating the character of warfare during the Medieval period when using the Warhammer Ancient Battles rules. There are also new rules and some updates and clarifications for the Warhammer Ancient Battles rule set.

There is a selection of rules clarifications and errata available online for Armies of Chivalry.

Expands:

Warhammer Ancient Battles
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Starplayer: The Football Board Game
description:
This is a football game where no knowledge is required. The goal is to collect a full squad of players in the same colour along with a manager and a stadium. This is achieved by rolling two dice and then deciding to buy a player of the colour you land on or a manager or stadium. Other spaces include Cup Match spaces, Starplayer spaces and the Chairman's space. The Cup Match let's you challenge another player to a cup match with the winner getting a win card which you need 5 of in order to win the game. The Starplayer spaces all give you something good unlike the Chairman space which can be good or bad. Once you have your 5 cup wins you can then challenge another player to the cup final in order to win the game.

From the back of the box

You're the new owner of a major football club! the race is on to rebuild your club and win the Starplayer cup in this action packed game for family and friends. You must buy a new squad of 11 international footballers, a new manager and a new stadium (a club set) with £150 million of Starplayer money! But spend it wisely... run out of money and you are out of the game. Don't worry - there are many ways you can increase your money so you can spend more on the star players of your squad.
As you race against your opponenst to collect your club set, enjoy playing Starplayer Cup matches by rolling the unique Starplayer dice... Win five matches and complete your club set to get your club to the Cup Final. Win the exciting cup final penalty shootout using the fantastic Starplayer goal die to win the Starplayer Cup and the entire game!

You don't need any knowledge of football to win starplayer.

Made in the U.K.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: UK version 2.0 (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
From designer:
In 2006, UK computer science professor David Millard published what quickly became a very popular "aftermarket" United Kingdom map for the amazing and wildly popular board game Ticket to Ride by Days of Wonder.

After playing (and very much enjoying) David's map a number of times - and having a little time on my hands during an extended job search - I set about to create an updated version. Some of my goals:

Spread the board a little and improve a handful of the "bottleneck" and "bypass" areas with a bit more grid-like access, particularly useful for playing with 4-5 players
Significantly add to the set of routes, making the game play a little more like the 1910 expansion to the original Ticket to Ride U.S. map.
Improve on the already well-done aesthetics if I could, while we were at it.

Armed with Adobe tools and an extended family of ravenous Ticket to Ride fanatics who would test play the revised board and ticket sets in their various drafts, I went to work. After a number of months, we settled on an updated board layout and a ticket set that makes for a lot of fun - and a lot of ticket gathering!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Pixel Tactics: Game Artist / Fábio Fontes
description: Pixel Tactics promo card that is a Kickstarter/Convention promo.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Munchkin Messenger Bag
description: The Munchkin Messenger Bag is, as you might imagine, a Munchkin-themed messenger bag complete with the logo on the shoulder strap and one side of the bag and with Munchkin pulltabs on the zippers. This item includes four new bag-related Munchkin cards and one jumbo die.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: RIOT: Cast The First Stone
description:
RIOT is a board game about social conflict -- a simulation of urban political tension and uprising. The game has a good setting and simple mechanics.

In RIOT, the player has to choose a side (Police or Rioters) and attempt to rule the streets of the city by maintaining control of different areas in a situation that seems out of any control.

The game is one of factions that have different powers. The four factions portrayed in the game are: Autonomous, Anarchists, Nationalists and Police. The game is turn-based and ends when a faction reaches its goal. The four factions have their own specific markers, powers, and goals.

RIOT is a card-driven game of area control and worker placement. The clashes between the various forces occur on the streets of the city with the aim of occupying buildings.

In summary, the Rioters struggle for control of the district of the city, while the Police try to block them. On the Rioter's turn, the faction of troublemakers can pursue various actions based on the buildings they control. The Police instead follow different rules.
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Spanish Civil War Battles: Belchite & Teruel-Alfambra
description:
Spanish Civil War Battles: Belchite & Teruel-Alfambra is an Operational level simulation of the battles of Belchite (August-September 1937) and Teruel (December 1937-February 1938). The game uses an adaptation of the Fire & Movement system.

Each hex represents one kilometer. Each turn represents two days. Units are brigades and regiments of 3-4,000 men, and battalions of 400-800 men depending on type. Tank units represent Battalions or groups of companies of 30-40 tanks or armored cars. Support markers represent artillery battalions or squadrons of assault and bomber planes.

World at War #62 August 2018

name: Calcool
description:
An entertaining dice game about addition and substraction in a number range between +20 and -20 for 2 to 4 players from age 8.
Each player selects 2 cards and puts them down before him. Each card shows 5 fields with dice printed in them. Some fields offer chances to gain points, others are traps and have to be avoided. Players score by being fast in putting down a line of 10 dice in 10 different colurs by placing them cleverly under theeir two cards.
To start the game, the 66 coloured dice are cast. Then the players play simultaneously. Each player grabs 10 dice one by one and forms his line of 10 dice in 10 different colours. As speed is a decisive factor players tend to make mistakes when arranging their dice and get trapped by the trap fields. This, of course, is part of the fun and motivates to do less mistakes in the next playthrough.
There are 2 versions of the game: an easier one with two levels for players from age 8 ++, which is called "Farbenspiel", and a version and an even more challenging version with 4 levels for players from age 12 ++ (called "Etappenspiel").

name: Lost Worlds: Hill Troll with Club
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Greysea Games, Nova Game Designs, SoftBank Corp.

name: Lost Worlds: Man in Plate with Sword and Shield
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


Man in Plate with Sword and Shield
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Chessex, Nova Game Designs, SoftBank Corp.

name: Zealand 1985
description: One of the parts of the Warsaw Pact plan to attack into the west was to invade Danish Zealand, along with the capital, Copenhagen. An improvised corps, including the 6th Airborne Division, 7th Sea Landing Division and the 15th Mechanized Division, was prepared for this operation. The Soviet units and the regiment from German Democratic Republic's army were kept in reserve. The opponent of the Poles was the "Zealand" Corps. Important part of the planned strike was the usage of nuclear missiles.

name: Stardust Coffee
description:
Story:
the 17th century, Ottoman Turk Empire, one of the most powerful states at that time, marched west to Austria and because of that, Arabs began to bring coffee into Europe. From that moment on, coffee has become one of the most popular drinks in the world. Then hundreds of years have passed, and even though travel between universes has become a daily routine like taking buses, coffee has spread from Earth to different Space Cities, the colonial satellites in outer space. Enjoying a cup of high-quality coffee every day has become the most anticipated thing for residents of Space Cities every day.

After hundreds of years passed, a space expedition led by Dr. Brent Tully discovered an organic material called "Stardust". By adding only a small amount of this magic ingredient, the flavors and aroma of any coffee are greatly enhanced. Moreover, the more freshly picked Stardust, the more it can improve the quality of coffee. This triggered a coffee revolution! In pursuit of the ultimate flavors, many new expeditions have been established on different Space Cities with the goal of "seeking the freshest Stardust and ingredients for the first time and delivering the most delicious coffee". Beside the danger of sailing the spaceship across the galaxy, there is a robber called "Galaxy Pirates", which is more threatening to them...

Game Aim:
In Stardust Coffee, you control a space expedition and sail your spaceships across the Galaxy. You collect different ingredients for coffee making and score by delivering the coffee back to your Starbase. Collecting Stardust and adding them to your coffee is another way to boost your Victory Points (VPs). By upgrading your spaceships, you could also speed up your collection of ingredients or Stardust.
When the game goes on, the Galaxy Pirates will attack your Spaceships and rob your ingredients. By fighting back the Galaxy Pirates, you get Honor points and it will be another source of scoring. Only the player who could manage the Spaceships the best would gain most VPs to win the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Atmosfear: The Card Game
description: Similar to Spades but a lot more fun with characters from the Nightmare Series. You try to collect the most keys. The Dice decide which color is trump. High cards can win, but low cards can change the rules. the second die is normal 1-6 and the third die rolls symbols with 7-12 on them.

name: Maya Chess
description:
Maya Chess is an abstract strategy board game for 2-players where 3 dimensional pieces fight for supremacy and try to crush the opponent's leader piece.
Maya Chess has a unique play system, for instance the pieces rotate on the board and each piece is a different geometrical structure. It requires 3D spacial awareness to visualize how the pieces will "roll" across the board.
publishers: Promotorías Social, Personas con Discapacidad A.C.

name: Rick and Morty: Mix-up
description:
Get more cards, more tiles and more actions!

In this stand-alone expansion of Rick and Morty: 100 Días, our two favourite characters have to travel through even more troublesome dimensions in order to close them with the right resources.

But there is a twist! Resources you collect are now gathered on special cards with a certain capacity (slots). If you close a dimension using the specific combination of resources demanded by each of those slot cards, you will activate it and score extra points! Wabba lubba dub dub!

Also, each player receives a portal gun. If you charge it with the right resource combination, you can travel freely to any dimension you like!

-description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Take That

name: Lilly Van Helsing
description:
A specialized team deals with violent werewolves, terrorist vampires or dangerous plants..

"Chasseur de Monstres" is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

—description from the publisher
publishers: Ediciones MasQueOca, FoxGames, Makaka Editions, Pegasus Spiele, Van Ryder Games

name: ASG Baseball
description:
ASG Baseball is a tabletop baseball simulation which uses individual batter and pitcher cards and dice to accurately recreate games between Major League Baseball teams. The game's distinctivie design feature is that batter-pitcher encounters are resolved by rolling the dice and consulting the pitcher's card. In some cases the outcome of the play is determined directly from the pitcher's card. In other cases the pitcher's card may direct you to a specific column (one of six) on the batter's card for the play result. The columns on the batter's card are organized to reflect the batter's normal, above-normal, and below normal batting average and slugging percentage. Advocates of the game argue that dominant pitchers are more realistically simulated by this play design in that they exert more control over the outcome of each at bat than is the case for better-known baseball boardgames such as APBA and Strat-O-Matic.

ASG also includes clutch hitting, errors, fielders' range, fielders' arm strength, infielders' double play ability, catchers' pitch calling, balks, wild pitches, stolen bases, stamina and unusual plays.

The game was introduced in 1973 with player cards based upon the 1972 major league season. The following year the company issued player cards based upon the 1973 season. Afterward, faced with demands from the Major League Players Association for royalty payments for the use of player and team names, the game creator ceased production until the game was resurrected by 3W Games in the late 1980's. Later, the board game was adapted to the personal computer and the software was sold under the name Diamond Dreams. As of 2011 neither the boardgame nor the computer version is being produced and marketed.

name: San Guo Sha: Complete Edition
description:
Same game game as https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/140065/san-guo-sha-compl...
Needs merging.

Released by the end of 2011, not long after the 2011 Standard edition, it contains 2011 Standard edition plus all official expansions. Its releasing date was so close to the end of the year that it hit some local markets only early next year, so it was sometimes mistaken as 2012 Complete edition.

Legends of the Three Kingdoms (a.k.a. San Guo Sha) is a card game based off the Chinese classical novel, Romance of the Three Kingdoms, which shares many rules with Bang!, the differences are as follows:
1. The Monarch (Sheriff) may get an additional skill related to their kingdom allegiance; players routinely have two powers.
2. Weapons may have their own additional powers.
3. A card to let a player borrow a weapon from another.
4. A card to cancel the effect of other cards.
5. Peach (Beer) may be played by any player when someone loses their last life; there is no exemption of using Peach when there are only 2 players left.
6. The game proceeds counter-clockwise.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Rivet Wars: M3 Vertical Tank vs. Landkrieger
description:
M3: "The M3 was commissioned as a light tank with good scouting and fire support capabilities. With its shield, the M3 can "block" for troops during forward assaults while its considerable firepower allows it to outgun most infantry squads."

Landkrieger: "Its innovative piston-driven suspension allows it to reach high speeds on rough terrain while also permitting it to navigate vertical grades that a tracked vehicle could not. Its dual hydraulic "fists" allow the Lankrieger to thrive in close combat and use nearby objects and weapons as thrown projectiles."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Die Siedler von Catan: Hochzeitsturm
description:
The Hochzeitsturm (Wedding Tower) is a new tile to replace the desert tile. If a 7 is rolled the usual rule applies but also every player with a settlement or city next to the Hochzeitsturm gains one resource of where the robber is placed.

It is part of a die-cut sheet, 20 Jahre Darmstadt Spielt. To mark his 20th anniversary the play group "Spielekreis Darmstadt" published a die-cut sheet with mini expansions to five popular games:

• Carcassonne
• Hugo, das Schlossgespenst (aka: Midnight Party)
• Die Siedler von Catan (aka: The Settlers of Catan)
• Village Port
• Zooloretto

The die-cut sheet was sold during the event "Darmstadt plays" from Nov. 15 through 16, 2014 and before that at the fair "Spiel" in Essen from Oct. 16 through 19, 2014 at the magazine "Spielerei".
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Siege of the Citadel: Luna PD Expansion
description:
In this expansion you'll discover arch villain Von Hölle a Bauhaus scientist who was corrupted by the power of the Symmetry and now leads a formidable cult of Heretics determined to bring down humanity from within. Players get a 7th faction - Luna PD and Freelancers to mix and match and you've got great new rules to add even greater challenges!

This expansion for Siege of the Citadel will let you play out early events where the heroes of Luna City first discover the corruption of the Dark Symmetry or you can be fighting the full power of the Dark Apostle Ilian as she vies for control of Luna City whilst the Siege of the Citadel is in full swing.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Timeline: Slovensko
description:
Timeline: Slovensko is a card game played using 110 cards. Each card depicts an event on both sides, with the year in which that it occurred on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

Timeline: Slovensko adds cards with events from Slovakia and can be combined with any other title in the Timeline series.

name: No Llamas
description:
Be the first person to collect 3 llama tokens in this card game of llamas on the loose from Ridley's Games! There's more than one way to win in this fun and fast-paced original card game. Play your llamas together to form herds, be the first to lose your llamas, or play the best llamas to win! Match or beat the llama card on the discard pile by playing a single card or starting a herd with more than one matching llama card. Try to win the round by being the first player to discard all of your cards, playing a card that no one else can match or beat, or by playing the fourth card of a kind to complete a herd.

—description from the publisher

name: Atol
description: In Atol, players are marine biologists cataloging species in a newly discovered Atoll. During the game, players flip a card with two sea animals and write one them down on their sheet trying to complete objectives. At the end of the game, the player who best catalogs the Atoll after 28 rounds is the winner!

name: 20 Jahre Darmstadt Spielt
description:
A set of small promo expansions in honour of the 20-year jubilee of Darmstadt Spielt. It was available at the event and can still (June 2015) be ordered via their homepage. This contains:

Hugo das Schlossgespenst: Gruselplättchen
Carcassonne: Darmstadt
Zooloretto: Langer Ludwig
Die Siedler von Catan: Hochzeitsturm
Village Port: Schatzkiste

name: InStructures
description: A party game where 2 teams race against each other to be the first to build a structure with the blocks provided, but only their “Foremen” get to see the blueprint. Good verbal communication is the key to winning! The game is full of interesting challenges to keep it fresh every time such as: silent foreman, memory challenge, blind foreman and a timed challenge.
publishers: Fundex, Jane's Games, Marban Industries, Inc.

name: Bethump'd with Words: Discovery Edition
description:
From the publisher:
...This edition of Bethump'd with Words is expressly designed for parents and children, teachers and students to play together. It tests strategy skills and knowledge of everyday words, including many from the lingo of today's youth, and will entertain and challenge both participating age groups. It enables teachers to stretch brain muscles while stimulating a strong interest in words, language, and, ultimately, reading.

name: Transformers Trading Card Game: Bumblebee vs Megatron Starter Set
description:
The Transformers Trading Card Game is a battling card game designed for two players. Players build a team of Transformers character cards and power them up with a customizable deck of battle cards. Transformers character cards are twice the size of standard playing cards; they can be flipped from bot mode to alt mode and back, and they feature premium printing treatment on one of their sides. The deck of battle cards features Action and Upgrade cards to enhance Transformers character cards.

This BUMBLEBEE VS MEGATRON Starter Set contains cards for 2 players to begin the action.

For full gameplay, 2 players can add cards from Transformers TCG Booster Packs, or 1 player can use these BUMBLEBEE VS MEGATRON Starter Set cards right out of the box.

Contents:
4 Foil Transformers Character Cards
Ready-to-Play Deck of 40 Battle Cards
Damage Counters
Rules Insert
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Avignon: Indulgence Pack 2
description:
Six new cards that can be added to Avignon: A Clash of Popes or Avignon: Pilgrimage.

Cards included are:

Archbishop x 2
The Archbishop is in the Bishop faction.

Sister x 2
Sisters are in the Peasant faction.

Swiss Guard x2
Swiss Guards are in the Inquisitor faction.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Print & Play, Religious

name: Ordered Witch
description:
Ordered Witch is a fast board game for families for children that are around 4 years old.

We are little witches who need to sort the magic items that have escaped from their cupboards.

Will you be the first witch to climb to the top of the tower?

On our turn we can play a family (by item or by color) or we can play a wand to other player (wands have negative effects).

When we complete a family we gain 1 point and when we have no cards in hands we gain as points as families are in the table.

The objective is to climb to the top of the tower (15 points).

-description from publisher

name: Heroclix Outdoor Adventure Kit
description:
This is an expansion for the Heroclix miniatures game. These objects cost nothing to use.

Contents:

1 Double-Sided Map: convention center and construction site
4 Object Figures: light post, crate, dumpster and mailbox
3 Double-Sided Scenario Cards
1 Rules Sheet
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Age of Towers: To The Rescue
description:
The To The Rescue expansion for Age of Towers combines all non exclusive Kickstarter stretch goals in one package.

Contents:

The City of the Wetlands contains all items for adding a fifth (or sixth if you also own 'The Winx' expansion) player to your games of Age of Towers. This includes an extra player board, a set of extra crystals, three two-part towers in the three colours, extra basic monsters, ...
8 special building miniatures with their quest cards. Including 2 new Sacred Stone mini's.
1 Mini Boss: The Dragon
5 Mercenaries with their cards and meeples
New event cards
New quest cards
Rulebook in English
Rulebook in French
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Movement, Network and Route Building, Take That, Worker Placement

name: 워드캡처 티키타카 (Word Capture Tiki-Taka)
description:
Word Capture Tiki-Taka needs speed and wit. This game for 3-6 player, and takes 10 minutes to play.

In Word Capture Tiki-Taka players has to call an associated word following the calling condition. But be aware of calling with another player at the same time unless you might get a penalty point.

To set up, shuffle 60 subject cards and make a face-down deck on the middle of the table and turn the rest back to the box.

When the game begins, one of the players turns the card over and puts it on the table so every player can see the Symbol on the deck and the subject on the front of the card.

All players must check the subject of the symbol matching the dummy on the card just released and shout out the words related to the subject to the letter condition.

If you succeed in saying a word alone, you get a point, and if you shout word at the same time as someone else, you get a minus point.

When the pile of cards in the middle of the table runs out, the person with the most points wins.

name: Fishfry
description:
A fishing dice game using 5 custom engraved dice. Players have three rolls to catch a fish by rolling a head, a tail (worth 10 points together), and various sized bodies that add to the score of the fish. The goal is to catch and score the largest fish possible. Players have to choose which dice to keep and which dice to re-roll on their second and third rolls. One side of the dice contains a small panfish, which is worth only one point, and cannot be re-rolled. However, if a player manages to roll all 5 panfish, the player proclaims a FISHFRY! and the other players have to "FRY-UP" their fish. Players often have the choice to push their luck, and try for larger fish.
The game plays well as a quick pass-time or as a gambling game with a little more strategy than other simple gambling dice games. Included are rules for one-round games, as well as multiple round fishing tournaments.

name: Lignum: Reserve Expansion
description: A mini expansion for Lignum that consists of 1 wooden disk in each player's color and a special rules supplement. This expansion allows for more accurate planning.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Worker Placement

name: Good Little Tricks
description:
Good Little Tricks is a compact trick-taking game for 2–5 players with a bespoke deck of 27 cards, split into 6 coloured suits of 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 cards.

The game is an ‘evasion’ game, similar to Hearts, in which the aim is to avoid taking cards, and while Good Little Tricks uses many of the conventions of standard trick-taking games it has some new tricks of its own!

“The highlight of the show.”
— Richard Breese, after playtesting the game at the UK Games Expo 2017

name: Das Magische Hexagon
description:
from translation:

Play Material

1 board
10 red and ten black Magicians
7 red and 7 black wisemen
1 red and one black marking stone

The Board

5 of the 61 fields show flames, respectively 10 are marked as red and black start fields.

The wisemen are imprinted on the underside with numerical values. These numerals indicate the valences. Three of the stones are worth a point.
Two count respectively for two points. Two stones are worth minus one point.

Each player receives the 10 magicians of his color and sets them on the appropriate colored start fields. The marking stones are set on the scoring section on the side. The wisemen are alternately placed. Red begins. The red player sets his own wiseman on an arbitrary free field.
Flame fields may not be occupied.

It is inserted concealed. The opponent may not see, which stone is placed. Also after the stone is set, it remains concealed for the remainder of the game. Neither may examine any of the stones, either his own or the opponents, after the placement phase.

Variant

The game placement can also occur openly. The valences of the wisdoms are revealed as they are placed. Afterwards, they remain concealed for the remainder of the game.

Movement

After all game stones in the game are inserted, the contest of the magicians begins. Alternately each player moves. Red begins. He can only move his magicians.

The magicians have three movement possibilities. In each round a movement can occur in only one of these three ways.

1. He may move his magician one square in any neighboring direction, pushing opponents figures accordingly, including the wisdom pieces, most desirably into the flame fields.

2. With his own magician he may jump over an adjacent game stone, whether it is his own or his opponents, or a magician or a wisdom.
Multiple jumps are allowed. Also one can change direction during such a jump.

3. The magician moves between Space and Time. If one's magician stands at the board's edge, so one can move out from the square and emerge on the opposite side of the board again. A player can push another piece over the edge to the other side.

It is not allowed, to move figures off the edge of the board and back to their old places.

One can move magicians through fire spaces and they may also stand there. One's own wisdoms may not be pushed in the fire. Foreign wisdoms are burnt immediately, taken from the game and immediately scored.

Scoring is determined by the opponents wisdoms, which are pushed in the flame fields. The points are indicated on the scales at the board edge.

As soon as a player has burnt wisdoms of the adversary that are worth five points, the game is finished and the appropriate player is victorious. Return to Main Email me.

name: Lay an Egg
description:
From the box: The all-family game that will give you lots of cackles. As the chicken goes around in a circle, the player that makes her lay the most eggs wins. It's Grade AA fun for everyone Ages 5 and up

As the chick approaches your egg basket you push a button to make her lay an egg. If the player times his push right the chicken will swivel its rear and an egg will drop out of its body.

The chicken even makes a clucking noise as it goes around in a circle...
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic, Farming

name: Moscow '41
description: A double-blind wargame offering an operational treatment of Operation Typhoon, the German drive toward Moscow. This unusual game uses no counters. Instead, the players mark unit fronts on a plastic map overlay.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Set-up

name: The Return of Heavyweight Champ!
description:
The goal of this game is to pick one of the ten pre-made boxers and attempt to climb to the rank of Heavyweight Champion of the World.

Boxers have basic ratings of skill, punching power, and defense. In any given month, assuming you aren't nursing some sort of injury or voluntarily training, you are randomly assigned an opponent according to your current experience level. You the take on that opponent in an extremely quick fight... it should last only 2-3 minutes. Based on the outcome, you may have advanced a few levels, earned some money, and pocketed some points to use for later training.

The cool thing about this game is that the fight purse is dependent upon your level, your opponents level, and whether or not it is some sort of title match (British, Commonwealth, European, or World).

name: Super Sharp Pencil & Paper Games
description:
This pocket book is the American edition of "Giocare con Carta e Matita" and collects 39 games to be played with paper & pencil (out of the original 50 of the Italian edition). Some of them are traditional, some are invented by more or less famous authors, a couple appear for the first time. A second section with a few strategy and tactics notes is included.

In 2003 the book has been reprinted under the title of "Mind-Sharpening Logic Games".

In 2008 an enlarged and revised edition appeared in Italian in 2008 as 101 giochi con carta e matita (ed. Sonda), while a reduced one for children with rewriteable boards has been published in the same year by Editoriale Scienza as "Battaglia navale e altri giochi con carta e matita".
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Book, Deduction, Educational, Math, Maze, Number, Word Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition
publishers: Elle Di Ci, Portal Games, Sterling Publishing Co.

name: Senlac Hill: The Battle of Hastings 1066
description: In 1066 Saxon King Harold force-marched his army up to York and fought a battle at Stamford Bridge that ended the Viking era in England. He then turned around and force-marched back to the south of England to fight the Normans at Hastings. Unfortunately, after trudging 250 miles in nine days, his soldiers spent the night before the battle singing and drinking instead of resting. Senlac Hill is Norman Smith's nicely done desktop published simulation of the 1066 Battle of Hastings. Emphasis is on disordering the enemy. Good rules covering archers and feigned cavalry attacks. Scenarios include the historical set up with the Saxons waiting on Senlac Ridge and the Normans formed up in the valley below, an alternative scenario that allows the Normans more freedom in deploying their army and one that gives Harold the option of moving down onto the valley floor to force the Normans to fight across boggy ground. One 11.5x16.5 inch game map, 140 counters that have to be mounted and cut-out.

name: Enlightenment
description:
Players gather "pearls of wisdom" to allow them to progress through different levels of consciousness, the first to reach the Enlightenment Space is the winner.

Pearls of wisdom are acquired by accomplishing tasks on Truth and Wisdom cards, by acting based upon Harmony and Hazard card instructions, and being affected by Karma cards.

name: Ætherverse
description:
From the publisher - ÆTHERVERSE: The Infinite Game of Miniature Battles Now available from Triskele Game Design Studios, Ætherverse is a science-fantasy miniature wargame with infinite possibilities. It's set in a sci-fi universe where the theory of multiple universes was proven to be true... and proving it set off wars across the Ætherverse by opening up new avenues of conquest. This backdrop provides limitless freedom to create worlds and armies, and to fight out wars between universes on your tabletop.

Ætherverse includes background material on over a dozen of these universes and the dominant empires on the Earth in each. The core rulebook includes 17 army lists, featuring the armies of these nations and races. Fifteen battle scenarios are also included to give you reasons to fight.

One of the key features of Ætherverse is the Army Creation System. Designed to allow the player to field any army they can possibly imagine, the Army Creation System presents a set of rules for creating an army from complete scratch. Design an army list to feature any miniatures in your collection and to play battles from anywhere within your imagination. Ætherverse gives you this freedom. There is no limit on what you can create
categories: Ancient, Fantasy, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Diceman
description:
The five issues of "Diceman" were magazine games published using characters from the British anthology comic "2000AD." Each issue contained three solitaire games starring characters such as Judge Dredd, Nemesis the Warlock, Slaine, and Rogue Trooper.

The games followed programmed story lines and were based, essentially, on a paragraph system - except, instead of paragraphs, the player was directed to illustrated panels. Each game contained all the rules necessary to play - generally combat rules and record-keeping - and was a self-contained adventure for one.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: World At War Expansion
description:
An expansion for Xeno's The World at War. Features new technologies, new ways of conducting strategic bombing, convoy routes, new industrial options, and more. Comes with rules, charts, and a new map of the world.

Expands:

The World at War
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II

name: 4th Street Baseball
description:
4th Street Baseball is a baseball simulation game using individual ratings to recreate big league baseball action. Ratings are printed in booklet format on perforated cardstock. They measure 3.5" x 2.5" (the same size as a bubble-gum card).
The game starts with the pitcher. Each pitcher is rated for his ability to get the ball over the plate, the likelihood of him giving up the long ball, walk to strikeout ratio, hits allowed, etc.
Each hitter has been rated for average, extra-base potential, strikeouts and walks, base running, stealing, bunting, and lefty-righty hitting. In addition, pitchers and hitters are rated for defensive range, error frequency, outfielder-catcher arms, and infielders ability to turn the double play.
Five dice are employed in 4th Street Baseball...one twenty-sided (d20), two ten-sided (d10), and two six-sided (d6).
Play starts by determining the count. The two d10 are rolled and the count is determined by looking at the pitcher's count column. If the pitcher gets ahead in the count, his ratings, along with all of the defensive players behind him, increase. If he falls behind, then the increase is instead given to the hitter. The defense is allowed to position its players and selects a strategy card (fastball, breaking ball, pitchout, etc.). The offense, likewise, selects a strategy card (hit and run, steal, etc.). All five dice are rolled, the strategy cards are revealed, and the play continues by finding a "matchup" on the pitcher's card. Matchups vary from balls hit to a specific fielder, to batter-pitcher battles, to ballpark and defensive positioning effects. Once a matchup has been determined, the defender's rating is subtracted from the hitter's rating and the result is compared to the d20. If the result is less than or equal to the d20, the hitter wins the matchup and the final result of the play is read off the hitter by adding the two d6 and referring to the appropriate column. If the d20 result is higher, then the play result is found similarly on the defensive player.

The game comes with a book (or two books, depending upon the season) full of baseball player ratings which are perforated to 2.5" x 3.5" (the same size as a bubble-gum card), baseball fields (printed on 8.5" x 11" card stock, for each team), dice, strategy cards, an easy-to-read results chart, and score sheets. All players are rated for the 2005 season, except those with less than 25 at bats or innings pitched, or pitchers who had 2 or less starts.

name: Star Fleet Battles Supplement #3: Fast Patrol Ships
description:
The third expansion for the Star Fleet Battles Commander's Edition, adding rules for the Fast Patrol Ships (or P/F's: from Pseudo Fighters in the Designer's Edition).

Includes Patrol Ships and Interceptors for the Klingons, Romulans, Kzinti, Gorn, Tholians, Orion Pirates, Hydrans, Lyrans, WYN, and ISC. It also has the projected P/F's for the Federation if they had built them.

Includes a 32 page SSD book, a 16 page rule/scenario book, and 216 die-cut counters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Battles of the Middle Ages: Lake Peipus
description:
Second game in the battle of the middle ages series, on one of the most famous battle of all the Baltic region history, immortalized by Eisenstein Alexander Nevskji
It uses a chit activation system and a partially randomized method of combat resolution (ie, units are rated for level, but the real strength of the unit is discovered only when it comes to fight for the first time).

Contains:
11 x 17" full color map (2 - 8.5 x 11" parts)
216 counters
Rules in English

Available for print & play download through www.wargamedownloads.com and
www.arima.it

Also available in printed version through Boulder Games and Noble Knight Games

name: Cordoba
description: Jews, Muslims and Christians live together in 10th century Cordoba. The players try to move their playing pieces, each of which represents two of those three religions, beyond the far side of the game board. When a player manages to get two of the same religious symbols onto the same space, all other playing pieces with this symbol (of either player) have to move backwards.

name: Diamonds
description:
Diamonds is a baseball game from the perspective of the team manager. Each manager has a set of player cards, each with individual skills ratings. Players determine the batting order and starting pitcher. As the game plays out, players can make substitutions and other managerial decisions.

The game is sold both as a Basic Edition, with 4 different teams, and a League Edition with 6 teams and un-laminated player cards (so that managers can name their own players). Both use the same rules.

The game contains four or six 25-card team decks, several other play cards, a sheet of uncut markers, and four dice.

name: Mein Mäuschen-Farbspiel
description:
Roll dice, cover plates, hide the little mice - the first game of the color-learning with fun and exercise.
Five colored fabric mice meet at the game board on which a picnic blanket is shown. In addition, a mouse-hole is made of soft fabric material. Once a child rolls the mouse icon, a stuffed animal squeezes through the hole in the "real world". Then the child seeks a hiding place for his rodent. It must find an object in the room in the color of the mouse and then put the animal below it or behind it. When all the mice are gone and on every plate is the right food, the children take the rodents out of their hiding places and the picnic begins.

name: Parsec Expansion Kit 1: Moons and Monsters
description:
There are plenty of new discoveries at your Homeworld! Several more ships have joined the exploration fleet, along with the discoveries of treacherous black holes and space warps. A "Golden" planet has also been discovered, somewhere among several moons and dangerous asteroid fields. But, most importantly, there is a rumor floating about of terrible creatures living in the vacuum of space, with an insatiable appetite for robots! Of course, those are just rumors. . .

This expansion kit for PARSEC allows players to discover more space around Homeworld, with additional rules, counters, and cards to enhance your Outer Space explorations!

Note: This Expansion Kit is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of PARSEC to use it.

Game Data:

Number of Players: 2, 3 or 4
Ages: 10 and up
Playing Time: approximately 90 minutes
Complexity: 2 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 3 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each player commands a ship full of robots exploring the space around their declining homeworld

Game Components:

• One Expansion #1 Rulesheet
• 18 additional Space Hex Tiles
• 2 Ship counters (1 of each color)
• 32 Robot counters (16 of each color)
• 4 Space Monster counters
• 6 Destroyed Moon markers
• 2 "5" credits
• 5 additional Nanotech cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Alpha Centauri
description:
Year 2728. Modern scientific technologies are combined with an environmental disaster, lack of resources and constant wars. Earth survives its last decades, and mankind is divided into four warring superpowers: the Russian-Chinese Empire, the Ukrainian Europia, US-Japan alliance and the Latin-African confederation. Last forces of world governments are thrown on the creation of space expedition in the region of the constellation, Alpha Centauri, where people found everything needed to create new human settlements. Are you one of those who will lead one of the expeditions and do everything possible to ensure that the descendants remember you as a person, not only as a founder of a new home for one of the superpowers of the forgotten past, but also who made it the most powerful.

"Alpha Centauri" is an abstract filler based on a bluff. The game lasts for eight rounds, each generally has a winner. During each round cards are played face down on any planet they want(each rounds has its different planets equal number of players). There are 3 main types of cards, which are terraforming cards, event cards and colonist cards (1 for each player). Player who places his colonist on the most "green" planet wins the round, all cards except colonist are discarded after and players gain new cards for next round. At the end of 8th round players count victory points.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Memory

name: Cadwallon: City of Thieves – Magic
description: Magic is bonus downloadable content for Cadwallon: City of Thieves that adds four potent new Equipment cards to your gang’s race for loot! Featuring a range of magical effects and the variant rules to use them, Magic brings even more variety to your nightly illicit activities.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Spinimax
description:
Spinimax is a three-player game for the Shibumi set.

The board starts empty. Players take turns adding a piece of their colour to an empty board cell.

Whenever a 2x2 platform is formed, at any level, then a piece is placed on top, its colour being the minority colour in the 2x2 platform (if any) otherwise the majority colour.

The winner is the owner of the piece placed at the apex of the pyramid on the final move.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

name: Splastwo
description:
Splastwo is a simple two-player game, playable with the Series: Shibumi game system. It uses the 4×4 board, 15 white balls and 15 black ones.

Rules

The players draw lots to their colour. White colour starts.

The board starts empty. Two players, white and black, take turns placing a single ball, or two balls in a line or three balls in a line – orthogonal, contiguous and at the same level - of their colour, either on empty board holes or stacking on 2×2 platforms of existing balls.

A player scores one point when he completes the first, the second or the third level, and two points when he puts the last ball of the pyramid, thus completing the fourth level.

Players are not allowed to pass and if a player has not legal moves the other player ends the game by placing his remaining balls to complete the pyramid.

The game ends when the board is full with the 30 balls and the winner is the player with the highest score.

The game can’t end in a draw.

Rules for this game are included in the soft cover Shibumi Rule Book

name: Hunt or Gather
description:
SURVIVE THE WINTER...
Hunt rabbits and squirrels. Fight wolves and boar. Forage for nuts and herbs. Hunt efficiently. Know when to hoard your bounty or race back to the village when the need is greatest. Survive the winter and live another summer.

HUNT OR GATHER...
Hunt or Gather is a fast paced and exciting blend of strategy, memory, and dice rolling fun. Each player gets to control two characters, a hunter and a gatherer. Those characters must pool their resources, because in the end only the weaker of the two counts.

Characters set out from the village, hoping to collect plants or hunt animals. With success, their territory grows making it easier to find the path home. If they fail, they may leave with their life if it's a harmless deer, bunny or squirrel, but death is instant if they roll poorly against a deadly bear, wolf, or boar. Good thing they have a lot of cousins to take their place, so you can set off again and keep playing.

name: Octopus' Garden: Coconut Octopus
description:
A promotional expansion for Octopus' Garden.

Beauty Score 1. Add 1 Coconut Octopus into the tile pool for each player. The Octopus is Planted as a normal tile, with the non-hiding side facing up. At any point later in the game, after Planting and before Move Sea Stars, the player may reorganize any or all tiles which are touching the Octopus. The Octopus is then turned over to display the hiding side, and may not be used again during the game. If either a Seagrass or Anemone is moved this way, placed Seahorse(s) and Clownfish remain in the Garden even if their initial placement conditions no longer exist.

name: Don't Get Mad
description:
Don't Get Mad is an exciting, fast moving game where all players must stake points from the cards in their 'hand' on the outcome of general knowledge questions - or - on a unique variety of dice rolls. There are over 1,000 great questions from 70 wide ranging categories where most questions offer multiple choices. But before a player stakes any points, all they will know on any question, is its subject and how many possible choices there are! The most unusual (mischievous) quirk allows players to choose whether they wish to Play or to Pass (to an opponent) or to make challenges. Whatever the 'in-player' decides to do, they will always decide on the number of points that are to be staked. Unlike; with most other board game 'classics'; no player can ever go 'OUT' of the game until the game is fully over!

Players: 2-6 or teams.

name: REVOLVIQA Red
description:
REVOLVIQA

RevolvIQa, the revolving game series debuted in Nürnberg Toy Fair 2013. It’s basis is an innovation: playing piece supported revolving mechanism. The supporter is a playing piece onto which a constituted bottom surface in the middle of the revolving device is laid upon. A playing piece supported revolving device can make 6 playing pieces step at once.
RevolvIQa Red and RevolvIQa Blue are two independent games, packed into independent boxes, however these ones are intending to be an overture of revolving game series.
In a RevolvIQa box there are 3 individual games: 2 pcs. revolving puzzle games in varied difficulty levels (1 player) and 1 pc. revolving board game (2 players). Playing adventure and rules are varied, however a.m. structure is the same in both RevolvIQa boxes.
Play with revolving puzzles first:
the basic idea here is to have different coloured balls as a „pixel” of a pic on a playing field. The playing field plate is removable and exchangable. It has a hexagonal shape and it is hole-punched at 37 places in bee-cells pattern. It is to be put onto a basic board having 37 spheric recesses in the same pattern area. After pouring the required balls onto field, revolve until all the coloured balls match with the colours of the graphic. Starting with any ball arrangement results solution! A „Fox” and a „Galaxy” in RevolvIQa Red, a „Parachute” and a „Birthday” in RevolvIQa Blue is available as main theme on graphics of the playing fields.
Play with board games next:
There are equal starting chance arrangements for both players and one after the other order playable games by immediate revolving in both RevolvIQa board games.
Player wins, who revolves 5 in one row of its chosen coloured balls at first: that’s the board game about in RevolvIQa Red. Defeat arrives as magic touch in most of the cases. It’s name: „COLORICA-5”.
Player wins in board game of RevolvIQa Blue, whose all chosen 4 ferries are able to cross the sea first, or the one, whose opponent can’t revolve rule-wise anymore. It’s wintertime and some areas in the sea is frozen (white balls on the board). Revolving rules: revolve on water only (support on dark blue balls only), at least one of revolving player’s ferries shall change place during revolving action, the opponent’s can be revolved at the same time, but only if opponent’s previous revolving action took place elsewhere. Captivating and exciting. It’s name: „FERRY”.


REVOLVIQA Red
3 games in the box: Fox, Galaxy, COLORICA-5

Revolving puzzle and board games that are developing creativity and logical and strategic skills for 1 or 2 players, children or adults.
Description
Fox

Revolving puzzle games that are developing creativity and logical skills for 1 player, children or adults. Revolve so that the colored balls could get into their position!

Galaxy
