Revolving puzzle games that are developing creativity and logical skills for 1 player, children or adults. Revolve so that the colored balls could get into their position!

COLORICA-5

Games developing logical and strategic skills for two players. The purpose of the game is that one of the players should be able to revolve five balls next to each other, in one line.

name: Noble Blood
description:
from publishers website

Noble Blood is a game of vampire herd management and minion acquisition. Players take on the roles of vampire lords vying for control of their city. In order to win the game, players will compete to accrue the most bountiful herd of humans to feed on and create a team of vampire minions capable of earning you the power and influence you will need to come out on top.

Play centers around vampires taking turns drafting humans from a central 'City' area consisting of 6 or 8 cards. Once taken, humans become part of your herd and can be fed on (feeding on humans does not kill them) or turned into vampire minions(each card has a human side and a vampire side). Every action in the game requires the expenditure of blood, so it is important to have plenty of big humans to feed on. But it is also important to turn members of your herd into vampire minions that might have a good turn order, the right influence symbol, or a power that you need.

Each vampire gets its own turn and its own specific place in the turn order so every time a player makes a new vampire, he or she gets another turn every round. Each vampire is unique and most have some kind of special power that can be used to a players advantage.

At the end of the game players receive points for the number of vampires under their control, the amount of blood in their possession, and the amount of influence they have acquired.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Journey Stones
description:
North Atlantic circa 900 CE

The Celts fought at sea for many years to prevent the Vikings from invading their lands. Set sail to sink your opponent’s ships. Gather your ships together to form fleets with greater striking range. Reveal your journey stones, hidden in two of your ships, at the right moment for a surprise attack.

Journey Stones is a two player viking themed strategy game where players attempt to sink opponent's ships. Each side moves, captures, and stacks tiles while maneuvering them to victory. Journey Stones is a chess/checkers style game with alternating turns of 1 action per player.

name: Banjooli Xeet: Kanasu
description:
A MINI-EXPANSION FOR BANJOOLI XEET:

"The more experienced voices of the Noamomi tribe tell that years ago, after the nine-hundredth and first ostrich race (in which, almost everybody shoud know Xultu shaman became winner), the breeders realized that one of them hadn’t reached the goal. They searched every corner of the Village in vain as they didn’t hear from kanasu ostrich again …

… until the penultimate race, in which many attendees noticed that there were six ostriches running on the dry river bed, what came as a total surprise for the quiet Noamomi. However, old Xewwi instantly comprehended what was happening. Kanasu had returned to run after been missing for years, who knows which cruel spell of the shaman apprentices had been cast?....
And something in his eyes indicated that he would no longer be scared of anything or anyone."

This expansion consists of a single ostrich that sometimes joins the race. It cannot be scared, and if it reaches the finish, no player gains points for it.


“Cuentan las voces mas experimentadas de la tribu Noamomi que años atrás, tras la noningentesimoprimera carrera de avestruces (en la que, como todo el mundo debería saber, resultó ganador el brujo Xultu), los criadores descubrieron que una de ellas no había llegado a la meta. Buscaron por todos los rincones de la aldea en vano, ya que nunca mas se volvió a saber del avestruz Kanasu...

...Hasta la penúltima carrera, en la que muchos de los presentes advirtieron que llegó a haber seis avestruces corriendo en el cauce seco del río, lo que sorprendió a los tranquilos Noamomi. Sin embargo,el anciano Xewwi, comprendió lo que pasaba al instante. Kanasu, había vuelto a correr tras pasar años desaparecida, quién sabe por cuál de los crueles sortilegios de los aprendices de brujo... Y algo en su mirada señalaba que ya no se iba a asustar de nada, ni nadie.”
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Maciejowice 1794
description:
Maciejowice 1794 depicts the last battle of Thaddeus Kosciuszko. Poles were opposed by a Russian Army led by general Ivan Fersen. Mechanics of the game are based on random leader activations that decide sequence in which units fire, perform movement and melees. Almost all units can participate in ranged combat, not only activated ones, so the battle can rage on all parts of the map. Many rules are identical to Szczekociny 1794 ruleset - additional rules include Limbered Artillery, effectiveness of first salvo, firing upon enemy from rear or flank and collapse of fighting units.

Scale of the game:
Infantry - companies
Cavalry - squadrons
Artillery - batteries of 2 to 6 guns
One hex - 100 meters
One turn - 15 minutes

name: Pixel Lincoln: Re-Election
description:
The year is 2013. It's been 150 years since RoBooth was defeated at the great Battle of Gettysburger, and things are finally back to normal. Pixel Lincoln is running for president once again, but has a new thorn in his side…. multiple versions of his 16-bit self. It's weird, confusing and retro! Which Lincoln will become president? Which Lincoln is the real deal? Who has the better Beardarang?

Oh, and Lincoln's hat is missing again and the world is doomed again with all of that time travel stuff….

Pixel Lincoln: Re-Election is a 4-part expansion to Pixel Lincoln: The Deckbuilding Game, consisting of new abilities, card types and game modes, but with a whole bunch of what we already know and love: Items, Enemies, Bosses, Mini-Bosses, Characters, Secret Items, and more!

This expansion was designed for the people.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme

name: Charków 1942-1943
description:
This is another game of "Great Battles" (WB-95) system which allows 2-6 Players to play German and Soviet operations in summer 1942 and winter 1943. This is second, much enhanced edition of the game that was issued back in 1998.

Game allows to play the fights that occurred during Soviet winter offensive in 1941/1942 and German counter attack that destroyed the pocket and begun the march towards Stalingrad in 1942. Those battles were very intense and maneuver ones due to vast areas and relatively small number of units on both sides.

Second set of scenarios allow to play German counterattack in winter 1943. This one led by elite SS corps broke Soviet defenses and recaptured Kharkov and Belgorod in March 1943. The success of the operation created the silent within one major city inside - Kursk.

name: Stalingrad Cauldron: Decision on the Volga, 1942-43
description:
Stalingrad Cauldron (SC) is purpose-designed solitaire wargame that covers the fighting in the areas of German Army Groups A and Don from the time of Sixth Army’s encirclement late in November 1942 through to its destruction at the end of January 1943. The single player actively commands the Soviet forces, while the rules system directs the player in the deployment of the Axis (German, Italian and Hungarian) forces. The player wins by accumulating victory points by achieving the destruction of Sixth Army’s component corps and the seizure of key areas around the map.

Magazine: World at War #40

name: Town Center: Essen / SPIEL
description:
Town Center: Essen / SPIEL is comprised of four double-sided player boards, with the all-new, limited edition Essen and SPIEL maps. There's also an A5-sized rulesheet/cover that explains the special rules of each map.

Both maps pay homage to the home of all of boardgamedom, that former industrial city by the Rhine, and the world-famous SPIEL fair. Essen is a spread-out urban/sub-urban environment with a distinct value placed on available parking spots, while SPIEL is divided into three large halls with very limited space in which to move around.

Join us in Essen / SPIEL and enjoy Town Center!

name: Mob Town: City Limits
description:
The City Limits expansion adds additional Landmarks, Professionals, and City Cards to Mob Town. It also adds a new set of cards called "Breaking News" which introduces a new element to each round, specifically in the last 10 cards of the draw deck.

Includes:
10 Breaking News cards
18 Landmark cards
20 Professional cards
22 City cards
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Set Collection

name: Sleeping Dragon, Rising Sun: A Companion for In Her Majesty's Name
description: With new equipment, Talents, Mystical Powers, scenario options and a host of Adventuring Companies, Sleeping Dragon, Rising Sun reveals the mysteries of the East to players of In Her Majesty's Name. In the West, the Great Powers send their agents into the ailing Austro-Hungarian and Ottoman empires but stop short of overt acts of aggression. In the East, however, conflicts between rival factions regularly erupt into open warfare. In India, the British Raj faces the machinations of rebellious maharajahs, Russian agents and a resurgent Thuggee cult. In China, the Celestial Court weaves a complex web of plots and alliances to counter both the external threat of the Great Powers and the internal menaces of mutinous warlords and an ancient power that has arisen and seeks to return to the Jade Throne. Across the pirate-infested South China Sea, Japan has established itself as a new Great Power and is starting to forge its own empire despite unrest from rebels and insurgents at home. Throughout the entire region treasure-seekers, mercenaries and adventurers of all stripes take advantage of the chaos to seek glory and riches.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: La Vie est une Jungle: Trahir est un plaisir
description:
A trivia game where you can team up for a while with another player to answer the questions together and advance twice faster.
The twist is that the first one to break the alliance will continue alone, while the unfortunate partner will be send with the last player on the board...

name: Monstre toi!
description:
Did you know your home is full of cunning little monsters whose idea of fun is to niggle you every day?
Team up with other learner catchers and use your powers of observation and your memory to catch all the monsters hiding in your home without falling into the traps laid by the Monster Chief!

The game is played in a team, everyone against the monsters, and has three rounds. During each round, the hunters must put at least 9 monsters in a cage in under 5 minutes. A round must be won to become better catcher and go on to the next round.

Win stripes and new powers to become an illustrious “Monster Frightener”.

Monstre is an exciting party game for budding monster catchers.
Its stickers glow so it can be played in the dark!

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Constellation Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for the "The Doomsday Machine" episode Organized Play event.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Lords of War: Templars versus Undead – Return Fire Booster Pack
description:
Containing 10 Kickstarter exclusive reinforcements cards:

2 backwards-firing Templar Longbows
2 backwards-attacking Templar Trebuchets
1 backwards-attacking Templar Longsword
2 backwards-firing Skeleton Archers
2 backwards-firing Plague Launchers
1 backwards-attacking Blood Golem
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Four Wizards
description:
Four Wizards is a new version of a classic card-shedding game. Players draw and discard their way to an empty hand, laying down a variety of cards designed around a medieval theme. Each deck comes with 72 cards and supports a game of 2-4 players. Included are 48 Medieval Unit Cards (4 Colored Factions: Blue Cross, Green Star, Red & Gold, and Purple Chevron).

In addition to the 48 Unit cards, there are 16 Wizards (4 different classes for each colored faction), and 6 Plague Cards. Plague Cards do not belong to any color; therefore, they cannot be discarded, ONLY PURGED. Plague Cards were created to prevent you from getting rid of all your cards. There are several ways to remove these cards from your hand (see Wizard Cards). Part of the fun is discovering these various methods of "purging" the Plague.

Wizard Cards are played in the same manner as the other Colored Units. For example, a Blue Wizard can be played on top of any Blue Unit or on top of any other Wizard. There are four types of Wizard Cards, each with their own unique action.

Swap-A-Hand Wizard - When you play this Wizard, swap your hand with the hand of another player. The choice of which player to Swap-A- Hand with is yours. Once the “swap” has occurred, play continues to the next player in turn.

Draw Two Wizard - When you play this Wizard, the next player must draw 2 cards. The player who draws the additional cards will still be able to play their turn. If they do not have a playable card after Drawing Two, they must continue to Draw until they draw a card that can be played. A turn is determined complete when a card has been played.

Purge-A-Card Wizard - When you play this Wizard, you may discard ANY card of your choice from your hand. Place the card of your choice facedown on the tabletop, thus removing it from the game completely. The card has now been PURGED.

Purge-The-Plague Wizard - When you play this Wizard, you may discard ONLY Plague Cards from your hand. However there is no limit to how many Plague Cards you can discard. Place the Plague Card(s) face up on the tabletop, thus removing it from the game completely. *The two "Purge" Wizard cards are the ONLY cards that can remove Plague Cards from your hand and therefore the game. Also important is the ability of the "Purge-A-Card" Wizard to remove ANY card from the game. The ability to remove Any card allows various opportunities to develop. In fact, sometimes the best play might not be to PURGE a Plague card. The choice is yours...

name: Run, Bug, Run!
description:
Welcome, bugs of the forest! This is the Centipede speaking, right from Racing Track. Today, on this sunny morning, I will be your host in this exciting new edition of the Spring Race!

This celebration pits the fastest, smartest and strongest amongst the denizens of the forest in an exciting race to be the 1st to cross the finish line. In order to win, contestants will have to use their wit, brawn and even the help of mighty allies!

So with the contestants already on their starting positions, let the countdown begin...3,2,1...or as we say:

'RUN, BUG, RUN!!!'

In “Run, Bug, Run!” players will compete to be the fastest bug in the yearly Spring Race. Each bug has different attributes and abilities, enabling different strategies in order to be the 1st one to cross the finish line. To do so, players will have to be faster than the others and spend wisely the leaves they gather on race cards, direct attacks and mighty special abilities. In addition, they can opt to check surprise locations, where they can earn extra powerful cards…or be awarded penalties for their avarice
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Environmental, Humor, Party Game, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Simulation, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Freak Shop: Card "13"
description:
A card "13", stronger than all the others. It's a big number, but it's not that much if we do not have anything else.
On the other hand it is a good way to get a lot of cards ... if indeed we want to leave this possibility to other players.

name: Kendo Duel
description:
Kendo Duel is a strategy card game that can be played in two game modes: the “Duel” and the “Competition”.

In “Duel” game mode 2-4 players can play together. They fight each other without drawing new cards during the game. The winner is the last player who has a card in one’s hand.

In the game mode “Competition” only 2 players can play and it is similar to a real kendo competition: the players can get ippons (points) and hansokus (penalty points), and the winner is the one who receives the second ippon (point) first.

CONTENTS

Attacking cards: MEN, KOTE, DO, TSUKI
(4×3: 12 cards) – in a brown frame
Counterattacking cards: the combinations of the basic attacks above (4×4: 16 cards)- in a brown frame
Reinforcing cards: JODAN, SEME (2×2: 4 cards) – in a red frame
Cards against reinforcing cards: MUSHIN, SEIGAN (2×2: 4 cards) – in a purple frame
Cards to defelct an attack: TAI SABAKI, KAMAE, FUDOSHIN (3×2: 6 cards) – in a blue frame
Cards to parry an attack: TSUBAZERIAI, BOGYO (2×3: 6 cards) – in a green frame
Alternative attacking cards: TAIATARI, MAKI AGE – (2×2:4 cards) – in a yellow frame
Ippon marks on one card (1 card): the marks to show the points must be cut out before the start
Penalty marks on one card (HANSOKU, 1 card): it must be also cut out before the start

---

I. RULES OF THE GAME MODE DUEL
- Cards needed: the whole deck except JIKAN DESU, HANSOKU marks, IPPON marks
- Number of players: 2-4
- Duration: 4-5 min. with 2 players

Starting the game
1. Before the start the following cards should be discarded from the deck: JIKAN DESU, HANSOKU marks, IPPON marks. The other cards should be divided into 3 subdecks:
a. Basic attacks (Men, Kote, Do, Tsuki)
b. Counterattacks
c. All other cards

These subdecks should be shuffled and placed to the marks on the gameboard face-down.

2. Deal 3x basic attacks (Men, Kote, Do, Tsuki), 4x counterattacks and 5x from the other cards to each player.
3. At the beginning, players can switch any 2 of their cards to other cards, each from its own subdeck. The new card should be drawn from the top of the subdeck and your switched card should be put under it. Switching a card is not compulsory.
4. Add the numbers on your basic attack cards: the player with a higher result starts the first attack. If more players got the same total, switch the card with the lowest number on it to a new one from its own subdeck. Examine your totals again.
5. You can start a new or first attack with the following cards and combinations:
- Men, Kote, Do, Tsuki attacks: a) alone or b) together with one reinforcing card (Jodan or Seme)
- Other attacking cards (Taiatari, Maki age). These two can only be played alone without reinforcing cards.
6. An attack aiming a certain part of the body can always be countered with a same attacking card or an appropriate counterattack card. For example, a single MEN attack can be countered with the same MEN card, or a counterattack, which answers, so starts with MEN. A counterattack can also be answered with another appropriate counterattack or single attack card, and so on.

However, if you answer a counterattack with a basic attack card, your opponent can then start a new attack and does not need to answer your card.

7. If you are attacked with a single attack with a MEN, KOTE… etc. or a counterattack; OR a basic attack reinforced with a JODAN or SEME card, you must always react to it.

- If you are attacked with a basic attack with a reinforcing card, you must react to the reinforcing one first. You can try to neutralize it, deflect or reflect it. If you can’t do any of these, your opponent pulls one card from you and can use it as one’s own.
- After reacting to a reinforcing card, you must react to the basic attack, too.
- If you can’t react to a MEN, KOTE, DO, TSUKI attack / counterattack, you lose two cards to your attacker.
- If you are attacked with a TAIATARI or MAKI AGE card, and you have no valid card against it, you lose one card to your opponent, which he or she may choose without seeing your cards.

8. If you lose a card to another player:
- in case of 2-3 players: it’s your turn to start a new attack against any of the other players;
- in case of 4 players: the player, who got your card can start a new attack, attacking anyone except you.
9. If you cannot react to an incoming attack, and have no cards to give away or to start with when it’s your turn, you lose the game. In case of 3-4 players playing, you drop out.

After you dropped out, your last attacker can draw one card from any of the subdecks as a bonus and can start a new attack.
When 3 players are in the game, the player who did not receive a bonus card starts the next attack.

10. If it is your turn to start an attack, but you don’t have any valid cards, you should discard one of your cards and draw a new one from the basic attacks subdeck and use that.
11. In case of 2-3 players: if you can react to an attack with a valid card, you are free to choose whom you would like to attack with your used card.

In case of 4 players: you cannot attack your attacker with a single basic or counterattack, except when you use a card that deflects or reflects an attack directly.

Hikiwake (draw): when 2 players play, the game ends in a draw if the last applied valid card of any of the players is a TSUBAZERIAI or a BOGYO. When more than 2 players play, in this case this player simply drops out.


II. RULES OF THE GAME VERSION – COMPETITION
Cards needed: all the cards
Number of players: only 2
Duration: 10-20 mins

Aim of the game:
The winner is the one who gets the second Ippon (point) first, or successfully plays the JIKAN DESU (Time’s over!) card.
It is considered as an IPPON (point) if a player cannot react to a basic or counterattack with a valid card OR has no more cards at all OR gets one’s second Hansoku or penalty points.
After an IPPON is awarded, all players draw as many new cards from any of the subdecks, that they have at least 6 cards in their hands. If you have more than 6, you can keep them but cannot draw more.

HANSOKU or penalty point must be given when:
1. ‘Stepping out of the court’: you couldn’t react to a TAIATARI card.
2. ‘Losing the sword’: you couldn’t react to a MAKI AGE card.
The second hansoku you suffer means an IPPON to your opponent, and this is marked with a „H” as an ippon for hansoku.
If it is your turn to start an attack but you have no valid card to do so, draw one card from the basic attacks subdeck and play that card.
After an IPPON is awarded or a HANSOKU is given, always the „unlucky” player starts a new attack.

GAMEPLAY
Rule to switch cards: Always before you play a card, you must switch one of your cards to a new one from any of the sub-decks (without showing). Put your old card under its own subdeck.

AND you must draw a new card from the Counterattacks or the Other Cards sub-deck. You cannot draw this new one from the basic attacks subdeck.

Exception to the rule: if you play a BOGYO or a TSUBAZERIAI card, an IPPON is awarded or a HANSOKU is given, you are not allowed to switch and draw again one after another. However, after an Ippon you can still draw cards until you have 6, as mentioned above. It means that if you get a HANSOKU or your opponent receives an IPPON because you have already switched and drawn, but still could not react, you are not allowed to switch and draw again. You must play a card directly from your actual hand.

Starting the game
At the beginning deal 2 cards from the basic attacks subdeck, 3 cards from the counterattacks, and 3 cards from the other cards subdeck to each player. During the game players play cards in turns according to the rules of the Duel mode and as well as the information written on the cards.

The first attacker is decided exactly the same way as in the Duel mode.
The differences between the Duel and the Competition:
The Competition is played with less cards in hand, and players switch and draw cards during the game, which is not possible during the Duel.
When you attack successfully during the Duel, you get cards from your opponent. During the Competition, you are awarded an Ippon or your opponent gets a penalty.
Gameboard: the divided subdecks must be placed on the marked places on the gameboard. The already played cards can be placed to the competition court.
In the Competition, the Ippon marks can be placed on the marked area ’Scores’ to show the points awarded.

name: BroWars: Prawo Pubów
description:
Description from the publisher:

BroWars is fast, simple and exciting drinking game that can be played at home or in the pub.

There are TWO different games inside the tube (the game comes in a cardboard tube!) with different set of rules and components. There are called Brewery Variant and Pub Variant.

In Brewery Variant players will compete in numerous quests to gather brewery tiles from the table. Each brewery tile has its color, logotype, cost and arrows in the bottom.

First player chooses one of available brewery tiles and has to pay its cost which he does by placing enough quest cards from his hand on the table. Then according to arrows on the tile he, his opponent or all players chose one of just placed quest cards. Players then compete in that quest and the winner gets to take the tile they competed over. The looser has to drink. Cards can be also played as special actions that will change conditions for the round.

At the end of the game players score points. 1 point for each collected brewery tile and bonus points for collected sets with similar color or logotype.

Pub variant is a bit more tactical. Each player gets 3 pub tiles and places them in front of him. Then everyone uses coin cards (with different values) and places them face-down below his pub tiles. Players have to defend those coins and steal other players' coins. In order to defend them each player puts 6 quest cards face down in front of their pubs.

During the game, a player chooses one of opponents' pubs that he wants to attack and has to initiate a quest duel depending on the cards that defends the pub. If successful, he then initiate another duel that protects that pub. Otherwise the defender takes up a turn. After beating all quest cards, attacker claims the defender's pub and all coins below. The game ends when one players is left with no pubs. Whoever has the most coins, wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: Second World War at Sea: Poland's Fantasy Fleet
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

Poland's Fantasy Fleet gives you the fleet the Polish admirals hoped to build in the 1930's, with battle cruisers, heavy cruisers, light cruisers and large destroyers. Seemingly an insane proposition, the fleet had a very real purpose: to secure the lower reaches of the Baltic Sea in the event of a war between Poland and the Soviet Union in which Germany remained neutral while Britain and France provided materiel and supplies but did not commit their own naval forces to keeping the sea lanes open. That seemed the most likely scenario for a future war, and a strong Polish Navy would be vital to victory.

There are 20 one-inch-long Polish ship pieces included. And you even get a couple of scenarios for Second World War at Sea: Sea of Iron to study this Polish war plan.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Furioso
description:
Furioso is a set of wargames rules that covers European warfare in the sixteenth century. The rules allow players to fight large scale land battles with a simple to use and enjoyable gaming system.

Already the nature of pike & shot warfare that would dominate the seventeenth century was already beginning to take shape by the end of this period. Furioso is designed to re-create large scale battles such as those fought at Fornovo, Cerignola, Bicocca, Dreux, Moncontour, Clontibret, Yellow Ford, Ivry.

Players will find themselves commanding (or at least trying to command) the armies of the period. Players will quickly realise that some of their forces have minds of their own. Gendarmes are likely to charge off at the earliest opportunity - even if this means an entirely unsuitable enemy in terrain not exactly suited to the fully armoured knight.

Players may wish to try and soften up an enemy before unleashing their Swiss pike squares but they will rarely get the opportunity. Impatient Swiss units are likely to have closed with the enemy before a cannon shot is fired - even if that means charging across terrain that is likely to disorder their densely packed ranks. More defensive minded players can protect their armies with extensive earthworks that will disrupt the enemies attack and provide valuable cover from enemy fire. However, players may find that the enemy are not happy to wait for these constructions to be completed and will launch surprise attacks before such works are finished. And of course, in a time when increasing numbers of mercenaries where employed, players will need to make sure that sufficient care is taken to avoid last minute pay disputes, strikes, mutiny’s and all of the other trials that would complicate the lives of sixteenth century commanders.

Furioso can be fought using any scale figures from 6mm to 28mm. The rules themselves have a very simple system at their heart. If you want to do anything you need to roll a d6, a score of five or more will achieve success, a score of four or lower means failure. Modifiers are applied but this is to the number of dice rolled to achieve success and not the score required. Success will therefore be measured by the number of successful scores achieved. At the start of a turn, players will roll one Initiative die for each unit, better quality and motivated units will receive a bonus to this score, poor quality unit’s a deduction. Units will be activated in sequence with the highest scoring unit going first followed buy lower scoring units - and units that score zero or less won’t be doing anything! This means that play will pass from unit to unit rather than one side activating all of their units and then the opposing side activating all of theirs. The result of this kind of mechanic means that players will have less control over their overall force and may find it difficult to execute a strategic plan - but in a period when many commanders would be personally leading their troops in to battle and fighting sword in hand in the front rank - that seems like an entirely realistic ambition for the period.

Also included in the rules is a series of random events of Hazards that cover such situations as Swiss troops striking over pay, raiding cavalry stealing an armies baggage and a whole host of other misfortunes that commonly befell armies of the period. To the rear of the rules are a number of army lists for all of the major armies of the period. Also included are unit cards for all of these units which you can copy for use. These will be used during the deployment phase of the battle so that opposing armies will have only a limited idea of their opponents composition and dispositions. And finally, we hope you enjoy playing these rules. Our intention with this game is to provide a fun and entertaining way to explore the tactical changes and challenges of the period with a healthy dose of ‘period-feel’ thrown in for good measure.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Phase Order

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – The Writhing Shadow: Tyranids Starter Set
description:
Tyranid vanguard organisms are often stealthy, and invariably lethal. When a string of strange disappearances and bloody murders led across the Nachmund Sector towards the planet of Vigilus, it was not long before an Inquisitor of the Ordo Xenos suspected such creatures’ involvement…

An expansion for Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team, this box includes 8 plastic miniatures, a scenery set (with exclusive rules!), and brand-new Tactics and Mission cards. Included:

- 8 Genestealers: supplied on bone-coloured plastic, these can be used to represent The Writhing Shadow or your own Tyranids Kill Team. These multi-limbed monstrosities are armed with rending claws and scything talons, and the kit includes a number of toxin sacs along with an infestation node;
- A scenery set comprising 2 Munitorum Armoured Containers, 6 promethium barrels, and 8 supply crates, supplied on brown plastic;
- 13 Tactics cards and 2 Mission cards: the Tactics cards are split between the 6 Tyranids Tactics taken from the Kill Team Core Manual and 6 Tyranids Tactics exclusive to this set, giving you new ways to play with your Tyranids kill team. Also included is a Tactics card for the included scenery, providing rules for incorporating them into your games. The 2 Mission cards are split between 1 Matched Play and 1 Narrative Play mission;
- An 8-page booklet describing The Writhing Shadow, their history and background, along with a showcase of painted miniatures and a timeline of their engagements;
- 8 datacards for The Writhing Shadow, ready for you to use right away;
- A sheet of card gaming tokens, including 10 Move/Charge tokens, 10 Fall Back/Advance tokens, 10 Shaken tokens, 10 Ready/Shoot tokens, and 6 Objective tokens.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Kunoichi ni Chikai
description:
くのいちにちかい (Kunoichi ni Chikai) is a game about ninjas in training. A "kunoichi" is a female ninja, and "kunoichi ni chikai" means "almost a kunoichi" - but you could also read it as "close to the ku". But what's "ku"? It's a little pink token in the box! Use the powers of your kunoichi trainees to move them around in the grid and get closer to the "ku"!

At the start of the game sixteen cards, one for each character, are laid out in a four by four grid. The players are dealt an equal number of cards, each corresponding to one of the ninjas. Each card has a different ability to move cards around, like "swap any card and the one two to the right and one down from it" or "slide any column up, wrapping around". After each player has used all but one of their cards, the last card determines which ninja they get points for, with more points going to ninjas closer to the "ku".

In order to win you'll have to use your powers to rearrange the grid while balancing that with holding on a character in a good position, even if they have good powers. You also have to be careful not to favor any character too obviously as other players can interrupt your plans.

Can you get close to the "ku" and finally become a full kunoichi?

—user summary

name: Small Indigo Plant
description:
A new one of micro-game series made by Jog Kung.

In this game, each player tries to dye the clothes in his/her indigo plant, first from white cloth to blue cloth, then to patterned cloth. The one who successfully dyed 8 patterned clothes first wins the game!

Players take turn to do one of the following:
1. Take a card from the supply and place it on his/her plant.
2. Take a card from the supply and add it to his/her hand.
3. Place a card from his/her hand to his/her plant.

The game ends when one of the following happens:
1. One of the player has dyed 8 or more patterned clothes.
2. There is only 1 card in any of the supply rows.

name: Pawikan Patrol
description:
Pawikan Patrol is an action-selection, light deduction strategy game set in a coastal community where players send Characters to the Beach to find the location of Pawikan (sea turtles) and their nests, while keeping the Poacher away from them. Along the way, players must also clean up Trash and make sure that the natural Predator of the sea turtles is kept safe from harm.

During a player's turn, they will choose a Character card from their hand and move it to one of the five face-down Beach cards on the Beach; in response, the Poacher card will also move to a new Beach card based on the number of arrows indicated on the Character. After moving, Beach cards in the same column as your Character and the Poacher are turned face-up at the same time: if they have the matching icon on the Beach card, they are collected; cards collected by Characters are put into their player's collection area; meanwhile, cards collected by the Poacher are discarded. If they do not have the matching icon, the cards are returned face-down.

Characters have special abilities that allow the player to gather information from the Beach or the Beach Deck, manipulate the position of cards in different zones, or negate the Poacher's ability to collect cards before you do. Players must be careful with their choice of Character to send on any particular turn, because once they move to the Beach, they have to wait they only have one Character in hand to regain the use of all their other Characters; timing their movement can be very important.

The player with the most number of points at the end of the game wins and is declared the Pawikan Patrol Leader; however, if they are they are careless enough to allow the Poacher to take away a certain number of turtles or eggs, ALL players can lose the game!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Environmental, Memory

name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Bellatrix and Wormtail Expansion
description: Adds Bellatrix Lestrange and Peter Pettigrew to the game.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Troll Adventure Pack Expansion
description:
High quality resin miniature, ready to paint and assemble. Includes character cards and upgrade cards for the Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game.

Adds new scenario rules and a Troll miniature to the game.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Hogwarts Professors Expansion
description:
Pack of high quality resin miniatures, ready to paint and assemble. Includes character cards and upgrade cards for the Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game.

Adds Gilderoy Lockhart, Minerva McGonagall, Severus Snape, and Dolores Umbridge to the game.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Railways of Portugal: Homage to Pombal
description: This is a small expansion to the Railways of Portugal that adds and additional start card with disks for each player. Good delivered to Lisboa are placed on each player's disk. The first player to collect 4 cubes receives 3 points.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Endangered: Tantrum House Promo Cards
description: A group of 6 Promo cards that are different Ambassador cards than those in the base game : Melissa, Kevin, Sara, Ryan, Katie, Will.

name: Ferro, Fango e Neve: L'operazione Barbarossa in 50 minuti
description:
Ferro, Fango e Neve is a World War II wargame that was attached to issue 9 of the ioGioco Italian game magazine.

On June 22, 1941 Hitler unleashes Operation Barbarossa and surprisingly invades the Soviet Union. It is a struggle against time: the Germans must bring the USSR to its knees before Stalin regroups and goes to the counterattack.

—user summary

name: Tibom
description:
Tibom is a fun and fast-paced game where you have to get rid of all your letter cards by matching them to the category on the table quicker than everyone else. Make other players draw cards by winning duels and playing special cards and be careful with the Time Bomb!!

—description from the designer

name: Batman Miniature Game (Second Edition): The Dark Knight Rises
description:
A comprehensive starter set, this box is packed full of models and accessories - everything you need to start playing the Batman Miniature Game. Based on the events in the Dark Knight Rises movie, this boxed set contains two complete crews (Batman, Catwoman, and the GCPD vs Bane and his mercenaries), including a Batpod and - for the first time - the Tumbler Batmobile! You’ll also find full-colour, slot-together scenery, markers and counters, cards, and a set of QuickStart rules. This is the ultimate boxed set for BMG.

- This two-player game box includes 12 ready to paint & assemble resin miniatures: - Batman - Catwoman - 3 GCPD Cops - Bane - Miranda Tate - Barbados - 2 Mercenaries - Batpod (with choice of rider: Batman or Catwoman) - 1 Tumbler
- 12 plastic bases
- 14 Character Cards
- 38 Equipment Cards
- 1 Rulebook (a reduced version of the full rulebook easy to learn with training scenarios)
- 2 Quick Reference Sheets 1 of each crew
- 2 full colour die-cut card buildings
- 6 six-sided dice
- 2 full colour die-cut card Templates
- +80 Counters

For the second edition.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Shaka Shredders
description:
Shaka Shredders: Rivals is a 2-player craftable card game made of interchangeable magnetized components. The game set comes as two separate decks, each representing a tribe. Players will choose a tribe, find an opponent, then draw a hand of 5 cards each. Players take turns drawing a card, playing up to one card from their hand, and making up to one character exchange per turn. This process is called a "swap" and it "levels up" your cards from rank 1 all the way to rank 4.

To win, earn 20 "CHEER" points by challenging your opponent's cards to Trick Battles that appeal to each tribe's fan base. CHEER is earned whenever you challenge your opponent but they fail to defend. They can defend their turf by matching up their own Tricks against yours, but the lowest scoring Trick will be removed from the game and placed into the discard pile.

Strategic play involves knowing when to challenge and when to defend. It also requires smart swapping to maximize the Ranks of your characters while preparing for counter play. There are 3 types of cards: Tricks that score points, Assists that boost Tricks, and Disses that remove other cards from play.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Team-Based Game, Trading, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Lost Worlds: Cold Drake
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Flying Buffalo, Inc. (FBI), Nova Game Designs, SoftBank Corp.

name: The Apocalypse of Darkness Warfare
description:
The Evil Spirits are coming! You must work together to fight the Demons and seal the Darkness Channel to send them back to the void. Meanwhile, you have to search for the crucial artifacts, “Divine Cloak” and “Staff of Desire,” to revive Mo-Niang’s spirit so that you can stand a chance to defeat the ultimate Boss and save the world!

The Apocalypse of Darkness Warfare is a cooperative card game based on a popular comics book of the same name in Taiwan. You will play as the leading characters in the story and search for the crucial artifacts to revive the legendary Goddess Mo-Niang and defeat the Demons.

In this game, player take turns to do the following:
1. Draw 2 cards from the deck. If a Demon is drawn, place it in front of you.
2. Perform as many actions as you wish, including:
(1) Play an Item card to execute its effect (e.g., Search)
(2) Play Action cards to defeat Demons in front of you
(3) Activate your special ability or equipped Items

Players need to also search the Resolution deck to collect all artifacts so that they can revive Mo-Niang's spirit. Therefore, they have a chance to defeat the Boos and win the game!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Cindr: Drakkenstrike & Paralyssx Promo Card
description:
A new Cindr App Dragon Profile card: "We may be twins, but we're anything but identical. One quick to act, the other analyzes every move. Together, we are nigh unbeatable. Are you game?"

Text says:
When dating the twins... Roll two dice for each attribute for a total of 8 dice. Center attributes give two Blue dice. Edge attributes give a Red and a Green die.
When burned, lose 3 Love points.

Originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: バロニィ：スペシャルボックス (Barony: Special Box)
description:
Barony + Barony:Sorcery in one Box!

Expand your own territory and take control of the Empire!
In the farthest reaches of the Empire, four barons are vying for supremacy. In the farthest reaches of the empire, four barons are vying for supremacy. They use their many knights to expand their territories, building villages, fortresses and cities. Push your way through the ranks, climb the ladder of power and inherit the throne!

Baronies" are baronies. Baronies are baronies, where you are a small local lord and expand your territory.

Dispatch your knights to expand your territory and raise your barony!
The player can choose to perform one of the following actions each turn: "Collect", "Move", "Build", "New City", "Explore" or "Noble Title".

A knight who expands his territory or defends a village can only be obtained by performing a "Collection" action. Knights can be ordered to "move" to expand their territory. Once there, the knights can "build" villages and fortresses, which can then be developed into "new cities".

As you expand and develop your territory, you gain resource tokens, and use these resource token points to gain titles from Baron to Viscount, Count, Marquis and Duke. The game continues until one of the players becomes a duke, and the winner is the player with the most points.

The simple rules are easy to learn, the clear actions are easy to play, but the choices and tactics of each move are interesting, and the game can be played in a relatively short time.

A wind of magic blows through the Barony!
Explore the mysterious land and find the source of the magic!
The Baronies: Special Box includes the expansion set Sorcery, which allows you to play with five players.

It also adds a new element to the game - magic. By chanting spells, players can make spectacularly game-changing moves. But this will only be possible if your opponent gives you enough time!

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)

自らの領土を拡大し、帝国の覇権を握れ！
帝国の最果ての地で、4人の男爵が覇権を争っています。彼らは大勢の騎士を使って領土を拡大し、村や要塞、そして都市を築きます。自分の支配権を押し通し、権力の階段を上り、王位を継承してください！

『バロニィ』とは男爵領のこと。プレイヤーは地方の小領主となり、領地を広げていくことになります。

騎士をうまく派遣し領土を広げ爵位をあげる
プレイヤーは「徴集」、「移動」、「建設」、「新たな都市」、「探検」、「貴族の称号」のいずれかのアクションを、毎ターンに1つだけ選んで実行します。

領土を広げたり、村を守る騎士は「徴集」を行わなければ得られません。騎士は「移動」を命じることで、領土を広げていくことができます。移動した先で、騎士は村や要塞を「建設」することができ、村は「新たな都市」へと発展させることができます。

領土を広げて発展させることで資源トークンを得て、この資源トークンの点数を使って男爵から子爵、伯爵、侯爵、公爵と称号を得ていきます。いずれかのプレイヤーが公爵となるまでゲームを続け、得点をもっとも獲得していたプレイヤーが勝者となります。

シンプルなルールは覚えやすく、明確なアクションはプレイもしやすいのですが、その一手一手の選択と駆け引きも悩ましく面白い、比較的短時間でプレイできる陣取りゲームで、美しいアートワークや木製のコマが領地を広げて行く箱庭感も魅力です。

魔力の風が男爵領を吹き抜ける！
神秘の地を探検し、魔力の源を探せ！
『バロニィ：スペシャルボックス』には、拡張セット『ソーサリー』が同梱されており、5人プレイにも対応しています。

また、ゲームに新たな要素――魔法が追加されます。呪文の詠唱によって、プレイヤーは目を見張るほどにゲームを変化させる一手を打つことができます。しかし、それが可能になるのは、対戦相手が充分な時間を与えてくれた場合だけです！
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fantasy, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Modular Board

name: Swordcrafters: Expanded Expansion
description:
The enemies are growing stronger and the King has asked you to craft an enhanced sword of protection using Sword, Relics, Sword Mastery, and Sword Tips.

This expansion contains three modules to mix and match with base Swordcrafters for amazing replay value.

Sword Mastery - Fight to claim each round and hone your blade.

Sword Tips - Player goals test how sharp you truly are.

Sword Relics - Add fragments of the past to the grid to keep your slices and selections intense.

Contents:
24 Sword Mastery Cards
12 Sword Tip Tiles
48 Sword Relic Tiles
1 Wooden First Player Token

Requires base Swordcrafters to play.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Puzzle
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Tuque
description:
From the rules:
Introduction
This is a reworking of a two-player Euchre variant that I was taught about 35 years ago in Arnprior, Ontario (a small town near Ottawa). It appears to have been a local variation on Six Hand Almonte Euchre (which seems a reasonable conclusion considering Almonte and Arnprior are roughly 30km apart).

Object
Seventeen tricks are played each hand; the object is to win at least nine of them.
The Cards
A pack of 39 cards is used consisting of A K Q J 10 9 8 7 6 in four suits (hearts, diamonds, clubs and spades) plus three distinct jokers (called Bennies).

name: Clic: El Juego de Fotos
description:
Walk around the city taking photos, be a photography student accompanied by the Professor.

Enjoy unique games, you will always play on a different map, your experiences will be different and the strategy will depend on your imagination.
The map is built with cards and players must advance towards the objectives.

Are you ready to become an expert photographer? Whoever achieves the best CLICS will be the winner of the game.

Pasea por la ciudad sacando fotos, asume el rol de un estudiante de fotografía acompañado del Profe.

Disfruta de partidas únicas, ya que jugarás siempre sobre un mapa diferente, tus experiencias serán distintas y la estrategia dependerá de tu imaginación.

¿Estás listo para convertirte en un fotógrafo experto? Quien logre los mejores CLICS, será el ganador de la partida.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Map Reduction, Modular Board

name: Rulebenders: Game Brewer Promo Pack
description:
2 cards part of a Promo Pack Game Brewer created to help cover the rising cost of ocean freight.

Description from the publisher:

Adds 2 Flexo cards. They are part of the set collection cards, but because they are found in the Flexo deck they add more choice when creating the sets.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Set-up

name: ケッコーデス！(Kekko Desu!)
description:
You are a mean person who comes to a gift exchange party and wants to collect only the gifts you really want. For that reason, you need to push the gifts you don't want to your friends and only keep the ones you wished for.
Of course, you're not the only one that's mean... Your friends might be even worse than you !

In Kekkou Desu, players try to win as many majorities as possible from the 9 card values in the deck. Depending on their value, the cards have laying effects or end of game effects. On your turn, you will place 1 card from your hand in your "received gifts" area and apply its laying effect if there is one. Then you will choose 1 card from the 3 available in the center of the table to add to your hand. Be careful not to play cards that might interest others too quickly! And don't forget that no one is really a friend here.

Kekkou desu is a light and fast card game. Underneath its nasty look, it is a game that can be played with friends as well as with the family.

name: Манчкин: Гравити Фолс
description:
This is the best summer in your life, Munchkin! A small town in Oregon holds many secrets for you to discover.
Choose from 10 favorite characters like Dipper, Wendy or Old Man McGucket and go on an adventure. Dangerous monsters are waiting for you, from annoying gnomes to the insidious Bill Cipher and his team from the Nightmare Dimension. Call your true friends Candy, Courageous Dan and Lazy Susan for help, arm yourself with Nyarf, Owl Scoop and Electric Gloves, fill your pockets with Fairy Dust and Smiles - then no curses will be afraid of you!

Манчкин: Гравити Фолс ("Munchkin: Gravity Falls") introduces a new type of card into the game - mystery cards. Each mystery card will give you two useful abilities, but keep in mind that monsters and other munchkins will not let you use them easily!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Rhodesian Railways
description:
From Capetown to Salisbury, from Durban to Walvis Bay, the railroads of Africa spanned a continent of jungles, deserts, veldt, swamps and mountains. German SouthWestAfrica, Cape Colony, Orange Free State, Transvaal, Bechuanaland, Mozambique, Natal and Rhodesia are the scope of this luckless economic game where the most money at the end of the game wins.

Ports are crucial to start a railroad, penetrating the terrain is expensive & difficult. Business interests drive players inland in this game for 3-5 players for about one hour. Loans are taken for intensive capital investment, with the game ending when one player has expended all their cubes.

Historically, the Dutch, Portuguese, Germans and British drove the development of this region, each with varying success.

Rhodesian Railways is the third game using Winsome’s Regional Railways System. The prior two games were Balkan Railways and Iberian Railways.

name: Hide and Go Sloth!
description:
Surrounded by lush green plants and delicious fruits, the curious little sloth wants to explore the jungle. They usually move quite slowly – but then can suddenly disappear very quickly! Three movement-packed games let children follow the trail of the cute little sloth. This stimulates both fine and gross motor skills, association skills, and imagination. Who will be fastest to find the little sloth in one of their favorite spots? Brings movement to playing fun!

—description from the publisher

name: Mandala Mind: The Card Game
description:
In Mandala Mind: The Card Game, you play as the frame of mind of a person who is meditating on an image of a mandala. This person is distracted at the beginning of their meditation, and your goal is to help them focus. Once focus has been achieved, you will have succeeded in bringing them into the joy of the present moment!

A game is played over a series of rounds, where you will move a pawn around a 3 x 3 grid of mandala cards removing distraction using frame of mind actions and mandala abilities. Before each game, you will choose a scenario to play, which provides a unique puzzle to solve. Each scenario has two phases that have different goals for you to complete. You win the game by achieving optimal focus at scenario-specific mandala cards in the warm-up (first) phase and by removing all distraction from every mandala in the meditation (second) phase.

-description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Wild Island: My Father's Dragon
description:
Wild Island - My Father's Dragon is a family board game based on the film My Father's Dragon. Each player represents a team of boy Elmer and dragon Boris. The island on which they find themselves is sinking, shaking, and changing shape all the time. But there is still time to save the island by smartly moving around the island visiting different animals and finding the right energy source. The first one to do so is the winner of the game.

The island consists of 16 tiles, randomly placed in a 4x4 grid. Each tile has nine spaces with trees and paths. Players move around the island by rolling a special die trying to reach their objectives. From the second round, the island starts to shake intensely and the tiles are shifted and moved by the players. There are multiple icons that can help players reach their objectives faster: Elmer and dragon Boris can go into the caves and come out in any other cave on the island, fly icons allow dragon Boris to fly to any other adjacent tile, and courage icons represent their bravery when trying to save the island. With them, they get courage tiles to be even more flexible when moving around and shaking the island. Some of them have to be used immediately and some can be saved in Elmer's backpack and used in one of the later turns.

The objective tiles each player has, are in the shape of jigsaw puzzle pieces. When the player visits their objective, they are turned around and when all four objectives are reached the image of a saved island is assembled as a small jigsaw puzzle.

-description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Maze, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Olimpíadas de Palabras
description:
You are an athlete of the word and you will show your ability in each Discipline.

You can run a marathon, do a triathlon, or win a mini-Olympics. You are going to go in search of all the medals.

Suite to the podium and do the Olympic lap.

Take many medals and break the world record!

name: Waddle Waddle
description:
Waddle Waddle is a unique strategy game that features the designer's own photographs of penguins in the wild, taken in Antarctica, and a game board made from a map of the regions around Antarctica. Waddle Waddle's blend of open drafting, set collection, area of control, and push-your-luck is as fun to play as it is beautiful to watch, and you'll learn something about penguins along the way too. Game play is lightning fast, with minimal downtime. Whether you're playing two or six players, it's your turn before you know it.

In Waddle Waddle, you play the role of a Penguin Hero, specializing in a particular Penguin Species. Each Penguin Hero is based on a real-life Penguin Hero who works to conserve penguins! They will help you to study penguins as they leave the Ice Floe and travel to their nesting grounds in the Antarctic region, called Rookeries. There’s safety in numbers, so penguins travel in groups called Waddles. As a Penguin Hero, you tag Waddles, scoring Conservation Points for each Waddle.

Waddles that contain Mating Pairs make Nests. Score extra Conservation Points at the end of each Breeding Season if you tag the most Nests in a Rookery. You also get player-specific bonuses when you tag the Nests of the Penguin Species your Penguin Hero specializes in.

Each penguin is represented by a Penguin Card with a number indicating its pecking order in the penguin social hierarchy. Only compatible penguins will travel together. There are six different Penguin Species that each like to nest in different places. You’ll need to carefully choose the Penguin Cards from the Ice Floe to score the most Conservation Points.

Food is scarce! There is a limited fish supply at each Rookery. It costs one fish to play each Waddle. You might need to send penguins on a Fishing Trip to find more fish. And finally, beware of Threats, both natural and manmade, that appear each Breeding Season and make it harder for Waddles to land at each Rookery. The player with the most Conservation Points at the end of the game earns the title Top Conservator.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: ISS Vanguard: Story Dice Expansion
description:
Introducing our latest innovation, the AR Vault: Story Dice. Elevate your gaming experience with fresh twists on storytelling, stunning dice, and unpredictable outcomes. Whether you're a tabletop RPG fanatic or a board game enthusiast, we've got you covered! Our Story Dice are 5e compatible, making them perfect for RPG players seeking something new and exciting. For Awaken Realms board game lovers, we offer dice expansions to bring an extra level of gameplay to your favorite games.

This set contains 2 Resin dice and 2 rule cards

D10:
When players perform an action on a Threat card, they now have the option to roll for a chance of receive extra bonuses. And while using the die incurs an additional cost, the rewards can be well worth the risk.

Danger:
When players roll a Danger die and consult the reference card, they now have the option to use this alternate ISS Danger die. With a higher chance of rolling more negative results, this die adds an exciting element of risk to each roll. But its not all doom and gloom - some sides also feature a special symbol with a highly positive effect!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: VAULT
description:
You are a professional hacker & thief and have taken on an open contract to infiltrate several high security locations to retrieve valuable data chips containing information on rival assets for a nefarious corporation ‘Paladin International’. Other hackers, like yourself, have also taken on the same contract, and are after the same target data, possibly at the same time! The risk is high, but so is the reward...

Over the course of your mission, you will have to break into 3 different vaults, retrieving data chips. As each code is cracked, the security level increases on the next suspected target, but the reward value also increases.

Will you risk & race for the higher value vault first, or play the ‘long game’ and go for lower value job, which will increase as the plot unfolds?

Each combination row contains a data chip. To win the game, you must be the first to unlock each combination & retrieve all three different data chips, and then transmit the data back to your handler.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Matching, Network and Route Building

name: Dixit: Disney Edition – Promo Cards
description: A set of 5 Dixit cards for the Disney Edition, included with Korean version preorders.

name: Craft & Peddle
description:
It’s spooky season, and it’s time for potions! In Craft & Peddle, a card game for two, players are alchemists crafting and peddling Potions (and maybe even trying some of the potions themselves).

Players use Action Cards to acquire and sell Potion Cards or use special abilities. At the end of the game, bonuses are awarded and the player who was the most successful alchemist wins!

name: Dude Perfect the Board Game
description:
Get ready for more fun during family game nights! Challenge your friends and family to mini sports games, dodge the Wheel Of Consequences, and aim to collect four Golden Boys for victory! With Dude Perfect The Board Game, the excitement never stops. It's a game that's sure to be a big hit with everyone, making your game nights even more awesome!

GAME NIGHT: Family/Friend Game Nights just got a whole lot better! Battle friends and family in mini sports challenges, try to avoid Wheel Of Consequences, and collect four Golden Boys to win!

Five dudes, a camera, and a friendly bet. That’s how dude perfect was born. Now bringing you interactive games to play at home!

INCLUDES: 40 Dude Cards, 6 Panda Cards, 9 Action Cards, 11 Roll Cards, 2 Dice, 5 Dude Characters, 4 Footballs, 4 Basketballs, 4 Golf Balls, 2 Flickers, 1 Golf Flag, 1 Spinner, 20 Golden Boys, 1 Game Board & Turntable w/ Basketball Hoop/Field Goal

COMPETITIVE GAME-PLAY: Compete with friends and family to replicate Dude Perfect shots and earn points, making every game session a blast.

NOSTALGIC BRAND: Immerse yourself in the world of Dude Perfect with elements that capture the spirit and excitement of their popular videos.

SPORT CHALLENGES: Enjoy a thrilling board game experience with exciting and challenging sport activities inspired by the famous Dude Perfect videos.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Card Castle
description:
Card Castle is a fast-paced, slapping card game that puts your reflexes to the test. Out-slap others to win cards and rule the Card Castle! Inspired by traditional card games like War and Slap-Jack, Card Castle adds several new twists including battling armies, tricky look-alikes, powerful Wizards, and fiery dragons.

In more detail, the goal in Card Castle is to out-slap your opponents, win all their cards, and become ruler of the castle. Players take turns flipping cards blindly from the top of their army decks onto the center of the table or playmat. When slappable opportunities present themselves (doubles, doors, or wizards), the first player to slap the pile of cards wins the battle and all the cards in the pile.

But be sure you don't slap the dragon!

name: Alarm! U-Boot!
description:
What is it all about?

Two fleets fight against each other during the game. Their aim is to destroy the enemy’s Command Ship. However this is a hard challenge because the game offers several options to obstruct or threaten the enemy’s vessels. Planting sharp mines in the route of the ships is one of them, or you may choose to bluff and plant fake mines that look exactly like real ones...

How does it play?

- Every turn the active player rolls a die. The die shows how many actions you have to take in your round: 1, 2 or 3.
- After you roll, you can plant mines on empty fields if you want.
- Now choose a ship and spend your actions. Turn, move or shoot. Every ship type has its unique weapons, and specific role in the battle.
- The first player who hits their opponent's Command Ship is the winner.

What this game offers:

- short, simple, easy-to-understand rules,
- quick set up, no more than 5 minutes after the second game,
- relatively short rounds (30-45 minutes), no time to get bored.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Memory, Player Elimination

name: Heroica: Promo Cards
description:
A set of 14 HEROICA promo cards. The cards include all the good characters (Barbarian, Wizard, Ranger, Druid, Rogue and Knight) and all 8 monsters (Goblin King, Goblin Guardian, Goblin Warrior, Dark Duid, Werefolf, Goblin General, Golem Guardian and Golem Lord).

The cards can be used to create random groups of characters or random monster and/or scenarios.

The cards will be freely avalable at HEROICA events in September and October 2011 in Italy.

The full list of events with special promo cards will be published in the news section of LEGO Games Italia web site and on LEGO Gams Italia Facebook Page

name: Munchkin Bracelet of Slapping
description:
Publisher's DescriptionMunchkin Bracelet of Slapping Rules

The Munchkin Bracelet of Slapping may be used in any game of Munchkin or its sequels. You may only use one Bracelet of Slapping in a game (and if the Bracelet is removed, you can't put it back on later).

Once per game, at any time when you have a free Hand, you may slap the Bracelet of Slapping on your own wrist. You have a +5 bonus as long as that Hand remains free. The Bracelet may not be stolen, lost to Bad Stuff (other than Death), or Cursed away. You may choose to remove the Bracelet of Slapping to cancel any "lose a level" effect. You must remove the Bracelet of Slapping if you want to use that Hand for another Item, or if your munchkin dies . . . and if someone else loots it from your corpse, he may use it! (He has to give it back once the game is over, though.)



OtherPart of the Munchkin series.

name: Unmask!
description:
Unmask! is a simple colorful, set collection, hidden role, press your luck game in which your goal is to collect the most victory points. You gain points by expanding your card collection through your "investigations".

Set in the Victorian Era, you take the role of one of the detectives whose job is to find the culprit behind a heist of the noble treasure by gathering information from the witnesses attending the grand event while the villain is lurking about trying to block all your efforts. In this small card game, you will be given the chance to unmask each other in order to nullify an opponent's special bonus through careful deduction before the game ends.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Roll for It! Deluxe Edition: Owlbear
description:
Roll for It! Deluxe Edition: Owlbear is a Promotional card produced and distributed during International Tabletop Day 2015

The Owlbear is a new target card that can be integrated in with the Roll for It! Deluxe Edition set.

name: Lagoon: Land of Druids – Forest Sentinel / Ancient Sentinel
description:
This is the third promo tile for Lagoon: Land of Druids, introducing a new site type (Totem) with special rules given below.

Forest Sentinel (Side Numbered 3A)
Site type - Totem
Energy - Elemeen/Vowelon/Deonin*
Text - When you unravel any non-totem site, if any of your druids are not on Forest Sentinel, move 1 of them to Forest Sentinel.

Ancient Sentinel (Side Numbered 3B)
Site type - Totem
Energy - Elemeen/Vowelon/Deonin*
Text - When you unravel any non-totem site, gain 1 seed of that site's energy and move 1 of your druids on Ancient Sentinel to any haven.


- A site with all 3 energies provides 1 energy of your choice for unraveling. A site with all 3 energies can be unraveled using 3 of any other single energy — either 3 yellow, 3 red, or 3 blue.


Totem Site Type Rules

When a totem site is unraveled, its tile is not removed from play like all other sites. Instead, when a totem site is unraveled, flip that site tile over to the site on the other side. The new site occupies the same position on the board as the original site. Additionally, all druids on the original site, including the unraveling druid, are transferred to the new site exhausted. The unraveling druid is not returned to its owner’s supply.

Note that, like any locked site, a locked totem site cannot be unraveled.

Promo Tile Setup Rules

To use the promo tile in a game of Lagoon, setup the game in the normal way. Then add the promo tile to the starting tile setup, adjacent to the two non-haven sites. Either side of the promo tile can begin face up.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Cardslab: Countries
description:
CardsLab Countries is an award winning game from Novabase Gameshifters 2016 gamification event held at Portugal. The game was launched at November 2017, after intensive testing with different kinds of audiences and revisions.

The pack consists of a deck with 75 cards (60 of countries with contents and stats, 12 special cards, a card with 60 country flags, 2 cards with shortened game rules), a rulebook and a world map. Each country card has the flag, location and capital, as well as stats like population, life expectancy or gdp. The game mechanics is "turn-based" and the goal is to get all the opponents' cards, which are initially distributed to everyone, forming a stack for each player (upside down).

Each turn consists of 4 phases. In the first phase, each player places 5 cards in his hand and can play special cards that change the course of the game, such as stealing the opponent's turn, double the winning prize, exchange all hand cards between 2 players or cancel any of these effects. In the next phase, the turn owner chooses a card from his hand, puts it upside down on the table and will have to decide between asking a question about the card to an opponent of his choice (flag/location/capital) or choose a statistic that will have to beat all opponents cards. For the latter, after the turn owner announces the statistic he chose, each opponent will have to pick a card from his hand and put it upside down on the table, to win the duel. This adds suspense, bluff and fun on each turn, forcing the player to carefully choose his plays. At the end of the turn, the winner receives as prize x cards from the opponents hands, depending on the special cards played, the duel type (question or statistic battle) and player count.

Many educational/general knowledge board games lack the fun and socialization offered by CardsLab. It's an 8-80 trivia & strategy game designed with a simple mechanics that can easily put 3 different generations playing at the same table. Also, without noticing, we are learning much faster than by reading a book.

CardsLab - Improving Knowledge Through Gamification.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Zooloretto: Castor
description:
A promo expansion for Zooloretto. This promo was given out at the 2017 Ludo-Outaouais con. The promo is only available in French.

The expansion consists of one 1 tile with a beaver.

Use the normal rules for Zooloretto, except:
The first player to fill his 6-space enclosure gets the Beaver's enclosure as a bonus and place it below his zoo near his barn. This player keeps the Beaver's enclosure until the end of the game and cannot put any other tiles on it. The Beaver enclosure allows the player to move up to three animal tiles from one or more trucks to his barn as a commercial operation. This action does not cost him anything, but it can only be done once during the game. The player then receives a coin from the bank for each tile thus moved.

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Season 3
description:
This expansion for Krosmaster: Arena was released exclusively in the form of blind boxes. A case of 12 figurines, comes with 4 random rares and one each of the 8 commons. There is a chance the figure will be a "chase" variant, with a gold-painted base and foil card.

The list of figures in the set is as follows:

1. Kanniball Archer
2. Kanniball Sarbak
3. Kanniball Jav
4. Kanniball Thierry
5. Kanniball Andchain
6. Moon
7. Dreggoog the Downunder
8. Dragossiper the Nag
9. Dragostess
10. Crocabulia
11. Hazwonarm
12. Boomba
13. Buck Anear
14. Deminoball
15. Minotoror
16. Otomai
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Rivet Heads
description:
In Rivet Heads, you're the boss of the most badass squad of mercs, fixers, and runners in the Sprawl. Make deals to secure top-of-the-line upgrades for your crew, and score the most rep by the end of three cycles.

Any time your marker is the one on the card closest to the deck, you will take the following actions:
1: Add the card that is currently underneath your marker to position 1 of your assembly line. You may add it either action side or scoring side up.
2. Choose a card in the new row by placing your marker on it.
3. Activate your assembly line and update your upgrade trackers accordingly. Discard the card in position THREE of your assembly line and slide the 2 remaining cards down to open up position ONE once again. If the card was on its action side, then it is discarded, if it was on its scoring side then add it to your score pile.
4. The player whose marker is now closest to the deck takes their turn.

Once the final player has taken their actions, form a new row of cards and a new round can start with the player whose marker is placed on the card closest to the deck. When a Cycle deck runs out, move on to the next Cycle deck in sequence until all cards have been chosen.

Once the Cycle 3 deck is empty and all cards have been chosen, continue activating your assembly line until all cards have left your assembly line. (i.e. the final card you chose will activate a full 3 times) Then move on to scoring.

-description from artist
mechanics: Open Drafting, Track Movement, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Dogfight
description:
A real time team based competitive game where two bi-planes operated by dogs try to shoot each other out of the sky.

During alternating timed and resolution phases, players have to quickly communicate with their team-mate to play up to 4 cards between them without showing their hands, and without giving away too much of their strategy to the other team.

If you can hit the enemy plane, that team will lose cards from their decks until one player runs out completely, and that plane is shot down.
mechanics: Action Timer, Communication Limits, Hidden Movement, Player Elimination, Real-Time, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Dixit 2: "Dice Tower" Promo Card
description:
A brand new card for use in Dixit!

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Explorers Pack.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Salmon Run: The Fork/Cataract Falls Board
description:
Part of the 2012 Salmon Run Kickstarter campaign, Salmon Run: The Fork/Cataract Falls adds another double sided board to Salmon Run.

The Fork: features a fork in the river.

Cataract Falls: features water falls.

name: Neptun: Queenie 1
description: Adds 10 special ability tiles. You draw the number of players + 1 at the start of a round. In reverse turn order everybody can pick one. For the entire round you can use that special ability.

name: Malifaux: The University of Transmortis Story Encounter
description:
Prepare to get schooled. The Iron Zombies of Professor Albus Von Schtook have graduated and are ready to enter the world...for a price.

Iron Zombies may be used as as Ressurectionist Horrors, as a scenario complication between two crews, or in the included solo play scenario.

"The supplement itself contains rules for the Iron Zombies when they activate, two new Scenarios ('School of Hard Knocks' and 'Recruitment Drive' and a solitaire scenario for a single player called 'Matriculation'."

High quality plastic models and M2 stat cards:

The Valedictorian (50mm base)
Student of Sinew (40mm base)
Student of Steel (30mm base)
Student of Viscera (50mm base)

Assembly instructions

Story Encounter Booklet/rules for using the Iron Zombies as part of a crew, as antagonists to harry fighting crews, or as opponents to test your own crew in a solo scenario
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Profiler: 14 Nouveaux Personnages
description:
Expansion found in Plato magazine 97

This expansion adds 14 new characters to the game.
publishers: Broadway Toys LTD, Cocktail Games, Interlude

name: Samachar
description:
Samachar is a light-strategy card drafting game that was launched at MeepleCon, India 2023.
