You take on the role of a Newspaper Publishing company and play against your friends to be the best Newspaper Company in India.

You draft cards and choose to use the same cards as either News Articles or Employees.

All players play simultaneously. Each player has 2 cards in their hands at the start of the game. They collect two cards from the deck. From the 4 cards, they play 1 card and discard 1 card to a discard pile. They then pass the remaining two cards to the player to their left.

You can choose to publish various types of News Editions: Daily, Movie, Sports, Regional, World or Current.

The game ends when one player publishes 5 News Editions or when 3 News Editions deck run out. Be the first to publish the most number and types of News Editions and win.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: 1842: Schleswig Holstein
description: 18xx set in the German province of Schleswig Holstein. It is a mixture of 1830: Railways & Robber Barons and 1835 plus some unique features for the Hamburg area. The game is available both in English and German either as kit or RTP.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Paratrooper: Great Airborne Assaults – Palenbang & Primosole Bridge
description:
"Paratrooper" is a two player wargame system simulating airborne operations from World War II to Korea. Each game in the system will include one or more scenarios, representing different airborne operations. This first game includes two scenarios. The first is Palembang: The Air Assault on Sumatra, February 1942, the Japanese airborne operation that attempted to gain control of the Dutch East India oilfields. In the second, Primosole Bridge: The Clash of Airborne, Sicily July 1943, the British 1st Airborne Brigade clash with the German 1st Fallschirmjaeger Division. Units represent airborne (parachute, glider) and ground forces at the company and platoon level. Each hex on the map represents approximately one mile. Combat resolution is quasi-tactical. Central to play of the game is the command system, with players expending command points to conduct special actions.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Hipatia
description:
Hipatia is a majority card game, as disciples and helpers of the ancient philosopher you will help Hipatia achieving her great advances and life goals.

Also you will have to be careful with the hate of Cirilo, patriarch of Alexandria, as you are in the middle of a political struggle between him and Orestes, the imperial prefect. Draw too much attention from the patriarch followers can end in your dead (and elimination from the game).

Use the powers in the cards to bypass your rivals in becoming the best disciple of Hipatia (alive).

—description from the designer

name: Balaclava: Breaking the Siege 25 October 1854
description: Balaclava: Breaking the Siege 25 October 1854 is a hex and counter mini-wargame from Decision Games. Uses the "Musket and Saber" Quickplay wargame system to portray the major battle of the Crimean War. Combat is based on unit quality rather than numbers. Special rules cover the Allied redoubts.

name: Championland: Track & Field
description:
Every year the grand arenas of Championland overflow with hopeful athletes and excited crowds. Only the strongest, fastest, and smartest can become true champions!

Track & field games are the bedrock of Championland. These introductory events give aspirants the opportunity to size each other up. Hundreds of competitors crisscross the various fields, intently studying each other's strengths and weaknesses before the next set of games.

The first in Julio Nazario's 18-card series of Sports games Championland from Button Shy.

All will be head to head games that play in 5-10 minutes.

Track and Field will focus using your cards as multi use, both as events and as athletes to participate in those events to win them!


Championland is a series of standalone 18-card games which uses a single rules system for all entries, then adds individual rules for each specific game to capture the experience of that sport.

Every Championland game includes two 9-card decks numbered 1-9. Each player takes a deck, shuffles it, and fans it out in their hand. On a turn, they’ll play only a single card and the card played MUST come from the furthest edge of their hand on either side. Players cannot reorder their hand, so they must make the best of the choices they have available!

name: Guardians' Chronicles: The Terror Trio
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In order to reinforce the defenses for his base, Doktor Skarov calls upon a formidable gang: The Terror Trio! Come, if you dare!

Guardians' Chronicles: The Terror Trio, an expansion for Guardians' Chronicles, introduces a band of new supervillains who will cause even more trouble for the heroes of Liberty Patrol! This expansion also contains new tiles that add tough challenges to your games and allow you to set Doktor Skarov's base in the heart of a raging volcano or in the icy winter of a polar landscape.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Touria: The 10th Castle Door
description: An extra door to mix in with the base game. If you open it, you lose unless you can discard a heart token.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Renaissance, Travel

name: Vinyl: Holiday Edition
description:
The fireplace crackles. The smell of pine is in the air. The family gathers to enjoy each other's company during this holiday season. In the corner of the room, a record player fills the room with warm, soothing tunes from classic holiday albums. The crate of albums is positioned near, holding onto the many memories connected of years past. Family members take turns getting up and selecting an album, studying the cover, and sliding the album out of the jacket to load onto the player. As the needle pops and crackles, the wonderful music enchants the room and seems to synchronize with the twinkle of the lights on the Christmas Tree. It is another Vinyl: Holiday!

In Vinyl: Holiday, players will work towards building Christmas trees out of albums. Each album features a sub-genre (Classical, Traditional, and Contemporary), one of four decades (the 40s, 50s, 60s, 70s), one of five spirits (Joy, Love, Peace, Hope, and Faith). These album trees are being built by the players to your left and right in the true holiday spirit. Some of the points you gain are entirely in your control with the matches you make with previously played albums. Other points come from the combined efforts of you and the players to your left and right. To further increase the scoring opportunities, each player can sacrifice their hand size to complete attributes printed on each album's gift tags. Vinyl: Holiday Edition will be a game that you will want to play all year round.

—description from the designer

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Bay Area
description:
This Age of Steam Expansion expands the game to the Bay Area of California.

The Bay Area is a full color paper expansion and depicts the entire San Francisco bay area and incorporates some new rules and features to add flavor to the proceedings such as two bridges across the bay and the city of San Jose, the first triple hex city in Age of Steam which always receives goods during production.

Age of Steam - the Bay Area is another fan produced expansion to the Winsome / Warfrog game Age of Steam. This map has been replaced by the Age of Steam Expansion: 1830's Pennsylvania / Northern California and is out of print.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Flames of War: For King & Country – Intelligence Handbook on British and Empire Infantry Forces
description:
For King & Country is a supplement to Flames of War, The World War II miniatures battle system. This book provides information on infantry from throughout the British Empire, Australia, Canada, India, New Zealand, and South Africa.

Complete organization and equipment for British, Australian, New Zealand, Indian, Irish, Scots and South African infantry forces in North Africa, Sicily and Italy are found in this supplement. Also included are variants for Commando troops and freshly-arrived Eighth Army and First Army forces, the history of the 50th (Northumbrian) Infantry Division, as well as inspiring color photos, tactics guide, and painting guide. Additional rules include new Night Attack rules, Tunisia and Sicily terrain generator, and the exploits of New Zealand’s Captain Charles Upham and the commando Brigadier Peter Young.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: The Genius Gems
description:
Each player receives their own Genius Gems grid and a set of the ten, double-sided clusters of gems. Roll five of the dice inside the shaker and they will land in the five coloured wells. Now race your opponent to fill every space on the grid using the ten clusters, so that the patterns shown on the dice appear simultaneously on the grid, in the correct colours.

All 10,794 puzzles have at least one possible solution. As soon as somebody finishes first, re-roll the dice and play again! Will you stick to using the basic dice, or up the ante and include the dastardly and/or devilish dice?

There may be times when it seems impossible, but there will ALWAYS be at least one solution... and that’s what makes it a ‘Genius’ game!
publishers: Broadway Toys LTD, Lúdilo, The Happy Puzzle Company, TWOPLUS Games

name: Star Wars Miniatures Battles: Vehicles Starter Set
description:
From the box:

The Star Wars Vehicles Starter Set adds a new dimension to your Star Wars Miniatures Battles games with vehicle combat rules, vehicle miniatures and advanced game scenarios. Do you have what it takes to lead your troops to victory?

Basically a repackaging of the Star Wars Miniatures Battles Companion, West End added some sample miniatures and dice to round out this boxed set.

Includes:

Star Wars Miniatures Battles Companion
Rebel snow speeder miniature
Speeder bike w/ Rebel pilot miniature
Speeder bike w/ Imperial pilot miniature
5 6-sided dice

Expands:

Star Wars Miniatures Battles
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement

name: Magic: The Gathering – Alara Reborn
description:
The first-ever 100% multicolored Magic set! Nicol Bolas's violent plans have reached their cataclysmic culmination, and now all five shards have reconverged, resulting in unspeakable chaos and power. To live another day, you'll need to master this grotesquely unified plane.

Alara Reborn is a 145-card set featuring the new Cascade mechanic, multicolored equipment, and a twist on cycling that will help you dig through your deck for answers to dangerous new threats.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Born of Titans
description:
Born of Titans is a game of heroism in the world of ancient Greek mythology. Two to four may play . Each player portrays a hero from legend who undertakes quests to battle with fierce monsters and retrieve epic artifacts.

Each player controls the actions of one Hero selected at the start of the game. Hero counters are moved on the map along from Sites to linked Points, Points to linked Points, and Points to linked Sites. A Hero's Ally, if she has one, and Crew remaining sit aboard the Hero's Ship and lend their skills to the Hero as needed.

Heroes, Allies, and Crew have three attributes: Battle, Navigation, and Wits. During the game, players must make die rolls against the combined attributes of their respective Hero, Ally, and Crew. Monsters and other game effects can kill Crew. A Hero begins with six Crew. Players record the current number of Crew by placing the Crew marker on the corresponding shield number. As a player's Crew are killed by monsters and other game effects, the owning player moves the marker to a shield with the appropriate lower number.

A Hero with no remaining Crew is essentially alone on a raft. Her crew is dead or has run off. If a Hero's Crew counter is on the "0" Shield on her Ship mat, the Hero may not add the Crew's skill numbers, and may only take one Action each turn. Also, when a Hero's Crew reaches the "0" Shield, she loses any Gear or Ally counters she had. Turn those counters face down and shuffle them back into their respective piles.

In the fashion of good mythology, BoT relies on a generous amount of Prophesy. The amount of Prophesy collected by a Hero is represented by a track on her Ship. A player may have no more than six Prophesy points at any time. Prophesy has two primary uses. A player may spend a Prophesy point during her turn to look at all counters at any Site on the map. This is important so a player can know what sort of challenge she faces on her next Quest or what a particular Sea Monster is. A player may dedicate Prophesy markers to provide bonus die rolls, if needed, during a Challenge. Each Prophesy committed allows the player to roll an additional die during the Challenge roll. Any Prophesy committed are lost at the end of the Challenge, whether used or not. Neither of these uses costs the player an Action.

Each player begins the game with a randomly drawn Quest Marker. The first player to gain a third Completed Quest wins the game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement

name: 4XL
description:
4XL is a sandbox 4X space game for 1-2 players age 12+, designed in Japan by Charles Ward from EX1ST GAMES, and is published as forever-free print and play game for the 2019 Solitaire Print and Play Contest. The art is by Szymek Dmitruk.

Setting: "Welcome to The Future, stranger! Yep, that’s what they named this galaxy eons ago. Today, trade hubs and hull dealers are everywhere, jump lines connect all of the major systems, and the Rogue invasion has finally begun - Yeehaw! It's time to make some lux.

You, Sir, can run my trade fleets, if you are interested. I won’t be dealing in smelly ass-teroid anymore. Careful though - you won’t stand a chance against the Rogue without protection or something to pay them with. They'll turn y’all back into stardust in no time. Here is what you need to do: Get rich hauling teratons of freight, then pay security to take care of the Rogue.

But if you want to get rich and famous, and get your hands dirty, then gear up for space combat. Oh yeah. I’m gonna blast some Rogue intruders with my battleship, Dolores. I’ve been saving her for the invasion. So long, Sir. If we meet again, I will be glad to lend a hand."

Summary: You guessed it. It’s the year 4040. You’ve just arrived in a galaxy called The Future and have been promoted to direct a trade fleet. Your goal is to make lots of lux by hauling freight and trading resources, to then develop your technology and eliminate the Rogue, before your spacefaring adventure comes to an end. You might build space stations, explore anomalies, compete missions, and attack the Rogue yourself with the powerful fleets you have acquired. The galaxy is yours for the taking.

Features:

Players control up to 4 fleets that can hold ships, crew, science, relics, cargo, and freight cards.
The galaxy is made of innovative chevron tiles that create different trading and traveling opportunities in every game.
The simple AI grows gradually and provides opportunities for scoring points.
Players can choose from a variety of ways to score points, from base building, the combat, anomaly exploration, missions, etc.


—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Transportation
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading

name: BattleTech: Clan Elemental Star
description: The Clan Elemental Star is a collection of five plastic miniatures for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: The Face of Battle
description:
The Face of Battle is a new WWII Skirmish Miniatures Game for 15mm to 28mm figures.
The Face of Battle game simulates the action that occurs during
the peak of battle -- the moments of sheer terror, panic, bravery, and intense combat.
The game is fast, fun and exciting to play. Players are always involved in the action during the game.

name: Tank Charts
description: 1/285th World War II Armor Miniature Rules. Rules also incorporate infantry, artillery and air units. As the name implies, the game is centered around individual charts for each unit, at it's core comparing the armor penetration at various ranges to armor thickness at the particular angle and location in which the vehicle is hit. Rules also cover morale, spotting, and indirect fire. Points are provided for each unit and extras such as artillery fire missions to facilitate the creation of balanced scenarios.

name: Munera Sine Missione
description:
Munera Sine Missione is a free set of miniatures rules which are designed to allow players to recreate gladiatorial combat in the arenas of Ancient Rome. The are designed to give a very quick, simple game, which can be played in ten or so minutes

The game uses a hex grid to regulate movement, and each gladiator has a number of action points to spend each turn. These points can be spent to move or attack other gladiators. Attacks are resolved by a simple roll-off between the attacker and defender, with the attacker getting bonuses for position. The defender gets a save roll to avoid wounds. Play continues until a gladiator loses all of their wounds.

Rules for a wide range of weapons are included,and all major historical gladiator types can be depicted with little problem.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Not Tonight Josephine
description:
Not Tonight Josephine is a historical trivia game. The game includes glass bead gaming pieces, a colorful board and question cards, many of which are also in color. There are two boxes for the cards, and cardboard coins, as well as dice.

There are 30 different question categories on the board, which uses a circular track with a hub layout. The question categories some are more traditional like "Ancient History", "Royalty" and "American Civil War", others are of a quirky nature such as "Famous Exits", "Cockney English" and "Submarines". Players draw a card which will have a choice between two categories from which to answer, all questions are multiple choice with three possible answers. If the player gets a question right they can roll again, if the question is the same category as the space the player is on they also receive a coin. The four special Double Trouble space on the board give the player a coin if they can answer both questions on the card. The player with five coins who then returns to the center of the board wins the game.

name: Tank Battles in Miniature 2: A wargamers' guide to the Russian Campaign 1941-1945
description:
From the dust jacket:
"Take command of a German Tiger tank or a Russian T-34 through the pages of this book! It explains how and why the Russian Campaign was fought, describes the vehicles and weapons used, and provides detailed playing suggestions for realistically reproducing the battles on the table top."
Second book in the series, a valuable reference for gamers and game designers.
publishers: Patrick Stephens Limited, The History of Wargaming Project

name: Harpoon Naval Review 2003
description:
From the Clash of Arms Games web

2003 Harpoon Naval Review contents.

Scenarios:

* Cuban Connection - US Coast Guard vs. Cuban Navy
* One size fits all? - Dutch ASW carrier group vs. Soviet SAG & submarines
* Indian Ocean Escort - NATO task group vs. Soviet submarine
* Operation Constrictor - Indian submarines vs. escorted MPS-2
* Eastern Exercise - PRC vs. Vietnam
* Little Wars: Myanmar and Thailand - Myanmar vs. Thailand
* Little Wars: Guyana and Surinam - Guyana vs. Surinam
* Send in the Marines! - US Expeditionary Strike Group 1 vs. Iranians

Articles:

* Street fighter on trial (littoral combat)
* Australia's Navy in the 21st century
* China's next generation
* Keeping the US out of the Gulf
* Don't sink this sub!

Game related articles:

* Variable damage in Harpoon 4
* Weapon mount arcs vs. Directors arcs
* Rules and Annex errata
* 56 Harpoon Form 10s for several scenarios.
* 16 Harpoon Form 20s for several scenarios
* Naval counters on the back of the page (need to be cut and mounted)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame

name: Republic to Empire
description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Wargaming the Wars of Napoleon Bonaparte.

Brought to you by the same team behind Beneath the Lily Banners, the book combines the writing of Barry Hilton with the creative talents of illustrator and designer Clarence Harrison. The book is lavishly illustrated with over 200 original photographs shot especially.

150 pages of full colour with 210 photographs of some of the finest wargaming models around. The rules come with a six sided gate-fold full colour play sheet on thick gloss finish card.

The rules require no rebasing of collections. Unit basing is immaterial as long as it follows the general conventions of tabletop gaming. Republic to Empire can be used for all scales although they are primarily written for 28mm scale Divisional to Army level games.

Unit sizes can vary from 16-60 for infantry and 10 – 60 for cavalry. The game play is smooth and free flowing with minimal need to refer to the main text once concepts have been mastered. New players usually pick up the key mechanisms within three to four game turns.
The rules contain comprehensive detail on

Scales – Creating your Army – Setting up the game – Command and Orders – Exploitation – Formations and Movement – Terrain effects – Skirmishers – Play Sequence – Artillery – Shooting – Charging – Close Combat – Resolve – Fighting in Built up Areas.

The text is laid out in a way that separates:

Background information on concepts

Core rule mechanisms

Examples of mechanisms at work

There a 10 page fully illustrated example game from the 100 Days Campaign with full detail from orbat construction to conclusion.

Special rules sections to cover adaption for the Revolutionary Wars Period and the 1812 War in North America are also included.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: XXXopoly
description:
One word, easy. XXXopoly was designed so that your mind can be focused on sex not on rules.

Roll the dice and proceed to a sexual space. Each sexual space has a sexual act. Acts range from foreplay fun to hardcore intercourse. Whenever your partner lands on a sexual space you own, they perform that specific sexual act on you. You can either perform the sexual act, or pay a fine to get out of it. The game is that simple.

Giving someone an orgasm is just as pleasureable as having one yourself. thats why XXXopoly includes Hot and Heavy and Erotic Chest cards. These cards range from object play, to role play, to kama sutra positions to bring you to new sexual realms.

Finger someone, tongue someone, tease someone, longer and harder by purchasing time chips from the bank. Each time chip increases the time of the action on the sexual space of your choice throughout the entire game.

Finally, look for the specially marked spaces around the board: strip teases, red light districts, even an S&M chamber. You are guaranteed to get laid every time you play!

source-www.xxxopoly.com
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Ouro de Tolo Nitroglicerina
description:
A new card for your miner to use in Ouro de Tolo game. More powerfull than the Dinamite, but is this any good?

You can use Nitroglicerina to pick up as many stones from the mine as you desire all at once, but you will keep all Foul's Gold that came with it. How many stones do you dare to take?

This free Ouro de Tolo expansion can be found inside Pássaros
categories: American West, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck

name: Foundations
description:
Foundations is a 2 players abstract strategy game that is played using board and pieces of an Isaac set.

The aim of the game is getting rid of the value of your pieces by carefully placing them on the board or on already played pieces, thus creating a tridimensional structure developed on different levels.

Players take turns placing one of their pieces in ascending order of length. If they can't find space for a piece, they must build on the next level in height so that both ends of the piece rest on top of two pieces of its same colour.

When players are forced to build on new levels, they can begin with a smaller piece, but they must then play again in ascending order of length and they cannot play in lower levels anymore.

The game ends when players cannot place any more pieces on the board. The winner is the player with less points still in hand. In case of a tie, the winner is the player with less points at the highest level on the board.

name: Record of the Three Kingdoms
description: Background of the game is set during the Three Kingdoms period. Each player will take the role of one of the lords. Each lord has an unique ability which if well utilised may be one of the factor impacting a player’s route to victory. In addition, players will get to come across well know generals from the Three Kingdoms era. With a unique battle system, military force will not be the only key deciding factor to winning. Clever use of tactic may change the situation of the war, making it possible for a weaker general to beat a better known general. To unify the world and win the game, having a good strategist is definitely indispensable.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Escalation
description:
Provided by Publisher:

Across the battlefields of the 41st Millenium, desperate commanders loose their greatest weapons of war. Classified “Lords of War” by the Imperium of Man, these vast and deadly assets bring a new level of destruction to the galaxy’s eternal war.

Warhammer 40,000: Escalation contains full rules for adding super-heavy vehicles and gargantuan creatures to every Warhammer 40,000 army. This means you can now use these massive models in games of Warhammer 40,000 as well as games of Apocalypse.

This 96-page, full colour, hardback supplement contains:

· A background section introducing Lords of War units and their terrifying impact on the battlefield.
· All the rules needed to play with super-heavy vehicles (including Flyers and Walkers) and Gargantuan Creatures, as well as rules for their potent wargear.
· An amended force organization chart that allows players to choose Lords of War units as part of their standard Warhammer 40,000 armies.
· Datasheets for every plastic super-heavy Citadel miniature, plus a selection of super-heavy vehicles and gargantuan creatures from Forge World.
· A showcase of expertly painted Lords of War Citadel miniatures.
· New Altar of War and Gauntlet Challenge missions that can be played instead of the Eternal War missions in the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook and relevant codexes in order to use the contents of this book.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Pixel Tactics: HD Leader Card – Udstad
description:
Pixel Tactics: Udstad is a single leader card for use in either Pixel Tactics or Pixel Tactics 2

Card text: Whenever an opponent recruits a hero, that hero restructures as far backwards as possible in the same column of his unit
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Pixel Tactics: HD Leader Card – Kaitlyn Van Sorrel
description:
Pixel Tactics: Kaitlyn Van Sorrel is a single leader card for use in either Pixel Tactics or Pixel Tactics 2

Card text: You can use Restructure actions to affect your opponent's unit. It takes two actions to restructure enemy heroes with the Intercept ability.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Tao of Peg
description:
What do Backgammon, Go, and Chess all have in common? They are board games that have stood the test of time. Built on simplicity but with potential for complexity these games provide a challenge for players at all levels. Tao of Peg is designed to use a combination of luck and strategy to win in a variety of ways. Tao of Peg is the perfect game for family fun or for more serious gaming nights.

The board and pegs are made of wood, and the board design is printed on a vinyl sheet and applied directly to a wooden base. The entire board is lightly coated with a protective varnish. Felt buttons are then added to the bottom corners to protect playing surfaces.

Each player is dealt four cards. A player begins by discarding a card from their hand. The player then places a game piece in any space with the corresponding color on the board. The turns ends by the player drawing a new card from the pile.

In addition to the 100 colored playing cards (25 per colored quadrant), each set also has two types of wild cards. Players may play a wild card instead of a colored card. Red wild cards allow the player to remove any game piece in play and black wild cards allow the player to place a game piece anywhere on the board.

There are four different ways to win;

make a row of 5 pegs anywhere on the board
make a row of 4 pegs in a single quadrant
place a peg in each corner of a single quadrant
place a peg in each corner of the game board

name: Rome: City of Marble – Patriarchs & Wild Tiles Expansion
description:
Two additions to Rome: City of Marble:

Patriarch consists of a big meeple in each color. It has more influence than a Magistrate.
Wild Neighborhood Tiles consists of 4 tiles and 4 coins. When scoring occurs, it counts toward whichever type of Civic Building is being built.

name: Daishō: Skirmish Wargaming in Mystical Japan
description:
Have you ever wanted to replicate the incredible feats of swordsmanship you see in movies like 47 Ronin and 13 Assassins? Stand surrounded by half a dozen angry Ashigaru and then, in a single fluid motion, strike them all down?
Bring forth fiery darts from heaven and hurl them at your enemies? Face demons from the pits of hell? Disarm and hammer an arrogant Samurai lord into the dust with your bare hands?
You can do this and much more if you play Daishō, skirmish wargaming in mythical Nippon.
This game allows players to field forces of five to fifteen miniatures in a game you can easily complete in an evening on a space only a yard square. The rules are short and simple to learn – few players need to refer to them after their second or third game.

This book provides:

The core rules of play.
The complete points system so you can create your own forces.
Full listings for twelve unique forces.
Armour, weapons and equipment, both mundane and magical.
Listings of skills, heroic ki powers and magical powers.
Fifteen scenarios, supported by seventeen scenario complications.
Ten detailed landscapes for you to play across, and
Simple, yet rewarding campaign rules.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: BAKA!
description:
BAKA! - The pocket-sized forfeit card game!

BAKA! is a fast-paced, quick and simple game. Tactically play your cards - the last player holding cards is the BAKA!

Players decide on a forfeit before each game, the last player holding cards is the BAKA! and is subject to that forfeit!

name: Gates of Delirium: Sacrificial Fire Mini Expansion
description:
The sacrificial fire board is placed next to the game map and allows players a new desperate action of sacrificing an investigator by spending desperation tokens. Players earn points at game end based on the number of sacrificed investigators.

This item was part of Renegade Game Studios Level Up Loot 2 promo box.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Mature / Adult
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Set Collection

name: Mainports
description:
Welcome to Europe! Discover its mainports and all the opportunities this true EURO GAME offers.

Close profitable deals, stock up on fuel and embark on your first journey across the European continent.
Ship grain from Lisbon to St. Petersburg and pick up some coal in Hamburg to deliver the cargo in Rotterdam. Will you choose to travel through the rivers or can you make a short cut across the seas? Smart planning of routes can be decisive as well as good timing on the rondel. Pock up some extra cash if you come across the flourishing mainport! Expand your enterprise with new ships and the latest technologies to get a head start to your opponents.

—description from the back of the box

name: Risk: Asterix – Collector's Edition
description:
New exclusive limited Edition 5555 copies! Completely bilingual German and French.

We are in 50 BC. All of Gaul is occupied by the Romans. All of Gaul? No! A village populated by indomitable Gauls never ceases to resist intruders. Take the role of a great leader and lead your people to victory not only through Gaul, but across the entire Roman Empire. Each nation has its own skills which greatly influence the game and from which tactical strategies can be developed.

Complete secret missions to get victory points and decide the game for you. But beware! The magic potion will also surprise you in the game and bring you benefits or maybe steal your points. With sesterces you can buy new missions and units that strengthen you in the game and bring you closer to your goal of becoming the ruler of the Roman Empire.

So, will you be able to use your skills victoriously or will another leader emerge as a glorious winner?

Get ready and brace yourself for the fight of a lifetime. With 2-5 players, ages 13 and up, you can muster your troops and join the defence of the conquests of Gaul or Caesar. You can choose from 2 different game modes. Distribute area cards evenly among all players and place your warriors on the field according to your cards. On your turn, you can attack neighbouring areas and, thanks to the various ports, even occupy coastal areas by sea. Roll the black dice to attack your opponents and use the red dice to defend yourself. If you manage to lead your attack profitably with the highest number of eyes, you can decide whether you want to keep fighting until you've taken out all enemy warriors or if you want to retreat first. This way, try to control as many areas as possible. 6 regions of different colours with a total of 45 areas must be conquered. Gaul with the largest land ownership wins the game. Potion Cards and Reinforcements provide special fun.

So arm your troops and go with RISK Asterix in the battle for the Roman Empire and become a respected leader.
publishers: Hasbro, Winning Moves France, Winning Moves Germany

name: Társasház
description:
This is a deduction party game for 3-5 persons, offering 30-45 minutes playing time.

A group of novice detectives are deployed to a condominium where every tenant is likely to be a crook. Each detective receives a description of a certain suspect, and their task is to find their target person in one of the apartments. The player who is first to succeed wins the game.

One of the players takes the role of the Game Master, acting for the tenants. The rest of the players compete with each other in the investigation, which must be done by questioning the tenants. However, as they all have something to hide, they may be willing to give some bits of information on their neighbors only, and never about themselves.

All the detectives receive a police file with a suspect’s description, a dozen question cards, a player aid used for deduction, and some cash which might come in useful to make people talk. In their turn, the detectives knock on a door of their choice and ask a few selected questions by playing their question cards. Their ultimate goal is to locate the suspect by deduction, based on the answers they get during the game.

When a player asks a question about the occupant of a certain apartment, the Game Master checks the back of the relevant door card (visible only to him/her), and tells the answer based on the 12 data found there. But as the answer will be heard by all the players, everyone can note it down and use it for their own progress! Door cards are placed on the table randomly. Not knowing which tenants the detectives will be looking for, the Game Master is not in the position to give hints. But his or her spirited answers can make this party game great fun for everyone!


============Description in Hungarian:

A Társasház 3-5 személy számára ajánlott dedukciós partijáték, mely kb. 30-45 percig tart.

A rendőrfőnök egy csapat kezdő nyomozót ráállít egy társasházra, ahol csupa gyanús alak és körözött bűnöző él. Mindannyian kapnak egy-egy személyleírást, és ennek alapján kell megtalálniuk a maguk emberét a sok egyforma ajtó mögött. Akinek ez elsőként sikerül, az nyeri a játékot.

Az egyik játékos játékmesterként vesz részt, ő személyesíti meg a ház lakóit, a többiek nyomoznak, egymással versengve.
Az utasítás értelmében a nyomozást a lakók kikérdezésével kell lefolytatni. Csakhogy ebben a házban minden lakónak van rejtegetni valója, ezért legfeljebb a szomszédairól hajlandó elárulni pár lényegtelennek vélt információt.

Minden nyomozó kap egy-egy rendőrségi aktát egy személyleírással, egy tucat kérdéskártyával, egy információs segédlettel, valamint némi készpénzzel arra az esetre, ha egyeseket csak vesztegetéssel lehet rábírni az együttműködésre. A nyomozó játékosok feladata, hogy minden körben bekopogtassanak egy lakásba, feltegyenek néhány jól megválasztott kérdést a kérdéskártyáik kijátszásával, majd a kapott válaszokból a játék során kikövetkeztessék, melyik ajtó mögött bujkál az álaluk keresett személy.

A válaszokat a játékmester adja meg: a játék elején véletlenszerűen lehelyezett ajtókártyák túloldalán – csak számára láthatóan – megtalálható mind a 12 lehetséges válasz. A kérdéseket és a válaszokat azonban mindenki hallja, így azokat más játékos is lejegyezheti, felhasználhatja! Mivel a játékmester előtt is titok, ki melyik lakót keresi, segíteni még akaratlanul sem tud. Ellenben ő és a válaszai adják meg a játék igazi hangulatát!

name: Microscopic
description:
Welcome to a world invisible to the naked eye, where cells evolve and compete to grow into the biggest, strongest, and fastest living organisms.

You will start off small and slow and weak. Collect enough genes to begin laying down cells, then choose which adaptations to focus on and which organisms will give you the best edge.

As you grow, you will need to make sacrifices to get to the next level, but everything ramps up as you race to the end, claiming the most organisms to win.

During their turn a player plays cards from their hand to their tableau and finishes by drawing. The game ends when any player claims three organisms (two for a 4-player game), which is also the win condition.

There is also a solitaire and co-op version with similar game play.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Race, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Just One: BGG Promo Pack
description: A set of 5 promo cards for the game Just One, featuring words inspired by BGG itself!

name: Campsite
description:
Campsite has players competing for the best camping spot. Play cards on top of each other to link elements like forests, mountains, and camping trails together to score the most points.

A clever card-based "tile" laying game that focus on maximizing your limited space!

Luck and strategy combine in the great outdoors (no actual camping required). Includes 72 cards 42 tokens, scorepad, and pencil.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Map Addition, Melding and Splaying, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Orbital Outpost MVM Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of the Man vs. Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter. This promo is also part of the Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition Promo Cards #2 set with a different artwork as card [P22].

1 card (63x88mm):

P18
Orbital Outpost MVM
Cost: 16 MC
Tags: Building (brown)
Active Phases: I-II
Effects: purple (ongoing) - when you play a card with 1 or fewer tags, you pay 3 MC less for it.

name: Clinic: Deluxe Edition – 6th Extension
description:
6th Extention, published in 2024, is the 9th expansion for Clinic Deluxe Edition.

It follows: 5 previous Extensions, COVID-19 Pandemic, Campaign Book and Biohazard.

“After the announcement of the final expansion, we decided to release just one more, called the addict expansion, because we geeks can never really stop playing - particular you, my wonderful fans! I present to you a new set of randomizer cards, a magical deluxe capsule to treat your addiction, a physiotherapist to provide massages after work, a funny Viagra expansion for our new elders, a set of real (but empty) capsules to replace the capsule tokens in Clinic: The Extension, new nursing assistants to help your overwhelmed nurses, and a few more items to round things out. The ultimate Clinic will satisfy the most demanding players, and provide the most realistic experience.

But the funniest bit of irony is that you will find YOU in the box in the form of a Clinic Addict meeple!”

Description from the rulebook introduction.
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medical, Territory Building, Transportation
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Tile Placement

name: Whoforwat
description:
The game title Whoforwat summarizes the gameplay: Each round, players collectively vote on who is doing...something.

At the start of each round in this co-operative game, lay out six zigoto cards, with each zigoto being a unique, dadaistic living being from the mind of designer/artist Edouard Didelot. Reveal an illustrated question card, such as "Who loves dogs?", "Who ran through this wall?", or "Who would be a good couch?"

Players secretly vote on which zigoto seems like the best who for this what, then they reveal their choices. If no zigoto has received more votes than any other, discard all the zigoto cards and play another round; if a zigoto has received more votes than any other, place it aside for the grande finale, then play another round; and if a zigoto received everyone's vote, place it aside for the grande finale along with a special "connexion" token, then play another round.

Once you've set aside six zigotos, lay out those cards, then play the final round. Reveal a question card, then everyone votes and reveals as normal. If you've all voted for the same zigoto, you win! If not, discard a connexion token and vote again on this same question. If you run out of connexion tokens before unanimously choosing a zigoto, you lose.
publishers: Blue Orange (EU), Ghenos Games, Pegasus Spiele

name: Speedway Challenge
description:
Speedway Challenge is a quick playing card game based on motorcycle speedway.

Races feature 4 riders, with rules for 2/3/4 players determining hand size and whether you control one or two riders each - how many races you play is up to you.

A race consists of 5 rounds, with players playing one card per round for each of their riders. The concept being that the track has 3 lanes (the white line, middle, and round the boards), with bikes only able to play cards in either unblocked lanes, or with a value lower than a bike already occupying a lane that turn. Since the leading bike gets first play the next turn, there is plenty of opportunity for blocking and jockeying for position before the end of the final lap.

Added to this are the chance of falls, injuries, start line infringements or even mechanical failures, to give a wide variety of race outcomes.

name: Battle of the Nations 1813
description:
After the devastating defeat in the Russian campaign in 1812, Napoléon Bonaparte withdrew with his army to Dresden in 1813, where he was pushed back to Leipzig by the great powers of Prussia, Austria, Russia, and Sweden. After the first contact with the enemy on 14 October, a cavalry battle near Liebertwolkwitz, which ended with much luck in favor of the Allies, Bonaparte now seeks the decisive battle. With the guards and eight corps, he has 210,000 men at his disposal, including 14,000 horsemen and 700 guns.

In the two-person game Battle of the Nations 1813, you take over the role of Napoléon and his opponent Prince Schwarzenberg. The aim of the game for Napoléon's French army is to occupy and successfully defend several towns around Leipzig. The allied troops under Prince Schwarzenberg try to prevent this in return.

At the beginning of the game, Napoléon receives face-down mission cards from different districts. These cards show him which towns he has to occupy. Depending on the level of difficulty, Napoléon receives different numbers of victory points for completed mission cards. The mission cards also show Napoléon how many points Prince Schwarzenberg wins if he does not complete the missions.

—description from the publisher

name: Island of Cards: Solitaire Game
description:
Island of Cards is a a solitaire card game using a traditional deck of cards. You will try to complete a 7 X 7 grid of cards, filling every spot with a card. At the end of the game, you would lose a point for any card not placed. Gain one point for each card left your draw deck.

Each turn you will draw a card and place beside a card that has a value higher or lower by one. As the deck become thinner and the island grows, you choices will diminish. Can you complete the Island of Cards?

name: Knockout Cricket
description: Play your own limited-overs cricket match! Contains playing board, 12 Cricketer figures, scoreboard, site screens, 5 packs of cricket cards, rules and dice. Ages 8 and up.

name: Andor: Les Présents de l'Arbre des Chants
description:
A one-card-expansion for Legends of Andor for the Festival International des Jeux de Cannes 2013 for the legends 3-5.

When the first hero arrives at the tree of chants (Field 57, resp. 45 in the mine) the heroes receive, apart from blue sky, toasted french bread and red wine:
1 water skin
2 gold pieces
1 spy-glass or 1 falcon
1 runestone from the board (Do not peek at the color before taking it)

The gifts can be distributed among all heroes as they see fit.

name: Iquazú: Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 Promo
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 10.

CONTENTS: 9 bonus tiles

PREPARATION:
Before the game, take out 9 bonus tiles with a light back, replace them with the 9 new bonus tiles, and shuffle.

HOW TO PLAY:
The new bonus tiles are distributed in the interim scoring along with the other bonus tiles.

You can use the new bonus tiles when it is your turn:

For the bonus tile with a gem and an arrow: If you use one of these bonus tiles then you may move on of your gemstones (you have already placed) to the right or left by one column. The gemstone must be moved within the same row. You may only move the gemstone if there is an empty space in the rock there (in the neighboring space of the same row). If there are multiple empty spaces in the rock on this space then you may select one of them.

For the bonus tile with the water drop and an X: If you use this bonus tile you may take one water drop off the game board and place it back in the water box. It doesn't matter whether the water box is currently in front of you or one of the other players.

Due to production reasons, the bonus tiles in the Advent Calendar are slightly thinner than the bonus tiles in the game.

name: Zhukov's First Victory: The Battles of Nomonhan
description:
Zhukov's First Victory: The Battle of Nomonhan, is an introductory level game of the battle between the Soviet Union and Japan's Kwantung Area Army in the summer of 1939. A series of border disputes between Japan's puppet state of Manchukuo and Soviet-controlled Mongolia since the spring escalated to an undeclared war.

The Japanese sent the 23rd Infantry Division, reinforced with tanks, engineers, artillery and backed by much of their air force, to teach the Russian garrison a lesson. Unknown to the Japanese, the Soviets also sent reinforcements led by General Zhukov. In a series of battles the Japanese gained some success in July, but were crushingly defeated in August. The forces of the Rising Sun would never again strike north, and instead cast their eyes elsewhere for territorial expansion.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 12 hours
Hex: 1 mile / 1.6 kilometers
Units: Battalion to Regiment

Game Inventory:
Two 11x17" full color map
Two single-side printed un-mounted countersheets (300 5/8" + 6 5/8x1.25" counters)(mounted counters are optional)
One 9-page rulebook
One Player Aid Chart

Player Provided: One 6-sided die

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Low
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 2 to 4 hours
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Zone of Control
publishers: High Flying Dice Games, Microgame Design Group

name: Guerra de Mitos XIII: Era Mortal
description:
Guerra de Mitos XIII: Era Mortal expands Myths at War, a card game set in a fantastic world where different mythologies coexist. It is a different, dynamic game designed to be able to build different decks with very distinct and varied strategies, and each installment increases both the number of available mythologies and the game possibilities.

The game contains 165 cards split with Celtic mithology and some Heroes out from Mythsgate (one of GDM Releases for 2018)

"Era Mortal" is the second expansion of the fouth age of the game.

Each player in Guerra de Mitos (Myths at War) needs to build his own deck of at least 51 cards (1 pantheon / 20 gods / 30 designs) of his choice, and each installment increases the diversity of characters, actions and strategies you can use in order to achieve victory.

Each player has to bring into play the cards his oracles offer him and play actions from the designs deck both in the influence phase (where the gods plan from their pantheon) and in the confrontation phase (where the characters who decide to go to battle fight to decrease the opponent’s power) to obtain supremacy or consign the opponent to oblivion.

—description from the publisher

name: Murano: The Christmas Tree
description:
Available at Lookout Games website

Rules of play:
Whenever any player produces glass (beads) or receives money, this player can use it to adorn the tree. The player places the money or the glass on a space on the tree and immediately receives the depicted number of victory points. You can do this only once per turn. The money and glass placed on the tree stays there until the game is over. Therefore it is no longer available for any player.

Included in Murano: Complete Edition.

name: Scotland the Brave: The Epsom Offensive – June 28-30, 1944
description:
(from the back sleeve:)

The Epsom Offensive: 28-30 June, 1944

SCOTLAND THE BRAVE tells the story of the BatUe 01 Epsom. Some histories pass over this battle as merely the second of Montgomery's failed attempts to capture the key city of Caen. Increasingly. however historians are • recognizing the true meaning of the Epsom Offensive. This was the battle which ended German dreams of driving the invaders back Into the sea. Hitler gathered the best of his remaining Panzer Divisions and broke them against the resistance encountered. The beginning of Epsom caught the enemy off balance and kept the Germans off balance until Hitler's counter-stroke in Normandy was doomed to failure. Most important, this was a battle in which enthusiastic but untried British troops stood toe-to-toe with some of the best equipped. best led and most experienced combat formations of the Third Reich. The Battle of Epsom was to set a pattern that was to continue for the rest of the campaign in Northwest Europe, from Normandy to the Baltic: the grinding-down of Hitler's elite troops by dominance in the air and by excellence of artillery support.

SCOTLAND THE BRAVE includes a well-researched historical game map of the battlefield, special rules, nine new scenarios and a Platoon leader 2.1 campaign game. You will also receive a comprehensive scenario tactics and designer's notes booklet. Everything is included to play using your existing ASLRB and game pieces.

Ownership of the ASLRB, BV and WoA are necessary to play this game.


Scotland the Brave is an expansion for the Advanced Squad Leader game system and can be linked to Scotland the Brave II: The Epsom Offensive – June 28-30, 1944.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Uckers
description:
Uckers is the traditional game of the Royal Navy. It's origins are lost in the mists of time but it is still played on almost all ships, submarines and naval bases to this day.

The game is played on a ludo board with two dice. Players play as pairs on opposite corners of the board, the aim being to get all your pieces home before the opposing pair do.

The main difference from ludo is that all the players' pieces can be out at once and stacked up, blocking your opponents movement.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Mercenary Air Squadron
description:
As the year 2015 came to a close it was clear the world was in a new trend. Instead of fighting wars with their own conventional forces, nations found it easier to pass the burden of conflict along to private contractors. They could be expensive, but a mercenary force was less politically liable than a country and more expendable. The best survived, and went on to glory and profit. The most famous and sought after are the mercenary pilots.

The leader of a Mercenary Air Squadron has many responsibilities. The fortunes of his or her firm depend on taking the right jobs for his pilots, outfitting with the right equipment, and keeping those birds flying. One month a mercenary squadron could be flying combat operations over the Pacific Ocean for Japan, and turn around and join the highest bidder against their former employer. Nothing is personal, except for rivalries amongst mercenary squadrons, which tend to lead to heated exchanges beyond that specified in a contract. Your prestige and fortune are at stake. Pilots, man your planes and your pocketbooks!

Expanded by:

Mercenary Air Squadron World War II: Mediterranean Theater of Operations
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Economic, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Double Vision
description: Double Vision is a drinking themed party board game for 4-8 adults. The contents are splash resistant so you can party with them. Players go to bars, answer drunken challenges, perform party tricks, fulfill new year’s resolutions, and talk in character to win drinks. After each talk, players can keep their name tag or trade for a new one. The first player to win 12 drinks (short game) or 21 drinks (long game) wins.
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Among the Stars: Consulting Firm
description:
Given out as a Promo by Artipia at Spiel 2015.

If you discard this card to build a Power reactor, pay 1 less.
If you discard this card to gain, gain 1 more.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: PUSH 'EM UP!
description:
The Titan Tethanos snapped his rusty fingers and pulverized almost all super-heroes we loved so much for years.
It's a lucky day for others who can now fight to come out of the shadows and be the new stars !

PUSH 'EM UP! is a card game where you have to win majority in a maximum of columns and place the higher cards you can to score the higher score.

You also have the power of the "PUSH" card that allows you to erase opponents' cards by pushing the last card of a column.

—description from the publisher

name: Hostage Negotiator: Career – Secret Cabal Year Zero Promo Card
description: This is a special Year 0 Career card that was offered to backers of the Secret Cabal Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Dogo Dash
description:
Dogo Dash
Dogo Dash is a quick-playing, super-colorful card game for 2 to 5 players. It’s a game of dogs and cats, bears and humans, where one is always trying to outdo the other. Who is going to come out on top? Will the Good Boys cause trouble for the Bears? Or will Cats woo over Cookie? Only a game of Dogo Dash will tell!

Components
1 rule sheet
60 cards
• 22 Cats
• 18 Dogs
• 12 Bears
• 4 Cookies
• 4 Good Boys

Setup
1. Shuffle the deck of cards face down.
2. Deal four cards to each player. This forms your hand. Keep your cards secret!
3. Place the deck face down in reach of all players. This is the draw deck.
4. Now you’re ready to play. It’s that easy!

Gameplay
Dogo Dash is played over multiple rounds. At the end of each round, players determine the winner of the round and score points. Then, everyone draws more cards. Once the draw deck is empty, one final round occurs and then the game ends. The player with the most points wins.

Round
Each round, players follow the same order of play.
1. All players secretly choose a card from their hand they want to play.
2. Place it face down in front of you and don’t show it to anyone.
3. When everyone has chosen a card, someone yells out DO-GO DAAAAASH!
4. All players reveal their cards simultaneously.
5. Now it’s time to see who won!

Round Winner
To determine the winner, check the played cards to see who played the strongest one:

Dog is stronger than Cat
Bear is stronger than Dog and Cat
Cookie is stronger than Dog and Bear
Cat is stronger than Cookie

Whoever played the strongest card takes all of the played cards and keeps them in a score pile in front of them. Each card counts as a point at the end of the game.

If there is a tie between two or more players for the strongest card, the tied players play another round between themselves but do not draw any additional cards. They continue playing until someone wins or they have played all of their cards. If no one wins, then the players split the points as evenly as possible, discarding the extra card if it’s an odd amount.

Watch out! If there is a Good Boy on the table, things get tricky.
Good Boys force a tie, no matter what cards are on the table. Play another round as detailed above.

Once the winner has been determined, all players draw cards until they have four cards in hand.

Last Round
The Last Round happens when there are no more cards to draw from the draw deck. Players now play one more round only using the cards they have left in hand.

1. All players secretly choose a card and place it face down in front of you.
2. All players take all of their unplayed cards in their hands and put them face down in the middle of the table. This makes the Super Pot!
3. Someone yells out DO-GO DAAAAASH! and all players reveal their cards simultaneously.
4. The winner takes all of the cards in the Super Pot!
o If there is a tie, the tied players split the Super Pot as evenly as possible.

Scoring
Once the Last Round has been played, count the cards you have collected.
Whoever has collected the most cards wins.
If there is a tie, then all tied players win!

Keep Your Eyes Open
If you pay attention to what cards have been played, then you can stay ahead of everyone else. Try and remember the number of different cards there are and use it in your favor to choose the right card at the
right time.

For instance: if you paid attention to how many Cookies were played, you can win the Super Pot with a cat, which is the character beaten by most cards, but wins against Cookie.
Combos

The Catnip Variant
When you get comfortable with the basics, here’s an extra move to add to the game.
If you have four cats in your hand, you can choose to play a Catnip:
1. Instead of playing one card, you put down all four cards and say ‘catnip.’
2. You then put all four of your played cards onto your own score pile. You didn’t win the round, but you keep the points for yourself.
3. 3. Everyone else continues the round as normal.

The Dogo Dash!
If you played a Dog and didn’t win the round, but you have another Dog in your hand, then you can make a Dogo Dash! Before the winner takes the cards, reveal your second Dog card. You now get to keep the Dog you just played and the Dog you just rescued from the winner. Put both cards in your score pile.

Credits
Author & Game Designer: Talita Rhein
Illustrator & Co-Designer: Margherita Barrera
Co-Designer: Johanna Janiszewski
Production Support & QA: Philipp Keydel
Rules Editing: Travis D. Hill
categories: Animals, Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Encounters: BattleTech
description:
It is the thirty-first century. For generations, the Great Houses of the Inner Sphere have been at war, squabbling over the scraps of the long-dead Star League. Centuries of fighting have led to the formation of countless mercenary commands willing to take on the tough missions that the Successor States can't—or wont'—take on themselves.

These mercenary commands live and die by two things: the almighty C-bill and their reputation among their employers that they have what it takes to get the job done.

Encounters: BattleTech is a 1—8 player, fast-paced, push-your-luck dice and card game. Players act as mercenary commanders taking on contracts for the Great Houses. Defeating the enemies set to stop them earns C-bills to spend on the equipment needed to keep their unit afloat. If they defeat enough enemies, they'll complete their contract and gain the hard-earned reputation that all mercenaries seek. So grab some dice, pick your favorite mercenary unit, and show the Great Houses that you're the best mercs in the Inner Sphere!

—description from the back of the box

name: Last Bug Standing in the Circle of Doom!
description: In Last Bug Standing in the Circle of Doom!, which takes place on a futuristic arena on a planet far, far away, the navigator directs the driver of the crew's vehicle through an alien landscape, while the gunner shoots at Bug-Eyed Monsters (BEMs). If you plot the right course, make the right moves, and pick the right shots, you will have the last bug standing!
mechanics: Deduction, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Square Grid

name: Bottom of the 9th: Fanatic
description:
Fanatic is a promo card for Bottom of the 9th and was offered by Foam Brain Games at Gen Con 2015 in a vending machine at the Asmadi Games booth for 75 cents.

Fanatic, listed on the card as one of the Sentinels of the Ninth, is one of the heroes of the Sentinels of the Multiverse. She is right-handed and plays first base. She has the Divine Focus ability and cannot modify low pitches.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: トレンド・ザ・ブランチ (Trend: The Branch)
description:
トレンド・ザ・ブランチ (Trend: The Branch) is a stand-alone card game from Japan with a theme of the apparel business that re-implements the 2018 release TREND. In this edition, players are still staff of an apparel shop. There is an additional branch system that uses multiple shop cards with special effects and combines these effects.

While the rules are similar to the original game, differences in this edition are:
1. Introduction of a new rule to add a branch - This allows the effects and abilities of shop cards to be used in combination.
2. Adding of four seasons to the character card - With the addition of the four seasons, you can enjoy the changing trends of the seasons and the changing fashion of the city.
3. Simple changes to the sales and pass rules - The basic rules have been revised to be simpler and easier to play.
4. All 132 cards - The number of cards has increased by 50 from the previous game, making it a more challenging game. Overall, the number of trend elements has increased to 20 and the number of shops to 12.
user summary
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Hot Wheels Acceleracers Collectable Card Game
description: Hot Wheels Acceleracers is a collectible card game based on the popular Mattel toy. Players race their cars across four realms, trying to be the first player to get three cars to the finish line. Spend Action Points to play Mod cards to permanently boost your car, or Shift cards to give you a temporary boost. If your car meets or exceeds the target number for the realm, then you speed on to the next one. Watch out, though, because your opponent can play hazard cards to try to destroy your Mods, or even your car!

name: Paleo
description:
A strategic game of adventure and dexterity

The fabulous city of Paleo was swallowed up by the oceans 5,000 years ago and fell into oblivion. A parchment manuscript has just been discovered, revealing the location of its gates. The city’s immense riches described in the manuscript have inspired much desire and greed.

As the head of a team of explorers and mercenaries, you have set up camp in the Paleo Archipelago. But other teams have also arrived at the scene.
Protected by your mercenaries, your explorers are ready to launch a search for the keys that will give access to the city. It is up to you to take advantage of the archipelago’s many reefs in order to stay ahead of your competitors.
---
In the basic two-player version of Paleo, players set up the 65 x 65 cm board with four central reefs, two sanctuaries for each player in the corners of the board, and five supplemental reefs placed according to various rules. Each player controls a team of five explorers and three mercenaries; you move these pieces by flicking them with your finger as in Crokinole. If your mercenary hits an opponent’s piece, that piece is removed from the board; remove all of the opponent’s pieces, and you win the round and score one point.

The explorers are used to enter the opponent’s sanctuaries and recover two keys that then allow the player to enter the gate of Paleo in the center of the board. (Any of your pieces that enters a sanctuary can be exchanged for another piece already captured by the opponent.) This victory is worth two points, and a complete game requires a player to earn four points to win.

Rules are included to accommodate three or four players, in addition to rules for ten other games for 2-4 players such as hockey, a kayak race, and Capture the King.

name: Bleach TCG
description:
Fifteen-year-old Ichigo Kurosaki never asked for the ability to see ghosts — he was born with the gift. When his family is attacked by a Hollow — a malevolent lost soul — Ichigo encounters a Soul Reaper and absorbs her powers. Now, he's dedicating his life to protecting the innocent and helping tortured souls find peace....

The Bleach Trading Card Game is based on the hit animated TV series SHONEN JUMP BLEACH™ from VIZ Media airing on Cartoon Network. Marketing plans include both retail and consumer initiatives such as free retailer-only promo kits, Premier Sneak Peek events, a wrapper redemption program and more.

Tournament kits containing support for a 20-player event including exclusive promo cards and assorted premium items such as playmats and deck boxes are to be available...
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ravening Hordes: The Official Warhammer Battle Army Lists
description: A supplement for 2nd edition Warhammer that featured full army lists for that edition of the game - the immediate ancestor of the 3rd edition supplement, Warhammer Armies. Included are rules for various armies along with points values, wargear, and full stats for the variety of units included with each.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Gingerdead House: Star S'mores
description:
In a galaxy far, far away...

The battle to protect your Gingerbread House from being devoured by fairy-tale monsters wages on! Star Smores is an all new expansion for the board game, Gingerdead House.

Star Smores features
7 New Defenses
5 New Monsters
2 New Actions
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Video Game Theme

name: A Case of Relativity (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
Set in 1905 N.T you need to prevent an assassination attempt on Albert Einstein

Language: English
Size: 167 Cards
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Highlands
description:
Description from the publisher:

Highlands is a solo boardgame set in middle ages Scotland, in a time of rival clans, factions, and kingdoms. Play as a king/earl/jarl striving to gain reputation and power as you build your empire in the highlands. Along the way, you will explore, decide how to expand, and encounter rival armies and a variety of creatures from the realm of the faes.

Highlands started as an attempt to create a Scythe-like solo gaming experience, but with a smaller footprint and less upkeep. Start with a Castle, a King, and two Workers. Then, hire more Workers, build a Cathedral, train a Soldier and a Knight, explore, encounter Faes, complete missions, and defend your Castle from the Enemy.

Highlands is played on a custom hex map 12 chess pieces, a 27 card Encounter deck, an 18 card Mission deck, and a handful of cubes.

Highlands won 4th place in the Best Overall Game category in the 2017 Solitaire Print and Play Contest.
mechanics: Action Points, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Philadelphia 1777
description:
Philadelphia 1777 is a board wargame about the American Revolutionary War campaign led by British General Howe against the American colonist led by General Washington. It is a point to point movement war game using blocks with labels for the military units. The game uses the system from our previous games, New York 1776, Trenton 1776, and Saratoga 1777.

Each turn both the American and British player will receive activation points with which to activate either groups of blocks moved by a leader, or individual blocks. When blocks of both sides end a move in a location together then a battle occurs.

The game has some excellent historical “chrome” mixed in.

There are lots of great strategic decisions for both sides in the game. Best of all it plays in 2 hours so you have time to play two games in an evening.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Turn Order: Random

name: Lightning Strike
description:
LS is a very fast game that can be played with miniatures or counters. Die rolls are very simple, allowing the inclusion of several ships per side. Layout and artwork of the book is very good. Rules are clearly written and simple, with optional rules adding a little more complexity.

From the back cover:
Lightning Strike is a game of tactical fleet combat set in the universe of Jovian Chronicles. Players take the part of ship commanders in the conflict, viewing the battle from above and giving orders to the participating units. This book includes basic rules and counters allowing players to take the side of either the Jovian Confederation or the Central Earth Government and Administration (CEGA).
-Quick Start rules to start playing immediately;
-Full rules for fielding exo-armors, fighters, exo-suits and warships;
-Advanced rules for aces, boarding actions and electronic warfare;
-Game statistics for the major Jovian and CEGA combat spacecraft;
-Six full-color counter sheets

name: Touchdown Heroes
description:
Touchdown Heroes is a trick-taking game for two teams of 2 players that is loosely based on American football.

One team is the offense, and one is the defense. While the offense only gets three downs to make a touchdown, and there are multiple levels of touchdowns, the game does also include interceptions, punts, onside kicks, and other features of American football.

The lead for a trick chooses if the team will call a running play (a must-follow trick), a passing play (a may-follow trick), or a kick (which involves rolling a dice).

The game takes place over two halves, and the team with more points at the end of the game wins.

name: Nay-Jay!
description:
Nay-Jay is a super-fast card game with simultaneous group play. Each player begins the game with their own deck from which they deal themselves a down-pile and four draw cards. They hold onto the rest of the deck to flip over one at a time in order to find more cards to play.

Cards are played in the common area on piles that are started with a "1". These card piles can be built up or down on with cards of the same color. Wild cards can be played on a pile to change its top number, color, or both. The first player to use all of the cards from their down-pile shouts "NAY-JAY!" and the round ends. The game lasts 6 rounds, and at the end the player with the highest score wins.

- designer summary.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Place Your Bets!
description:
Based on the 1974-75 game show Dealer's Choice, with a stake of $100 each player participates in five games of chance. Each game has been assigned rounds in which it may be played. The player designated as the dealer for each round chooses the game from a group of 12, all used on the show. The rules for each game are written on its board.

The final round is played with the Bonus Dice. The Bonus Dice have money amounts from $50 to $200 written on eleven of the twelve faces; the twelfth face contains a spade. Each player makes a secret guess how much money the Bonus Dice will accumulate before the spade is rolled. Those who come closest without going over get their holdings doubled. The player with the most money wins.

name: Holowczyn: Battle of the Moscow Road
description:
Battle between Swedes and Russians on the road to Moscow 1708. Swedish Game Production Combat Series No. 1.
Production qualities are fairly low but the 17" by 12" map is workmanlike in 5 colors and the counters are clear with Swedes in light blue and Russians in green.
The Russians are on the defensive in prepared positions but are surprised by a sudden Swedish attack through the marshes on the flank of the position. The Swedish units are much better than their opponents but there are few of them. The fight is therefore fairly evenly matched.
The Rules use a standard sequence of play of Move, Defender fires, Attacker fires, Melee and then Rally. Losses are taken to attack strength necessitating the use of loss markers but stacking is limited so the stacks do not get too high.
Special rules include Leaders, Pontoon Bridges, Surprise, extra reinforcements etc.
Same rules as Peter the Great by the same Designer

name: Super Mario Bros. "The Great Ladder Race Game"
description:
Players guide Mario and Luigi as they race down their ladders. The first one to reach the bottom of the ladder is the winner!

The game comes with a blue platform with a vertical tower that holds the two yellow ladders. The ladders spin on the vertical tower. Mario and Luigi have hooks on the backs of their heads and legs so that they can latch on to the ladder rungs. The object is to rotate the ladders back and forth to make Mario and Luigi climb down the ladder.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Racing, Real-time, Video Game Theme

name: Goal! College/Pro Football Greats
description: A fairly simple football game - play by play, rather than quick-play - first designed/marketed by Wichita Game Co., then, picked up and distributed by Bob Valvano's Valgames. One of the big draws was the awesome number of teams from cross-eras included in the game.
publishers: Downey Games, Valgames, Wichita Game Co.

name: Sniper Attack
description:
Panzerschreck Magazine #10 and included Panzershreck Anthology.

Sniper Attack is a solitaire WW2 card game in which where you control an individual sniper and try to eliminate enemy soldiers while staying alive yourself. Requires a standard deck of 52 playing cards.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II

name: Culture & Conquest
description:
CULTURE & CONQUEST
Simulation of ancient civilizations.
This dice game does not require a map or counters.
Solo or any number can play.
Published in Academic Gaming Review
http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Culture.html
publishers: Academic Gaming Review, Warp Spawn Games

name: Knatsch: Katalog Edition 3
description: This is the third expansion for Knatsch/Knights, published in the Abacus Spiele catalog, with two special cards to add to the base game. Once captured, the owning player may capture cards from the stacks by rolling a large or small straight (1-2-3-4 or 2-3-4-5, respectively) depending on the card. The player may still capture a card by beating its combination normally. The cards do not affect capturing cards from other players.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval

name: Jasmine: The Battle for the Mid-Realm
description:
From The Rules:

Each player in the game becomes the leader of one of the four warring factions and tries to gain control over the lands of the Mid-realm. The winner is the player who 1) Has the only castle left remaining in the game or 2) is the first to collect three powerful magical items inside his castle. The game reflects the struggle for control of these lands through combat, magic, spying, assassinations, political maneuvers and the special powers possessed by each individual faction.

Luck often helps, but the strategy you choose will determine how well you do in the end.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Set Collection

description:
Rules for English Civil War wargames with army lists and campaign system.

This set of rules was developed from the author's house rules, originally designed for the War of Spanish Succession, and subsequently adapted for a wide variety of periods.
categories: Book, Civil War, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Monty's Maze
description: Monty's Maze creates an irresistible adventure of challenge and excitement. Build an expedition and take it into the mysterious maze to uncover the treasures of ancient tombs. Watch out for the rope bridge, the dark chamber, and the bat cave! Outrun the Keloy Monsters! Escape from marauding opponents! Unload your treasure and go back for more. If you can secure 3 golden masks, you win!

name: Grim Reaper
description:
Grim Reaper is a game where two populations compete for survival.

Pieces have gender, can ‘mate’, give birth, age and die.

The game is won by the player whose population lives longest or who connects two sides of the board.
